review_body: So happy to have found this inviting boutique hotel in the village. Wonderful front desk staff, clean room, & cozy lobby. Centrally located to many great places , shopping, eating , drinking , historical sites.

Loved the Lobby with it’s rustic and nostalgic charm. Room had a balcony with landmark views of Empire State. Tub was a nice addition, as big as the pancake dish!Can’t wait to return and enjoy the fire places in restaurant and Lobby again before it gets too warm!
user_name:
danf337
New York City, New York

review_body: I had never stayed in Greenwich Village before and am very happy that we found the Walker. Great staff, beautiful building, clean, great location. The restaurant is very good. The rooms are nice and clean. I will be coming back here

This is a cute hotel. Clean, quiet, staff at the front desk and housekeeping were welcoming and available at all times.We didn't eat at the cafe but heard some live jazz as we were heading out for the evening.When we headed out for breakfast, an hour later we came back to a clean and refreshed room.The rooms look red and blue online with a lot of light, so I was really disappointed that our room was drab brown and really dark unless you had the drapes open. The major drawback with that is that you can't do that at night, which made it difficult to look through suitcases and generally just be able to see well enough to get dressed.We had a two double bed room, so perhaps the higher end rooms were the ones with more space and looked like those pictures online.Aside from that, the nightly turndown service was nice with delicious cookies.The location was perfect, so you expect to pay more for that.I took off a star only because of how dark our room was.

We wanted to stay away from Times Square area this visit and chose this gorgeous boutique hotel. Very friendly staff. Rooms were lovely but New York size, it is a boutique hotel after all! Rooms decorated lovely in Art Deco style. Would say they are a little dark though! Bathroom has everything you need regarding toiletries. Nice desk in the room and a basket with nibbly bits in that could be purchased. The bar area is very nice, was buzzing most of the times we were in it. Breakfast was good and huge portions! The restaurant looked nice and was busy so remember to book. The bar area appears to be a meeting place for drinks after work or catching up with friends. Bar tenders are very good and everyone very friendly. They have just opened another hotel and I’m pretty sure it will be as good as this one.

We stayed at the Walker after it was recommended to us by a family member, and it did not disappoint. It is a lovely hotel with attentive and helpful staff. The bed was fantastic and we both slept as well as we do at home (which generally is not the case when we travel). There is also great water pressure in the shower. The lobby area is wonderful for relaxing and having a cocktail, and we found the food in the restaurant to be delicious. We will definitely be back on our next visit to NYC!

Where can I even begin with the Walker Hotel??? From the moment I reached out about booking a group reservation for a work trip, working with this hotel staff has been a dream.Literally no ask is impossible for superstar coordinator queen Isabel! Every request, no matter how tardy or inconsequential was handled without any back and forth within a matter of hours after it was made. Once our group arrived, many of us were allowed to check in early with no added charge.The space is so effortlessly chic and well-styled. Working out of the lobby was really pleasant (also, conveniently located close to transit and Union Square). We also dined in the restaurant one evening; the food was delicious and the ambiance was very sexy.The hotel staff went above and beyond at every opportunity to make this a pleasant stay. I received a hand-written note thanking me for choosing the Walker for my party and a fresh pair of cookies delivered to my in-room desk every day.The rooms are very trendy and waking up to a picturesque view of the Empire State building shining at me through my Juliet balcony was... not too shabby! And, can I just say, anyone complaining about room size is clearly visiting New York for the first time! If they could see my first New York apartment, they'd probably have an aneurysm. Bonus points for a well-outfitted gym in the basement level.All I heard from my team was how beautiful and charming the hotel was (and so many notes about great service). Thank you Walker Hotel for working overtime to make me look great!!!

Once again I had the pleasure of staying at The Walker, our families favorite retreat in the city. It is always a pleasure to spend our yearly break in this lovely space. However, I did feel compelled to write a review to address some of the things that were noticeably deteriorating . In short it was really customer service. While there were a number of helpful staff , there was a sense that many of the staff were just not bothered. The front desk staff without exception were wonderful but the front area wait staff and the staff at the side desk were uninterested , unfriendly, unmotivated and generally unpleasant. One of the things that we always liked to do after a day in the city was to sit in front of the fire and have a glass of wine. By the end of our trip we were not inclined to do that mainly because of the unfriendliness of those staff. They were more interested in chatting to each other! A smile would have been appreciated, a personality of some sort or just regular customer service. All were missing. Unfortunate.
user_name:
Margaretj9498qh
New York City, New York

review_body: Every year we head to Manhattan for the theatre, the arts, museum, restaurants etc. We never realized the gem in the Village, the Walker Hotel until this last December. So beautifully quaint. As you enter , you will find a toasty fireplace, beautiful and comfortable furniture and some evenings music in the lobby. Our room was small, but comfortable. We loved it so much, my wife is returning to celebrate our daughter’s birthday. I plan to be there for the dental convention. From now on, this will be our hotel whenever we’re in the city. A special thank you goes to Bates, Jareth and especially Jasmine who were so helpful with lots of information and to ensure that our stay was comfortable. There was also a restaurant and bar, so we didn’t have to go too far for breakfast or even dinner. Bottom Line, this was a beautiful Boutique hotel very conveniently located.

From the classy '20's vibe of this grand dame hotel to the clean, comfy rooms and fabulous restaurant and bar, we'll come back to the Walker Tribeca for our next NYC visits! This location is easy to reach Soso, Greenwich, museums, quaint coffee shops and more.

This is a charming, unique boutique hotel in a great location in the west village. The staff is warm, so friendly, and attentive to your every request. The lobby has cozy seating, a beautiful fireplace and wonderful service for drinks and food. The rooms are small but very well done.We will definitely return!

The Walker hotel is a truly extraordinary experience. It is funky, posh, and unique. The beds are like sleeping on clouds, the rooms are quiet and exceptionally tasteful, and we really enjoyed the small touches like cookies delivered to the room, and text messages from our personal concierge. The location cannot be beat, as it is at the edge of the West Village but super close to Union Square, so totally accessible to Times Square, and all of the museums, etc., in Midtown as well as the hip downtown scene with its vintage stores and farmers markets. The only (tiny) point of feedback we had was that the room is a bit dark as most of the lightning id table lamps. Otherwise, it far exceeded our hopes.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about this boutique hotel. Natalia and her staff were amazing!! The house keeping dept kept the room in tip top shape!! The bathroom and bedrooms were immaculate. The food is wonderful at the hotel. I would definitely come back again. The hotel lobby and lounge area is cozy and warm. The staff went over and beyond!! Thank you!!

This was our first time at the Walker and we loved it! The staff were all so kind and helpful. The room felt spacious by NY standards and had everything needed. We had a beautiful view. Best part about this hotel is the lobby bar that had a fantastic piano player in evenings. If you want a smaller, personal hotel in a great walkable area, I recommend this gem!

I’ve been staying at Walker Hotel Greenwhich Village for 3-4 days per month over the past 1,5 years. I have room requests that I occasionally get but very frequently not. Tonight I got the dungeon, not my request with a city view. For the price tag of 450 per night, it’s not good enough. This is consequently my last stay at Walker.

Excellent hotel, Nice rooms, good shower, a cookie every day and a magnificent view (we were at the 16th) over Manhattan. Good restaurants and bars at walking distance. At the centre of the Big Apple, be sure you don’t spend to much time in the subway.

This was my first stay here. My husband and I had a wonderful stay. The staff were friendly, we received a free room upgrade which made our stay (beautiful room with a view and large soaking tub), we loved receiving cookies and a kind note upon our return from dinner, and room service delivered our food and drinks quickly. Brunch was also delicious. We will definitely stay again!

The visit did not start well as we arrived at 7pm and our room wasn’t ready. But Jasmine saved the day with her professionalism and Customer service orientation. Room 1804 with a view of Empire State Building, fabulous breakfast (the homemade granola was delicious), wonderful jalapeño drinks listening in jazz in the lounge, and great soaking tub. Wonderful neighborhood, try Lady Mendl tea room. Highly recommend this hotel.

Just on our way home from 5 nights staying at this wonderful small hotel. Staff were amazing .. David, Lisa ... all going that extra mile to make the stay wonderful. Room was perfect.. small but that’s what you expect in NYC .. lovely bar and cosy lounge area. Will definitely return

Adorable hotel. Location is phenomenal! Located in the heart of Greenwich Village. Service is A+++ and the rooms are super nice and a good size. The restaurant in the hotel is also really yummy. I will definitely be staying here again!

Located in The Village, right off the PATH and the 14th Street subway, The Walker Hotel is hard to beat! A cute boutique hotel with plenty of charm only matched by an even more welcoming staff. I will not stay at another hotel in NYC unless this one is fully booked. Perpetually excellent experiences!
user_name:
Y5810TSmattc
Hoboken, New Jersey, United States

review_body: This was a most pleasant surprise. A beautiful hotel with staff that go out of their way to accommodate guests. A warm and welcoming fireplace in the wooded reception area. We were met by intimate live jazz playing a very good restaurant and bar (we spoke to a group of locals who come to the restaurant which is always a good sign). The rooms are small but with lots of welcoming touches, including terry cloth-lined bathrobes and slippers in the rooms. The walk-in shower was great and the bathroom amenities of good quality. The shower heads are a bit funky and should be replaced. But everything else was perfect. Staff were great throughout. A special thank you to Bates who gave us great restaurant recommendations and arranged for a piece of birthday cake to be sent to our rooms. This is a high class place without pretentiousness. Will definitely go back next time I’m in New York.
user_name:
lovestravelling2003
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My girlfriends and I come to NYC every year in January to teach a trial advocacy clinic at Cardozo Law School. Over the years, we have been “put up” in many different hotels by the law school. None of them compare to The Walker and our trip is enhanced immeasurably when we are lucky enough to stay there. The warm and cozy vibe hits you the second you pull up to the front door and it never leaves. The rooms are small (even by NY standards), but none of that matters because they are so well appointed. The lobby, the bar, the restaurant, the staff....I can’t say enough good things. I want to live there.

It was a wonderful experience. Very good location, clean and neat room. Very quite and reasonable size for NYC. It was a nice surprised to have cookies every nite in your room! People were friendly and helpful too. And the restaurant food also tasty.

Loved my stay but had three issues:- the shower drain was very backed up so I had to stand in 3 inches of water, which was very unpleasant. - I wish the hair dryer had been higher quality - it really bothered me that fake information was added for my phone and email address before checking in, and that the staff member brushed it off like no issue. It was very off-putting and made me mistrust the check in process.
user_name:
glks7
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night, having previously stayed in Times Square for 4 nights 2 weeks earlier. The location is much quieter and felt less touristy, which is what we wanted. A beautiful hotel, well kept. Our bedroom was fabulous, a great city view and very plush. 1930s style with an old fashioned telephone and art deco furnishings. The bathroom was superb. I couldn't fault it. Breakfast was great. One of the receptionists was a bit rude at first and seriously needed to cheer up and I would have given it 5 stars but for her. But the receptionist we dealt with later was wonderful and a credit to the hotel. There is also a really nice italian restaurant across the road which we went to. All in all, definately book this hotel if you're staying in Greenwich Village. We could have stayed longer.
user_name:
Joanne S
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: The Walker Hotel is an elite class that caters to great hospitality with friendly and helpful staff. The room (1704) was spacious and absolutely beautiful. The terrace is a dream and the huge bathroom was a surprise. The tub is enormous and the products feel and smell amazing. Highly recommend.
user_name:
jasonher
New York City, New York

review_body: Stumbled on this hotel on a quiet street in Greenwich Village for a business trip. High touch service with an excellent feel. The lobby feels more like your personal den complete with a piano a guest actually played one morning. Walking distance from great neighborhood restaurants and shopping. Would definitely stay there again.

My daughter and I needed a place near Greenwich Village. The Staff was very friendly and professional. They seemed to genuinely want to make our stay comfortable. The rooms were clean and updated. The hotel had lots of original character. Location is great. Would highly recommend and will stay here again on my next visit.

This is our second stay in two years and again some pros and cons. Pros: * Restaurant still really good (we had room service one night). Lovely guy who took our room service order organised some basic pita bread for my daughter (menu is not particularly child friendly, but fabulous for me!) * Great location, lovely neighbourhood and handy having the Murray's Bagels and Chipotle nearby. Also had a really good dinner at Da Andrea across the road. Easy to get around by subway. * Lobby still lovely and live music Thurs/Fri/Sat nights. * We arrived around 4.30pm and our room wasn't ready, but they got us a round of drinks while we waited (which wasn't long at all!) Cons: * I was bummed to be a return guest (from Australia), book direct with the hotel, and still the get the room straight across from the elevator (i.e., the noisiest!). Maybe that is the only room with the two double beds. *Again, the beds are on wooden bases that catch your ankles and I see from other reviews I am not the only one! So bloody painful and easy to do given the rooms are NYC size (small!) * This time I found the room SO DARK. Like put every light on and can't find things you are looking for in your suitcase. * Housekeeping - we were missing robes, shower cap not replaced, etc. TV remote didn't work to turn on or off the TV (but did to change channels...) * They provide cookies at night, which is lovely, but even my sugarholic child wouldn't eat them, they just were not very good! *No help as a single adult with a child getting my bags from taxi to lobby or from lobby to taxi on departure (to be fair, there seem to be a LOT of "squeaky wheel" guests, and I am not one of those). * A lot of noise the last night. Like a fight or a party, I couldn't quite tell which. People in the hallway at 4am. Not the hotel's fault, but ugh. So inconsiderate in a small boutique hotel. On the upside, when I mentioned it to reception, they tried to apologise by getting me a coffee or something (I just didn't need anything, but appreciated the offer!) * Seems to just look more run down than when we were there two years ago. * No fridge or kettle/coffee making abilities.

We came to celebrate our anniversary and the hotel staff was so lovely and made it such a special trip. The hotel is in a perfect location tucked away from tourist traps but still central. The Art Deco style feels very New York and the amenities are top notch!

We love boutique hotels that are not big chain companies. This was great. We ate at the nice restaurant. Room was clean and bathroom updated. Great area for what we wanted close to family. Nice staff.

We took our two daughters to New York for 5 nights early December, staying at The Walker Greenwich Village. The hotel was particularly unhelpful when staying with small children (6 months and 6 years). Our room was tiny and the hotel stated they provide no cot at all. Not even remotely trying to help. The room we received when we arrived around 11pm absolutely wreaked of damp from the bathroom. No room service after 10pm also and no coffee making facilities at all in the room, not even a kettle to heat a babies bottle or a mini fridge to keep anything cool. We were moved the next morning by a begrudging member of the young reception team. No apologies whatsoever. Not a good start. The rooms are very small and the beds have a wooden plinth at ankle bone level which became a real pain, literally. The bedding almost hovered over you it was so light and uncomfortable. Our stay was not comfortable at all really but was one of the only rooms in New York able to accommodate a family of four. It’s just such a shame they are so child-unfriendly. On the upside the hotel is nicely located but we would not stay again or recommend to families. The hotel appears to be run by an extremely young team, quite obviously lacking in experience, drive or regard and with no visible Manager at any time, perhaps why they were so ill-equipped to cater to a family.

The Walker Hotel is a hidden gem which we were fortunate enough to discover. This is our third Christmas in NYC and each time we've stayed at the Walker. This visit we had the best room in the hotel and it was wonderful, with a balcony and a fabulous view of the Empire State Building. The Art Deco decor is accurately conveyed in every detail while still accommodating the modern traveler's technology needs. The bathroom was stunning with a huge tub and separate shower. Equally important is the fantastic service provided by a super-friendly, courteous and efficient staff. We'll definitely be returning here next Christmas!

This was my second time in New York and I enjoyed the my stay with Walker Hotel Greenwich. They allowed me early check in at 10 am as I arrived early after a long journey. The room is fine for a solo traveler and very comfortable. It has everything you need. The toilet and toiletries were more than enough. The receptionists were very helpful, all of them and they provided guidance on transportation to certain touristic places and even went the extra mile and printed out directions on which subway to use and how to reach your destination. The room service was excellent and I always found cookies put in my room in the evening. The hotel is close to everything and since you came to walk in new York, this is ideally located and you can walk everywhere. The hotel has a 5 star restaurant which i tried once fro breakfast and once for Thanksgiving dinner and the food is so yummy but a little bit expensive but it is worth it. Highly recommended hotel.

Loved our stay at the Walker Greenwich Village! The location is perfect if you’re looking for a place away from the craziness of midtown. Rooms are small but well appointed, comfortable and beautifully decorated. Staff was accommodating and friendly- from front desk to bar staff to restaurant servers. Definitely recommend!

Lovely hotel with welcoming and helpful staff. Art Deco design features and comfortable beds. Slept really well. Would definitely return. Close to subway stops and within walking distance of lovely restaurants, bars and shopping.

The rooms are small, of course, which is not the real problem. The bellman didn't tell us where the thermostat was, or that there was room service. There was no folio in the room, as you usually find in a hotel. One of the robes supplied (not Frette) had a threadbare belt-- really, tattered and with threads hanging from it. The shower didn't drain well. There were two inches of standing water, mid shower. The shower handle came off in my hand. When I put it back on, a sharp piece of metal on the back cut me (the size of a paper cut). The next day, I had forgotten, and the shower handle punctured another finger. The bathroom door handle came off as well. One of the two light bulbs in my nightstand lamp was burned out. Two nights, the hotel restaurant was not available to us, because it was hosting private parties. When I ordered room service for breakfast, they failed to give us cream for coffee or milk for oatmeal, even though we'd asked for it. By the time it was brought to us (with an apology), those cups of coffee were cold, and the oatmeal was lukewarm. I only told the front desk about the shower handle; that is a safety hazard. I wonder if they fixed it. The housekeeping staff were efficient and polite. Oh-- and I found out there's a fitness center after we checked out. I had to use the ladies' room, and to get to it downstairs I had to pass the kitchen and the fitness center. I'm not sure the fitness center was operational.

What a great place to stay! The Art Deco vibe is consistent throughout the hotel and while our room wasn't big, it was very clean and nicely appointed. The staff were very professional and polite and the extra touches, from the complimentary champagne when they noticed it was my birthday to the fresh cookies we came back to at night, made the stay feel special. We had tasty cocktails and olives at the bar and had a fresh and yummy breakfast at the cafe.

Got off to a bad start with offhand staff checking us in you don’t need that after a long flight! Rooms small nowhere to store anything ! Overall impression was very lack lustre . Only saving grace was comfortable bed and pillows . No management to speak of was run by youngsters who couldn’t care less !!

I love staying in this quaint hotel.. Each time I come to NYC with my husband this is where we stay :) I specially love that it feels cozy and friendly! When you come from far away like we do, it feels very nice to be made to feel right at home. After a 14 hour flight, we arrived to the city early enough, so check-in wasn't going to be happening for a while, plus my husband had to go off as he is here in business. Your staff were wonderful at making me feel very welcome and took really good care of me while waiting for my time to check in..I specially wanted to make sure to thank Lashawn (hope I spelled it right) ;) as he made sure I was comfortable and happy, as well as keeping me company while making sure to check up on my room being ready :)I hope I can keep coming back and seeing friendly smiles.. always :))

The hotel was lovely and so clean. The staff went above and beyond our expectations. My daughter called to tell them it was my birthday and the staff had a special chocolate treat and some bubbly which made our stay extra special. The staff helped us with everything and were so nice. The food was delicious. We will be back again and again. The location was perfect, close to subway and Washington Park.

The Walker in ‘The Village’ was a delight! The hotel was very atmospheric and had a great,friendly,helpful staff. The hotel’s location was ideal for artistic/cultural visits. The Walker is in walking distance of four on NY’s indie movie theaters, three of the best jazz clubs and a host of great theater companies as well as the Joyce theater for dance!

8 ladies traveled far and wide for a weekend reunion at The Walker Hotel. It is a charming hotel, in an excellent location. We were able to enjoy the lovely lounge area in front of the warm fire, have drinks and catch up. Huge shout out to Marie for her hospitality and ability to recognize the guests wishes. My bed was incredibly comfortable, bathroom immaculate with great water pressure on a higher floor. Would absolutely stay here again.

A friend and I stayed here for one night while spending the weekend in the city. The location of the hotel was perfect for us as we enjoy walking as much as we can. It's on a quieter street and is within reasonable walking distance of shops, restaurants, different neighborhoods, galleries, etc. The women at the front desk were so friendly and made checking in a very pleasant experience. The room was nice and worked well for us. The only slight downside was the walls seemed to be a little thin. We could hear doors slamming throughout the night and a child crying early in the morning, but it wasn't anything too out of the ordinary for a hotel (especially in a busy city). We also had complementary water and brownies left in our room at the end of the night which was a kind touch. There is a cafe and bar downstairs that has cute decor and a nice atmosphere. We didn't eat there but sat for the afternoon to have some coffee and tea. Overall I think this hotel was a great spot to stay, especially for the night or weekend. There's easy access to the city, it's less crazy than staying in more central Manhattan, and the price is really reasonable for New York.

We booked the hotel based on location, price (reasonable price for an expensive city) and the photos as the hotel looked to have character. All the staff were really lovely, helpful and friendly, from the front desk to the restaurant / bar staff.First impressions are good, with a roaring fire in the lobby and music playing. My room on the 15th floor had great views out to the city skyline and the design is tasteful. Bathroom was very clean with a great shower. However, the hotel is clearly tired and the public areas (in the light of day) need a lick of paint and a good clean! My net curtains had tears in the them, as did those in my friend's room. The carpet outside the lifts was really not clean and neither were the public bathroom areas downstairs. This is a really beautiful building, nicely designed and with a great team of staff. The potential is clearly there but the management need to invest some time and energy into tidying it all up. It could be stunning! Overall a bit disappointed.

My partner and I stayed at the Walker Hotel from November 1 - 5, 2019 for an extended weekend after he completed his business in New York earlier in the week. The staff were all very friendly, intelligent, knowledgeable and very forthcoming with extra service and recommendations. The location was great for exploring the city and surrounded by neighborhoods, a wide variety of great restaurants and shops that was perfect for exploring on foot in the lovely fall weather. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and are looking forward to our next visit to the Walker Hotel. The Walker will no doubt be our go-to hotel for future trips to New York City.

Not the cleanest (don’t look too closely at your remote control), food wasn’t great (avoid the goat cheese, tomato frittata) and overall, things didn’t seem to be really taken care of. The knob to my bathroom door fell off and there are stains all over the carpet in the room. Also very loud. I could hear my neighbor along with outside noise. Street noise is expected to some extent, neighbor noise is not. At this price point ($460 per night) I would not recommend this hotel, nor will I be staying there again.

My lady friend (dubbed Ms Marian by Staff) and I stayed at The Walker Hotel Greenwich Village from November 1 - 5, 2019,for pleasure shortly after I completed five days of business where I stayed, by myself, at another NYC Hotel. From the minute I was checked in by Ivanna Fernando unitil we checked out it was a blast. We stayed on the top floor where there was a pied- a-terre and balcony. The room was well appointed and comfortable and by New York standards large. The lobby with the large fireplace and comfortable seating served as our "living room" and was a great place for entertaining guests, people watching and enjoying well made cocktails from the adjacent bar. The staff, Marvin from North Carolina, Marie from NYC, the two guys, both named Bates (one from Nashville and the other from Mississippi and the Bronx, plus the young man from Burkina Faso were all friendly and bright young people with great futures ahead of them.The food, breakfast and dinner were exquisite, well presented and delicious. The hotel sent up to our room freshly made "turn-down" cookies nightly. Marie even sent up a bottle of great wine - a delicious red as a token of her appreciation for the wonderful conversation we had the night before.Within walking distance were so many neighborhood restaurants it was almost overwhelming. They were Italian, Japanese, ,Mediterranean, Mexican and so on. Needless to say, we will be back. This place is definitely "The Spot" and I highly recommend it to individuals, couples and/or groups looking for an experience and adventure. My work takes me to major and minor US and Canadian cities and I would put this hotel in my top five.Ted WilliamsDes Moines, Iowa

This is second stay at the Walker Hotel. Each time we have had a wonderful experience. The hotel is ideally located to our friends that live in the Village and we can easily walk to their homes and travel all over the city via the subways. Great local restaurants and lots to see and do in the immediate area. We look forward to our next visit and highly recommend the Walker for a wonderful experience and great service.

The hotel is very charming from the outside, with the brick interior and flickering gas lights. There is a doorman to open the doors and greet you into the lovely, old-timey interior. The reception desk is located to the right of the stairs, hidden in a corner. Everyone was very friendly and helpful with the check-in, my stay, and local information. The room itself was very nice, with the TV hidden hidden behind some beautiful lacquer sliding panels. The two double beds were very comfortable (well, the one I slept in was). The hanging cabinet in the room had a light that turned on when you opened the door, and there were two umbrellas for customer use.The bathroom was really nice! A large walk-in shower and nice-smelling soaps. The tiles were very classy, and the entire room was very art deco and enjoyable to come back to after a day of work. The complimentary bottles of water and home-baked cookies were a very nice and unexpected touch!

Quaint hotel in the northern side of the Village. It is located out of the hustle and bustle of the City with a healthy mix of residential and commercial establishments. Several subway stations/lines are within a few blocks away, and Murray Bagels is around the corner. The Hotel personnel were friendly and helpful. Room was fine for our needs, and we appreciated the nightly turn down service and cookies. What a treat.

While the Walker Hotel certainly exudes an elegant charm, as a place to stay while in New York, I found it lacking on many fronts...* I arrived at 4:30 PM -- well past check-in time, and my room was not ready -- had to wait 30 minutes to get into my room.* A maintenance guy came to my room to "recharge" my lock. When he tested it, it was fine. Apparently he was sent to the wrong room.* The power outlet in my room did not work, the clock did not work, and the shower drain was clogged.* There were only four coat hangers in the little wardrobe. * The shower head dribbled more than it sprayed. When I tried to adjust it, the entire pipe behind the wall moved -- it was not fastened correctly.* Both the restaurant and the fitness center were closed for an event the morning of my stay (without any notification upon check-in) -- so no breakfast, and no workout. * I received a text message 5 hours after I had checked out asking me "how my stay was going".My recommendation to management is to focus on getting the basics right. Bathrobes, slippers and cookies at bedtime are irrelevant if you can't deliver a basic level of hospitality.
FantasticNice viewComfortable roomSunny orientationCleanGood serviceWarm ambiance, you feel at home even you are not.Would go back definitlyThe dining room is great and the food is very goodGreat!

We arrived at the Walker Hotel on Wednesday night, pressed for time to make our existing dinner reservations. I went to check in only to realize I had reserved the wrong dates! They were not expecting us until tomorrow evening. I was gutted. It was late, and at the moment we had nowhere to stay. They informed me they were booked, but immediately started calling surrounding hotels, and got us a room for the night. We returned the next night, checked into our room, The Walker Terrace, which was just stunning. The terrace was the best part of this room - an uninterrupted view of the Empire State Building. Our room was spacious (for NYC) and tidy. We checked out the bar for happy hour, loved the chit chat with the bartender and staff. The location was exceptional as most of our plans were in Greenwich & Chelsea. Lovely stay at a lovely hotel - most definitely will return.

My husband books this hotel regularly for business purposes. Whilst the hotel is of a good quality standard I found the customer service disappointingly poor. The bar staff were rude, front of house unhelpful and when a complaint was made no follow-up or feedback given. They need to work a lot harder to get the customer service up to the standard of a good quality hotel.

Small, boutique hotel on a quiet street in West Village in great location with excellent young staff. Check in was fast and efficient. The bellman, Bates, was so knowledgeable (where to eat, how to get limo to airport on departure)., the breakfast staff were efficient and very pleasant . Rooms tend to be small so chose rooms based on how important space. The carpets in hallways and in bedrooms hopefully will be replaced. Location is food heaven- famous Murray’s Bagels and Japanese deli steps away on Sixth Avenue, great Italian across the street, gluten-free Hu on Fifth Avenue. Definitely will return.

I took my son to NY for some mother-son time. We wanted to stay in Greenwich Village. It was not easy finding a hotel in that region with two beds in a room. Fortunately The Walker Hotel had a room. I am so glad we stayed there. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The ambiance of the hotel is relaxing yet sophisticated. There is a fireplace and seating area as you enter, a nice bar and a restaurant. The hotel is small so it is quiet. Only 7 rooms per floor. We heard very little noise at night. The rooms are small but it is NY. Plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance as well as comedy clubs, the High Line and Chelsea. The beds are comfortable and they deliver fresh baked treats at night to your room.They also provide you with bottled water daily. Lovely hotel. Hope to be back.

We just stayed here for one night but LOVED the vibe of the hotel inside and out, service was impeccable (I called the front desk for toothpaste and they delivered it in 5 min), and the bar had delicious drinks. Loved the Art Deco feel and it’s proximity to everything great in the village. I would highly recommend!

Very claustrophobic- rooms are not well lit or airy , poor service- denied check in for 5 hours after a really long flight - asked for a restroom to take a shower and was directed to go to the public toilets , very limited food options . Definitely not a three star service or worth the price

My husband and I visited the Walker Hotel last weekend. I wanted to give a shout out to the amazing staff members: Stacy-Ann, Ivanna F. & Cameron. I visited NY for work and also had a wedding over the weekend. Stacy-Ann & Ivanna were extremely helpful (and complimentary of my outfit - always a sure way to get bonus points). Cameron was super helpful and on top of helping us with our bags/directions. All around all-star crew!The bar was also cute & cozy and the bar staff was fantastic. We'll definitely be returning! - Love the Delvas :-)

My husband and I stayed at the Walker Hotel last weekend. I'm writing a quick review to acknowledge the AMAZING staff! Stacy-Ann, Ivanna F. & Cameron were awesome. They were considerate, caring and on top of things. I specifically appreciate their friendliness and willingness to help even when inconvenient for them. My husband and I will definitely be returning! PS. The bar was super cute and the bar staff was also fantastic. Thank you!

I think the Walker Hotel is amazing. Everyone here is really nice and helps you in any way. One person I recommend is Stacy-Ann. She is VERY helpful and is very kind. The hotel is awesome too. The historical feel to really just make the whole experience way better. I feel like this hotel is really the best.

Lovely, comfortable, inviting boutique hotel in Greenwich Village. Clean and cozy. Staff is incredibly helpful and courteous. The restaurant is fantastic! My only negative is rooms are on the small side but we were never in the room.

I’d definitely stay here again when heading to New York.Pros- super quiet - friendly staff- near train station- loved the co bigelow products - loved the unique style of the room- free bottled water was a bonusCons- none

Amazing facility if you travel as a couple! Great location in a beautiful neighborhood. We had a glance on the Empire State Building from our window. Very kind and helpful receptionists. We will certainly be back!

I have been to NY several times and this was, in fact, the best place I've stayed in. The staff is great, the room ald cleaning great and the restaurant very good (have to try the pizza with mushrooms and truffle).

A cute hotel.A nice gesture that I remember - after they clean the room they put a plate with a few cookies.The room could be bigger. The breakfast was great+ the waiters & chef were attentive and helpful (we wanted to get the dish with half of its ingredients)  The crew is super positive, feel free to ask anything (an umbrella for a rainy day/ a good advice for a place to hang around in a sunny one.)

Lovely hotel and staff. Will stay here next time visiting NYC. Comfortable bed, accommodating staff and perfect location to explore the Village. It is very quaint and charming. Thankful to find this place.

Do you like a wonderful getaway? Do you want to be in New York City with all of the good things and the bad things? Stop looking for other hotels and book this immediately. It’s the most magical place we have ever stayed. Great food nearby. Check. Wonderful views of the New York sky line. Check. A perfect getaway you will never forget. Check.

We stayed here for five nights and chose it based on our travel agent's recommendation and the relative proximity to things we wanted to do during our visit, which were mainly in and around Greenwich Village. The Good:Relatively quiet in terms of street noise, away from the hustle and bustle of midtown. Out package included a prix-fixe breakfast every day, two tickets to the Whitney Museum, and a $50 Food and Beverage Credit.The prix-fixe breakfast choices at the Society Cafe were fine, but some menu items (eggs, salmon toast) were better than others (olive oil pancakes). Loved the fresh pressed juices, as well as the music choices. We also ate here one evening as well. Food is locally sourced.Plush robes in the room, nice assortment of bath products from a local apothecary on 6th Avenue.The Bad:While we were aware before booking that the room would be small, we weren't prepared for how small the Queen room would be for two people who had enough luggage for a five day stay. Not a lot of space to keep two suitcases, and nowhere to really sit and relax unless it was on the bed. We could also hear the person in the next room when they came in at night, and when they were drying their hair in the morning.Housekeeping would come far too late in the day - we called down one day and were told they cleaned rooms up until 5 pm (?!). There was one day we came in mid-afternoon wanting to rest before dinner and the room hadn't been made up yet. When housekeeping showed up, since my husband was sleeping I told her to just give me clean towels, and handed hers ours without the room being cleaned. The next day we returned to the room around 4ish. Again, the room was not made up. Since housekeeping was in the hallway, and we told her we would go down and wait in the lounge until she was done. The last morning we were there, she knocked on the room at 10:30 am (we hadn't checked out yet and were still packing, since check out is at 11). Soap was not replenished during our stay (thankfully there was enough to last until check out), and one afternoon, we had to call down for additional toilet paper, which they brought while we were out to dinner. When we checked in, the complimentary bottled water was not in our room, and we had to call down for it since we were dying of thirst.No ice bucket in room, no glasses (not even plastic cups), no pen and paper. One day when we called down for ice, it never arrived. Another day, they brought up the ice we asked for, but no glasses (?!).At breakfast one morning, while we were still working on our coffee, the waitress reminded us we had to leave our vouchers for breakfast on the table, as if we were going to run off without paying.I'd like to see a more polished look for the bellhops (can hard to tell in the lobby who is a bellhop versus who is a guest), but each one we dealt with was extremely helpful.For the price we paid, I'm not sure if I would stay here again for a future visit to NYC. I might if the price were right and I had a specific reason to be in the area.

As one of the organizers for a group staying at the Walker Hotel, I found the hotels staff to be incredibly accommodating and made for a seamless experience for my team and our guests. Amenidies such as unlimited water bottles, and turn down service is lost in big brand hotels - and these at the Walker make all the difference when in town for a hectic event.

The staff at the Walker Hotel went above and beyond during our trip and made our stay truly extraordinary. Each of them from the front door staff to reception truly made a personable lasting impression that you don't see at many big name hotels. We will be returning soon.

I thought I'd treat my husband and I to a couple of nights at The Walker Hotel while staying for a few weeks in NY. It was very overpriced for what we got.Unfortunately I chose the smaller room as all the other rooms were even more expensive.Luckily it was only for two nights.Limited room for the suitcases and really nowhere to put toiletries in the bathroom apart from a couple of small ledges.The staff were friendly enough and the ambience was nice in the lobby area.Location was good and just around the corner was a Bagel Buffet place where we got a good cheap breakfast.I would not stay here again. Much better value and space with an AirBnB and even other hotels in NY.

This was our second visit to The Walker Hotel and I highly recommend it on the basis of both visits. The first time as a base for our wedding and the second on our first anniversary. The staff made each occasion special, decorating the room on our return from getting married and providing some Prosecco on our return. we stayed in a Queen Room each time, which was spacious and comfortable; the bath was fabulous place to relax after pounding the streets of New York and the terrace had a great view of the Empire State Building. I found it very conveniently located, with easy access to great restaurants and bars. We choose to walk everywhere and even Central Park was accessible. If you are looking for a small hotel, with great service for a special occasion then you could not do better. I hope to return again soon.

Clean, accommodating, nice service and friendly. Great GV location. Breakfast comped and was delicious. We will be back. Valet parking not a bad value however must leave the car in during your stay or be charged it time it is pulled.

The best thing about the walker hotel are the staff. They are very friendly. It’s in a good location and short walk from union square and many restaurants. Ground Zero is about a 45-60 minute walk from the hotel. This was our 5th trip as a family to NYC. We had previously stayed in Manhattan twice, Soho and China town so we wanted to try Greenwich village. We had noticed on the previous comments that the rooms were small. So I thought we were prepared for small. 2 people can not walk from one side of the room to the other at the same time. The wardrobe was only big enough for a few hanging items. 3 hangers! (Our daughter did have a slightly bigger room and wardrobe.) The bathrooms are tiny too. With an opaque glass door so not much privacy. Also a shaving mirror or magnifying mirror would be a great addition to the bathroom. I’m sure this would have all been fine if it had been for just one or two nights but any longer and it becomes irritating. The rooms are clean and tidy. The beds are comfortable. The air conditioning is extremely noisy. Drinking water was replaced 2/4 nights. Lovely toiletries. Only 1/3 of our rooms had a snack basket.

I had friends who stayed here while they visited for the weekend. The hotel has a cool/edgy/tasteful interior and my friends were super satisfied about the experience. Especially memorable, however, was the friendly service. We had booked tickets to a concert we'd been waiting on for a long time, but found out last minute that it had to be printed (we'd assumed tickets are mobile). StacyAnn was able to print the tickets off on an extremely short notice at night and we were able to make it to the concert! 10/10 would recommend/stay again.

I booked the Queen Hudson Deluxe room and was impressed by the semi-private balcony on the 2nd floor. Shout out to Chris, a new employee there who was very friendly and helpful, showing us a different room just so I had an idea what the hotel offered. I'll be back!

Nice location and close to our family's apartment. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Didn't like having to wait for ice to arrive. Overall experience was great. They held our luggage until our room was ready.

The Walker Hotel was recommended by the couple we traveled with and we could have been more impressed with the hotel. Liza cordially checked us in when we arrived and made us feel welcomed and valued as guests. The rooms were beautifully decorated, adequate in size and very comfortable and quiet. The shower had amazing water pressure, good lighting and adequate counter space. At the end, Liza also checked us out and inspired us to return to her lovely hotel in the near future.

Great atmosphere, quiet room, staff was incredibly friendly and professional. I will definitely stay at The Walker Hotel again. The food at the restaurant was excellent. You walk into the lobby and immediately feel safe and welcomed!

This charming boutique hotel felt like home before I'd arrived, courtesy of wonderful Lisa, with whom I booked my room. I value the human component in a hotel stay highly, and the Walker gets top marks on this point. Everyone I had contact with, from making the reservation to my departure, including wait staff, cleaning staff, reception, room service, EVERYONE, was friendly, gracious, efficient, and exceeded in delivery whatever my actual request had been: amazing! Secondly, cleanliness: the hotel again receives my top marks with one odd exception: the outer entry of the hotel, which of course is the 1st point of contact on arriving, needs love. Maybe in the form of fresh paint, a new entry carpet, maybe a consultation with a lighting expert: my first moment was disappointing due to a soon-dispelled sense of the shabby. I hope management, which excels in many areas, takes note of this review and spruces the entry up. Everything else was wonderful, but a first impression has a way of lingering. Thirdly, the in-house restaurant is fantastic. My first night, I arrived late, tired, hungry and was swiftly shown to a fabulous corner banquette where I enjoyed warm and efficient service and an absolutely delicious meal. It felt like my life was saved. Next, if you can book a room in a high floor with a south facing view, do so. The view outside my 17th floor room was cinematically perfect: I owned downtown! In sum: I left feeling pampered, cared for, better for the stay.

We stayed at the hotel with several other friends in order to attend a wedding at a nearby venue.The rooms were very comfortable, and the service, from the front desk staff to room service to the staff in the dining room, was all great. A particular shoutout to Eddie and his staff ( Rodrigo, Mostafa, Chase,Freddie, and Jorge) for the great job they did for the breakfast our large group had on Sunday, and to Marie for arranging the breakfast

I was in NYC on business and stayed here because it was close to where I was working. I arrived at 10:30 pm and asked for a recommendation for a late dinner. The restaurant recommended many places nearby and did not push their own restaurant, which I appreciated. The room was small, as expected, but it met my needs. The bathroom was so small that there was no room to put anything other than my toothbrush. But the shower was large and had lots of hot water and good pressure. The room would have been cramped for two people, however. The bed was comfortable, but nothing special. I appreciated the Saratoga Springs water.

Just visited Walker hotel for a birthday celebration. Cute,quirky from the outside. Beautiful decor, friendly helpful staff. Room cute,clean,comfortable beds. Art Deco vibe. Would definitely stay again.

5 night stay in August and can only say that despite the huge challenges the staff faced when there was a water main burst under the hotel they made our stay in this quiet and elegant hotel an absolute joy. An unassuming and understated entrance on a relatively quiet street leads into what I can only describe as what I imagined a Greenwich Village hotel would look like. A little quirky in its layout but beautifully decorated. Whilst our room (Hudson style - so had a balcony) was small and not much clothes storage space it was quiet and comfortable and had all we needed.The fabric of the building may have cracked for 24/36 hours with no water and issues on the lifts etc but the staff especially Steven Ramirez (manager I believe) were always courteous, helpful and went beyond what could have been expected and whilst others (understandably) bailed out we stayed and were pleased to have done so.I would happily go back and stay here.

We had a lovely couple of nights at The Walker. Our room was beautifully decorated, with a little terrace and a lovely big bath to enjoy a soak in. The bed was very comfortable - we slept like babies - and it was nice to see the Empire State Building from our room. I would however have liked to have had coffee making facilities in the room.The art by local artists throughout provides a great gallery, which I enjoyed looking at.We only had breakfast at the hotel one morning, and it was delicious. The staff were especially friendly and welcoming. We had plans for the 2nd morning, otherwise we would have eaten here again.

Water has been out for hours now, since my arrival. Elevators are down and now the phones are dead in the room and calling the hotel's main line leads to a "service unavailable" message so there is no way to reach staff other than trekking down fifteen flights of stairs to the front desk. Not to mention the very small rooms that although nicely decorated, have been poorly maintained and not well dusted/cleaned. The nicest thing I can say is that the front desk attendants are friendly.

Staff are motivated and delightful across the board, reservationist, reception, housekeeping, bartender and engineer. Little historical touches, rich wood tones and luxurious fabrics engulf you in Art Deco and fit in well with the attractive building. The location is almost perfect for easy walks and little restaurant gems abound. A lot of well thought details. I do prefer larger rooms with a couch and small sitting area and much bigger bathrooms. Glad NYC has boutique properties like Walker that thrive and good luck in Tribeca come the fall.
user_name:
alanmaxg
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for three nights with my daughter for a 16th birthday trip. Staff was terrific! Sent a hand written birthday note and piece of cake to our room. Check in and out with luggage storage was easy and pleasant. Beautiful blue bottles of water sent up to the room at no charge whenever requested. Cookies at turndown. They called a car for us to get to the airport that was less expensive than Lyft or Uber. Terrific location on a beautiful street close to 14th street and Union Square stations. Rooms are small but square footage is listed so shouldn’t be a surprise to anyone. Looking forward to returning to the Walker Hotel for my next trip to NY.

Great view from the 15th floor of our room of the Towers and the Village. Loved being in the neighborhood near Union Square and Washington Square. Hotel near lots of restaurants and stores. I've stayed in various hotels around the city and this was my favorite. The room was small but lovely. The lobby was welcoming and so was the staff.

4.5 stars. I stayed here for 3 nights in July, during one of my long weekends in the city. Here are my thoughts.Good:- very charming and small hotel. I cannot stand impersonal, huge chains, and this is the antithesis of that. It has history, character, and charm.- great location in Greenwich village. Last time I stayed in the city, I stayed in the Bowery/Chinatown area. While I love the vibe in the lower east side, I realized that it was too far south, and I ended up having to Uber so much that it cost so much money. During this trip, I was able to walk around the village, to Chelsea, the Meatpacking, SoHo, etc.- friendly and attentive staff. On my 2nd night, I had an issue with my shower (paint and plaster fell from the ceiling), and they made sure to attend to it immediately. - Bad:- the rooms are small but not unusual for NY. Even though they were tiny, they were arranged well, and for a solo traveler or couple, they don’t feel too cramped.- older hotel so there are some maintenance or function issues (e.g., paint peeling off and falling from shower ceiling, no USB ports, no trash can in bathroom).In spite of the few negatives, I had a great stay at the hotel and will likely come back soon!

After a previous recent visit to NY I stayed at a horrible AirBnB and had an awful time in NY and swore the city off. I came back to NY for work and stayed at the Walker and the experience was so pleasant that it reminded me how lovely NY can be. The rooms are stylish and the hotel is incredibly well designed. The service was exemplary - when I asked for more counter space they brought in an extra small table for me. Only complaint is that the bathrooms need more counter space.

The location couldn’t be better - A tree line block in Greenwich Village and easy to get to anywhere. Comfortable room, bed plus a great shower. The friendly, attentive staff makes the whole experience quite special. Great restaurant too!!

Adorable, DECO, nice staff, good food.. a TERRACE.. cute decor, free perks, OLD BUILDING WITH CHARM, Good soap, COMFY BED. It's all here. At the Walker. Great spot. Near subways and restaurants... a nice walking loop through the West Village!!!

Stayed here for 5 nights on a work trip, staff were excellent and fun from the moment I arrived , even gave me a free beer.Rooms were really nice, well maintained.. Food was good, maybe a little pricey, maybe not - it's NYC.Highly recommended.

I chose this hotel over the W Union Square primarily because of price and after reading the many positive reviews. We weren't disappointed. The Walker is located on a quiet street bet. 5th and 6th avenues. I loved that the hotel was in between Brownstones and not on a major thoroughfare with honking taxis. We had a double bedford room which was cozy but perfect for my 17 year old son and I. Double beds are only big enough for one adult. The bathroom was also small but the shower was great ! and the soaps and shampoos very nice too ! They also gave complimentary water. We had breakfast at the Society cafe on one morning. It's a cute space and the breakfast is fine. Service was very friendly at the hotel and they even texted after the first night to make sure we were happy. I wanted to be near NYU as my son was moving there after our stay. I would definitely recommend if you want to be in this area. I moved to a midtown hotel after my son left me and missed the quietness of this hotel.

Beautiful Hotel. Amazing Service. Great Rooms. I would stay here again in an instant. Ideal location. You can explore Greenwich Village and Union Square --- plus, you are only 2 miles from Times Square. Staff was exceptional. Example -- we had a young bellman named Daniel, who would constantly assist us -- grabbing bags hailing cabs --- always going the extra mile. This is was common with all of the staff.The restaurant within the hotel, The Society Cafe, is extraordinary. Be sure to eat at least a couple of your meals there.

What an amazing experience! I was in New York on business and needed assistance with making a booking and sorting out y itinerary for my stay. I was assisted by Kathy Ma who completely took over and made sure that I was happy with all the arrangements. She made very good suggestions for restaurants, things to do, places I have to see etc. and also finalized all of my reservations. The hotel room was great, the location of the hotel is close to lots of restaurants, bars, comedy clubs and jazz clubs but in a quiet street. I will most certainly be back. Thanks to Kathy and the Walker Hotel for the incredible stay!

The front desk staff especially Lisa, Eddy, Perry, Joyce, and David were always most helpful, fun and helped make the stay special. The housekeeping staff, are always in the backgound but too are to be applauded. The afternoon cookies...delicious and welcome after a long day in the city.We had the "room with a view" of the Empire State Bldg which at night is spectacular. The location was perfect as we were heavy users of the buses and subway system..We LOVE NYC in good part because of this special hotel

We will definitely return to the Walker. We needed an ADA (accessible) room, and the room worked out very well. Curbless shower, grab bars near the toilet, etc. The staff assisted us with my husband's wheelchair whenever they spotted us moving through the lobby, and they were so personable. We felt really welcomed. Lovely bathrobes in the room, too.

What a lovely hotel. Amazing staff hit just the right balance of friendly,helpful and attentive. Great location and comfortable rooms make the place a respite from the busy city. Centrally located with dozens of good,great and affordable dining options.

I would absolutely recommend (and stay again!) the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village! The team anticipates your needs, is highly energetic and so helpful! They definitely stand apart in a city full of hotels! The hotel is fantastic in its own right!

We really enjoy the Hotel and the service. We booked directly with the hotel and we had great price and great surprises ( breakfast coupon, drink at the society) The view from our room was super. It is a small room but everything is in place so you have plenty of space. We will be back as soon as we can !

Great location for me! with easy access to subway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed eating at the restaurant as well. I would recommend this hotel and I look forward to coming again.

We booked this hotel for Pride Weekend in June. We couldn't have been made to feel more welcomed and comfortable. We were given a phone call days ahead anticipating our visit and asking if there was anything we needed. When we arrived we were greeted by Lisa and Perry who were so warm, friendly and accommodating. They took care of our luggage until our beautiful, clean and comfortable room was ready. It was reasonably priced, perfect location to everything downtown and more importantly, Lisa, Perry and the brunch hostess was so friendly, it really felt like we were staying in someone's home. This will be the only place I stay is I need this location. It was recommended to me by a friend and it did not disappoint. Lisa and Perry, as our first line of impression, were professional yet friendly and felt like friends immediately. Can't say enough about them and this hotel.

Great hotel in an awesome location, excellent staff & service. Steven & Liza are the best! Close to the best that New York has to offer - High Line, Whitney, Soho, West Village shopping...easy access to public transportation.

This place is so fine. Top of the tops in each and every detail. Has style and good atmosphere as well. Loved the lobby and restaurant. I did think my room was a bit small and it was a shame they didn’t have a fridge and a kettle. The location was perfect for me.

The entire stay was wonderful. The staff were friendly and helpful. Cathy and Daniel checked us in which was quick and easy. Ivy checked on us during our stay. And Eddie helped us with valet. He was so nice and easy to talk with. The room was clean and organized and evening turn down service was something we had never experienced before so it was a nice surprise. The water pressure in the shower was to die for. All around it was excellent.

My room was nice and very tiny. It was quiet. The location is great as well as the hotel, very nicely furnished. I found disturbing the loud music early in the morning in the breakfast room. The quality of the service ( at the front desk, at the restaurant) is a variable one. Room cleaning service should improve.

When there are events in the Village, at the New School, or at NYU, this is a great place to stay. A bit expensive, but then that is true everywhere in NY, but worth the convenience. The room, service, and having an all-day restaurant are all a plus. Just a few steps from the subway for both the West side and the East side, so convenient to the whole city as well. This is a small hotel, but with amenities of a much larger one.

We loved our stay at the Walker Hotel. Our room was fabulous. It was very quiet. We never heard elevator noise or other guests at all during our stay.The shower was the best shower I have experienced in a hotel. Usually hotels have low water pressure, but this was definitely not the case.The beds were very comfortable. I brought my computer cable and plugged my work computer in and was able to work great from the room. They also have WIFI which we used for our devices.The Society Cafe was wonderful. We ate breakfast here everyday and it was the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. Great seasonal menu. Location was perfect! I've stayed in Time Square before and prefer to be out of the hustle and bustle of midtown. This location is the perfect location for the subway, plus walking to the parks, Union Square and the West Village. The employees were very friendly. Always lending a hand with the door, bags, a car service, if needed, restaurant recommendations, or directions. We can't wait for our next visit to NYC and the Walker Hotel.

I stayed at this hotel this past winter, as part of a romantic weekend trip. I had plans to propose to my now fiance there. Steven, in guests services, really did a phenomenal job. Him and his team bought flowers, balloons, and rose petals. They decorated the room while we were out. They really did a great job, which made for an amazing proposal, I couldn't have done it without them! The hotel itself is a wonderful place to stay at!

My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Walker Hotel. The concierge team and additional staff was extremely welcoming and helpful throughout our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel to others. The Walker Hotel will be our go-to on our next visit.

New York can be crazy when traveling with a 13 year old... But when you stay at The Walker you feel like you are at home. The team that works there helped us with everything we asked about. The restaurant is VERY GOOD. Again... in some restaurants it is hard to find something a 13 year old boy would eat.. but they helped cater their amazing cheeseburger to the liking of our son. The room was comfortable and cozy and the view from our room was amazing. Just can't say enough good things about Walker Hotel in Greenwich. Thank you all for a great time.

Lovely hotel, tucked away in a busy area of Greenwich. Comfortable hotel, restaurant, and bar. Rooms can be small so be sure to look at the square feet you like best. Our room was perfect. Art deco, nicely appointed, water and snacks. Bathrobes, too. Shampoo and body lotion. Try it; thought the price was good, too, on a weekend.

We absolutely loved the Walker. The moment you walk into the hotel you're transported to a NY hideaway, quiet, funky interior, and incredibly kind staff. Kathy, Perry and Cameron were the best! We slept like a dream and walked just around the corner to Washington Square Park, feeling the magic of the Village all around us. A lovely stay, we will be back!

I love this hotel. The accommodations, location and mostly the STAFF are so kind and caring and competent. Liza and Joyce were great. I had a problem and it was fixed within five minutes (the lock was stuck) The staff really care about their guests.  The Society Cafe has delicious food and the servers were great. Honestly, I feel as if I am 'home' when I stay here. You would not be disappointed at The Walker in the Village. Kudos to ALL of the staff

This is such a restful place to come back to after a big trip in the city. The room was quiet and had a lovely view. We loved the food at the restaurant also. The staff really made an effort to make us feel at home and welcomed. We strongly recommend Walker Hotel Greenwich Village.
user_name:
danielR1478HB
New York City, New York

review_body: Art Deco nostalgic design without sacrificing contemporary conveniences. It is hard to find a comfortable and quiet hotel in Greenwich Village/Union Square area. I've stayed at the Hyatt Union Square and the W Hotel and much prefer the Walker. The evening jazz performers in the lobby area was very nice. The only negatives are no in-room coffee and I had a shirt laundered that came back dirtier than when I sent it in; grease marks that I was not able to subsequently get out. However, I recognize they don't launder in-house, so it was a vendor error.

The rooms were bit small but very beautiful and clean. I stayed here four days and it was a pleasure. The staff was extremely polite and friendly. The location of the hotel is perfect. I give my highest recommendations.
user_name:
jasonbA8551OP
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at the Walker for a week-long business trip and I found it to be an excellent home away from home. The front desk and lobby staff were all incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. Kathy was particularly helpful in assisting with requests and also provided an exhaustive list of wonderful local restaurant recommendations.The room, lobby, and dining areas were also all cozy and tastefully decorated to exude an elegant art deco ambiance. I highly recommend the Walker for the personal service, central location (walking distance to Chelsea, the Whitney Museum, and several MTA stops), and comfortable accommodations.

The experience of staying at the Walker hotel was extraordinary. The staff are extremely kind and accommodating, always going the extra mile to make the stay more pleasant. The hotel has a great vibe and is very well maintained. A special thank you to Kathy and Perry for their kindness, friendly attitude and the cookies!
user_name:
Daniel C
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Had an amazing stay and am really looking forward to returning. This hotel is very beautifully done with a super cool vibe, down to the tiniest details. Amazing staff, comfy bed, great water pressure, timely room service, great cocktails and the food was excellent. Kathy and Liza at the front desk were fabulous and took such good care of me! Thank you ladies!

Even though i stayed here on a business trip to NY, i would recommend this place for family trips as well. It has really great ambience and the bar is lovely too. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious, clean and the room service was excellent.

The staff at the walker hotel was amazing! They had amazing recommendations for food and were so helpful. Steven and Leo answered all of our questions— especially about navigating and learning the subway— and we loved talking to them. Will definitely be staying here again!

The Walker Hotel is a dream!!!!! My niece and I arestaying while she gets settled into her dorm for the the summer. The Concierges are outstanding!!!! Steven and Leo, the Concierges, are bright and eager faces that love their jobs!!! Whether walking you through the best subway route or choosing the perfect restaurant, they are ready to help!!!! The Hotel is lovely and warm and you actually feel like they are going to miss you when you check out. We loved our stay and our bathrobes!!!!!! Thank you Walker Hotel. A slice of Heaven is what you all are!!!!!!

Absolutely love this hotel! Checks the box in every aspect - from the staff / service, to the location, comfort & more - I plan to come back whenever I visit the city. My wife and I were celebrating our one-year anniversary, and the staff upgraded our room plus also left us a surprise bottle of champagne & chocolate covered strawberries. We could not have enjoyed our stay more. Further - for what it's worth - this is coming from someone who lived in Manhattan for five of the last six years, prior to moving out a year ago. Besides the staff and 'niceness' of the hotel, it is also in an absolutely wonderful location. Looking forward to returning!

This is a very comfortable hotel. The room was small, but the lobby, with several sitting options and a lovely fireplace, provides a nice place to sit and read when not out-and-about in the city. The location, near the vital Union Square, provides easy links to every other part of NYC, from Times Square and the financial district to the Upper East Side and the Met. Greenwich Village itself is a fascinating place to explore on foot.

Great spot right in the village and 2 minute walk to the heart of the west village. Stayed here in May after having booked an air bnb which was a disaster. This hotel rectified the trip !!! The staff were all lovely and the hotel, A’s a boutique, was so personal. The society cafe has a great buzz too! This will definitely be myNew York spot from now on!!

Does not deserve the 4* - quality of service is poor - no special attention from the staff (not really friendly and attentive) which is a big disappointment > the staff is not at all customer oriented (they are all looking very smart but they do not care about us in a genuine way) - the room is very small and we literally have no place for clothing storage (in particular if you stay 1 week) - the quality of the food is really good - the room and the hotel are super clean - very good location and super convenient - the WiFi connection is not good - I don’t think I will come back

Room 603 had problems. Plugged bathroom drains that overflowed when you showered (open shower with only a curtain) covering the the floors with 2 inches of soapy water, noisy, broken heater fan blades that clunked all night when the heater turned off and on, and a dark room with very poor lightening that made it very hard to put on makeup. When I reported the problems they took care of it immediately! Came back to my room at the end of the day and everything was repaired!! I was also given a lovely fruit plate and thank you note. The staff is GREAT but at $600 per night I will look for another hotel when I come to Greenwich Village.

pro’s: location. staff. housekeeping. con’s: very very small room. way overpriced. room needed total redo and bathroomrenovation. no in room coffee maker. no bottled water. no minibar. no counter space in bathroom. noisy if on street. while they can’t change room size they can renovate and price accordingly. the potential is there. again, staff gets A+.

It’s a terrific place. It’s small enough that you don’t feel like you’re just one of the several hundred guests staying here. With a great restaurant and super front desk, it’s why I keep coming back.

I had a relatively long stay at the Walker and booked a package with breakfast, which was worthy. Our first room was a little too small then we changed to a larger one that was adapted to people with disabilities. It was more spacious but it would have helped to have a squeegee handy for the bathroom would flood after every shower. Service was extremely attentive and responsive, and all people very nice, really made us feel at home. Fitness center was fine but not too impressive. Overall, a very nice hotel at prime location.

Location fantastic. Staff very pleasant and accommodating. Recommend for couples. Nice quaint lobby. Shower pressure fantastic. Rooms small but, enough room to store luggage and small desk too facing window in case u have work to do. I would stay here again. Dont plan on watching tv tho there is no service most of the time.

Love this place! Rooms are clean with nice amenities. Nice beefy towels! The food in the restaurant is delicious with friendly service everywhere. It would be nice if there was coffee in the room or at least in the lobby. The $20.00 drink voucher should be valid for the full amount! For example, if you have a $13.00 drink you should be able to use the balance toward a second one. A glass of club soda with mostly ice was $3.00! That was rather expensive.

good things: wifi works well, slippers, umbrella, robes, laundry bag, provided, thick towels, two free water bottles or you can get them free from the gym (24hrs open), strong shower pressure, dark room, shower plumbing works well, enough bathroom space for amenities, doormen open doors for u each time u go in and out, enough waiting area near the lobby, cozy place to read, comfortable bed, clean sheets, well turn down service, heater works well, no bright digital clocks watching u in the middle of the night, comfortable pillows, many cafes around the hotel, bad things: room door closes pretty loud- neighbors can wake u up in the morning if theyre early birds and ur nocturnal; wished there was usb outlets.

booked 4 night early April, nice hotel, rooms very small but great decor, staff are friendly, always stayed in midtown but this is a really nice area and would return to this location again, settled to bill on departure and then few days later had a $25 charge to my card without any explanation, email the hotel to be told it was for an umbrella, there was an umbrella in the room that we didn't use and was defiantly still in the room when we departed, the did credit the $25 but was not impressed the way this was just charged to my card, was looking on my statement for something else so wouldn't have found this charge.

Arrived on Sunday evening after a 20 hour flight to be blatantly ignored by the front desk receptionist, not even an acknowledgement with eye contact or a "be right with you"...After a 15 minute wait, I get my keys and am told there's no one who can help with the bags. Fine, lug my bags up and the room is stifling hot, and very very small. AC blowing hot air... No one answers the phone... Had to go downstairs, wait 10 mins for the front desk clerk to be free only to be told AC doesn't work, hasn't been working for a day or 2, may not be fixed for another day or 2 and I can get a fan or the window open. Why wasn't I told at check in - an indifferent shrug.  When I express my disappointment - the response is a casual shurg and that as a favor he can cancel my check in and not charge me for the night.... Seriously? But wait it gets worse...As I'm leaving I explain that I've got a critical package being delivered tomorrow and I need them to please accept it and I'll come by and pick it up... I'm told it's fine... And guess what - it was returned to sender.Shockingly bad experience won't stay here again.My expectation: an acknowledgement when you are waiting at front desk, Room with temperature control, acknowledgement of the issue when you check in with a clear expectation of when it'll be fixed. A reasonable gesture (free breakfast or drinks or something) for the inconvenience, if the guest doesn't accept - an offer to accommodate at another property close by and transport to the property (walking the guest).... At least that's how I've been managed when stuffs gone wrong before...

There are many things we like about this hotel, and a few we do not. On our second stay in 4 months, regrettably the latter look a bit larger.On the positive side, the staff continues to be very nice; the atmosphere, location, quiet street and distinctive restaurant are all positive achievements. While our room was immaculate, the HVAC didn't work. The fan provided some useful "white noise" but didn't cool the room down at all. The room, at a $300 price point, was very small. The bed, a bit soft, and the toilet in the bathroom was right up against the sink/vanity. It might have been acceptable if you were lacking a left arm.While the Walker didn't pioneer the concept, the mini closet armoire was quite annoying. The magnet closures almost needed a crowbar to open. The inside was filled with two safes and was more suitable for a junior high school locker than a place to put adult clothing, including raincoats and suits.The lobby, bar and restaurant are all quite charming, and even the elevators had some art deco flair. The building is quite old, so they are stuck with low ceilings and small rooms. For one night, we could make do. For a more extended stay, we will stay elsewhere. Last time, we had a handicap accessible room, so I can answer some of the questions below.
