One of the better hotels I have stayed in for NYC travel. Cool vibe, clean room, comfortable- would highly recommend it. The location is close to everything and one of the best neighborhoods in NYC. They add small touches that go a long way- complimentary water in the room, sweet treats at turn down service, beautiful bar/lobby. It all goes a long way to make for a unique and comfortable stay.

Had a good time. This hotel is in a great location, provides great service, has great food and drinks. Even the wifi is fast. Couldn't ask for much more. Would definitely recommend and will likely be returning myself.

We had a wonderful stay at The Walker. The location is fantastic, and the vintage interiors are really charming--albeit petite. From initial efforts to secure the best rates via telephone to on-site advice for good walks, coffee, and local eats we especially are thankful to the staff (Irvin!) We did enjoy one dinner at the restaurant on site and thought it was good, and the popovers were unforgettable.

We just finished a 2 night stay at The Walker Hotel for pride 2018. It was a gorgeous property. I loved all the art deco accents. Truly felt like an oasis from the craziness of Pride going on all around. The room was small but well appointed, with deliciously comfortable beds. The staff was impeccable. Would absolutely recommend.

The Walker is in a good location just off 5th ave in the Village. Lots to do around the area and access to Union Square station just a few blocks away. Rooms are very small, bathroom is very small, no counter space with a quirky shower layout (no tub, water can flood floor of the bathroom from the shower). Nice, courteous staff and good value. If you are expecting a more luxury hotel experience, this is probably not the place for you.

I stayed at this hotel for one night this month on a business trip, and it will now be my go-to hotel when coming to the NY office. The property is very convenient to Union Square though just slightly removed from the bustle. The hotel staff was very accommodating, and I found the property to be quiet (having a room on the backside of the hotel definitely helped). While the room was average size for NYC, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was a decent size with good products, and everything was very clean. I definitely recommend giving it a try!

There is a need for new mattresses I was told they are replacing them this coming week.Food was very good in restaurant . All employees were very helpful .Great location. will stay here again.Will suggest to friends.

Housekeeping not up to par. Found holes in blanket and sheets, did not clear used towels despite it being put on the floor. First time we checked in, provided bathrobes but the second time we checked in, did not provide bathrobes until requested from housekeeping. Lighting not sufficient at night in the room – no uplighting in the sleeping area. Housekeeping overly persistent in the morning when I want to sleep in.

The Walker is a very cool hotel in a great location. It has a 1920s aesthetic that’s done well. The rooms are small, but you expect that in NYC. The walls are very thin and the doors are very heavy, so expect to hear a chorus of loud banging in the morning and evening and other guests wake up and come home. I recommend bringing earplugs (seriously - it’s very loud). The housekeeping is very scattershot - some days they replaced towels and robes, some days they did a turn down service, every now and again they’d leave water. The bathroom was never very well cleaned and always seemed to have other people’s hair on the floor. The door banging, intermitant towel replacement, and slightly dirty bathroom didn’t bother me that much because I was traveling for work (ie not travelling on my own dime), but at $400/night the Walker should sort those issues out for paying guests.

The Walker is about a 15 minute walk from where I was working while in New York. My room, as expected, was small. The narrow armoire had two dresser "drawers" that were roughly the size of a shoebox each and one was storing a hair dryer.. There is only a couple of inches of space on each side of the toilet, with the shower on one side and the sink/vanity on the other.. There is a tiny nightstand on each side of the bed, with a top shelf on each side largely taken up by a lamp and a phone. That said, there are a lot of nice touches. The bathroom is done in marble tile and there was always hot water with good water pressure in the shower. The amenities include body wash, shampoo and conditioner from C.O. Bigelow (and if you like them, they're just a short walk away from the hotel). The towels were large and substantial, not thin. The room is decorated in darker woods and has a historic vibe. There's a small desk and office chair, and then a padded chair in the corner of the room. Due to the room size, my suitcases essentially became an ottoman for the padded chair because there wasn't anywhere else to put them.While I was not in the room most evenings, the one night I was, there was the pleasant surprise of the hotel delivering two bite-sized lemon macarons. I also ordered room service one evening from the onsite restaurant and it was delivered promptly. The bed was not to my liking.. First, it's a mattress on a platform, so it was softer than I prefer. That's a personal choice, though, so I don't consider that a mark against the hotel. However, I found myself remaking the bed most evenings because the bottom flat sheet needs an exacting alignment to cover at both the top and bottom of the mattress. Being tall, if the coverage was at the top, my feet were on bare mattress at the foot of the bed. I 'd prefer a fitted sheet that fully covered the mattress, but barring that, I had to redo the bedsheets with the gap above the pillow at the top so that my feet were on the sheets.at the bottom.Overall, it was a decent place to stay and the staff interactions were always pleasant...help with suitcases coming in, someone holding the door during afternoons and evenings. If you're traveling solo for business or pleasure and can get around in the confines of a smaller-sized room with your gear, this is a fine choice.

After the craziness of our wedding, my wife and I needed to get away from our Brooklyn apartment for a few days. We stayed at the Walker Hotel over Memorial Day weekend. From our room on the 18th floor, we could look out over the city and feel connected to everything. The Empire State Building was framed perfectly from our room, just past the rooftops and water towers of midtown Manhattan. We had a quiet balcony, a giant bathroom and a comfortable bed. We loved breakfast at Society Cafe inside the hotel, not to mention Murray's Bagels just around the corner. The central location of the hotel is hard to beat, with restaurants, attractions, and lovely, quiet Greenwich Village streets everywhere you turn. Walk south and you're at Washington Square Park and all the cool spots around historic MacDougal Street. Walk west and you're at the High Line, Whitney Museum and Hudson River Greenway. Union Square Park is just East of the hotel. We stayed the whole weekend and didn't even set foot on the subway. It was exactly the escape we needed.

With the exception of my son; this was our first visit to New York; albeit one of the most expensive city’s in the world, it did not detract from the fact that the accommodation he chose for our group was exceptional. However; not being a frequent visitor to the states let alone New York; there are many, many hotels in this city with more than a pretty price tag for an evenings stay let alone four nights as we did.We found the cost was very competitive, it’s location in Greenwich Village was perfectly positioned for visits to both Up and Downtown attractions, the food, drink, ambience and decor were all above our expectations and I don’t doubt would match if not better much more expensive locations. The rooms, if not a little on the small side, were more than adequate, very clean and equipped, after all, we were sightseeing and rarely in there only to change and sleep. The staff, Nancy, Angel, Keith but in particular the Concierge (Marcus) were all extremely helpful, cooperative and professional in their approach and attention to detail and above all consistently demonstrated a ‘One Team’ and ‘Can Do’ work ethic or policy. I took delight one afternoon, having flashbacks, to the early 80’s and the ‘hip hop’ days in a short discussion I had with Marcus relating to Afrika Bammbataa, Johnson Crew (Space Cowboy) and DJ Hurc but in general the beat from the Bronx.On a more serious note but to conclude; I and we all, can thoroughly recommend this hotel and all its staff to provide a very clean and comfortable stay.Thankyou again to all the team at the Walker Hotel.

The hotel is in a great location. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms and bathroom are spacious (for nyc) and clean . The toiletries they offer are nice. Their towels and linen are fresh as well. The only problem I had was with the gym. The gym is basic and enough for some stretching, weights and cardio. Unfortunately the ventilation is so bad that the smell is awful in the gym. I had to force myself through my cardio session and I had my clothes, hair, everything smelling after that. I told them about this the first day, but I suppose they can’t fix a ventilation issue in one day. The kitchen shares a ventilation duct with the gym. This is the problem. The second day was even worse, and the smell was stuck to my clothes so much that I felt like my room was smelling after that as well. This problem is enough for me never to go back unless it’s fixed . If you’re not using the gym, this hotel is ok. Otherwise use an outside gym.

Our daughter just moved to Greenwich Village, so we wanted to find a quiet place to stay that was close to her yet accessible to the PATH and subway. This boutique hotel was ideal. Irvin, Nancy, Danny, and Amos were very friendly and attentive. The room was nice, clean, and quiet. We will definitely return to this quiet little gem.

We visit New York every year sine we left 5 years ago and the Walker has become our home there. The lobby is like a living room where we entertain friends and family and all feel welcome and at home. The location is wonderful near all public transportation and great walking. The staff is super friendly and attentive and the views from the upper floors are amazing. The restaurant is convient cozy and delicious. All in all another great stay at the Walker

I think the hotel is overpriced, but that maybe all of Manhattan. Is five days worth the same as five weeks in ex. Thailand for the same amount? My review is much about if I feel its worth 600$ for a single room each night at this hotel. I will say no, N.Y is not that for me. Before I get to the things I don't like with the hotel I have to say the staff are friendly, polite and that the atmosphere in the lobby and bar is very nice.If I shall mention the negative it is that rooms are old. They are similar to how the rooms did look in Bangkok in the 1990`s. Also see the TV-serie "Patrick Melrose" that shall be in 1982, they got same design in the rooms. Madrass is soft and kind of well used, but after walking for twelve hours daily I sleep as I was in coma. But as you see in photo I did have some poop stains in the top mattress, these was there for all five days. I did not want to lift the rest of blanket. I'm glad I am not a traveller with black light (UV-A), think maybe I would have problems to sleep.When it comes to problem to sleep, you got a alarm censor over your bed. If you just move as much as a toe it will light up a strong red lamp. Literally if you move your toe. Why this censor is there I don't know, there is no system that register if I leave my room. So this must just be on when the room is not rented out. Well, if you are a little paranoid and don't like the feeling about be monitored - this is not the place for you. Also, the shower did need some maintain. But for me its not any problem, I just mention it in this review so it can be rated against value.All of N.Y. was the same, no toilet brush in toilets. Thats maybe the American culture, like to have people clean your .... up after you. I did leave 5$/room for the housekeeper daily, but even so I am not comfortable to leave a bear cub for her in the toilet. RESTAURANT - this was not an good experience. We did sit down one evening at 5:30 PM before we should go for Broadway. Empty restaurant, ask for table, had to check if available. OK, order steak and lamb. 45 minutes after order I did say that if not food comes we must leave. Ten minutes later comes, chewy meat and nothing special. This restaurant is nothing even close to worth the money - Sorry chef!So to check out; when we did check out 5th of May they ask if i wanted an invoice on mail. Two rooms x five days was 5000 $. I did say yes please, send to my email. Did not get the mail, but see that they 7th of May, two days after payment have charge us additional around 600 $. 8th of May I send them this mail; "Hello. After check out your receptionist did tell me that you would send me an copy of the invoice at mail. I can’t find any mail, can you please send me a new copy on both rooms. I also see you have charged my card once more at 7th of May, please send me information about this in invoice. Have a nice day. Best regards ......."No response, send a copy 13th of May and have still not get any answer. They had no problem with recive mail when I did book room directly, but now they don't get it apparently. In the end I will say, I am not a type that complain or have give them any trouble. My holidays is for short to use it for any complain. They got an honest review instead. Will I ever go back to N.Y and use this amount on a room that will cost 30$/night in Phuket or 50$/night in Bangkok, or like 100$ in Oslo, Norway? No, thank you. Been there, done that.

Boutique hotel in the village. Celebrated our 20th anniversary in NYC. We really enjoyed our stay at The Walker Hotel. We were greeted with a celebratory note to a nice bottle of Prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries! Our room included breakfast in their restaurant named Society Cafe. We were able to pick from a prix fix menu which included juice, entree and coffee or tea. Great selection and delicious. Stop by for drink at the bar and see Pablo. Super great guy!! Overall, a wonderful stay.

The Walker is an absolutely fantastic Hotel in Greenwich Village.The staff Nancy, Travis,Phil and Danny were friendly and so attentive to our needs. The comfort, quietness , and cleanliness of the rooms was really very nice with awesome showers.The food was delicious my thanks to Chris and his entire kitchen staff including waiters and waitresses. We will definitely return to this little gem in Greenwich Village. Thank You all for a perfect Weekend. Pat & Jim

The service was great! Marc, Amos, Danny and Angel all did a fantastic job. The customer service was too-notched-both helpful and friendly. They attended to our needs quickly and gave us advice for scheduling cars and getting around the city.

We had a wonderful time at the Walker. Great location, restaurant, cozy lobby, small but nice rooms and the concierge was able to get us great seats at a premier Broadway show. Highly recommend and will stay again in the future!

Always looking for another neighbourhood to visit and recently chose the Walker Hotel, wanting to be near Greenwich Village. The hotel is tucked a bit away but in a great location. Chelsea Market, the Highline and Whitney are all within walking distance, as well as the Village's great offerings, and plenty of subway stops nearby to take you throughout the city. The room (two double beds which can be a challenge to find in a smaller NYC hotel) was neat, well laid out and featured some lovely art deco touches and fun vintage pieces. Staff is great - helpful, friendly and welcoming. And the brunch is excellent. A pleasure to walk Manhattan where it isn't all skyscrapers and is filled with character as well as great restaurants. Definitely on the list to return to during a future trip.

The Walker Hotel and staff were absolutely wonderful. From check-in to the restaurant to their bellmen. We were in town for a special event and everything was taken care of perfectly. Marcus, Phil, Angel and Keith were friendly, helped us make reservations, handled our luggage and assisted in any way they could. Room was well kept and clean, modern. Restaurant food was delicious and had a variety of options. Great location in Greenwich and close to so much. Highly recommend.

This hotel has a delightful atmosphere, an indisputable sober elegance and a fantastic quietness. All the crew is always kind and discreet. I also had a welcome handwritten letter and every night they left me some little sweets on the desk table. My room wasn't particularly small. I really loved my stay at them during seven nights in Greenwich Village.

I was in NYC for business and needed to be able to get uptown & downtown on the west side, and to downtown Brooklyn and neighborhoods south of there. So this location near the F & 1,2,3 was perfect. The room was spacious, immaculately clean, and comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was my favorite part of the stay. I like the decor which was art deco. I especially liked the option to

The Walker is an amazing place to stay. I'm in NYC a couple of times a year for business, and staying at the Walker is one of the highlights of the trip. Their staff are friendly and professional, the restaurant is pretty good, and the rooms/common areas are fantastic.

I stayed here to tour Parsons School of Art and Design with my admitted daughter and loved the location just one block from the school. The hotel staff was especially accommodating when I called the morning of the day I was arriving to make sure I had a room with two beds, and they moved me to room 1802 with a great long view south towards Freedom Tower. The staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout my stay and the bar and restaurant were very nice as well. I likely will make this home base on future visits.

Recently stayed 12 days at the Walker Hotel. Perfectly situated in terms of walking to Greenwich Village and Chelsea and super close to the subway. Yes the rooms are tiny but you just manage to live with the space you have. I did enquire about moving to a larger room given the length of our stay but we really couldn't justify the extra $60 a night. The concierge offered for us to store unused suitcase/s to create a bit more space but we made do. No request was too much trouble. We asked for a kettle so we could make a cup of tea. We asked for a late checkout so we didn't have to sit around the lounge. All could be accommodated. We did miss a bar fridge but there really wouldn't be room. The front desk staff were really great and very helpful when we needed to find a laundromat, subway advice and even weather predictions. The bar was terrific too but make sure you make use of the happy hour!. All in all we had a great visit and would highly recommend the Walker Hotel.

We (my 16 yo son and I) visited NYC to look at colleges and booked at the Walker. It had a great location in Greenwich Village and was close to the subway. The neighborhood was beautiful with a nice mix of homes, restaurants and stores. The hotel has a unique colorful Art Deco style with attention to every detail. The lobby was warm and welcoming (check out the beautiful metal ceiling). The rooms were small but comfortable with two double beds, a small wardrobe and desk. We found the beds to be incredibly comfortable with awesome sheets and pillows. While small, the bathroom was workable and was very stylish black and white tiles. The hotel provided robes, slippers and Bigelow toiletries. We found the front desk staff and bell men very helpful with our numerous questions. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast twice and the food was great though pricey. We were able to get a breakfast voucher for two breakfasts for $25, but keep in mind the menu is limited if you use the vouchers. It was a great place to stay and I’d recommend the hotel to other visitors.

This boutique hotel is nicely situated between the Village an Chelsea. Everyone is genuinely friendly and helpful. The resturent Great location on the border between the Village and Chelsea. Really great people who care and good in house dining. This is my second visit and I'm more impressed than I was after the first visit. If you want to stay in this area of Manhattan, consider this hotel. You'll be surprised at how nice this is.

Very nice hotel, friendly staff that provide us with great recommendations for restaurants. The staff was on top of everying and ready to help with any questions. Rooms were clean, location was good, looking forward to going back.
user_name:
Diane G
Rye Beach, New Hampshire

review_body: quite a special place, mainly due to the reception and bar area, uber cool place to chill, lovely staff and nice rooms, found mine big enough, the sheets are so hot tho, kept waking me up, the bar staff dont chat to you which is a shame, but i found that everywhere, what’s happened to the freindly bar man these days, certainly not fashionable in ny it seems, i recommend this place tho i think i will book again next time in ny, ps breakfast was very small, was still hungry when i left, only did it once

I stay at the Walker every time I come to NYC as it is always a good experience and it is located close to my daughter’s apartment. Excellent in every way except I wish there was a bedding option of a cotton blanket instead of the duvets which always make me hot. Otherwise all is excellent.

The hotel is a gem and the staff working there deserve a note of appreciation. We had a professional and friendly assistance from all of them but especially from Natassja and Shanon who worked the afternoon-evening shift and were there when we returned from our endless strolling of the neighborhood , trying to visit the 400 art galleries in Chelsea. Natassja was extremely helpful in solving our WI FI problem and went back and forth to our room and back to the front desk until the problem was solved. The proximity to everything including Union Sq. is an advantage. The snow added to the magic of our 7 days stay and we enjoyed the warmth in the lobby, the music and the good tasty food in the restaurant. We were welcomed each day with 2 bottles of water and cookies and not only upon arrival. WE were recommended to stay in this hotel and this is our recommendation to others to follow. True, the room is small but this is the standard in big cities and the ambiance, the service and the location, compensate for this minor disadvantage.

We arrived 1am from a long flight and were pleasantly greeted by Johnie. He gave us all info of room and we proceeded to try and get on the correct time zone. Due to unforeseen circumstances we needed to check out earlier then expected. I wanted to personally give gold medals to the desk staff, Johnie, Markus and Irvin for being so accommodating. When you are made to feel special even tho you have only stayed at a hotel for a short time that is truly a gift that many others should love to hear. We will be back some day soon.

2 night stay at this cozy boutique hotel with an intimate vibe. Great location on a quiet street but easy walk to many great areas and restaurants. Somewhat smaller size room but with super comfy bed, spotlessly clean room and well appointed and maintained bathroom. All staff were very helpful, courteous and obliging. Front desk interactions were a pleasurable experience. Hanging out in the lobby by the fire on a snowy day was very pleasant and Keeley was so accommodating to serve me coffee. The wait staff in the restaurant were very professional and friendly and worked seamlessly to provide great service. The breakfasts were fabulous and I loved the sky lit room. Nancy at the front desk even sent up a special treat which was very much appreciated. Will definitely return to this classy hotel!

Stayed five days at this lovely hotel. perfect location,walking distance to restaurants,clubs,subway. Quiet,albeit small room. Coffee downstairs in the lobby was excellent. We never ate at the small historic former jazz lounge restaurant in the back.

I was very pleased with the Walker Hotel. It is on a quiet street, so there are not the everyday sirens. The hotel and rooms are very well kept. The rooms are quiet as well. There is a hotel on site which we found to be wonderful. The only thing I question is that the room state the the rooms have double beds. I honestly believe they are 3/4 size beds. Narrow and short, but it worked for me because I am average size. I would book again for sure at this hotel.

Gorgeous and quiet, the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village is a great find in a terrific location. Pros - Beautiful brick building on a small, quiet street. Rooms are well-insulated (super quiet), nicely decorated, and feel crisp and clean. Free wi-fi. Convenient and cozy restaurant and bar off the lobby. Nice, safe neighborhood with lots of restaurant options, and easy walk to Washington Square. Cons - Rooms are small with very little surface space to place your cosmetic bag, book, etc. Overall, I felt like it was a nice option for the price ($250 range).

This is a great hotel for business or leisure. Cosy, full of period features and very comfortable room. The restaurant is worth eating at if you are not up for exploring further and the staff were really friendly.

The location of the hotel is superb but for us that was the only area where our expectations were met/exceeded. Lovely restaurants around (try Oliu e Piu, Ribalta or Mermaid Oyster House) and easy to get to many of the NYC highlights on foot from here. The room decor was nice but the room was so small it was uncomfortable. Service at the bar wasn’t very good on either of our visits which I think was bad luck but still not acceptable when you’re spending 80 dollars for 4 drinks. Overall stay was fine but wouldn’t come back.

Very convenient Village location at Fifth Avenue. Close by are Murray's Bagels, Blue Bottle, Cittarella, C.O. Bigelow, Beacon's consignment and many wonderful restaurants. Perfect spot to be near Parsons, New School, NYU. Had Barrow Queen with a window seat. Lighting could have been much brighter but the room was a good size with a very nice bathroom. Staff very courteous and friendly. Nice treats left every night.

This was my second trip to the Walker, and considerably worse than 12 months ago.I had a number of issues with my room, and the hotel were unable to resolve them, and didn't allow me to change rooms.Firstly, the heating. Travelling in winter, NYC is cold. The room was chilly, so I put the heating on. Between going to sleep and waking up at 3am, I'd gone from freezing to being in a sauna. Looking at the thermostat it was now 7 degrees above the temperature set. Reception just said that it was an old building and to be expected - none of the thermostats worked.My plan for the subsequent night was to keep the room cooler, but the bedding was very thin (so you have to ask for an additional quilt, which took over three hours to arrive and needed chasing).When the heating is on, it's very noisy and annoying.The smoke detector (besides being positioned in such a way that it wouldn't detect any smoke!) has TWO lights that flash quite brightly EVERY SECOND. The hotel said this was normal, and offered to turn off my detector (which I declined, and suspect would violate various fire regulations).There is a motion detector for the heating that is bright and makes a faint high pitch noise every time it's triggered. It picks up movement in bed, so is again, very annoying and hinders sleep.There is NO sensible storage. Yes, there's a wardrobe, but nothing else. No space in the bathroom to leave more than a toothbrush (and after you use a glass, they do not replace it, so I had 3 our of 4 nights with one glass, not two in the bedroom). I had to leave all my toiletries on the desk. The desk is cluttered and has little space to do any work. The bedside table is very small - you can just fit a phone and bottle of water on it. Unlike even budget hotels, there is no paper or pens provided in the room. The lighting in the room is very poor. With the curtains closed, there are two bedside lights and a small desk lamp, these give a nice subtle light in the main part of the room, but not enough to work/pack/unpack etc... The other lights are by the door but don't light the main part of the room.The staff seem to have little knowledge of the city. I needed a new pair of jeans and asked for nearby shops, and I was directed quite a few blocks away, and not to the Levi store one street away!For a luxury hotel, it's missing a lot of the standard in-room items. There is no kettle/tea/coffee facilities, no mini bar, no paper, no pen, no shoe polish, no flannels/face cloths, The inside of the wardrobe was quite dusty, and not ideal for storing clothes.As an able bodied traveller, it's hard for me to pick up on what an accessible room may need. There are clearly some well thought out things here, such as the low racks in the wardrobe (but this prevents hanging long coats/items), low level peep hole for the door, locks at a sensible level etc... However they've positioned various elements of furniture so I think that a wheelchair would struggle to get around the room. The desk would not be easily usable, and plug sockets would not be easy to get to. There's a wet room which is good, but the support bars are positioned so that the toilet seat won't stay up. Also having a wet room means once you've showered you can't go back in.The room service food was pretty poor. My fries were all burnt and pretty bland, and it was basically $35 for an average burger.Some elements of the hotel are good, such as the style, but overall I can pretty confidently say I won't be staying here again, and will recommend colleagues to look for alternatives.

We went to New York for my wife's birthday. When researching restaurants, the ones we wanted were all in the Greenwich, Grammercy, or West Village neighborhoods. These are some of the top restaurants in the city. The Walker was in the right place. They have a friendly staff always trying to help. There are a restaurant and a workout room right in the hotel.

The staff at the desk were very nice and very professional. Got a room with 2 double beds that was adequate in size for a typical New York village hotel. Clean and comfortable. Small and quiet which was nice. Hard to control the air. Room was warm. May need to work on that issue. I will return.

4-night stay, cozy as NY boutique hotel rooms go, accommodating staff wanted to respond and please our requests. Nice sheets/towels, plenty of hot water. Easy walks to both mid-town and Greenwich. Return to hotel after all day outings felt like home away from home.Happy Hour, fireplace welcoming- great pizzas, wines $7.00, The Society Cafe restaurant in the hotel probably its greatest asset. Farm to table foods, preparations, service, setting all really great! Bartender Pablo made great drinks and so friendly.We've stayed twice and would return again.

Stayed at the Walker Hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. It's a great location with a hip vibe with a warm and friendly staff, excellent wait staff in the restaurant which has wonderful food, beautiful rooms with great views of the city. This will be our go to Hotel from now on. Thanks Walker Hotel!

I recently stayed at the Walker Hotel in Greenwich Village. The hotel is very charming and has a real intimidate feeling.You can’t beat the location either. However, what separatedthis hotel from others is the Jazz experience. Seems the hotelhas partnered with a local Jazz school and the students performon Friday & Saturday nights. These kids were great. Much moreenthusiastic and connected to the audience then a lot of other performers I have seen. Next time I need a hotel room in Manhattan, I’ll be staying at the Walker.

My wife and I spent Saturday night at the Walker--this was a return trip for my wife. We had a room on the 15th floor with a great view looking uptown. It was a very comfortable room, although not huge, and a great bathroom. It's just a matter of time until we head back again.

Just spent 4 nights here, and can't say enough good things. While the room is not large (reading this ahead of time in other reviews helped manage expectations), the beds were super comfortable, and spotlessly clean. Where this hotel really shines though is their staff. Nancy checked us in and was a great first face of the hotel. While we didn't get everyones names, we did deal with Marcus, Keith, Phil and Travis, among others who were incredibly professional, pleasant and helpful. Without exception, every staff member we encountered was friendly and pleasant, including housekeeping or general staff we ran into around the hotel. Kudos to the management for building a great team and we hope the staff are recognized and appreciated. The restaurant and lobby area were great also. Cant wait to return!

I booked the Walker on Tablet Hotels as I have many other hotels and therefore knew I'd be happy. But Walker Hotel surpassed my expectations. There's something about entering the hotel and walking down the stair into the lobby that made me feel transported. Not only did I appreciate the charm of my room, the staff was a delight. I do not know the names of everyone I met, but all were wonderful including Channon, Travis, Angel, Nancy and Irv. Thank you to everyone!
user_name:
SPQRdude
New York City, New York

review_body: While, typical to New York hotels the room was on the smaller size, it was cozy and inviting. The quaint decor gave the room a homey and pleasant kind of feeling. The staff were extremely agreeable and welcoming and where always ready to assist. The location is exceptional, being located between 6th and 5th and not to far from other Chelsea as well as other NYC hot spots.the food was good (the steak i had at dinner is one of the best i ever had) all in all, wonderful experience.

Walker Hotel, great location! Room was small but clean. There seemed to be a lack of connection with some of the staff in the cafe in hotel. Bartender was fantastic! We wanted to use the stairs during our stay and we noticed that they were never cleaned. Very cool hotel, just in need of some TLC

My husband and I just came back from a three night stay at the Walker Hotel. It was a fabulous experience, from the moment Marcus gave us a lovely welcome until Amos made our leaving so easy. The bed was really comfortable, sheets and towels luxurious, the breakfasts and the dinner in the restaurant delicious.Full disclosure- I am recently in a wheelchair and was  anxious about the accommodations - the bathroom was perfect and the shower was amazing! Also I was nervous about being a “disabled codger” in this hip hotel - but everyone was so friendly and helpful I felt genuinely welcomed. Thanks to Irv and Danny as well as the two lovely young women who served us breakfast. ( Besides being so friendly, everyone who works here is incredibly good looking - it’s like being in “Walker- The Movie!”) I highly recommend this gem of a hotel.

Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. Pros and (minor) cons below.Pros:* I loved the location - easy walk to multiple subway stops and things like a Chipotle, Rite Aid (chemist/drug store) and Murray's Bagels within a few hundred metres. Definitely recommend the weekly subway pass for $31 per person (no discount for kids), we were only there 5 days but it was the easiest and most economic way around.* The lobby is gorgeous, lovely to sit and while away a few hours.* Restaurant also very good - not particularly kid friendly menu, but great for adults and kids with more sophisticated palates!* Happy hour Monday - Friday, great prices on wines and beers and pizzas.* Overall it was pretty quiet - we had bad jet lag and there was noise during the day (housekeeping, guests chatting in hallway), but not their fault given the time it was!* The hotel is small enough that I felt comfortable leaving my 8yo in the room and hanging out downstairs in the restaurant or lobby - she could easily come find me.* Free Wifi, always a plus!* Overall the staff were helpful - they didn't sometimes know the answers to questions I had (e.g. about subway - the closest stop was unfortunately closed for uptown trains the weekend we were there), but the staff were well intentioned.* Little bakery treats at bedtime!Cons:* The rooms are, being NYC, tiny. This was fine, except for the fact we had two double beds (as requested) and the beds are on solid wood bases that stick out from under the mattress. I lost count of how many times one of us clocked our ankle on the frame. Perhaps consider adding some padding? I know it seems petty, but as my daughter lamented after doing it once again "This is the only thing I don't like about this hotel".* The house keeping was ok but not great. There were hairs on the wall of the shower when we arrived. The shower cap not being restocked after I used it. Empty wine glasses from the bar being left on the desk the next day. Towels seemed to be replaced/replenished in a hit or miss manner. Nothing earth shattering, but not what I am used to (maybe because I travel a lot for work in Asia). Would definitely consider staying again and would recommend!

quaint charming hotel. in the middle of the village. the staff is great- bed very comfortable- room nyc small- but lovely. 1st class- sheets soft, excellent hair products- safe in room-very small hotel- rooms are very close to each other- butthat was not a problem for us.

I enjoyed my visit here last summer. The room was not large but was pretty comfortable and tastefully furnished. The bathroom was a nice size, clean, and aesthetically welcoming. Dinner one evening was delicious with excellent waiting service. Reception staff were responsive and helpful.

Our stay wasn’t perfect, if had the chance to give 4,5 instead of 5 I would. I have a lot of nice things to say and 2 concerns.First: on arrival (december 31st) I found polite people that supported me in upgrading the room: I’ve tried to book for months a waverly queen but on line booking could not guarantee city view, therefore I booked on Booking.com a Grove Queen and upgraded when the lady at the desk confirmed she had a wonderful room on 17th floor (room 1703). My first complaint is about reservation: why didn’t you book a city view room for me the first time I asked, in october? Why did you always reply you could not guarantee?The room was nice, bed was comfortable, pillows were too thick (I’ve asked for thin pillows but didn’t get) but house keeping was amazing. Our room was cleaned twice a day, every night when the maid came for bed turndown she left two small cakes for us: we appreciated a lot. City view was stunning (freedom tower), room was warm when outside nyc was freezing. Toiletries were replaced everyday and highest quality, plenty of towels and large shower. The second concerns refers to the fan inside the bathroom that could not be switched off: as a result we always kept the door closed (you can’t even sleep with door opened) and in the bathroom temperature was much lower compared to the room. A switch to turn down the fan would be perfect. The lobby with fireplace is so cozy and Society Cafè deserves a visit: we had cocktails before dining out, a pizza and an excellent breakfast. On our last day we had room service and everything was well appointed. Coming back to the hotel after walking in the snow or freezing on the sunny days was a pleasure. The staff gave us enormous support on our departure day, not only storing the luggage but arranging the limo to the airport, and waiting with us outside with 10*F (-12 celsius) to load our bags. The hotel is perfectly located near 14th street metro, a 5 minutes walk with the snow, 3 minutes in normal weather conditions. Highly recommend, and thank you all for the excellent stay.

I returned to the Walker Hotel for 12 nights over the holiday season (Dec21-Jan2nd 2018) this time with my 20yrs old daughter. Having previously stayed there in Sept 2017 on my own. Location is fabulous close to subways uptown & downtown, restaurants, great coffee places, museums, everything is easy to get to. ALL the Staff including Marc Antony, Nancy & Linda, who went out of their way to arrange my return, as well as the front desk staff, Marcus, Alan, Amus, Phil,Keith (including Doormen and Breakfast Waiters & the lovely young lady Restaurant Hostess with long black hair who remembered me from the previous visit, & housekeeping) are very Professional, Friendly and Extremely helpful. We loved coming back after being out during the day to a fresh, clean, gorgeous art deco room & a sweet treat was left on the table each night which was lovely, as was the choc birthday cake left for my daughter on our arrival. A nice surprise! The bedding was so comfortable, the amazing water pressure in the shower was heaven. The size of the room was perfect. We had a gorgeous view of the Freedom Tower. Had Breakfast included at the Hotel's restaurant which was nice. Also used the gym which was well set up.Love the Gatsby Art Deco Boutique ambience of this hotel. To be greeted by the warm fireplace as we entered the hotel after being out in the cold all day, as well as the smiles and greetings from the staff, made us feel like we were coming home.Would definitely stay at The Walker again! Highly Recommend it!

Such a great find in Greenwich Village. The staff is a group of accommodating, young, professional, helpful, welcoming group.The architecture is stunning. The lobby has a fun vibe. The restaurant is a great meeting spot. But call ahead for a reservation.The rooms are real art deco. small, but spacious enough.Can't wait to return

Great sheets, pillows, darkening shades, bar/restaurant was great as well, although the staff in the bar was so-so. The front desk was super friendly and helpful. I really liked the hotel a lot!!! Hope to come back in the spring with friends

We spent a week at the hotel over Christmas and were impressed with the welcoming, personal atmosphere, and outstanding staff. The lobby, restaurant and bar are comfortable and relaxed, we were always happy to come back after a busy day, felt like home from home. Though on the small side, the room was well appointed and relaxing. Special mention to Vanessa, Nancy, Marcus , Danny and Phil - you made our trip memorable!

I had a wonderful time staying 3 nights for a business trip at this hotel. The service was perfect, from drinks in the lobby to dinner at the restaurant. The room was very comfortable and a nice size for NYC. My only issues was in my unit on the 18th floor was the fact that the room was blazing hot and if I did not have the windows open, it was not comfortable for me.

excellent location, clean, good service. it has nice classic details on baths and rooms. it has a very good bar and restaurant service. it is at walking distance o many branded stores on 5th avenue. excellent!

If you plan to stay in Greenwich Village, this place is a gem and centrally located. Rooms are on the small side, but we were out most of the time anyway. The shower stall was spacious and had very good water pressure. Would stay here again.

I cannot say enough about this hotel. From the moment I called to inquire about rooms, the staff was professional and very friendly. We booked two rooms; while not large, both rooms had everything we need and were comfortable, stylish and clean. It's on a very quiet street and with only a few rooms on each floor, it's quiet inside too. Returning to the hotel after getting caught in buckets of freezing rain, I wandered into the bar and asked Pablo the bartender to surprise me with a spicy drink to warm me up. He invented a wonderfully unexpected cocktail with an ancho chile liquor, lemon and some other secret ingredients. He made it clear that I didn't need to buy it if I didn't like it, but I did! I didn't try the restaurant this time, but will definitely return because it is a beautiful hideaway, and the menu looks great. This hotel is a tremendous value and a wonderful place to return to after a busy day in NYC. I have a new favorite hotel!

In spite of the freezing temps, we flew into New York for Three Kinds Day weekend. The holiday decorations on the facade of the Walker Hotel were the perfect welcome for the last Christmas celebrating we were going to do until December. The fireplace and sitting area reminded us of an upscale New York apartment. They made some great recommendations for jazz clubs and we immediately dropped our bags and hit the streets for Smalls. The staff were welcoming at every turn. I forgot my key on the first morning and the bellman was more than accommodating. He was the same gentleman who stored our bags on Sunday morning. Our room was a great size for two. Bathroom amenities were appreciated as well as the hot shower (and good water pressure). Breakfast each day began with their signature beet juice and hearty egg dishes. All in all it was a splendid way to begin the New Year! Keep up the good work. We'll be back!

We had room with twin beds on the 16th floor. We never had to wait for an elevator.The room was tight and the desk was too close to the bed so the desk chair did not have enough room to sit comfortably. There are not enough flat surfaces in the bedroom and particularly in the bath room. There should be more hooks in both rooms to hang towels and clothes.Service and food was excellent.

Will go again - great property and stay! hotel is adorable and in a great location. Staff is friendly and accommodating no matter the time of day. Little extras like the water bottle and sweet treats on turn down were awesome!

Upon arrival we had less than 10 mins to be back out the door for a show, the staff took our bags, requested we organize all other details the next morning and got us a car immediately!All of the staff were particularity helpful; Marcus on the front desk helped us with showtimes, locations, advice for gigs, restaurants - at any point he could help; he would. Restaurant & bar is fantastic. Rooms were great with a great view. I will 100% return to this hotel when I next go to New York.

Stayed here several times and from staff to setting it never disappoints. Love the guest rooms and the dining spot and bar and there's always a good-humored and helpful staff. This recent time Marcus, Phil and Keith were the usual best. I don't typically write reviews and hope that the Walker keeps its unique and easy and affordable attitude.

Friendly staff, breakfast option, great bar, comfortable beds. Enough space for overnight stay, a little small for longer visits. Reasonable price for the city. Classy design with dark mahogany hues. Breakfast options were strong.

I was looking for a hotel close to Greenwich Village and I found this hotel quite by accident. From the welcoming homey entrance filled with leather sofas and bookcases to the attention of the staff this place is a winner. I was greeted by Marcus and Phil the concierge extraordinaires. They were excellent in all ways. They were helpful and attentive. My room was a small queen, beautifully decorated in an art deco style and size wise was adequate for a single. The sheets were Frette, the amenities in the bathroom of very good quality. There was a turn down service and each night there were cookies left for a late evening snack.Since it was during the most freezing weather I have ever seen in New York, I ate one lunch and three breakfasts in their very lovely restaurant. The food was well prepared and very delicious, the best scrambled eggs and crisp bacon, an excellent cup of coffee, a delicious flatbread mushroom truffle pizza at lunch. Staff was also excellent and attentive.This hotel met all my needs and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a small intimate and friendly welcoming place.

Stayed here New year's eve.The Walker has the charm of a small European hotel. Great vibe in the lobby our room on the 17th floor had an unobstructed view of lower Manhattan and was cozy and inviting.Had drinks in the lobby bar before heading out to dinner and the staff was friendly.Thw Walker has a great N Village locatyion and we will be back.

Perfect hotel for a quick visit to NYC at Christmas. The staff was very professional and very helpful. Although the rooms are small, it is NYC and most rooms are small. I would highly recommend. Great area to walk and see the village.

This is a very pretty hotel in the West Village in NYC. The location was perfect for our needs and the staff was extremely accommodating, super friendly and efficient. We stayed in the Grove Queen which was lovely but small. I found the room size frustrating, more because the small space could have been better utilized to accommodate guests' needs, i.e. the table in the room was the only place to set up a computer but there was only one outlet which a lamp was plugged into. Once I unplugged the lamp, I couldn't see what I was doing since the only overhead light was in the small foyer.There was a small armoire that served as a closet with three small drawers inside. The pulls on the armoire doors were slippery, making it difficult to open them. The very tiny nightstands that were attached to the bed were occupied by lamps that took up all the space on the nightstands. We spent three days here, during which time, I don't think the carpet was vacuumed once since the bits of paper that were apparent upon our arrival, were still there when we left. Other than that though, the room and bathroom were immaculate. I would consider staying here again but only if I could afford a larger room that had sufficient outlets, lighting and storage space.

It is a lovely, small, boutique hotel tucked away off 6th Ave. I've wanted to stay but could never pony up the $$. Found a deal and booked. Great front desk staff, small (but typical Manhattan) room size, very clean and comfortable. Great breakfast. I might even go for breakfast without staying there next time! The bar in the afternoon was the only glitch - bartender did his best but hard to keep up on a Friday with lots of people and only one of him. Still a charming spot.

This was our second stay in this boutique style hotel. Staff was very accommodating. This is becoming our"go to" hotel fro NYC. Away from the noise and bustle of midtown. Nice "cozy rooms. Some with great views. Plenty of dining options within walking distance and close to the the Village theaters.

Great place to stay. We were here for a week, two adjacent rooms for us and two teenagers. Great service, cool atmosphere, friendly staff team, perfect location. Highly recommended. I'm now writing more characters only to satisfy trip advisor.

The service was wonderful. The hotel is charming. Rooms are a bit tight and it was difficult to even sit at the desk. Room amenities were nice. The gentlemen at the front desk remembered us and it was nice. The bar has good drinks and bites too. We would return.

As fellow New Yorkers we highly recommend staying at the Walker Hotel. The hotel is a block from Union Square and centrally located in the heart of New York. I highly recommend the 17th and 18th floors. Our room had a beautiful terrace overlooking the Empire State Building, extremely comfortable bed, and spacious bathrooms with great shower pressure and a large Koehler bathtub perfect for relaxing in. The best part of the hotel was the staff. Irvin, Phil, Keith, Angel, Marcus, Oscar, and Pablo (the bartender) paid attention to all our needs and went over and above to make sure our stay was 5 star. The staff is amazing!!! Highly recommend!

I stayed at the Walker Hotel for business, but brought my family with me. - My wife and 2 children - 1 and 3 yr olds. The service was great and accommodating for my situation. The hotel is very tastefully designed and presented, and like most places in NYC, space is tight. It was clear that this hotel does not cater to families, but the staff was very cooperative and helpful: I was in and out of the hotel often pushing a double wide stroller, and doorman always helped me and my wife get out the door when our hands were full. Danny and Angel were great helps with luggage (and we travel with a lot these days.) Cons: small room with small beds, but had a great view looking south to the finical district from 17th floor.

My wife and I were in NYC for work and stayed at the Walker for the first time. What a great place. Very nice hotel on and quite street but close to coffee, restaurants, subway, etc. We would highly recommend the Walker Hotel on your next visit.

It’s hard to find a great hotel in close proximity to my office on 6th ave and 17th street, so this hotel is a gem. I enjoyed my stay, and figured out how to live in the smallish room, and bathroom, but thats to be expected in NYCRooms are well appointed with nice amenities and a very friendly staff that is very accommodating A quick shout out to Marcus and Nancy who were very helpful during my check out process and correcting an error on my bill, they took care of it quickly and with no hassleThis is my go to hotel on my quarterly visits to my NY office

From the moment we arrived, everyone was welcoming, and helpful for our first visit to NY! Loved walking down the stairs, greeted by a fire, and great decor. It is what I imagine an old speakeasy was, initimate and iniviting. We tried the restaurant as well for brunch, and the food was delicious. The double bed queen was perfect for the three of us, my 17 year old daughter and her friend. Our view was beautiful, lots of pillows on the bed, and a roomy bathroom and shower. The window could open a little bit, which helped get some cool air in, and hear the city. Location is great! Near the subway, lots of restaurants and shops. I would go back again!

Great location in the middle of Greenwich Village, close to shops and restaurant. Nice guest - nice charming hotel - . Very helpful working people. Quite rooms on the upper Floors, bar with lots of atmosphere

We had a fabulous stay at the Walker Hotel. Its a lovely location and the staff are just amazing. My only criticism is that the beds were not very comfortable and we would have preferred a standard double as the two beds we had were both a bit small and we prefer to be together.

My first trip to the Walker hotel. Charming old building in a nice part of town . My room was well finished and the atmosphere of the hotel generally was understated elegance . The staff were very friendly - special shout out to Marcus and Irvine on the check in desk . I look forward to my next trip to NYC .

The people that work here are so genuine and ready to help you with whatever that is - finding a good spot to eat, calling you a car, or bringing you up a towel within minutes. This hotel is beautiful on the inside and on the outside - cliche, I know, but it is a 5-star hotel at its finest. In the heart of Greenwich Village too? Count me in for a third stay in the future. Thank you Marcus!

We had a wonderful stay at the Walker, the hotel has a lovely relaxed ambience. Our room on the 17th floor had a great view of WTC, comfortable bed, great power shower, all nice and clean. All the staff were friendly and helpful, special thanks to Marcus, Irvin, Danny and the barman who hails from Boston and supports Spurs, we didn’t catch your name but thanks again for the off menu Espresso Martini. Five stars, hope to visit you again one day soon

This hotel is simply perfect. I love the boutique style and total functionality that you get the experience in the room. The room has “a place” for everything you need to be organized and comfortable. I had the pleasure of being checked in by William both times, and was impressed that he remembered me from my first visit. He offered me the option of two rooms, one being on the 13th floor with a spectacular view. Really love coming to this hotel and will continue to choose this hotel every time I go to New York for work!
user_name:
realauren
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Walker was a perfect place for my friend and I to stay for 5 days. We selected the room with 2 beds. When we checked in we were given a choice of floors and of course, we chose the upper floor which had a beautiful view! I guess that is the benefit of traveling M-F. We realize that hotel rooms are not very large in NYC, but the room and bathroom were spotless! The staff was fantastic, friendly and very accommodating. I would stay there again in a heart beat. Although we did not get a chance to dine in the restaurant, we did enjoy our Happy Hour cocktails and friendly bartender. Well done Walker staff!!

So I travel for work about 70 nights a year and try and hit a few boutique hotels when I can. The Walker is very well located and very attractive. I pulled up and had a bit of trouble finding it at first as it blends in very well and looks like a neighborhood building. You go down a wide stair case into a small but very cozy and cute lobby. That's when things hit a hitch. I had a two night stay planned and an early dinner appointment on the first night. I arrived at 255 (checked on Uber app) and check-in at front desk. The Clerk has some trouble finding the reservation but eventually gets it. He says my room will be ready in five minutes and I should just have a seat in lobby. I realized I had forgotten some toiletries so tell him I am going to run out while they finish and will be back in 15 minutes. I get back at 315. New clerk at desk. He asks me a bunch of the same questions and then says my room is not ready. I told him other clerk said 5 minutes and it had been 20. He says they were very busy. At 330 I try again. He tells me housekeeping is just finishing and offers me two drink coupons for the wait. At 345 still no word and he tells me he can't get in touch with housekeeping. At 4 I finally go up ready to move to another hotel my TA found and the other clerk says "oh yes, it was ready a few minutes ago." Of course I was sitting 10 feet in front of him. Now I might say it was a one time issue but woman next to me was irate as well. She checked in early morning and asked them to call her when room was ready. She came back at 4 saying no one had called but she assumed it was ready. Clerk says, oh we don't call you; we assumed you would keep checking in with us. Really, maybe at a Motel 6 but not at your rates.Once upstairs the room was very nice. Very artdeco, dark woods. Feels very luxurious. My room had a nice view South towards Freedom Tower. Room needs more lights. Other than foyer light thee are three small dim table lamps that all point down and so don't illuminate the room. Bathroom was small but nicely done. Very nice toiletries. Restaurant is tucked in the back of the ground floor and is hard to spot. It is cute and breakfast was tasty and reasonable. They have a few fixed price breakfast deals. The Salmon toast was quite good. Did not eat dinner, but had a couple drinks at bar.  It is a small area in restaurant. Not too exciting but drinks were very well done and bartender quite friendly and helpful. Fitness room is very small. Two machines and some weights. Probably not adequate for more than a one or two night stay.I debated whether to view this as a three star or four. The service issues are a real problem. But the room was very nice and bedding was excellent so it won out. If the management could fix the relatively indifferent front desk staff
user_name:
SAM5000
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a nice place with good reputation and nice location; however, it seems that they have become complacent in many ways:1) We were promised a high floor - did not get (6th of 18)2) The air conditioning started blowing heat instead of air and caused the room to be very hot. We called the front desk and they said the "engineer" would come and check it. He never came. 3) Saturday night the fire alarm went off 2 times. When trying to go down the stairs, several levels were completely blocked by the housekeeping carts. This is a MAJOR fire hazard. Upon getting down to the front desk, they said the kitchen set off the fire alarm. They set it off again also. This was a big inconvenience 2 times going down the obstructed stairs (and back up them since elevators were shut off due to alarm)4) corners and baseboards dirty5) rate was not clear as it said "total price" on reservation; however, upon arrival that is the basic rate and then they add taxes and fees on top of the "total price" rate. 6) the wifi is not good and is inconsistent. Several times, I turned it OFF to speed up the connection without the wifi. 7) rooms are very small, but that was expected in this area. It seems that this hotel is complacent throughout.

My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Walker Hotel in Greenwich Village. It is ideally located, close to subway, restaurants, bars, shops etc and has a lovely villagey feel. Our room was definitley on the small side but the beds were very comfortable and the room and bathroom were very clean. The reception and concierge staff were great, very helpful and friendly. A nice lobby/bar area to have an afternoon drink or just a sit and rest and weary legs. Would definitely recommend.

The Walker Hotel is a gem of a place in Greenwich Village. It is a charming place with a wonderfully friendly staff, terrific restaurant, and well-appointed rooms, although small ones. The fireplace in the lobby immediately sets the tone for this lovely hotel, and the brick ceiling in the hallway and the stylish dining room all contribute to the intimacy of the place. Highly recommend it.

We stayed for four nights and we couldn’t have found a better place to stay. We discovered lots of lovely bars and restaurants in the area and several jazz bars are a few minutes walk away. The staff are absolutely lovely and very friendly and accommodating.

All very nice. Room not the largest, but made up for by amenities.The staff were all excellent. Bar (food) and restaurant were also both winnersMarcus at the front desk was the best. He really made an impression on us with his friendliness and attentiveness. Not easy to do since everyone was in top form

Really wish we had stayed another night or two! The welcoming, approachable and went out of their way to make us feel at home. Props to Phil, Marcus, Danny and Angel who physically chased down a cab for us! Room are very comfortable. And, have to say that the Black Manhattan from the bar dowstairs will haunt me, in a good way, for a long, long while...!

My wife and I just returned from NYC and stayed 2 nights in the Walker. While the hotel is nice, the service is what will bring me back. The check-in was courteous and professional and the check-out was simply outstanding. We checked out and had some extra time to check out a few more sites in NYC. Not only did they hold our bags securely, but when we returned they had our bags IN THE CAB and it was waiting for us -- and we got back about 10 min earlier than we had indicated. This was very appreciated since it was Halloween and the big parade was starting to get things jammed -- so getting out efficiently was important. A big shout-out to Marcus, Irvin, Angel and Danny. Many thanks.

I stayed at the Walker Hotel earlier this month and requested a quiet room, with a bathtub if that was available. The class of room I’d booked didn’t feature a tub, and it was a $200 upgrade that I decided to skip. The hotel is interesting layout. Enter street level, walk down a flight of stairs to a lovely lobby on one side and restaurant behind, and elevators in between. My room was tiny but that wasn’t an issue; and I loved how quiet it was. The bed was incredible and very nice linens. My little room was an Art Deco haven. I felt safe and cosy. The cleanliness was ~almost perfect, but some details overlooked: dusty lampshades (floor corners too) and fixtures coming off the wall (hand towel bar) or into my hands (shower handle). The hotel was quick to fix the reported issues, but guests shouldn’t have to encounter those problems. Also, at least once a day I ordered room service, including hot water for tea, as well as an ice bucket in the same order, and one item would always be missing. I felt bad for the delivery person to have to go back and would double tip them. By the third time this happened, I was pretty annoyed, so I’m mentioning it here. I know they’re a small hotel so being more organized will help with efficiency and not overworking the staff.As far as the food from the restaurant, it’s pricey but certainly delicious. I liked the pasta and the beet dishes best, as well as the cookies! At night turn down service would leave little treats- all were fabulous.One day it rained; the hotel has umbrellas available to loan. Great touch! I enjoyed every person I interacted with: housekeeping, front desk, concierge, bellhop, room service... all very nice folks. The Walker Hotel is centrally situated in the Village, is a beautiful space, comfortable to stay in and (mostly) very clean and restful. Here are some suggestions: general maintenance ought to be stayed better on top of; pay closer attention to the room service orders. Fixing those issues would make this hotel a top notch place to stay.

I've stayed at the Walker a couple of times and it's always great. Lobby atmosphere is super cool, staff is really accommodating and friendly and the rooms are perfect. Can't beat the location. Even coffee delivery at 5:15am was handled with ease.

Three nights and everyone was attentive to our needs. We'd like to particularly mention William, Danny, Angel and the nice young man who brought us our coffee every morning and always asked if we were comfortable and needed anything else. The location was perfect for us. The room is very clean, small but everything you need is there.

Stayed for a couple of nights. First night we were staying in the tiniest room. You could barely walk around the bed and opening a suitcase fully was impossible. The style and furnishings are lovely and the communal areas are all very nicely done. The breakfast was nice but not overly generous for $25 pp (an egg on the side of the pancakes was $4 extra!).The staff were lovely and helpful. In particular one member of staff (dark hair and glasses) sorted us with a larger room the second night which was a relief. Generally the staff are young and very friendly. I enjoyed it a lot once we got the larger room and the staff were fab but overall was very expensive ($400 per night) for what you get. If you are able to get a better deal then am sure it would be super. Great location though!

Just returned from 4 night stay at The Walker for first time. Our group of 5 ladies booked 3 rooms (2 doubles and 1 queen). Location was ideal for exploring the village. This place delivered 5-star service. Marcus, Danny and the rest of the team exceeded all expectations. This is the 7th year our group has traveled to NYC and this ranks as our best boutique hotel experience. As other reviewers have stated the rooms are small, but this is the only negative and, given the location, hardly noticeable. All 3 rooms were clean and quiet (7th and 8th floor). Bathrooms were updated and amazing water pressure. The bar & lobby were a perfect hang out spot before and after a night out. All bar staff were super friendly. As an added bonus, the hotel offered a flat-rate car service to airport upon checkout. We will be booking again next year. Thanks for a great stay!!

loved loved loved my stay at the greenwich, despite the teeny tiny size of the suites. lovely warm welcoming lobbylove the "gastby-esque" inspired decor.staff were a delight, particulary Marcus who was so charming and helpful- went out of his way to help a london gal figure out my train journey to JFK.what a wonderful stay.

My husband and I stayed here for a weekend trip to NYC and really enjoyed this hotel. The architecture and ambiance are amazing. We loved that this was a smaller hotel situated in a neighborhood and not one of the overrun tourist areas. We had a larger queen sized room which is about the same size as a normal hotel room at a chain. I believe there are both smaller and larger rooms available but it suited our needs for a short trip. I wouldn't stay here with children as the size and setup would make things a little cramped. The hotel itself is compact but again had all of the amenities that we needed. It has a cute bar/restaurant area that is great for grabbing a drink prior to (or after) heading out and about. We ate breakfast at the restaurant on the morning we left and I would say that the food was good but not outstanding. All of the staff at the hotel were really great - they sent us a nice fruit plate and bottle of sparkling water when we checked in. They offered many great suggestions of places to eat and things to see. Overall this was a great hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Cool looking place.Tiny rooms.Little, low beds. Some of the glowing reviews seem to ignore the deficiencies because the architecture is neat.We were given two drink vouchers at check-in - that's nice.Looked to use them at 11:30 on a Saturday evening. The bartender said "white wine or red wine?" "The Bar is closed."I mean, this is New York, right? 11:30? Well, apparently the bar was not actually closed, since there was a bartender, and he was able to muster up the strength to pour two wines. Just NOT beers or cocktails. He was also very anxious to point out that the drink vouchers did NOT include a gratuity for his wine-pouring. And, he also informed us that we needed to consume our beverages in the hotel lobby, as in : get out of here. Tacky. Not at all with the hip vibe the hotel is attempting to portray. You might think that is understandable, since they do need to close up shop at some point, even if 11:30 on a Saturday evening sounds more like Greenwich, KS than Greenwich Village. (Nothing against Kansas, I know the bartenders are more courteous there). However, when we went back to the elevator bank near the bar 20 minutes later the same people that were in the bar earlier were still in their booth sipping. Good for them.As for the customer service, why take a nice offer like two free drinks and turn it into a hassle?

The hotel is perfectly located. The staff was very kind and helpful from the moment we got there to the time we left. We would like to thank Irvin, Marcus, Danny and Angel for making our trip so much better. Also, the Hudson Room is very comfortable, quiet (which can be rare in the city) and has a lovely balcony that made us feel at home. Next time, we won't have to spend any more time looking for a hotel in NY.

The hotel has nice atmosphere, great location, the room was clean and thoughtfully decorated. The East Village location I really liked. The lobby and hotel restaurant have a great atmosphere. Very old building with character but restored. The room was nice. I would consider going back there. Its newly renovated and the rooms and bathrooms are new and nice. Its a New York Hotel and the rooms and small and that's part for the course. Some constructive feedback: On the first night the HVAC in the room worked the air intake must have been near a kitchen and had a deep fryer smell and on the second night the HVAC malfunctioned in the middle of the night and started blasting heat out when it was supposed to be cooling. The door in the shower was also not properly installed so it hung funny and did not close. They need to rehang the glass shower door the right way. These are fixable problems in my mind. If I saw it as an option for my next business trip to NY and the rate was reasonable again I'd stay there.

20s style with modern facilities and excellent, friendly service. Food in the restaurant was extremely high quality. Would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect for taking huge bites of the delicious Big Apple.

We stayed at the Walker Hotel for a recent trip. We loved the location and the hotel was everything we expected. Marcus took great care of us. I had called a few days before our stay to request an upper level room with a view of the city and told him it was our anniversary. We had the best room on the 16th floor and there was a nice surprise in our room to help us celebrate. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Marcus and Angel were the best! I highly recommend a stay at the Walker.

Very friendly and helpful staff, pleasant dining room, perfect room. Excellent location in the Village. I was able to entertain and discuss business in the dining room. Wonderful view of the World Trade Center.

Reasonable location in the West Village. Hotel is clean and well-kept. Rooms are small with a ridiculously tiny closet and inadequate space even for travelers who pack light and always fly with carryon baggage. Staff is good and the Walker is overall pleasant with quiet rooms.

The hotel is in the heart of a very lively and vibrant area and yet we had 5 nights uninterupted sleep. No noise from inside of outside the hotel. The staff were great, special mentions to Irvin, Keith and Phil but all the staff were great. They helped us with various things like taxis and restaurants and helped make it a very pleasant enjoyable stay. Again, I must stress the fact that unlike a previous trip where we stayed in another hotel disturbed by sirens, roadworks etc, the peace and quiet was brillaint.It was also very clean and well furnished. I have no problem in recomending it.

I booked a room for 2 nights online for a recent business trip to the area - I travel to the city 2-3/month on average. When I arrived at check in, I was given a ADA compliant room which is not what was advertised. Typically ADA rooms are offered at a lower cost because many people (myself included) do not like the change in configuration - namely the shower area as it is typically designed to accommodate someone in a wheelchair. Bottom line was that they did not have any more regular rooms so I was given a room with 2 smaller beds for my first night. That evening I wrote an email to the General Manager expressing my dissatisfaction with the situation (cause this is not a low cost hotel nor a Springhill Suites). Three days later, even after a friendly reminder to the front desk attendant I have yet to receive a reply from MarcAnthony (General Manager). Mistakes in my opinion are only mistakes if they are left unaddressed - I guess we can call this choice for a hotel a mistake. Be careful if you book here and arrive later in the evening as you will likely experience what I did this week.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Walker! The staff was friendly and professional, and the room was very nice. I'll definitely be staying here again. Bonus, the food in the restaurant is excellent, and they leave cake on your bed each night when they do turn-down service! Oh, and they were able to arrange transportation to the airport for a very good price.

Absolutely loved staying at the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village! It is a quiet reprieve from the busy streets of NYC. Cozy lounge area greets you downstairs where it is a nice place for a cocktail & conversation with friends. The entire staff, especially Marcus, Angel & Natalia, were super friendly & helpful. They greeted me by name every time I walked in & out of the hotel. The room is quaint & quiet. It was fun to come back to a yummy turn-down treat each evening as well! The location is near many shops & restaurants, as well as easy to get to subway stops. I will definitely stay again.
user_name:
Karen K
Indian Harbour Beach, Florida

review_body: I love The Walker -- it's my favorite place in NYC. I prefer staying in The Village and there aren't many options in that area. The Walker is very nice and stylish on top of it's great location. The rooms are decent size for NYC, the staff are universally very nice and helpful and you can get a balcony! What's not to like?

my husband and I stayed at the Walker from 30 July till 3 August. I love this hotel and the staff were wonderful. It was so close to our conference and to the village. It is gorgeous,clean and the theming was amazing. We want to send a shout out to specific staff at Walker for exceptional customer service. Thanks to Nancy, Denny and Irvin. This was our first stay in the village and we will definitely be back. Peace and thanks

had a very nice time and the hotel was really nice and especially Irvin, Marcus and Johnny with their help. Helped with directions, cab ,when we had questions they were very helpful. Just a nice place to stay and the food was goodthe lazo s

I love this hotel. North of Washington Square, it's a very relaxed location and within easy walking distance of midtown. The 30s decor, though recent, is very authentic and gives the hotel a thrilling old NYC atmosphere. Bed was very comfortable and the shower great. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.

Just got back from a 4 night/5 day stay here. We loved it. We had never stayed in Greenwich Village before so picked here as The Marlton was booked. Glad we did. Lovely friendly staff who will do anything for you without any trouble (we often ordered a tea and a latte in the front lobby in front of the fire when we got back in the afternoon).Special mention to Irvin and Danny who helped us on our last day - Danny weighing our cases for us and Irvin who had helped pre our trip (our trip was to celebrate a special birthday) with restaurant recommendations (Rosemarys, The Grey Dog, Sotto 13 - amazing I must say!) and also made sure my mum whos birthday it was got a bottle of champagne and cake on the day.We will definitely stay here again if we come back, hopefully next year. The style of the hotel is gorgeous too - think 1920s Great Gatsby!

You know when you meet an attractive person and once you get to know them, they don't live up to their hype, well, unfortunately that was The Walker Hotel Greenwich Village. The hotel is quaint though not technically in Greenwich Village. The lobby is lovely. The hotel staff is at tentative. The bath/shower products are good quality and they provide bathrobes. The amenities are lovely. But the bad outweighed the good. At 3:30 am I could hear the people (man) in the room above me having sex one night. The next night he came back to his room around 3:30 am and talked on the phone! As if sleeplessness was not enough, I found a used plastic dental flosser for teeth made into our bed underneath the bottom sheet. I brought to the attention of the front desk. They apologized. If you cannot be confident about the hygiene of a hotel, I cannot give the hotel a good review. I was very disappointed that the management of the hotel made no effort to contact me. We stayed at the hotel 3 nights and up graded from a standard room. William at the front desk was very helpful booking the reservation.

This lovely, well-run hotel is in a great, central, relatively quiet location. They are also one of the few hotels left in NYC that doesn't allow pets which allows for a quiet and allergy-free stay.The staff are attentive, friendly, and genuine allowing for a very relaxed atmosphere.
