The rooms aren't big but the bathrooms are perfect. This is my go-to place in NY.

It was a first time visit for both my Wife and I. Although we had friends who helped enormously in showing us around, The Walker Hotel was not only aa perfect venue to unwind at the end of a very hectic and bust day. The staff were exceptional, especially Danny, Irvin and Angel who were on hand to assist with advice when requested - this is often required when you are a first time visitor to a City that never sleeps!!We would recommend a Terrace Room such as 1705 if you are there for any length of time as space is scarce in such a City. The Hotel is vibey, comfortable and fun

An organization I belong to does a couple of small get-togethers a year. Recently, I chose the Walker Hotel because there is a charming oasis of a restaurant in the back with a space that is perfect for the 15-20 of us. The chef uses local produce and decides on the menu options close to the date of the event, and what was served was absolutely fantastic. We chose all vegetarian and vegan options since I wasn't sure about people's dietary needs and didn't want to ask -- too much work -- so I just played it safe. It was a wonderful event and we will definitely go back!
user_name:
marabel100
New York City, New York

review_body: We have stayed in Walker Hotel in August. It is a small charming hotel in good location. Breakfast is a la carte, we have it incl. in our rate, basically one can choose a fresh juice, coffee/tea and warm /cold dish (eggs, avocado toast, granola, pancakes, etc.)in 25 USD value. Double beds are really small, the room was very small, but the bathroom was nice and clean. Staff was excellent, helpful and smiling. Good location for families accompanying kids for the uni/college.It is expensive 4 stars hotel in Greenwich Village, in walking distance from 5th avenue, shops, restaurants, Union Square, Washington Square Park, etc.

This is a hidden gem - even the front door is not that noticeable but step in side and you are in a beautiful art deco hotel which emits class at every turn. The staff are excellent - chilled and extremely helpful - quite a rare mix. The bar man, Ryan, went out of his way to provide his insight on where to go in New York. The rooms are amazing. The hotel does make you feel you are stepping back into the glitz, glamour and real bohemian culture that was and still is Greenwich Village. I had researched the hotel prior to booking as it was part of my husband's 5th surprise. I recommended it to my sister-in-law who had stayed near Times Square the previous year. My sister-in-law and husband also fell in love with it. Yes - you will fall in love with this hotel. Each night you will get a lovely little surprise from the kitchen too.

I agonised over the number of stars. If my visit had gone smoothly, it would have been five. Given what happened during the visit, it should be three. So four is a compromise.Having added an extra night to my original three night booking, I had an inkling that there might be a problem, so I made a point of speaking to one of the many and changing receptionists before going out on the third morning. Later on I was telephoned while in Central Park to be told I should have checked out at 1l. I explained the situation again, but when I got back, I was told I needed to check in as a new guest. To do that I needed photo ID. I pointed out that the photo ID was in my room. But no photo ID, no room card. A perfect Catch-22. Fortunately another receptionist came along and vouched for me, but it spoiled what was otherwise a very happy stay.The room was extremely comfortable, with good storage space, and the bonus of Bigelow's products in the bathroom. Despite being on a fairly busy street, the room was very quiet.The downstairs lounge is a good place to sit, and drinks are offered, though there's no problem if you just want to sit. There is a lot of breakfast choice, and the espresso is excellent.As for location, the Walker is ideal. We walked to and from the High Line, walked to and from the Lower East Side and even - though it was a bit of a marathon - to and from a show on Broadway.The housekeeping staff are extremely charming, as is the barman, and as are the waiters, so a very recommendable place to stay.

Wow, had an amazing stay at the Walker. Small, intimate, boutique, gorgeous comfy art deco hotel. Nice clean modern bathroom with large beautiful Frette towels. Very comfortable bedding with choice of pillows. Stayed 10 nights in a Standard Grove Room on 12th floor overlooking the New School of Music and apartments. So got a feel for what it would be like living as a New Yorker. Two blocks from 2 main subways uptown & down town. Very easy walk to heart of the Village, Soho, Tribeca & lovely Chelsea Market & gorgeous Highline. No kettle in room but was sent one immediately upon request. Lovely surprise sweets & 2 bottles water left for me in room each night. Free Wi fi. Gym was small modern & clean & catered well for what I wanted. Lovely small intimate lounge areas to sit and chill with a drink from the bar downstairs. Heaps of nice places to eat close buy. All the staff Marcus (GM), Eli, Thomas, Nancy, the Door guys & Bar/Restaur hostesses were wonderful. Very professional and personal. Was made to feel at home. Definitely would stay at the Walker on my next NYC trip. Five Stars!!!!!

Made a trip to NYC, and had the pleasure of staying at the Walker. I really enjoyed the well appointed rooms, and delicious Society Cafe breakfasts; their juices are the best thing after a fun in the city!

Very attractive boutique hotel in West Village. Friendly helpful staff, very attractive rooms, modern yet classic bathrooms. Close to 14th street and Union Stations. Close to Chelsea market and the southern end of the High Line.

This hotel is erroneously called a luxury boutique....the term luxury did not apply. There was no doorman anywhere to be found and it was seriously in need of a thorough vacuuming! This would be great if it were at least $100 cheaper. There were holes in my sheets....very unacceptable;( There are way too many other options in Manhattan, this place was in par with a Hampton and others of that ilk, just a lot more expensive....disappointing;(

Truly enjoyed walking out the front door to the heart of Greenwich Village; walking distance to great restaurants, bars, music venues was fantastic. Subway stations were close by as well. The hotel itself has a beautiful exterior and nice lobby. A fireplace and seating area is cozy and comfortable. We didn't try the restaurant and bar as there were so many great choices nearby (Le Pain Quotidien and the Corner Bistro a few blocks away were great for breakfast and lunch, respectively). I did have some minor complaints. As others have written, the room was not well lit. The air conditioner was from a previous century, placed into the wall and would constantly turn on/off. The air conditioner was also quite loud. Since we were on the second floor, we preferred to use the stairwell. It would be nice if the staff could clean the stairs as it was not clean (small bits trash of the floor, dust, a ladder in the way). But my biggest complaint was the lack of storage space in the room- the room did not have a dresser and only a small closet space. We lived out of our suitcases for a week. Unacceptable. As far as comfort in the room was concerned- (with the exception of no dresser) the bedding was fine for us. The bathroom was clean and well designed. Bath amenities were very nice. Maid service was excellent. A sofa chair was comfortable. The rug however was well worn and could use a replacement. In the lobby, the front staff was personable but not at the professional level of finer hotels. Some of the drawbacks for this hotel can be easily remedied- like adding a dresser to rooms and more service training for the front staff. I would seriously consider updating the lighting and climate control if this were my hotel. Doing so can move this hotel from a good boutique hotel to a top level experience. Will I return? Can't beat the location, the cozy feel of the place. For a short stay-yes. For a week or so, maybe not; it's the little things that count- like a dresser for your clothes, adequate lighting- that can make or break one's decision to return.

Very quaint, small but cozy and comfortable. Restaurant is excellent but pricey. Location is ideal in NYC, close to everything. Rooms are small but adequate. Close to Union Square and trendy 5th Ave. Shopping everywhere.

excellent boutique hotel on quiet street. Close to everything we needed to get to. Staff were attentive and always ready. We enjoyed the breakfast in the restaurant and the drinks at the bar before dinner in Manhattan. We will be back!!John O'Loughlin

The Hotel is a gem. Very clean, friendly staff, rooms are very nicely decorated, charming, lovely neighborhood, good food in their restaurant. Greenwich Village is a wonderful neighborhood. Washington Square is a place to sit and enjoy all that goes on there. Close to NYU.

I had my family visiting NY stay because of the convenient location in the Village. A great room with friendly and helpful staff made theirs a great stay. There is no place like it in the area. Highly recommended.
user_name:
genwnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: Charming, immaculate, convenient, comfortable throughout, friendly, great in-house restaurant (esp. breakfast!) with a very nice evening happy hour. This was my sanctuary after a long day of work & a little evening entertainment.

Good reviews are mercifully brief and this is one of them. Cool place, elegant and classy rooms, chic decor, and a very helpful staff ( who got me a last minute extra room ) I can't say enough good things about this place. It had the feel of a private members club but none of the elitism that sometimes accompanies that. Will go back when we next visit NYC.

The service at the hotel is superior, including the restaurant and bar. The environment is peaceful and elegant. The rooms are clean and functional. We were happy to have a 5 star restaurant in the hotel - The food, coffee and drinks were excellent!

This is a lovely boutique hotel at the northern tip of Greenwich Village, within walking distance of a few subway stops (to get anywhere in the city very easily) and of Union Square and Washington Square parks. It has a stylish Art Nouveau aesthetic with a fine looking lobby as you descend the stairs from the street level. Check-in was friendly and quick and compared to some tiny Manhattan hotels, you don't feel as cramped at the Walker - with two fast elevators and a nice lobby area to lounge in. They even gave us two complimentary drinks to the attached bar (Society Cafe) which we used on our last night. The rooms themselves are nicely appointed, with a decent bathroom, robes, and complimentary water. Closet space was decent though not huge. The only minor drawbacks (which take it from an excellent / outstanding hotel to a very good one) were: 1) very dark room, three small lamps were all that were available to light the room, making it almost impossible to even read at night; 2) inconsistent AC - turned on powerfully blowing cold air for a few minutes then turned off till it became too hot again; 3) tiny hard pillows - barely the size of your head, with no others to use! These were minor problems in what was otherwise a very good hotel that we would stay at again if we were back in the city. (PS: The gym in the basement was small but decent)

The location of The Walker is unbeatable in Manhattan. Centrally located on the Northern edge of Greenwich Village, everything is walkable. Everyone on staff is incredibly helpful and gracious with their time. The restaurant is great and the in-room amenities are on-point for NY hotels.
user_name:
Rob B
New York City, New York

review_body: Big room , super comfortable bed , nice and quiet location - great sleep - note we asked for soft feather pillows - supplied no problems.Ate in the restaurant for breakfast once - would rate it 3.5 out of 5.Really close to Union Square /Chelsea , awesome restaurants & shopping.Loved our stay , will be back!

This hotel is well located and has a warm ambience. The resultant is excellent but expensive if you are British due to the exchange rate. The room was charmingly decorated but tiny. It was kept at a good temperature by air conditioning but you cannot control it and it comes on randomly throughout the night. I will definitely stay here again As it's the perfect location.

We loved staying in quiet Greenwich Village away from the hustle and bustle of the busier areas of NYC (Times Square, Central Park, etc). It was also nice and close to great restaurants and not far form Chelsea Market and the High Line. The lobby is a stunning area with lots of little seating areas and tables. Our room was clean and tidy with lots of fun retro touches (and modern amenities). It is a bit on the small size, but it is NYC and that's to be expected. There was plenty of room for us (we were out in the city most of the time anyways), and there was a small desk as well as closet space. I would have liked more counter space in the bathroom but there are shelves for toiletries in the bathroom. AMAZING water pressure and we loved the free water (in glass bottles). I'd definitely stay at Walker Hotel Greenwich Village again in the future. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant but it was amazing! The carrot/orange/ginger juice was a refreshing start to the day and the avocado toast was so amazing I got it two days in a row. The coffee is awesome and the service was great. And it's such a chill, cool atmosphere. We loved it!

Small room, with the smallest closet possible. Found bugs in the room, dark and uncomfortable pillows. The people who work there were lovely, however, I cannot recommend this hotel. The location was good and pretty central.

The hotel is stylish, clean, nice location and good service. this should result in a good review. Unfortunately the ventilation system made so much noise that we did not sleep at all first night. For the second night we changed room and this was good. Sleep only one out of two nights is however not good enough.

Stayed here for a work conference. The staff was friendly and accommodating. They made every effort to make the stay comfortable. This hotel is conveniently located and walking distance to many different restaurants and sights. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone looking for a place in Manhattan/ Greenwich. The Society Cafe is also delightful.

It is within walking distance to most places we need to go. The two double beds rooms are good for family travel with kids. The rooms size is a bit small. There is no fridge and hot water boiler which I prefer to have.

Great location in the Village near Union Square, very convenient from the subway. Very European feel, small rooms but very clean and very helpful staff. Bathrooms were nice and modern. Lobby and hallways were a bit dark but easy to navigate. We would stay here again.

The Walker Hotel was a quiet oasis on a recent 3-night stay in New York. Our rooms-- both "barrow queen deluxe"--were spacious and well-appointed, with comfortable beds and a nice sitting area, including a window seat in the bay window that overlooks 13th street. The rooms were remarkably quiet, even with the big windows looking out onto the street. The staff of the Walker Hotel were, to a person, helpful and friendly. And the location is perfect for seeing the city, either on foot or by subway!

Great 1 night "sleepover" with my friend who was in from LA. Who knew there was a renovated SRO turned boutique hotel on 13th Street in tony Greenwich Village? Unusual in its prime location and our room had 2 small double beds but it was cozy and quiet as a bunker!The hotel is beautifully renovated however a very small lobby and not a real congregating place at check in. The resto in the back of the lobby is so pretty with its tin ceiling and lovely fixtures.Great location to shopping, eating, touring and for any tourist/visitor who is traditionally staying Uptown and missing the best of NYC.Dont look for luxury or other appoointments but a solid place to rest your weary body! I may recommend to my family to stay there in October for a local wedding!
user_name:
Nuts4shoes
New York City, New York

review_body: Hubby booked a room last minute to celebrate our anniversary. Unfortunately at check-in, we realized he had screwed up and booked the hotel for the wrong date. Luckily, that was the only thing that went wrong!The girl at the desk could not have been nicer - said not to worry, not only could she get us a room but it was $10 cheaper than the room we reserved at hotels.com. It was only 12:30 so a room wasn't ready yet but she would text us when one became available. We mentioned we were in town celebrating our anniversary. We hadn't even made it to the corner yet when she called and said a room was available. And what a room! With a picture perfect view of the Empire State buildingFrom there we went for a lovely walk around Greenwich Village. This hotel is close to everything and we had a great time eating, shopping and exploring. When we came back to change for dinner we were pleasantly surprised to find a dessert and chocolate covered strawberries waiting with a card wishing us a happy anniversary! What a nice suprise! We went out for dinner and came back for drinks. The bar was clearly closely as it was midnight on a Thursday but the bartender graciously stayed open so we could enjoy our nightcap. Then upon returning to the room we were greeted by a chocolate cake and more anniversary wishes!The location of this hotel is superb, the decor is wonderful, the staff is amazing. I don't often give this much of a rave review but the Walker Hotel clearly went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing anniversary!Tip: there is garage parking right across the street that can be reserved for a very reasonable rate.
user_name:
Dee B
Moorestown, New Jersey, United States

review_body: If you're looking for an upscale feeling hotel and room in a great location the Walker fits the bill. It is suited for solo or couples due to its small size. This is a good base to explore NY and not spend a lot of time in your smallish room.

Came into town last minute and after staying at the hotel once, a few months ago, the hotel staff (especially the rep Natalia) were beyond accommodating, welcoming and provide exquisite service. The hotel is super clean and tidy. Great restaurant, center location. A great Boutiqe hotel with high service awareness and client oriented in this crazy city! A hidden gem!!! Woud def come back next time. This hotel just earned a lifetime guest.

I wanted to love this place but after our room still wasn't ready after check-in time (they gave us drinks at the bar but I would have preferred a shower!), our room was missing amenities and drinking glasses, most unfortunate was that our room wasn't cleaned during our stay. We weren't around all day but thought leaving the clean-up sign on the door would have given them a hint. Always looking for that perfect New York hotel...the search continues.The hotel bar, however, was very nice.

I love staying here - it's an absolute dream location right in the village with great proximity to everything downtown - West Village, Greenwich Village, Union Square, etc. The staff are always super helpful and the rooms are lovely. For the price, which is pretty reasonable for Manhattan, I think it's great. The rooms are a bit tight, but that's to be expected in the city. Overall a nice experience.

We stayed and booked two rooms between four of us. Good job we did, the rooms are small. You can't have two suitcases open! The corridors are hot, dark and gloomy. The restaurant due to its fancy menu is a desert, completely empty and uninviting. Rooms are Art Deco style and tired. House keeping is erratic and frankly the rooms need a damn good spring clean. Frankly a disappointment for the money and I wouldn't recommend this Hotel. The area of Greenwich it's in isn't the one you'd want to be in either!

We stayed three nights with our daughter. The hotel itself and the rooms are extremely dark. When you first enter, you have to go down a level via stairs carrying your suitcases. We were presented with our extremely small room, which was poorly lit and kept in brown and dark colours. We went to the reception and asked to change rooms to something lighter as shown on their website. We were given a blue room instead of one we left (which was supposed to be red). In turned out that the new room was exactly similar, except in our view for the dark blue stripe on the bedspread and the dark blue curtains and pillows. TThere was a single sheet below and on to of the duvets. This meant that the sheets came loose during the night, which was annoying at one point and disgusting at another, since the duvets had old blood stains and other stains on them. The bathrooms were nice, and the location was OK.

From the moment we walked in the service and atmosphere was top notch! Every detail made our trip so successful! Room was beautiful and comfortable and though in the city nice and quiet! A short walk to everything!!! Each direction a different experience! Could not be happier with our stay. A perfect spot! Close enough to Times Square and the peace of the village!

This hotel is beautiful and you can walk to so many places and it was very close to everywhere I needed to get to. The only downside that I experienced is since it's a boutique hotel and smaller the hallways are very small and you could hear every door slam, especially early in the am when housekeeping started to go in and out, wasn't the best wake up call but besides that the staff is super friendly and it is an adorable place.

Nice room for NYC and Price. Nice furnishing. Staff very nice and helpful. No coffee in the morning at all. You'll have to pay for it in the restaurant. Coffee in restaurant is not good and costs $4. Very good location. Unfortunately, we were just there during gay pride parade and we had a very hard time getting around. Wish they had told us of this huge city street blocking around the hotel. But in New York, you should ask hotel if any special events in area.

This is a small, friendly hotel. I stayed with my teenage daughter in a twin room which was clean, nicely furnished, comfortable and exactly as expected from the website. We enjoyed an excellent evening meal in the restaurant, but it was on the expensive side. (This is a great location and there are many local restaurants within a few minutes walk so it is perfectly possible to eat well for less elsewhere.) The stand-out feature is the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff, who were attentive without being overbearing and nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely stay here again.

this is a nice hotel, small on the Lower East that lets you explore the area with short walks around. We thought the breakfast and cafe attached to the hotel, just okay. They could do a lot better with a little up grade.

I had a fabulous time The Walker Hotel, primarily because of how excellent the staff is. Everyone is incredibly friendly and welcoming, and I have to give special commendation to Irvin, Keith and Danny, who went above and beyond. Our rooms weren’t ready on time due to unforeseen circumstances, and the staff bent over backwards to make it up to us. And this is high praise is not limited to strictly hotel staff. The kitchen and wait staff were also amazing, from late night requests to all around excellent service. I can’t give them enough credit for making my stay as enjoyable as possible. Regarding the hotel itself, the rooms are smaller than they look in the photos, but from what I hear they are par for the course for NYC, but if you’re into cozy this is the spot for you. Other than that, the water pressure was AH-MAZING, and the beds while small (I was sharing, and it was a full size, where I’m used to a king) they were very comfortable. I was in town for a bachelorette weekend, otherwise I would normally stay with Friends. But if I find myself in need for a hotel in NYC in the future, I’ll definitely be checking the availability at The Walker.
user_name:
mnmsxg223
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location! So much within walking distance plus subway stops nearby. Staff was cold and not all that helpful. Took forever to get car (there are plenty of garages close by that are cheaper than valeting it). Well appointed room but small (it is NYC, after all ). Would be difficult for someone in a wheel chair. Would try something else next time.

Nice, quaint, small hotel. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Even by NYC standards, however, the price was not worth it. The rooms (our room, anyway) was so small that stepping over our small amount of luggage added to the claustrophobic feel of the room. When we returned from our day in the city for a cocktail, I had to go the lobby to enjoy my drink, I felt so crammed into our room. Add on the fact (through no fault of the hotel), something dramatic was taking place in the room next to us at 12:30 a.m. and causing a lot of noise. And the AC "clanked" every time it shut off, waking us up all night long. Nice place but we will not be returning for that cost.

As an ex-New Yorker I know my way around the city so I knew this was a good location. As with much of Manhattan one has to go street by street as the city has way too many homeless folks. I loved my room, I loved LOVED the shower as the water pressure on the 9th floor was amazing. Silly but it matters. Good towels, sheets and lovely turn-down service, cookies and bottled water. Not a fan of Bigelow's hair products but I get why they were the choice in the bathroom since they're down the street literally. The one negative thing: don't use their offer of a "private car" to the airport. The flat fee of $55 turned into $68 with a $5 "credit card" charge. Who does that? Made me livid. And the car was old, dirty, the driver cranky. Phooey.

I love the Walker Hotel! The staff is so friendly and welcoming, and the rooms are delightful. From the turn down service to plush towels to a top-notch restaurant, this hotel has it all. But what makes it so special is the personalities of the people who work there. It's clear they're proud of their hotel, and they bend over backwards to accommodate their guests' every wish. I spent four wonderful days there, and when I'm next in NYC, I'll definitely stay there again.

This is a small boutique hotel located in a prime neighborhood. It's extremely close to Union Sq. and Washington Sq. Easy access to both areas. It's very pretty on the outside the lobby is also very pretty. I arrived early for a business meeting and I had to change in a small bathroom. It was a bit awkward, but my only choice. I would not recommend the hotel for business. Some of the front desk staff was extremely friendly and others were not. The rooms were delightful. I would have liked to have a small fridge to store the water and other drinks I bought. It was very hot out, and the warm water and sodas just didn't do it. I did not try any of the food at the restaurant. For the price, I might try somewhere else next time.

Stayed one night on business. Very nice area within easy walking distance of most downtown attractions, shopping etc. The decor is very dark and air conditioning does not work well (feels more like humid air). Staff are very polite and accommodating. Price wise it was expensive but very typical of Manhattan.

Great location, great service, great food from Chef Zabita - can't wait to return. Really comfy room and great view of the city. Great restaurant in house and nearby. The lovely Linda took care of us - thanks Linda x

Loved this hotel -- the reception was friendly, the location was great, and the room was well-appointed and charming. Love the art deco feel. Also the breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was delicious. I would definitely stay here again. A great find.
user_name:
nicky20016
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Walker Hotel offers a truly unique experience. From the moment you are welcomed at the entrance by the bellmen, to the stunning staircase leading to the sunken lobby, this hotel really knows how to make a good first impression. I've seen other travelers complain about the size of the rooms, but they obviously don't understand you don't travel to New York to hang out in your room. I loved everything about my room and also found the water pressure to be outstanding, which is hard to come by. The place is spotless and well maintained and the amenities are high end and very thoughtful. The entire staff made me feel at home throughout my stay. Everyone I encountered was genuinely friendly and caring, like a family. The icing on the cake is the restaurant, Society Cafe, nestled in the back of the hotel. The menu by Chef Christopher Zabita is exquisite and the staff is exceptional! If you want predicable and boring, don't stay here. If you're seeking an experience; make your reservation today!
user_name:
MD L
New York City, New York

review_body: I chose this hotel for its location. In the past, I have stayed in Times Square to be near the theatres but this visit I was planning to spend most of my time in and around Greenwich Village. It was a great location, near Union Square and the Subway, on a very quiet street. The lobby is beautiful. The breakfast was very good. The room, while small like all NY hotels, was clean and a/c worked great. The shower was slow to drain and the in-room safe didn't work, but other than that, everything was great. I would definitely stay here again.

It is definitely a good location, and super clean and nice room. But based on the price, you can get better options around the area. To be more precise, what made my experience not the best one:- Very bad Internet. I had to do some work from the room and that was impossible with the Internet provided by the hotel;- Noisy air conditioner. It stopped abruptly and noisily, as someone hitting the wall;There was something else that annoyed me, but I would not say that this is valid for all customers. I mean, if you don't need a power adaptor, don't read the following one:- Don't provide EU-USA power adaptors. I forgot mine and I was offered one set for 30 dollars. Again, on my previous experiences with other hotels around the area and for the same price, the reception borrowed me one adaptor at anytime for the period of my stay.

If you are seeking genuinely caring staff from Andrian and all others at the front desk to mixologist Pablo at the bar to the room attendants, etc coupled with s ophisticated decor and a great location in a quiet neighborhood just a five minute walk to the major train hub at Union Square, The Walker should be your go to hotel. It is now ours. My wife and I would now not go elsewhere.

Its all in the details and the people. The Walker Hotel exceeded my expectation. Driving into the city can be intimidating, where will I park, is there a valet? Their instructions prior to my arrival made it stress free! They were there to welcome me and share in the excitement to see my son and to offer a bedtime treat and fluff my pillows. I felt at home. Is that even possible on a visit to New York? Yes it is but only at the Walker.

Pros: Location is excellent, nice turndown service (when you do get it), quiet, charming styleCons: It seems like the rooms are falling apart. Our shower knob was no longer attached to the plumbing fixture so you had to be careful when turning the shower on and off. The towel rack also had the same problem. It literally wasn't attached to the wall. The rooms are tiny so if you are sharing you obviously won't be in the room for long! There is just a shower (so no bath tub).

I visit New York several times a year for work and for the first time found myself looking for a new hotel after my old favorite was sold. I stumbled on the Walker Hotel and took a leap, and I'm glad I did! What a fantastic location. Delicious restaurants, subway, shopping all within walking distance, nice, clean room with a spacious updated bathroom. It's New York, so the rooms aren't going to be gigantic, however they are absolutely fine for a place to lay your head, change clothes and get back to exploring. Because of the size of the hotel, you can be outside in a matter of a few minutes as opposed to large chain hotels. I'll be back later in the year and plan on staying here again.

Boutique hotel in Art Deco style. Compact lobby with pretty good restaurant at rear. Modest fitness center. Service helpful at front desk.Free wifi and Saratoga water in small, well-designed bedrooms. Pleasant earth tones decor. Walk-in shower in black/white tiled bathroom.Good value for money and would definitely stay here again.

I just came back from a Memorial Day Weekend stay at the Walker Hotel. What a find! The building is charming, gorgeously preserved and full of nooks and crannies, and the staff is friendly, helpful, accommodating, exemplary. From the moment you enter and see the fire in the fireplace, to the moment you cross the threshold to your room--which includes the most comfy bed I've slept in in decades--you are pampered, delighted, and uniquely at Home. The Walker is a true gem, a rare find, and one I want to keep to myself. I will be back, it's my new hotel of choice. And it will be yours too.
user_name:
SingularGirl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Walker is a really great hotel in Greenwich village. The only problem we had there is related to the size of the beds. We booked a room for 3 people (my wife, my daughter and I) and we received a room with two beds (that's obviously normal) but the width of the beds was only 120 centimeters. That's to narrow to really have a good night.

Very cute boutique hotel. Clean, comfortable rooms albeit very small, which is typical for NY. Robes and slippers, excellent service and a great bar and restaurant. I traveled fro business and the location is perfect. rooms were amazingly quiet and well appointed. Desk staff was polite and made it a wonderful experience. They concoct a delightful Manhattan at the bar.

We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village. The location was perfect for us and the service was excellent. As with most boutique hotels in NYC the rooms are not large, but they are beautifully appointed and comfortable. Breakfast is included each day which was a real perk....the meal included tax and gratuity and guests were able to order from a menu rather than the cattle call buffet which included breakfast often means. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Small hotel with attentive staff and a nice, relaxed atmosphere, very handy for mid and downtown. The rooms are small but that's why it's more affordable than many. Nonetheless clean and good turndown service. The bar and restaurant has a nice ambience, particularly for a relaxed cocktail after a hard day sightsee and shopping!

I like this hotel. The bathrooms are great, the location is very convenient, room service is quick and the rooms are comfortable even if a bit small. The one gripe is the Walker Terrace room that I booked. The website says they have a "large furnished terrace". On the 17th floor that is true. On the 18th floor, that is not true. The "terrace" is not a terrace unless you mean the literal definition of a terrace, a "a level paved area or platform next to a building; a patio or veranda." It is probably 4 feet deep and there is no furniture. You could stand out there to look at the city and have a smoke (I don't smoke) but that's about it. The rooms on the 17th floor have a "large furnished terrace", and you can tell b/c from the 18th floor you can sadly look down at what could have been if you had been assigned a room on the floor below. I called to book again and asked about this and the person on the phone told me there was a table and two chairs on the 18th floor terraces. I was in room 1801 and I assured here that was not the case, and that the room next to me (I think 1804) had a similarly sad small unfurnished "terrace", which I knew b/c there was only a hedge separating my non-terrace from their non-terrace. I recognize it's annoying to classify rooms a bunch of different ways, but they should call the 18th floor "Walker Balcony" rooms or something that does not indicate a large furnished terrace. I'd consider staying there again but I very much dislike being mislead. So no new bookings for me for now.

Our daughter just graduated from NYU. After four years of staying exclusively at the Walker (previously the Jade), we can say definitively this has been our home away from home. Whether she was living on Washington Square Park as a freshman, near Union Square as a sophomore or junior, or in the West Village as a senior, the location has always been a convenient walk from wherever we needed to go. The rooms have always been comfortable and well-appointed, the service always prompt and gracious (spend time in the lounge or go to happy hour!), the food and amenities always a plus (delicious treats are delivered with the turn-down service!). I've used the work-out room and dined in the restaurant numerous times. When I was searching for a place to stay, I read another NYU mom's recommendation of this hotel and decided to try it. I'm glad I did!

The good:Location. For us it was the center of all our activity. If you want to explore Chelsea, Greenwich, the village and Soho and Noho, the location is idealCheck in and out. Fast and very friendlyDecoration. Outside and inside looks cozyThe bad:The quality of personnel is very varying. Some very good, some very mediocre. The worst was when we ordered during happy hour two glasses of white wine and decided on Sauvignon Blanc. The lady got back with red wine. When we told her that we ordered Sauvignon Blanc and this is white wine, she argued that Sauvignon Blanc is red. I had to take the menu to proof she was wrong. Rule no.1; do not argue w guests. Rule no.2; if you argue, make sure that you know where you are talking about.Rooms: we got these rooms adviced for three people in one room but the beds and roomsize is far too small, even for two peopleRoom cleaning; far too late. On average the room was cleaned only at 3.30 pm.

I've stayed at Walker Hotel several times and it continues to be my favorite West Village abode. The Art Deco theme draws unique elements from its neighborhood such as rooms named after iconic Greenwich Village streets and custom art all around from local artists. The staff is so courteous and the beds are super comfortable - I sink into them and don't ever want to leave! My favorite room type is the Terrace Suite facing north with views of Empire State Building (has a huge soaking tub!) Definitely spend an evening at their restaurant Society Cafe which serves market to table cuisine and wonderful cocktails. I consider Walker Hotel my home away from home.. and being someone that gets homesick easily.. that's a big statement! <3
user_name:
jlin113
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfect place to spend time with friends over brunch or dinner. We had heard about the excellent brunch and decided to experience personally. Indeed it was not disappointing. Not only the food was delicious, the staff was very attentive. Well worth your money. For sure we will be back.

The location of the Hotel is great. You are in walking distance from attractive neighborhoods like Soho, Noho , West Village and Greenwich Village and well connected with nearby Metro stations to anywhere. The Hotel is nicely decorated, a house living room type lobby and young staff is there to welcome you. You get complementary mineral water every day. The rooms are quite small and very small if you are 3 adults, like we were. Not enough place for your luggage and 1 small closet is not enough for 3. 1 week was not enough for the team to understand that we are 3, so almost every day we had to ask for 1 more towel. Every evening they bring to the room tasty chocolates or candies (but 2). The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant. Free Wifi was strong.

I hate saying negative things but I am hoping the hotel will learn from them and make it better. First off there are a lot of steps to get in and out they do have an elevator tucked in a corner to go up and down to the lobby. We booked on Expedia and it was quite expensive for 2 nights came to 840. The room we got was not worth it at all. I was told I was getting the grove room, it was so tiny and not functional..there was a big black line down the TV screen and the temperature was not comfortable for sleeping. I complained the 2nd night and they told me the room control is overridden by the hotel...really?? My room was so small there was no dresser. Barely any room around the bed to move. On a good note the shower was wonderful and the linens were very nice on the bed. Every time we stepped in and out of the elevator the rug was filthy and not welcoming, maybe I am spoiled? But for the price it was not worth it. It is such a beautiful space and great location though.

Priceline ripped me off terribly with this hotel.It is presented as a luxurious 4 1/2 star hotel, in the West Village, and I bought 3 nights, weeks in advance, for $1200 total, which avgs to $400/night. (Priceline has higher fees than almost any other booking service, and at least 10% higher than booking directly, so their advertised "lower prices" actually end up costing you more. Additionally, the reservations are non refundable, so when you get saddled with a dud, like The Walker hotel, your vacation is ruined. Firstly, it was 45 degrees outside, but "winter is over so we don't have heat". Apparently, the thermostat in your room is just a decoy, much like this hotel's advertised location and star rating and the temperature is one size fits all- and same temp throughout the hotel. I woke up with a cold. Secondly, it is FILTHY. The rooms are disgustingly dirty, old and full of dust. The sheets had holes. The whole place has a gross, old musty smell.The room was the size of closet. Literally, so tiny I had to hang my clothes in the bathroom, on the shower rod. The bathroom did not have any counter space for toiletries or a place / enough space even for your toothbrush. The alleged "room service" is just a couple of cold sandwiches from the bodega on the corner, and the staff are BRAZEN LIARS. I asked, before ordering, what the fruit plate was like, because I suspected, based on everything else in this dump, that it was going to be just melon- the cheapest fruit. The person who took the order said "Every morning, our chefs go to the Union Square Farmer's Market and select the freshest fruit that day." Ah, amazing. Except it was all frozen melon which tasted moldy.

This is a lovely small hotel on a pretty street off 6th Avenue. The decor is classic art deco -- very handsome. The staff is young and friendly. Comfortable beds in a small but pretty room. We did not eat at the restaurant but we had late night drinks and were not rushed out even when the restaurant was emptying. In the range of NYC hotel prices this one is probably mid-range, more than a chain but so well worth the extra money because of the hotel itself and the lovely, convenient location.

My husband and I celebrated his 40th NYU law school reunion with a overnight stay at the walker hotel. The hotel is lovely, an almost hidden jewel (it's 18 floors tall) on a pretty street a few blocks from Washington square park and NYU. Although we did not sample the restaurant located at the hotel, the menu looks enticing. I am looking forward to staying at the hotel again.

This was our first stay at The Walker but it won't be our last! The location is perfect - loved the neighborhood and central location downtown. Everything was charming - the (small) room, the lobby, the restaurant and mostly, the staff. Thank you!

I have chosen this hotel to stay closer to the conference. The breakfast was not included, but you can have it at the restaurant at the hotel. I recommend to do so - breakfast is good. Also upon arrival they give you two tickets for free drinks which unfortunately I didn't have time to use. Wifi connection is good, but you can't use more than 2 devices. The rooms are not big but cozy and clean

I recently stayed at the Walker Hotel with a friend during our visit to the USA. We had three nights in a twin share room.It was a perfect way to start our holiday after the 20+ hour trip from Sydney. The hotel could only be classified as boutique and is tucked away on a seemingly quiet street, but in the heart of it all! We had a quiet room on the third floor, and no complaints about the room as stylishly decorated, great water pressure in the shower, and comfortable beds (not to mention the robes and slippers). Each evening we were delivered a small plate of complimentary dessert which was a treat!We didn't eat at the hotel, as it is roughly a 10 minute walk to Washington Square Park, or Union Station where there are plenty of eating choices, and around the corner is Murray's Bagels (very popular!).We found the staff very friendly and helpful, particularly on check out when we needed directions to our AirBnB apartment in Brooklyn, and also in regard to storing our bags for the day.We have already been recommending the Walker Hotel to friends travelling to NYC later in the year!

Absolutely loved our stay at the Walker Hotel. We were greeted warmly by every member of the staff. Our room? Gorgeous. Spotlessly clean. Warm and inviting. We dined in the restaurant as well. A wonderful dinner. We loved the little treats left in our room by the staff. The decor is lovely. All in all a wonderful experience.

I have requested an early checkin which was kindly provided. At the front desk there was no delays, and I received qualified and helpful assistance.Room was in perfect shape, the internet connection was good and the hotel has an excellent city location. Totally recommend!

Great location and value. Within walking distance of many of the things we wanted to do.Enjoyed the bar. The staff were helpful and the room though small was comfortable and more than adequate. We'll be back.

We staid recently in the Walker Hotel, it's a small boutique hotel in the perfect location, the staff were friendly and attentive. We ate a couple of times in the hotel and the food was superb. I only have one small down side was we needed a room for 3 people and they are very small.
user_name:
Graham M
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed overnight after visiting family. All staff were extremely helpful. Daniel and Angel helped us arrive and depart. They are part of a very convenient car valet service. After our family visit we visited the restaurant/bar sat by a nice gas fireplace and enjoyed several drinks The morning of departure we went back to the restaurant but had missed the end time for breakfast. We asked the waiter if it was still available, he checked with the chef who then prepared us a wonderful fresh omelette. Cannot recommend this cozy classy hotel any higher. Great experience

My daughter and I just returned from 5 days at the Walker. It was my first visit to this hotel. It will not be my last. Was referred to the Walker by colleagues at NYU with whom I was in town meet and to attend special events. From the moment we hit the door, EVERYONE--from the doorman to the front desk staff to the concierge (Michelle)--were friendly, kind and very, very good at their jobs. Downside--only one: the room was quite small, but its New York so it has now impact on my five star rating. They went the proverbial extra mile on everything--from bar service to the comfortable lobby alcoves to even replacing, at their expense, a pair of my daughter's running pants that went missing after our first night. If you want to be surprised with consistency and professionalism, stay at a hotel with an excellent location, too--stay at the Walker.

Our stay at the Walker hotel was pleasant and charming. The Walker hotel is a well disguised gem in the heart of Greenwich village. The great thing about the location of the hotel is its proximity to 5th Avenue, both the East and West village as well as Union square. One great aspect of the hotel is that it does not look like a hotel and we loved how inconspicuous it was.We found the rooms to be comfortable and cosy. The sizing of which matches the New York norm of being a little on the small side. We found that the rooms had terrible lighting. We struggled with the lack of light in our room. Other than the lighting the room was quaint and comfortable.In regards to the service my mother and I had two entirely different experiences. I found the service to be young, jovial and welcoming. The hotel staff are young and interactive and showed a genuine interest in my experience. I did however find that the door men were never at the door. This was highly frustrating as I had to hail my own taxis or go down to reception ask them to call a door man for me.My mother on the other hand felt that the hotel staff were dismissive of her. When we walked in together the reception always greeted me but never my mother. I was always asked about my excursions but again my mother was ignored. We both found this to be unprofessional especially since it was my mother who was paying for our stay. Ultimately my mother felt that the hotel staff were welcoming of young patrons and that she was not identified with as an older, more established woman and this ultimately took away from the personal experience of her stay.The last comment I have to make is in regard to housekeeping. Our room was not vacuumed once during our stay and it was obvious that our bathroom floor was not mopped or cleaned. Furthermore our toiletries were never replaced which was an irritation.Overall the stay was good. We also tried the restaurant at the hotel which we throughly enjoyed. Ultimately New York has so many wonderful hotels on offer and we have mixed feelings on whether we would stay at the Walker again or try somewhere else.

Stayed with my family for a week over Easter. Really liked this hotel. Yes, the rooms are small and the restaurant is a bit overpriced, but we found the place to be cosy with very friendly staff. Best of all is the location. A short walk from Greenwich village, Washington Square, Chelsea, the high line, West village, Union Square . . . Loved every minute

Such a fun, welcoming hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village. Every staff member I interacted with treated me like I was a special guest. Warm inviting atmosphere. Very comfortable beds. Well appointed. It's small so you don't feel overwhelmed. I will definitely visit again when in New York City.

We booked the highest category room the hotel had, but found the rooms to be tiny, even by New York standards. Another issue that came up was cleaning. All the days of our visit we left the room at around 8am and would be back by 12-1pm to find the room not yet cleaned. When mentioning that to the hotel staff, we were told we probably left the "don't disturb" sign on the door, which was obviously not the case. The biggest advantage to this hotel is the location, other than that, we were very underwhelmed.

Wonderful stay; at first was disappointed in size of room, bed, etc, but after staying there, totally comfortable and appreciated the quality of the room, bed, linens, shower, bathroom supplies (but would like up graded t-p). Would also like a light weight blanket. LOVED breakfast. Don't ever take the avocado toast with eggs off the menu! Loved also the waiter who warmed my cream for my coffee!

Rooms are really small ,so are the beds (1,60) and you better beware of extras : our waiter asked if we wanted our scrambled eggs with bacon - the eggs are in the menu but the bacon is extra ! also ,our room was not well cleaned unfortunate when you pay 470$ a day .

Be prepared. The rooms are small. BUT they are also lovely! Very clean, bright & up to date. Plenty of room for one person. If you get a little claustrophobic, there's lots of comfy gathering space in the lobby. The staff is the nicest I've experienced in NYC & the location was awesome. Our breakfast was top notch! Great stay--I'll be back.

The Walker Hotel has a fantastic location in Greenwich Village. Our room (1503) had a fantastic view south of the Freedom Tower and lower Manhattan. The bed was very comfortable. The room was very quiet even when we opened the window.

This is a great place in a great location. Nancy, one of he managers, was SOOOOO helpful with both our reservation and once we got to the property. Beautiful rooms and public space. Very nice restaurant. We'd definitely stay here again!

Stayed here for nine nights on a recent business trip to NYC. Hotel has a very 1940's vibe with art deco decor in the guest rooms. My room was on the 11th floor and at the front of the building. Since the Walker is in a residential area I found it to be quiet - away from the sirens and noise of the busier streets. My room was small but since it was only me, it was more than adequate. Two people might have found it to be a little 'cozy' though. The Hotel was very clean and everyone was more than friendly and helpful. They provide free bottles of water daily and treats (cream puffs, macaroons, brownies, etc.) at turn down, which is a nice touch. It is in a great location - walking distance from just about everything you would want. Would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to friends.

We recently spent 8 days there on our honeymoon and found this a great hotel to stay in. Location is fantastic - 2 mins to the 1, 2 or 3 subway (going up the west side of Manhattan), 2 mins to the 4, 5, 6 subway (going up the east side) - and being in NY, you want save yourself some walking time! The hotel is the smartest in the street with a great deco vibe. The staff were efficient and friendly - we got up-graded to the top floor with a view over downtown and Freedom Towner once we told them it was our honeymoon, plus they had champagne and a chocolate dessert waiting for us - much appreciated touches. Don't know what the traffic noise would be like lower floors, but only sirens penetrated to the 18th. The room is smallish (I think to be expected in NY) but nicely furnished and the bed was VERY comfortable. Only con was controlling the temperature in the room (a bit beyond me) which meant we over-heated a number of times; plus the pelmet stops the windows opening more than 10cm (to stop people throwing themselves out?!) so even getting a breeze was difficult. The foyer is small and nicely furnished and the restaurant is expensive but served one of the better breakfasts we had in NY. Overall, we recommend a stay.
user_name:
PeteNettell
Blue Mountains National Park, Australia

review_body: This hotel is located in Greenwich Village. It is around a $50 Uber ride from Laguardia airport. I made the mistake of using the hotel service. The hotel service charged $71. I learned from it and took Uber back to Laguardia for $50. The hotel car service that they use is not very good. It took their pick up service over an hour to pick me up from Laguardia. I stupidly used them again to go to Fordham U. At first the driver took us to the Fordham in Manhattan. The hotel has a good breakfast. Order the pancakes. We stayed in room 1701. It was quiet except when other guests decided to chat loudly while waiting for the elevator.

The Walker is guest focused and detail oriented. Their overall decor is so spectacular and inviting. Their staff is extraordinarily accommodating. From the doors being opened for you, to the treats brought each night, I felt not only welcome, but special. Lastly, you really can't beat the location. Bravo, Walker Hotel.
user_name:
mcr03170
New York City, New York

review_body: My son and I stayed recently at the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village and enjoyed it immensely. The entire property, from the lobby and other common areas to our room, was impeccably clean, and the vibe was welcoming and comfortable from the first moment at the top of the stairs entering the lobby. Our room also had the extra benefit of a great view south toward Lower Manhattan/World Trade Center area. The hotel is located in an attractive, quiet street in the heart of Greenwich Village, close to The New School and other nearby landmarks and destinations. I would also recommend two great places to eat just steps away: Murray's Bagels around the corner, and Da Andrea restaurant a half-block to the east.

We spent 5 nights at the hotel as a special trip to New York to celebrate my daughters birthday. All the staff made us very welcome with special treats for all of us as well as the Birthday girl.The staff were charming and helpful. The Art Deco hotel was lovely with a bar and restaurant on site .Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel was ideally situated within walking distance of many of the great sites while being in a residential area with great charm . I would really recommend it .

We stayed at the Walker Hotel for two nights and our experience at this lovely art-deco style boutique hotel was delightful. The staff was attentive and kind and brought delicious pastries to our room as a special treat to welcome us and our 14 year old. They also supplied umbrellas and great neighborhood restaurant tips! The only downside for us was that our hotel room was on the small side, which was not a surprise for a NYC hotel, but hard with three people in two double beds with little room to walk. Despite its size the room was comfortable and well equipped and we had a gorgeous view from our 17th story window. The restaurant in the hotel, Society Cafe, offers a nice menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and an "all-day menu", with many interesting choices for vegetarians.

For our first trip to New York we couldn't have picked a better location. The hotel is situated within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions with the benefits of great restaurants in Greenwich close by. On entering the hotel we felt instantly at home and appreciated the warm fire in reception. The staff on reception were fantastic throughout and couldn't do enough to help us. Our room was small but you expect this in NYC, it was nicely furnished and very clean and with a very good bathroom. We will absolutely be coming back to stay here on our next visit to NYC.

I stayed at The Walker last year when it was called The Jade and my experience then was perfect. However, this year it was completely different. I had to change rooms 2 times because of a mold smell. The first night my room had no heat and when I called I was told it was too late to do anything, I was not even offered another room. I just feel this hotel is not paying enough attention to little details as they should. I did not feel the bathrooms were cleaned properly either. I know they are opening another hotel soon, also called The Walker on Walker Street and maybe they are spending too much time there.
user_name:
Curlygirl1955
New York City, New York

review_body: Truly a remarkable hotel with great ambience, welcoming to all. Conveniently located, outstanding service by staff, clean, and very quiet. Will definitely stay here again when in NYC. Lovely restaurant to boot. You won't be disappointed!

I've stayed at this hotel twice in the past month, and both times have found it to be ideal for my needs. The lobby, restaurant, and rooms are all attractively decorated. The level of service is friendly, efficient, and prompt. The room was comfortable, with a number of nice pluses such as complimentary bottled water, free wifi that works well, nice robes and slippers, nice bathroom amenities, and turn-down service with a complimentary sweet. The location is great as well - within a block or two of two subway lines, around the corner from a great bagel place, and in an attractive and safe part of town. I'm glad I found this hotel, and I will definitely be going back.

Don't hesitate to book here! I'm telling you! I've stayed at several hotels in the city in this price range. The Walker has a warm lobby to come home to after a cold snowy day, cozy beds, kind staff, perfect location, and quiet rooms! Our room was across from the elevator on the 12th floor, but we never heard a peep!There is a quaint gourmet Italian restaurant across the street that I recommend -and other nearby shopping, drug stores and restaurants!I will definitely return!!!Just a note: no in-room fridge or coffee maker

My 1st stay won't be my last. The hotel was stylish and had everything I needed. Decor was amazing- very cozy. The best part was the incredibly friendly, helpful staff. Every person I had contact with was welcoming. Air and Nancy did an exceptional job.

Well, we had to vacate our Apartment due to refinishing our floors at home and decided to stay in the Neighborhood. I'm pleased to report that the Walker Hotel has done "Boutique Hotel" pretty well! The room, although small, has a very comfortable bed and a wonderful, full on water pressure Two person Shower. We sprung for the balcony and it's almost as big as the room, nice place to have an after work cocktail. And speaking of cocktails, the bar is very nice with a full bar and good wine selection. All of this comes at a price.... It is New York City after all. But all in all there are way more expensive places to hang your hat. We got a complimentary breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good. We are having dinner there tonight will let you know in subsequent review how it was!All in all a very successful staycation!!
user_name:
RIBBRO
New York City, New York

review_body: My friend and I stayed at the Walker Hotel for the New York half marathon last weekend. The hotel is a lovely art deco hotel, feels small and homely, but clean and comfortable. The staff were really friendly and attentive, both during our stay and after we had left, when some of our packages had not arrived, they made several trips to fedex to send them on to us.Nothing seemed too much, and all staff from Bellman to housekeeping were polite and friendly. The location is great, and food at the restaurant delicious. I gave it a 4 star because the room was a little small ( although I know this is new york) and it would have been nice to have had a coffee machine in the room, but this is a minor point. The complimentary waters were very welcome and the turn down service chocolates delicious!I would definitely recommend this hotel.

This beautiful boutique hotel in a quiet area in Greenwich village was a great find! The rooms were comfortable and clean with an upscale bathroom boasting luxury towels and excellent water pressure. I had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and was greeted with friendly and helpful wait staff that made sure my special dietary needs were met. The food was delicious and served expediently. Highly recommended.

The timeless Art Deco style made me feel like I was back in time.... I can't say enough about the staff, super friendly, extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Their restaurant The Society Cafe is a must try during your stay. I can't wait to come back and get spoiled all over again. Thanks Walker Hotel for a fabulous stay!!!

Service professionalism, cordiality, efficiency and excellent location is what we received at this hotelHaving booked the room directly with the hotel, I confess that we received a very good deal and were offered a great variety of alternatives and suggestions based on our stay and budget.Before arriving at the hotel, we did some shopping on Amazon.com and after check-in, that same first day of stay were already all the boxes waiting for us in the room. None of them was missing.The staff at the front desk who took care of us to check in as well as any concerns we had was extremely cordial with us, to the point of assisting us even when we had to modify some of the reservation, always supporting us and providing us with convenient solutions. Particularly Miss Natalia made us feel at home, and so did Adrianne and Ari every time we asked them for support in the Front Desk, and Jorge in the breakfast area.The hotel has a design and class that deserve to stand out. And to this must be added the professionalism of all the hotel staff.The rooms although not very spacious -convenient this is not a feature of hotels in Manhattan- turns out to be very comfortable and organized to have an excellent stay. The cleanliness and hygiene is remarkable.The location of the hotel is excellent for people like us who like to walk to neighborhoods like SoHo, NoLiTa, Meat Packing, Flatiron and 5th Avenue. Those looking to go shopping will find the best known brands a few blocks from the hotel.Having visited the town about twenty times, we are with my lady practically certain that the Walker Greenwich Village Hotel will be our number one choice in the future.

My fiancé and I stayed in the Walker Hotel to celebrate our engagement and we definitely made the right choice when it came to choosing this hotel for our first visit to New York. The hotel has a lovely Art Deco style interior and was warm & inviting from the bitter cold temperature outside. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Particularly Nancy on the front desk who recommended a lovely Italian restaurant for us to eat at. She also rang ahead, booked the table for us & also arranged for our dessert to be paid by the hotel which was a lovely surprise! The hotel is located in a really nice part of Greenwich village with only a short walk to everything you could need. I would highly recommend it and would love to stay here again in future!

We stayed 3 nights and would definitely stay at the Walker again. We stayed in a Waverly Queen room on 17th floor which was a nice size, well appointed and maintained and had a fabulous view. The staff was excellent-very friendly and helpful. The lobby is cozy with a fireplace and some nice sitting areas and restaurant/bar was a great place to have drinks or breakfast. Location is perfect for Village, Chelsea, Soho, Flatiron, etc. We were with 3 other couples and all enjoyed our stay there.

People like hotels for alot of different reasons. For me, it's all about the food. Yes, the beds were super comfy. Yep, friendly service and large rooms with a view. But for me? I have some challenging food allergies (onion, garlic) and Chris Zabita, the executive chef, bent over backwards to make sure I had a great meal every single time. This kind of extreme service is sometimes lacking in NYC, where you just have to grin (grit?) and bear with it... but not here. The manager Linda is amazing. So are the wait staff, the desk staff .. even the cleaning staff was friendly and helpful.Sound too good to be true? Well, it's not. Try it - you'll love them!

We had a great stay at the Walker Hotel! Location is perfect a very short walk to the subway, easy access to all subway lines.( buy an unlimited 7 day pass to make the most of your stay)( lines F & M take you to the nearest stop other trains are express and don't stop at 14 th street station). The room was beautiful and very clean as you'd expect. The staff are very friendly and so helpful ( a porter named Angel, so nice and couldn't be more helpful). All the staff we encountered were polite , friendly and always smiling. We would highly recommend this hotel! We stayed on the 16 th floor and the view of the city was worth it!!

This was our first stay at the Walker Hotel and won't be our last. The location could not be better; all of Greenwich Village is spread out around you and most sites are a 10 minute walk or less. The hotel is on a quiet side street, right next to the New School University. Streets were safe and clean. The Walker Hotel itself was a delight; nicely decorated with a sunken lobby w/fireplace and an extremely classy bar and restaurant just a few steps down the hall. Breakfast was included with our room and it was superb--fresh-pressed juices such as carrot/orange/ginger...amazing. THe staff we interacted with including William, Josh, Adrianne and Brian went out of their way to be helpful but were also very professional and non-intrusive. We felt very comfortable with them. This is a romantic hideaway, mid-range in price but an excellent value. Not particularly a good site for families with small children, kind of an "place for grown-ups" but otherwise would recommend this hotel without reservations.

The hotel is beautiful and the restaurant excellent. It has the kind of neighborhood feel you are looking for in Greenwich Village. The lobby is charming with a fireplace and overstuffed furniture. It is an easy nine block walk to Washington Square, so it is a great place to stay if visiting NYU. You are right next to the Parson's school. You are 1 block from the 123 subway station on 14th making it a snap to get to Times Square. Union Square is only 3 blocks away. Lots of restaurants all around. The staff is fantastic and willing to go out of their way to make it a great stay. A special shout out to Mike and his crew. Definitely plan to come back

A charming hotel. Excellent staff and reception. The room was rather small for two people. Delightful lobby area. Restauant service a little slow. However, it was most enjoyable being at the Walker.Thank you.

Cute hotel in the middle of Greenwich Village. Lovely decor. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent food! Everything was so fresh and tasty. Walking distance to Union Square and Washington Square Park. We can't wait to stay again!

Spent a lovely evening at the Walker hotel. Located on my favorite block in NYC. The staff was gracious. The room while small was perfectly outfitted and the breakfast while eclectic was wonderful. I can't wait to stay there again.

Just spent an enjoyable week at the Walker Hotel in Greenwich Village, Manhattan. The rooms are clean and well-appointed, the staff particularly friendly and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. Special mention to Josh on reception who whenever we had a question always came up with the answer in double quick time. Irvin, William, Nancy and Briant were also first class. The hotel is really conveniently located for the Village, Midtown and Downtown, nowhere is too far away, and subway stations nearby. But also great was the ambience, very relaxed and friendly - and the food in the restaurant and bar was also very good. We particularly enjoyed coming back after an evening out and having a nightcap - the piped music in the bar is sensationally good soul and r and b. All in all a great stay, reasonably priced, would definitely recommend.

Everything about our stay at The Walker was wonderful! My husband and I got married this past weekend, and we decided rather than stay in my parents' UWS apartment we'd splurge and get a nice hotel room as a little sanctuary away from the family. I am SO glad we chose The Walker!Even before we arrived, we felt the care and attention from every member of staff. I called to make the booking, and I was immediately told that the hotel would do everything they could to make our stay as special as possible. When we arrived, we were given breakfast and drink vouchers, they made sure to give us a room with a gorgeous view of the southern tip of Manhattan, and as we were unpacking room service came up with a bottle of prosecco and a little fruit salad. Later that afternoon they brought up some cake as well. The next evening, after our tiny wedding in Central Park, we arrived back at the room to find they'd made up the bed specially and left us two delicious pieces of chocolate fudge cake.Every member of staff we spoke to was helpful, friendly, and clearly so delighted to speak to guests. We are absolutely going to get the train back down to The Walker for our 1st anniversary because we know they'll make the effort to make it as special as this weekend was.Thank you so much for making this the best possible weekend!!

We loved the Walker Greenwich. Some Pluses: Great location, beautiful facility, large towels, robes, turndown service, NYTimes, restaurant on site, workout facility, bottled water, comfortable bed and bedding. Negatives: cell service is not great and sometimes non-existent in hotel (they should invest in a booster for service); coffee (you have to purchase and it's not cheap. Even if they gave a discount -- it would help). We will be back I'm sure.

Fantastic deco design, with well designed rooms and helpful staff. Bar pleasant to relax at with a cocktail or beer, and restaurant served good food although didn't get particularly busy whilst we were there. Great location in Greenwich Village with plenty of bars & restaurants on the doorstep. A really enjoyable 5 night stay, would return.

The design and quality of this hotel is superb. The rooms are beautifully decorated and feel very luxurious.Staff are helpful and attentive.The rooms are reasonably well equipped, but for this kind of hotel it is missing a few things (no shoe shine or cotton buds for example).Also, the two things that are stopping this from getting five stars are (1) the noise (not from outside, but from other rooms, doors slamming etc..) and (2) the showers - they are dreadful - there's a single fixed shower head that has minimal adjustment. Not super high pressure either.Service at breakfast could have been better, but the food was generally good.Wifi was hit and miss on my work PC, but worked fine on my phone.Definitely recommend, despite the complaints.

We spent 5 nights here, and the fire lit lib was so warm and welcoming in sub zero temperatures. This is a hotel of charm and character, with great Art Deco decor. But the best thing was the friendly and attentive staff are its best asset, ready to help but not in your face. We thought the price for our room was very good value, but next time I would go for a higher floor (we were in 6th) as it was quite dark, even facing on to the street. There are good coffee shops and restaurants near by. We had dinner in the hotel and it was good, but a little pricey.

I come to this hotel once a week for work and it is always a wonderful experience. Cleanliness is my biggest thing with hotels and everyone here truly takes care of where they work. I am always greeted with kind words. My favorite Saratoga water is in the room. The location is perfect!!! Easy access to subways and the east and west side. The BEST thing is at turn down service they leave a few treats (macaroons for example) on the night stand! The perfect way to end the day! And my girl Ari always takes good care of me!

i booked four rooms for a wedding party that was complicated by weather conditions, the normal changes to be marrieds go through and orchestrating a lot of people with different (but compatible) rhythms. the reservation-guest relations staff couldn't have been more friendly, helpful and downright pleasant. kudos to nancy, irvin and ari for a job well done.
user_name:
ijt-nyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I have never written an online review for a hotel, but the experience I had at the Walker Hotel was so amazing, I felt compelled to not only compliment the staff personally, but to let everyone else know what an amazing place this is. After an incredibly long journey into the city (including flight delays), I was expecting the typical NYC Hotel impersonal check-in process. Instead, I was welcomed by 3 different people within a few minutes, each asking if there was anything they could do to make my stay more enjoyable. I was also greeting we extra amenities in my room, including a cold beer (which somehow the Walker team must have known I needed!) along with a handwritten note welcoming me to the hotel. In the next couple of days, that attention remained (an example: I needed shaving cream, and after calling down to the front desk I had it in my hand within 2 minutes .. no kidding). I especially want to recognize the outstanding service at the front desk (Josh and Natalia .. thank you for your professionalism + humanity!). I have found my new "go-to" hotel in NYC.

Linger here. Tucked into a strategic location in the Village you find this boutique hotel with a great many amenities to make you return, again and again. I discovered The Walker last fall when I flew in to attend a dinner at The James Beard House and returned recently to repeat the same hospitable experience. While it could be very easy to fall in love with this location for its stately appearance, comfortable lobby and delightfully stationed rooms, but it's really about the people at this property. Honestly, I'll request a floor just to get the same houseman (Tashi) who took every opportunity to make sure I smiled and was happy with my room. The front desk staff are your greatest resources in negotiating your activities, from the simplest desire to linger in the lobby or to aid your efforts in planning your day (Irvin and Natalia were gracious hosts). The bellman is your man, no matter who is on duty, but I'm going to give Briant a shout for taking the time to get to know me and assure me I'd get where I needed to be. The management and staff at this hotel from the front of the house to the back make the difference here. Bottom line, they love what they do. The biggest change since I was last at this property was the addition of the restaurant, Society Cafe. Can I just say "THANK YOU" to the decision maker on this shift in the infrastructure of the hotel. Delicious. Simple food made exquisitely. A wonderful attribute to include with the property and perfect for the guest as well as an interloper. Chef Zabita has appointed an delicious menu of food and beverage to accommodate any appetite. The lobby. Have to love a lobby intentionally designed for you to linger. One can either sit and read in front of the fire place or tuck oneself away in a corner with a laptop or simply to position oneself to people watch an entire afternoon away.Stay here once and you'll return.

We stayed here for 10 nights for a family holiday in New York. I can't fault this hotel on anything; everything from the minute arrived, decor of rooms, food in the restaurant and drinks in the bar was amazing. The hotel is ideally located close to Greenwich Village and easily accessible for shops, restaurants and bars. The restaurant and bar on site serves very high quality food and drinks. The rooms are small but very well kitted out.For my next trip to New York I will definitely returning here!!

Stayed here for 4 nights and had the best experience. All the staff was personable and friendly, from the front of the house to the cleaning crew to the restaurant staff. A+ service all the way. Hidden gem of a bar with great drinks!Room service was impeccable. Heavy blinds to keep out sunlight when you want to snooze a little longer in the morning. Gym downstairs when you want to squeeze in a workout. I'll be coming back, thanks again!

You'll think you are getting into 1930 building, but it is only 4 years oldso cozy and even small room has almost every thing, if you need coffee maker, they can provide for you.Dinning at hotel is must!! Young chef will make great dishes with local ingredients.
user_name:
Takami Y
New York City, New York

review_body: The Walker Hotel is in a perfect location to enjoy downtown. The rooms are small, but comfortable. The on premise restaurant is wonderful. The hotel vibe is very cool.
