A special shout out to Joshua at the front desk. When I called to make our reservations I spoke with Joshua and discovered he was from Bethlehem, Pa, where my husband and I live! The Walker is very lucky to have him as an employee. He took excellent care of us and was professional and personable. We will be back. THANK YOU JOSHUA.

I could not be happier with our stay at this fine hotel. The staff were unfailingly helpful and polite. William, who was working as concierge our first night, helped us get tickets to The Blue Note since he's knowledgeable about the jazz scene. Our room was clean and comfortable and at 5:00pm every night, the staff knocked on our door with small desserts to get us ready for our evening.

Decided to treat my wife to a weekend in Manhattan again for the new year. The Walker is a beautiful hotel in central Greenwich Village. It is a small boutique hotel to be sure and rather expensive. The staff are all very pleasant although at times rather absent minded (read on). I reserved the Walker Terrace and when we were shown to our room on the 18th floor we were disappointed. The room was TINY. I have stayed at many upscale hotels in Manhattan but this was ridiculous for the price. The bed is definitely not a queen and less than 18" from the floor. The "terrace" was about two feet deep and the width of the room, approximately 15-20'.I called the front desk and Irving (front desk) was very accommodating. He explained the 17th floor is larger (it turns out about 5' deeper and a full patio with a table and chairs, which is a big difference!) He graciously told us he would move us and to leave the bags in the room and he would have them moved to the new room. We went to have lunch while they cleaned the new room. Upon return the 17th floor room was ready but the bags were beside the front desk even though they assured us they would be moved for us. Instead of waiting, we took the bags up ourselves as they are on wheels. Not a big deal but in the big picture a little annoying.The hotel and rooms are immaculate and house keeping is above par. Beautiful bathroom with a DEEP soaking tub. So big I wanted to swim laps... :-) It is an Art Deco motif and I think very beautifully decorated. You feel like you have transported back to 1925. VERY little space for clothes, a small free standing wardrobe closet is all.The lobby is small but very cozy and a nice place to sit, read the paper and have a cup of coffee. The restaurant is nice with good food but, I am sad to say, incompetent wait staff. We got the couples weekend with breakfast both mornings. The first morning my wife specifically asked for cheddar cheese on her eggs and not only did the waitress forget the cheese and have to bring another serving, she charged for both breakfasts while we were pre-paid. I am the moron that often fails to check the bill but this was hard to miss! The second morning my wife again asked for cheddar cheese and even reminded the waiter a second time and he STILL forgot the cheese. This is not a Waffle House in backwoods Georgia, it is an upscale hotel in Manhattan. I do not like to make a scene and we politely asked for the eggs with cheese and the waiter was appropriately contrite that he had forgotten. The manager (I assume) brought the breakfast Part Deux to the table with apologies. She knew we were leaving and wanted to offer us another free breakfast but gave us two drink vouchers to try and make up for it. The fact she tried is what counted here as were leaving.Over all the hotel staff try to make it right but I believe there is a maturity issue with some of the staff that belies a training issue. I might stay again but would make sure to get he 17th floor and check the wait staff. :-)

Rooms aren't huge but very quiet and comfortable. Great service & nice restaurant and bar in it. Has a work out facility. Shower is amazing. Nice location and well appointed for price. Easy walk to many restaurants.

Very welcoming fireplace and lobby to have a quiet coffee with friends and charming ambience. Rooms are the usual tight squeeze in Manhattan but service was friendly and helpful at all times and breakfast was delicious. It was a good choice as a place to spend quality with friends in this special part of New York city.

If you like cozy, charming with all the elegance of a small hotel, this is the spot. Staff could not have been more gracious. Replete with out of the way seating spots and fireplace, from Doorman to restaurant, what a find!!

I really liked my stay at this hotel. My expectations were not high because it was a late and last minute booking but the place is so conveniently located with the subway a minute or so away, and other shops and amenities very close by. Initially i was put off by an ugly rug in the middle of the foyer, but in fact the decor was very nice and the room was not only very spacious and clean - the bed is extremely comfortable and I slept better than usual! The place has charming decor - with old fashioned/stylish vibe which makes it feel more like a home than a city central hotel, so it is quite appealing and different from standard modern decor in many NYC hotels. Every day they leave a little free snack in the room. Note that what they call a mini bar , is in fact just snacks and rinks on a tray and there is no fridge. I had several visitors and they all said its a great place. The best things about the hotel are: 1) the restaurant - the food was absolutely delicious, I ate there several times and cannot recommend it highly enough. The restaurant itself is cosy with an open fireplace and skylight. 2) the staff -they are all wonderful and go out of their way to help you at all times, like they would a good friend. There are two African waiters who are absolute gentlemen and so friendly, but I found ALL of the staff very helpful with anything I needed, and nothing seemed to be too much trouble.  I made a costly mistake with my booking as I booked an extra night by mistake, and though i was not entitled to a refund because i realized very late- the hotel honored me with one and took the trouble to contact the booking agent to keep them informed. My 8 night stay was at a very good price. Though it has to be said it was off -peak. I will try this place, next time I'm in NYC as I have stayed at 5or 6 hotels in NYC and this is by far the best in terms of value for money and service.

Booking was easy online and Mike at the hotel was very helpful in arranging a car to meet us at the airport with our 7x suitcases (moving to the US for one year)! The room was small but lovely, very comfortable with two full double beds for myself and my daughter and a great walk in shower in the bathroom. We chose the option with Breakfast included but were a little disappointed with the meagre offering for breakfast. You get one hot drink, one juice (but not plain orange juice for example, must be a fresh press) and a choice of one 'meal'. I chose avocado toast and had one small piece of multi grain with a few thin slices of avocado perched on top, a few re-heated roast potatoes and a few leaves of salad. No pastries, refills of hot drinks (the teapot literally only delivers one cup) or even any butter, spreads, jams or jellies. At $25 face value it seems very over-priced for what is provided, even given New York prices. It was a pity to have that experience both mornings because everything else was charming and couldn't be faulted.

Stayed for 2 nights with 2 adult children. Charming hotel, so much character & friendly staff. The best thing was a great nights sleep, it was quiet! Rooms are small as others have said but it's NY so that's to be expected. Bathrooms are very nice, a reasonable size. Everywhere was very clean, good quality bedding, towels & robes. Water in room and evening chocolates very nice touch. Really liked the bar, although $30 for a round of two drinks: a vodka and tonic and a gin and tonic meant you wouldn't want to stay there too long! Overall loved the hotel and would definitely recommend and return!

Thats it in Greenwich Village. Convenient, close to restaurants and Washington Square. We booked on short notice a few days before the New Year after reading TripAdvisor reviews. This was a quiet place but not on a busy thoroughfare. The lobby was inviting and multiple seating areas for groups of people. Front desk very prompt and ready to help. Room rate was acceptable Many breakfast places close by, Murray Bagel around the corner. The Grey Dog was a 0.5 miles having a great menu, hip place and awesome coffee. Evening we headed to Ribalta pizza, Scarpetta and Otto all within walking distance. The restaurant at the hotel was close to empty (early in the evening) and I couldn't read the menu without a flash light and pricy. The room, tiny, but that is New York, Frette sheets with robe and slippers (how cool is that) toiletries (high quality) big TV and FREE water!! Plenty of NYT newspapers in the lobby so you could take one and not feel guilty. Coffee in the restaurant ($4 cup) was average in taste. The temperature in the room was hard to adjust but the desk made every effort to address this issue. I would recommend this hotel because location, service and comfort. They will improve the restaurant experience over time but right now it is too expensive and hard to read the menu. It is convenient to the Village and the lobby has so many sofas, chairs, tables and nooks to enjoy. Also a small library. It is right around the corner from Parsons so if you are looking for a smaller hotel with great amenities this is it.

We stayed at this hotel for 15 nights over Christmas and New Year. The hotel is well located in a quiet street and great for exploring the streets of Greenwich Village and the West village too. The room we had was cosy, warm, comfy and clean. The front desk staff for extremely aloof and completely uninterested in us. On occasions they were quite unhelpful. They certainly didn't bother with warm wishes for Christmas or New year! Also the room could benefit from better designed storage space, which was practically nil for two people for 2 weeks.We have visited NYC many times and feel we could have chosen better accommodation for a long stay.When we checked out they didn't even ask whether all had been satisfactory, let alone whether we'd enjoyed the stay! It was very impersonal for a small hotel.We had the worst and most expensive coffee from the hotel restaurant

Coming from the midwest, I was very pleased to have chosen the Walker Hotel. The room was very small but totally adequate for a single woman. Bed was great, linens luxurious, and very nice bathroom amenities. After requesting a fan, the room was more comfortable. I do like to sleep in a cool room. Windows opened very slightly and did not have good circulation; a fan alleviated the situation. Ian, one of the bartenders, was hilarious and also very good at his job! Unfortunately, I did not have the opportunity to try the restaurant, but the decor and beautiful and cozy. My son recently moved to the area and this will be by home base for every visit; the location is dynamite and the front desk personnel were extremely accommodating.

First time for us staying at this hotel and we loved it. Very friendly staff, great atmosphere, liked the bar and all in all a great feel to the place. We are biased because we love Greenwich Village but it's so much better than the huge hotels in mid town. Rooms small obviously but not tiny and great bathrooms.

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel recently, and I can say that it is a great find in Greenwich Village. My room was clean, and nicely decorated in an art deco style. It is conveniently located to art galleries, jazz clubs, bookstores, and the service was exceptional. Special thank you to Sarah, concierge department, who made great recommendations for dinner, and Natalia who was wonderful at the front desk in finding me the perfect room for my needs, and always willing to point me in the right direction during my stay. I will definitely return!!!

An older hotel which has been marvelously updated. Check in was smooth, room (1507) was typical NYC size but fabulously done in Art Deco style. Good bathroom. Great comfortable bed and awesome view of Empire State bldg.The only disappointment was the bar/restaurant. I overheard a manager say they haven't had a hard re-open yet and that's what it felt like. Service in the late afternoon was slow even tho it was almost empty. Very cool drink menu. Enjoyed a margarita w grapefruit juice. Had the green salad w radishes and was tasty. Late night service better. Check out is at 11 and by 11:20 the front desk is calling your room.When I left for the airport and was about to get an Uber, the bell capt said they had a town car waiting that was only $55 including tolls, taxes and tip. I took it as suggested but it didn't include a tip. I added a tip so not quite the bargain I thought it wd be.

Booked through hotels.com - apparently for 2 doubles, so the staff was nice enough to move us from a room with two beds to one queen. We were much more comfortable there and appreciated the quick, seamless move. Room was comfortably large, for anywhere, NYC notwithstanding. Bathroom amenities were great and our room had a fabulous terrace that would be great in warmer weather. The restaurant onsite, Society Cafe, is recently renovated - both the facility and the menu. The bar area, doing all kinds of fun, crafty cocktails is separated from the dining room by a low wall and high plants. Just enough to keep the two spaces separate. The dining room is cozy and contemporary, with enough going on to absorb the sounds from other conversations. Nothing worse than dining in NYC and feeling like you can hear the conversations across the room. Not here. The food is bonkers. The menu is made up of small Firsts, pasta-focused Seconds and entree- style Thirds. Try anything and everything. The Hamachi, Burrata, Foie Gras PB&J were standouts. And if gnocchi is on offer, GET IT. You won't be disappointed. Chef has created a farm to table menu that is on another level. Even the cocktail menu features inventive martinis, and wrists on classics, frequently prepared with handmade mixers and local spirits. The wine menu features (good, if not great) NY wines in additon to the Californian and French wines one would expect. This is definitely an occasion-worthy experience, but I would also make a point to stop into the restaurant the next time I'm in the city, occasion or not.

We spent 6 nights at the Greewich Hotel and we have been very disappointed for multiple reasons:1. On december 31st, I left my necklace on the desk in our room as well as the second door key that we had. We spent all the day out and we came back at night the necklace and the second were gone. Instead, we found on the desk another necklace that did not belong to me.We informed the reception about what happenened and left the necklace we found, their response after two days has been, we have no evicence of what really happened and you have to take the responsibility of what happened. As a "courtesy" if we can say, the hotel offered the return to the airport and one dinner that we had in their restaurant... In any case, this does not compensate the loss of the necklace. The decision taken by the hotel is not commercial at all and legally disputable. 2. We did not find the hotel staff devoted and friendly in spite of what some comments can say. Not professional.3. The rooms very small, dark and not well equiped to put luggage and stuff. Our room was also very badly sound-conditioned.In positive points, the hotel in ideally located and the rooms are actually very clean.In the end, in our view the hotel is over estimated and too expensive for the premises and service you get in return.We do not recommend this hotel.

We booked on short notice, just a few days after Christmas after reading TripAdvisor reviews. We wanted to stay in the Village and enjoy the many restaurants surrounding this hotel. Also wanted a quieter place that was close to Washington Square but not in a busy thoroughfare. There were breakfast places close by, Murray Bagel just around the corner. The Grey Dog was a few blocks away (0.5 miles ) which was a great menu, hip place and had great coffee. We tried the Restaurant at the hotel, but it was empty, expensive and hard to see the menu without a flashlight. We headed out to a pizza place one night- Ribalta, and Scarpetta another night. Back to the hotel, the front desk - helpful and friendly getting us a quick ride to the airport and tending to our heating problem in our room. It was hard to adjust the thermostat due to the warm weather in New York. Opening the window and the door to the room was somewhat helpful, but the staff were prompt in addressing the heat. The bed-super comfy, sheets- Frette (awesome) toiletries (high quality ) and robe and slippers also provided. How great is that? Plenty of NYT newspapers in the lobby and free water in the room. Now that is unheard of in most NYC hotels. The coffee in the restaurant ($4 a cup was average) I would recommend this hotel because of the comfort of the rooms, although small, but every NYC room is small unless you live in Trump Towers. Who stays long in a hotel room? It has a great location, amenities, and lobby that accommodates many groups of people providing a couple of sofas, chairs, tables and nooks to hang out. I feel they will improve the restaurant experience over time because it is an asset to have the convenience of an in-house place to eat. Maybe a menu with some medium priced items, pizza, burger, sandwiches, soup, nothing fancy just some comfort food to help those who want to stay in for the night but have a satisfying meal without breaking the bank. I know this place can do it.

Ended up here on last minute trip over Christmas-new years week. Overall good stay. Very friendly helpful staff. Small but well appointed room. Great bath. Complimentary water and great toiletries. Today was rainy and we were delighted to find complementary umbrellas at the front door. We were going to try their restaurant but the menu was not what we had in mind so we did not. NYT in lobby in am. Good but not great coffee. We were on floor 16 and struggled to keep our room from getting too hot. It as 40 degree weather but if you had any heat on the room got too hot. They promptly checked it out for us. Our only choice was open window and to turn off heat and fan completely. All in all a good stay. Would return but ask for a lower floor room next time.

Nice clean rooms with an Art Deco feel the space. Sarah was our concierge who offered great local tips on places to eat and sites that peaked our interest. We'd text and she'd be right on it! Of course its NYC so the rooms are quite small but good size bath.
user_name:
Regina M
Miami Beach, United States

review_body: I was very happy with my experience in this hotel. While the rooms are not large, they make good use of the space, are comfortable, and do not feel cramped. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive. Two experiences that stand out for me are: I asked for a cab to be hailed while the doorman was occupied so a manger came out and stood in the sleet-rain to hail me a cab. The other, while I sitting in the lobby several hours relaxing, reading, and drinking coffee an employee (the cafe hostess I believe) stopped by a few times to ensure my cup was full and warm. The Walker will certainly be my top choice for hotel next time I am in NYC.

This hotel was the perfect location for our visit that was part business and part pleasure. The staff was friendly and helpful; even at 1AM when we arrived. The entryway was inviting and there seemed to frequently be people relaxing and enjoying the ambiance. The food was delicious (although the Orange Crush drink with breakfast (OJ, carrot juice, and ginger) had too much ginger for my taste). Our room was beautiful and comfortable with an amazing view of World Trade Center One (we were on the 14th floor). LOVED the water pressure in the shower. Highly recommend staying at this hotel!

I have tried a large number of hotels in NYC. This one is one of my new favorites. Smiling employee faces, excellent breakfast, comfortable beds, a great shower. Wii definitely come back to this great hotel for business or private.

I booked the Walker Hotel on booking.com because I wanted to stay near Parsons. The room class I selected said that it could sleep up to 3, which sounded ideal for my family. On arrival, my husband found it to be a tiny room barely suitable for a couple, let alone one with a kid in tow. We needed to book another room last minute at a high rate...which was also small. Aside from the location which is very close to Parsons and a nice Korean day spa Silks across the street, I would not stay here again.

Visually appealing, friendly staff and judging from the delicious food at a party we attended there (and we booked a room so we didn't have to get back to CT at 3 a.m.) their restaurant must be great! Cozy little lobby with copies of NYT to grab and read, like the little tables throughout the main level where you can just sip coffee, talk, read the paper. Warm, cozy look to the whole place, lots of wood/brick.Room was not spacious, but we weren't expecting that in this setting, and by European standards the size was fine. We booked 2 bed room, and the beds were really comfortable and especially the pillows (NOT hard, but not so soft and flat that you couldn't use them to read in bed).

Lovely clean rooms, consistently the same friend unstaff and they know me, perfect location. Elegant personalized place to stay. The lobby has a fire and serves drinks and coffee. People sit sipping wine at small tables and in the comfortable couches.

We stayed a week in the hotel in a waverly room 1503 15th floor it is a nice decorated room with all what you need and nice viewThe hotel is located fantastic in Greenwich village near all and 2 min to metro the area full of restaurants walking distance The hotel feels like a family all the staff very friendly every request we had was organized, more water , coffee ........Really 5 stars friendly service Especially the supervisor of reception - Nancy liang that was on top off all , solving every thing sending a wine bottle and cake to my wife's birthday We look forward to return to this hotel

We recently returned from a 4-night stay at the Walker in December 2016. We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay. Staff was very personable and helpful. The sleek, art-deco design and atmosphere of the lobby and rooms feels upscale without being stuffy. Small touches like free daily bottled water and turn-down treats add to the experience. We stayed in the most basic room, which was tight, but not uncomfortably so for us.Another great thing about the Walker is its location. We were just travelling for leisure and wanted to access locations all over Manhattan and Brooklyn. The hotel is centrally located on the island, so it's pretty easy to get just about anywhere. Within two blocks in either direction, you can access most of the major subway lines you'll need to get around, and it's less than a 15 minute walk to a wide selection of great restaurants and shops in the Village.We will stay at the Walker again on our next trip.

My daughter and I stayed here for 10 days during the first 2 weeks of December.The Good:Great location that was close to everything while still being a little less frantic than uptown Manhattan. Really close to lots of great restaurants in Greenwich. Close to 5th Avenue and all the shopping.There was a lovely sitting area in the foyer with a fireplace which was very cosy.Staff were helpful and friendly.Turn down service with little chocolates every evening.When sitting in the lobby there was a busy vibe feel that was very cool.Beds were really comfortable and the towels in the bathroom were large and really good quality. Good quality bathroom products.Not so Good:We had the 2 double bed room as my adult daughter and I were travelling together, Unfortunately, we could not unpack our luggage as there was no where to unpack to. The small wardrobe was able to hold 4 jackets and not much more, And to compound the issue there was only room to have one suitcase on a rack. The room was so tiny that we spent any time in the room on our beds. The room was serviced daily but it had a funny smell which made us feel that it wasn't really clean. They were supposed to give us two bottles of water every day but they stopped doing that half way through our stay.There was no room service menu or any information in the room on how to order room service, contact reception, contact housekeeping. It was really strange, I had to ring an outside line to get to reception to ask about room service. They didn't know the extension to room service so they transferred the call and then the room service person read me the menu (while I was calling from my mobile). Our room was right next to the lifts so we got lots and lots of noise.We were suffering from jet lag and wanted to sleep in each morning but the housekeeping staff were VERY noisy in the corridors - letting doors slam ALOT, talking loudly etc..,, it was horrendous. Im used to the housekeeping staff being very considerate of hotel visitors. There was no bar fridge in the room and no coffee or tea available in the room. This was a real killer for me as I can't function till i have my first coffee of a morning. On the first day, I had to get dressed and go to the restaurant and ask for coffee as room service. It didn't happen again!The drinks from the hotel bar were the most expensive drinks by far, that I had during my visit. We are part of the Tablet group which meant that we had free breakfasts as part of our stay. However, the hotel only allows 3 options from the full menu and the serves were very small. We stopped eating in the restaurant after day 4 because we just got bored with the offering. And the coffee was bad compared to other places but I am an Australian coffee snob :)

My wife and I visited NYC for the first time and chose to stay in Greenwich on a recommendation. The Walker Hotel is ideally located close to the subways and within walking distance of Union Square, SOHO, east and west village, and slightly off the beaten path. There are loads of great shops and restaurants within walking distance. The Art Deco styling is gorgeous and the staff are friendly and courteous. Very clean and spacious rooms, only complaint is the rooms are a little dark because there is not enough lighting and the decor is quite dark. We stayed for 3 nights and had breakfast one morning and dinner one evening. The food is excellent! However, the restaurant service (The Society) is not the greatest. I think they were training new staff when we were there and they were not very attentive. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a quiet romantic setting and enjoys walking to the action.

Excellent hotel with customer focused management. I had a great meal at the new restaurant - wonderful food, cool vibe, fun room. Management is dedicated to the customer experience, particularly for repeat visitors. The neighborhood is fantastic and in total, this is the place to stay in the area.

We really loved the safe and welcoming ambience of The Walker. The rooms are small and hanging space is very limited (though the simple addition of a longer hanging rail could solve this problem),but the excellent service and helpful staff compensate for this.The bartender was wonderful as was the food and beverage manager who recommended some excellent wines to have with dinner.  The location was perfect for exploring the city and was a haven of peace compared to the bustle of Midtown..

With intentions to dine in the Village or West Village areas during our 3 days in the city we opted to stay in this hotel and we were not disappointed! Inviting exterior on a quiet street, cozy lobby and comfortable room, the Walker met all expectations. A few minutes walk from the Union Square subway stop and walking distance to all our dinner spots as well as Washington Square made it the perfect place for our stay. And with the subway so close our trips uptown to the Metropolitan Museum and to Broadway were very easy to do. The beds were comfortable, room very quiet, bathroom more than adequately supplied with good products and thick towels...and while the room was on the small side it was perfectly comfortable for resting our feet. Upon returning to the room every night a little sweet bite was left for us. We would definitely return to the Walker for next stay in the city.

Small but cute rooms and a warm inviting lobby. The bathroom was beautiful with a large relaxing shower. The bed was very comfortable. We were on the 18th floor and the views of the sunset as we got ready for our evening out were just spectacular.Adrienne at the front desk and Amos were friendly and professional as they checked us in and escorted us to our room. Sweet place to stay and I would stay there again.

I had a very enjoyable stay at the Walker during a four-week visit to New York. The style of the hotel is lovely - modern with art deco accents. The facilities were of a high standard - the shower pressure was great, good tv and the bed was very comfortable, although I had a problem with heating at one point which was ultimately resolved. As I was staying for so long, a mini fridge was provided in my room. That, plus the decent size of the room, which had a desk and two armchairs, gave the room a studio feel rather than an impersonal hotel room feel to it. The location was perfect for me - close to Union Square, Chelsea, and the Village. For me, the Walker is a keeper and I hope to stay there in future visits.

What a great hotel! Location was ideal as we've been to NYC before and wanted to do more things Downtown.. rooms were cosy and clean, staff couldn't have been more helpful..and the complimentary bottle in our room for my husbands birthday was a great touch! :-) will definitely be back!

I wanted to love this place (we normally stay at a really cool hotel in the area when we visit NYC) but I wanted to switch it up, which ended up being a huge mistake. The hotel seems nice online but the staff and service is lacking! The front desk man asked me 3 times if I knew how to spell my name correctly when they lost my reservation. They double charge my credit card. There was an intruder in the hotel, who was banging on our door and put the hotel on lockdown and they never informed us when it was safe to leave our room. It was terrifying but these things happen and you can't blame the hotel but the way they handles the situation was less than professional. Our room was never actually really cleaned by housekeeping and we aren't that messy. We had to ask them to come clean it and provide things like toilet paper. All in all - it was a crappy experience and we paid about $450 USD a night. I would rather have stayed somewhere else for that price!

Very romantic and cool vibe boutique hotel in Greenwich. Staff was lovely and they gave us a room with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. Was my girlfriends birthday and we came home to a lovely hand written birthday card, piece of chocolate cake and bottle of Proseco!! So Happy with everything and will definitely stay there next visit. Highly recommend.

We arrived separately for our holiday weekend stay. My partner had booked this hotel because it was close to my school and my apartment in NYC. When you arrive it's a wonderful greeting and the hotel has a beautiful entrance, although rather impractical with all the stairs you have to traverse just to get to the lobby. We found it had a wonderful design and in certain areas great care had been taken. The staff was good, but not great, there seemed to be wholes in the service and training. The food and beverage department appeared great. That is until you realized that the 24 hr room service was limited to 5 food items. The room was great until you realize the utility closet is right outside your room and you are privy to hear every housekeeper and maintenance persons movement. The trill of having a terrace to have drinks or breakfast on is diminished when you realize it's barely large enough for two people to turn around on. We did enjoy the wonderful bathroom and the large tub came in very handing for me as I was feeling unwell most of our stay. We loved the menu in the restaurant and bar and the staff was efficient just not what we were expecting at the level of cost and location. We wish them well, but we will most likely not be staying with them or recommending them to our friends and family.

We've been staying here for the past few years. If you like jazz, you can walk to nearby clubs- the Village Vanguard, Small's, Bar Next Door, and 55 Bar are all within walking distance. It's also within walking distance of Union Square. Great downtown location.

What a great find! We were considering a midtown hotel as first time NY visitors, but so glad we decided on the Greenwich area. It was so nice to be able to come back to this part of the city after a long day of walking and exploring - so warm, inviting, comfortable, quiet yet convenient.Close to 14th Street subway stations, you could get anywhere in Manhattan within minutes. Walk to West Village and the High Line / Chelsea area.Guest service of every single one of the staff was outstanding.Beds so cosy and comfortable, fluffy towels, beautiful bathroom. As lovers of Art Deco, this was just perfect for us.If you are considering this hotel, don't give it another thought, just book it!

We have just arrived home from this hotel. Firstly the location of the hotel is the main reason to stay at this hotel! The room was a little small but cosy. The downside to the size meant there was little storage for clothes and suitcases. We ended up using a small bench to lay most of the clothes on.We didn't sample the food at the hotel but we did have drinks. The first night we tried to order a drink about 10pm to watch the football in the restaurant (empty) and were told we only do cocktails at this time - I fancied a glass of wine so we didn't bother and went to our room instead. Then as we were getting ready to leave to come home - I asked to order drinks (at about 1pm) and was told the bartender hasn't arrived yet so the waiters couldn't serve it. All a bit bizarre to be honest for reasonable times of the day to ask for a drink. Finally the restaurant hostess sorted it out for us but all we wanted was a wine and beer - nothing fancy.Staff were really pleasant and I was impressed by the doorman who could lift both 20kg cases up the stairs to help us leave. What a strength! I would stay here again mainly due to the location more than anything else and the rooms were spotless.

So close to West Village and Bleecker Street shopping/food wonderland. Ari Bounas was our Guest Relations Supervisor and she was great; handled my travel issues with efficiency and no-drama! Thank you, Ari! Thank you, Walker Hotel!

This hotel is a stunning find, it's a smaller hotel but they really know how to treat guests. I was on the 17th floor and the room was great and the view was amazing! I will defiantly be back here next time I visit the city.

My wife and I would like to personally thank the hotel and the entire staff (too numerous to mention, certainly Irvin for one) from the moment we checked-in until the moment we checked-out for their kind and great service. They made our honeymoon at the hotel in NYC great - we can only offer our thanks. Cheers guys.

Things have changed for the worse, with the new management. I guess if your a foreign traveler, this place would appeal to you. Although folks like myself that travel weekly for business, it's not a the perfect hotel. The hotel rooms could use some maintenance (clogged shower drain, missing tile grout, etc.,) Unless your like enough to get the larger suites, the regular size rooms are perfect for just the bed and don't try to use the table, because either is no room to pull out the chair, not sure who the genius was the designed this concept. The restaurant tends to focus on those enjoying a glass of wine and sitting in the dark, older folks will need a flash light to read the menu, which is another item that really disappointed me. As for the exterior noise, what can I say it's NY...get a room on the 17th or 18th floor and it's not that bad.

My son and I stayed here when we came for his NYU interview. The building (from the outside) is absolutely 'old-world' charming. Inside is chic and quite beautiful. Yes, it is dark, which took some getting used to, but it is all part of the ambiance which I found to be very unique. Our room, while tiny, was just enough space for our needs. The bed was very comfy. I slept well although our thermostat did not work. The room was overly warm even though the air conditioning was on. The only thing we could do was open the window. The bathroom, (also tiny) was super chic in black, white, and chrome. I appreciated locally made toiletries and super luxurious towels and bathrobe. Our room was never 'made up' even though we were out from 7am until 2:30pm. We left again at 4:30pm and didn't return until 11pm. It seemed curious to me that someone would come and leave coconut macaroons on our night table despite unmade beds and empty coffee cups from our morning coffee service. The room gets much tinier when it is unkempt. I called and mentioned it to the front desk. They didn't seem to have much to say about it but did offer to send up clean towels. I developed laryngitis and wasn't well enough to speak or I would have been much more vocal about the lack of housekeeping service. All in all, I still loved the hotel, the bed, the location, and the overall 'feel' of the place. We had dinner in the new restaurant after our broadway show. The food was incredible and perfectly prepared. They accommodated my special dietary needs graciously and with delicious execution. The wagyu beef was excellent. The staff in the restaurant and the hotel were all very warm and friendly. I would definitely stay here again, and speak up next time if there are similar issues that need to be addressed.

The hotel is amazing: it is a small pearl into the city. The staff was very kind and helpful every time we need them, also they leave every day a delicious gift in the room: small things make the difference! One of the things we preferred was the position: Greenwich village is the best way to breathe the real New York, every street is a surprise, restaurants and pubs are wonderful and you get more quality for less money respect to other parts.Also, the position of the hotel is central enough to let you move around with no troubles and to feel you safe at any time. Here it comes the best part: our room was very clean and well organized, even if the space was not much (but this is a standard in NYC), but the bed is unbelievably comfortable, you just lay down for 10 minutes and you'll fall asleep right away. We would definitely stay here again, it was a pleasure being their clients!

The hotel was in a great location but there was a lot that brought it down. The noise, not from the street but from slamming doors, noisy staff and hearing when your neighbours are blowdrying their hair. The first day my bathroom was not cleaned properly, I never had glasses in my room for the first 2 days and when wanting some coffee and breakfast while working from my room I was disappointed to find that the phone didnt work. I also waited a good 7-8 minutes for the elevator to stop on my floor the one day. The hotel was comfortable (great beds), neat, tidy and boutique like its just a shame that the weaknesses in service and noise bring them down.

Great location in the heart of Greenwich village. Comfortable clean room and beds. Friendly staff. Elegant and cozy lobby and restaurant. Wifi ok, had to pay for faster internet. For some odd reason my mobile data would drop out in the room.

We arrived in NYC at around 9:30AM, so were worried that we wouldn't be able to check in to the hotel yet, but were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready at that time and for an extra $75.00 we were able to check in early. The hotel is very conveniently located on W.13 St between 5th and 6th Ave, so getting to and from the subway was a breeze, when we didn't want to simply walk wherever we wanted to go. The hotel is a very stylish art deco building, inside and out, with a large welcoming lobby that has couches and tables for dining and drinks. Our room was on the 12th floor with a view of the Empire State building and was quite small, although we didn't mind since the furnishings and layout were all well suited to the room. We had drinks in the lobby/lounge at one point and twice we had the breakfast served in the lobby/lounge. Service was always exceptional and the food and drink quality was also very good.

$65 per day for valet parking with no in/out privileges. So, I said, okay, I'll find my own parking and asked if it was okay to leave my car out in front for a couple of hours. They said sure. Car was ticketed, for $65. I strongly suspect management asked for it to be ticketed. The room was also not properly prepped upon arrival. An empty roll of toilet paper hung on the dispenser and there was trash on the bathroom floor. The room itself (two beds) is small with no room for luggage.

I had no idea this hotel even existed until I found it on the NYU parents website as a suggested location to stay near the University. I made a reservation online but then when I called to hotel to check on it they asked if I wanted to upgrade and I said yes. Smart move. My wife and I were upgraded to a spacious room with a balcony on the 17th floor with bathroom that had a large tub and a separate shower. We could see the Empire State building from the balcony. Amazing view. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room even had a working analog radio! If you don't know what that is you can Google it. There is a restaurant in the hotel but I also found a great little bagel place right around the corner for breakfast. The Walker is a beautiful hotel that is easy to miss in the big city but if you are looking to have a restful weekend with your spouse it should definitely be on your list!

Tucked away on a quiet side street, The Walker Hotel is a warm, welcoming boutique hotel. Service, cleanliness and stylish décor were all positives.As one would expect from a 'boutique' hotel, the room was quite small with limited wardrobe and bag storage space. It was fine for one but a couple would struggle in the queen room with clothes and luggage for more than a few nights.The restaurant was being refurbished, so food was available in the sitting area. This wasn't particularly suitable for more than a snack. However, the work looks good and I'm sure that this will be a nice restaurant environment when it opens shortly.It's convenient for the subway with a couple of stations/lines available within a block or two. It's also a good location if you like to walk, with Union Square 5 minutes away and the East Village and SoHo within 10 minutes or so.Overall, a high standard of accommodation in a much calmer environment than Uptown. The trade off is room size.

My husband and I planned to celebrate our 25th anniversary on Nov. 9 with dinner at Sushi Nakazawa and a night at the Walker (we actually live in NYC, but on the upper west side). The shock of the election the previous night cast a pall on our festivities, but the staff at the Walker did everything they could to cheer us up. They upgraded us to one of the penthouse terrace rooms (the only rooms with soaking tubs in addition to showers), gave us a lovely fruit plate and a bottle of prosecco, and also tickets for drinks and breakfast. The hotel is decorated in an Art Deco style, and the rooms are radically different from antiseptic chain hotel offerings. The beds are comfortable, and both the sheets and the bath towels are Frette (even the slippers are Frette!). The bathrobes are super-plush and cocooning. There is an old-fashioned style Tivoli radio on the desk and a phone on the nightstand with a rotary dial. We loved the attention to design details. I must mention that the bathtub was large enough that I could actually float in it!The restaurant was under renovation while we were there but the kitchen was in operation, so you can get food either in the lobby/lounge or via room service. All the food and drinks we had were well-prepared and delicious. We were enjoying ourselves so much that we extended our stay an extra night. The terrace room wasn't available the second night, but we got one of the Barrow rooms and it was lovely as well. The hotel is in a great location in the Village, close to public transportation and loads of shops and restaurants. We decided we would return for the next special occasion -- probably for my husband's birthday in the spring. Looking forward to it!

I stayed at the Walker Hotel for 3 nights as a gift from my brother who stays there whenever he visits NYC. There wasn't one person working there who wasn't incredibly friendly and helpful. The decorating is very warm and inviting. My room was fabulous - beautiful decor with plush bedding and beautiful bathroom amenities. I had a terrace that gave breath taking views of the city. Everything was very clean and very well taken care of. The hotel is central to everything. The Walker definitely helped make my trip memorable. I hope to go back soon.

The Walker Hotel is a small European style hotel. The service and personnel were excellent. The location is quiet but very convenient near many good small restaurants and shopping. The rooms are small but nicely appointed.

Fabulous hotel, decorated in a boutique style with all the necessary amenities (gym, good food, good room service, lovely toiletries, a safe, iron, hairdryer, big TV with many channels, etc). I read some other reviews about the construction works but during my stay I didn't even notice them! So don't be put off.Staff were also very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The location is perfect, you can get all around New York from here and the neighbourhood has lots of restaurants, shops and bars you can walk to, yet is really quite at night. Bed was also amazingly comfortable!I came here on business but would definitely come back to stay on vacation. Thank you Walker Hotel!

What a wonderful surprise the Walker Hotel was. I knew the location was going to be great, but the hotel itself was hip without being flashy, well maintained, wildly tasteful, quiet (!!!), and the hotel staff were consistently kind and helpful. Will always stay here!

The only word that I can use is DARK..... I arrived at night and the lobby was dark, the check in desk is in a corner in a cave. The receptionist was surly. After a night in my cave room, I explained to the desk that I literally could not see to read. The lamps were 14 inches tall and there was no way to read a book before retiring. I requested a taller lamp, but was given yet another tiny dusty dirty lamp. I had to use my flashlight from my phone to see the colors of my clothes. I propped the curtains open. The desk clerk explained that the lobby lights are on a timer. Well, their lobby is actually down a flight of stairs and when the lights are dimmed: good luck. When I mentioned it all employees agreed. My bed was comfortable. My bath was minuscule but very clean. I do not know if the room was clean because it was too dark. I stayed here and paid about $500 a night for four nights for parents weekend at NYU. If you are a spelunker you will be in heaven. Also, the doors to the rooms automatically slammed hard enough to shake the entire room.

Having researched many hotels in NY, we were not disapppointed. The staff were warm and friendly; the room, although not big, was clean and comfortable (with clean robes and hot shower after a long day walking). The General Manager made a point of ensuring we were made welcome. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast (although this is not included in the price, we found it comparable to the same price as eating breakfast out) and they were in the process of improving their dining area. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the subway. One day we will return!

What a lovely hotel! The lobby/bar/restaurant is warm and welcoming. The staff was incredibly helpful (Arielle!) and the room was wonderful--very comfortable and well laid out. My daughter was moving in to NYU, and this was the perfect location to wander around and get acquainted with the neighborhood.

First, many thanks to Jude, at the desk for exceptional service! This was our third (or fourth?) time at the Walker. Both previous stays were when it was the Jade. The hotel is much the same, with the same retro rooms and kind staffStayed in a lower floor room with one queen bed and a sitting area and bay window, as there were just two of us. The room definitely felt roomier--rooms with two beds can be cramped. The rooms are cozy and darkish. I was very excited to see the door on my shower this visit--we had a much drier bathroom as a result (thanks, Walker!). Yes, the restaurant and bar are under construction and the lobby felt much busier as a result. But room service was prompt and friendly, and we received a discount as a result of the construction. The neighborhood is wonderful, the hotel is in a quiet block but charming West Village is just a few blocks away.

There is much to love about the Walker Hotel: the beds, the towels, the intimate lobby, the service provided by the lobby personnel (excellent) and the helpfulness of the staff at reception. The room we had was on the small side, but that's New York. But the Walker is a work in progress, perhaps. I say this because not only were there renovations going on, but it also seemed that the training of the housekeeping staff had perhaps not yet been completed. Every day there was some (minor) problem related to the housekeeping service - no water on a couple of days, glasses not replaced on another, towels overlooked on another occasion. There were also a couple of technical hitches - the phone didn't work on one occasion and a light blew in the bathroom. That all sounds like a list of complaints, I know, but you'll notice I still gave this hotel four stars. It's a great little place, full of potential. Perhaps if more attention was paid to staff training these glitches would be ironed out.

Despite a website telling you stories about the lovelty bar, and the beautiful areas to relax in... there were none. We arrived to find that half the hotel is a building site. Don't trust what their website looks like! The pictures are of the previous hotel: the Jade.We had hoped to spend a week walking around NY and relaxing at the hotel. In the end the hotel was the last place we wanted to be.

Wonderful atmosphere. Professional and helpful staff. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. On the negative side, the air conditioning is very noisy. All in all a very nice experience, great location.

Amazing hotel. Nice, clean, cozy rooms, service is next to none. The restaurant in the lobby is a wow. I stayed in more than 30 hotels in Manhattan and this is by the far the best hands down. Also, the neighborhood is just great and a lot of restaurants and shopping places.

What a wonderful small intimate hotel. The staff went out of their way to serve us and make sure we were happy. The room was great and bed very comfortable. In the morning they had offered breakfast that was over the top and newspapers to read in their comfortable living room setting. It was just a beautiful experience and I look forward to returning soon.

My girlfriend and I stayed here in September and had a great time.The hotel is in a brilliant location – very close to key Subway stops (so you can easily get around the city) and a short walk to the heart of Greenwich Village, which is a really nice area – lots of great bars and restaurants.The hotel itself is quaint and stylish. The restaurant was closed when we visited but the small lobby is a nice area to sit and relax (and grab a drink or food if you wish – we did use room service one evening and the food was delicious).The staff are very pleasant and attentive, and made us feel very warm and welcome.Our room was nice – we were offered one with a view of the Empire State which was brilliant. The room was pretty small (we were advised when we chose it), but it wasn't an issue. The quality and style of the hotel and the excellent location more than make up for it.So if this hotel is within your budget I'd definitely recommend it. This was my 4th time to NYC and definitely the best.

Stepping into the Walker Hotel was a welcome treat after a busy day touring Madison Avenue & Grand Central Station! It had been raining and blustery so when we came through the entrance doors to the warm light of a fire place and soft light, I could just feel the tension leave my mind. The staff was friendly and welcoming, helpful w/suggestions and available to obtain/schedule transportation. There dining room was under remodeling, but they had a very cute area for a light breakfast - tea/coffee, pastries in and around the fire place area. It is also a nice place for a glass of wine at the end of the day.The rooms are small but very well done, bed - oh so cozy! Soft sheets, great pillows, comforter and once the door closed, the only sound we heard was the Maid wondering if we were ready for fresh towels the next day. After a show on Broadway, we came home to turned down sheets and a sweet treat - the coconut macaroon was my favorite!The Walker is just a short walk to the Washington Park and the NYU Campus. So many little eateries available near by. Great people watching - The People of Greenwich Village LOVE their dogs and are generally don't mind if you give their dog a pet behind their ears.Definitely would stay at the Walker again -

This was a great place to stay in the Chelsea area. The room was quite big enough for NY. It is what hotels used to be: well appointed Art Deco style, small and cosy, great restaurant, very friendly staff. I think it was a bit expensive, but not for NY. I would always opt for this hotel on a New York trip.

We enjoyed staying at the Walker Hotel. It has a welcoming atmosphere and a very friendly and helpful staff. The wine bar is fabulous in the lobby. The rooms are small but extremely comfortable. I am a picky traveler and like a 4 or 5 star hotel. The Walker was absolutely a 4 star property. Beautifully furnished and extremely clean. A great home base for a week or weekend in the city.

The location is gorgeous. It feels like walking into a bygone era. The entire staff is amazingly friendly. The turn-down service was a fun perk with a treat waiting each evening.Easy access to subways. Excellent coffee options very close by. Loved being right there in Greenwich Village.I would absolutely stay here again.

A beautiful hotel in a great location, with some pleasant, helpful staff and good food. But it fell down in a number of areas, which made the experience pretty average.Rooms are small, poorly planned, with very little hanging and storage space for clothes and bathroom stuff. No fridge, no coffee-making facilities, just a messy mix of expensive 'minibar' snacks taking up a lot of room on the small desk. Electrical sockets for hair dryer and chargers in unhelpful positions at floor level, nowhere near a table. The ground floor is being refurbished, so a small reception area doubled as a check-in desk, luggage store, lobby, bar and restaurant, often feeling very crowded.Room cleaning/servicing was erratic and random: some days bottled water was restocked, others not; a cleaner knocked one morning at 7 clutching a black plastic bag, asking for my garbage.The two elevators could not cope with the number of guests - leading to lengthy, frustrating waits for those on higher floors who couldn't take the stairs. Also very frustrating for the cleaning staff who have to use these same elevators for their carts.I was shocked to see large items of trash (filled plastic bags, random litter, sheets of polythene etc) lying around on the service stairs on several floors - and even more shocked when they were all still there, untouched, four days later. These stairs doubled as the fire exits to be used by guests - a real hazard in an emergency.So the stay was a very mixed experience, and the late arrival of our airport transfer booked by the hotel made our departure stressful. Such a shame it didn't live up to its promise.

The hotel was great for our trip. Visiting family living in the Village. Location was perfect. We had the larger size room which was a good size for NYC. Room service was on the ball. All service people were very very polite and helpful. We highly recommend it and would stay there again!

The Walker is a hotel-sized loved letter to the Art Deco era, done with exquisite taste and exceptional and attentive service. The rooms are intimate, yes not large, but thoughtfully designed with all your needs in mind. We were pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the hotel restaurant and ended up eating a number of meals there. Impressive that after a single meal the restaurant staff recalled us by name and also various meal preferences. A new Big Apple favourite with our entire family, young and old.

Hotel staff were fantastic, all very helpful and friendly, notable was Amos for booking my taxi to the airport and just a general helpful person. another person was Sharon who managed the bar staff.Hotel is in a great location, I would recommend this hotel for business or tourists.

Love staying at The Walker hotel! ❤️️ Adrianne and Josh are the best! Always give a friendly welcome as soon as you walk in the door. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you are comfortable. My first stay at the Walker hotel was on August 26, 2016, My daughter is attending NYU so I wanted to find a place that I can go all the time. I have been to the Walker Hotel several times in the last few months and loved it more and more each time I visit. NYU's parents weekend is this Saturday and Sunday; I will be looking forward to the outstanding hospitality at this fantastic hotel. Thing I love about the Walker Hotel Views of the Empire State building Room service Bellhop service Grape and Vine restaurant Room size is perfectComfortable bedsGreen friendly Kathleen Carney

We love the feel of this hotel. The rooms are always clean, the staff is professional, courteous, friendly but not overly-fake friendly. Perfect...a home away from home. We love that It is walking distance to the Village Vanguard.

Perfectly located - I had events each night of my four-night stay either in the West Village or the East Village - and I could walk to everything. One afternoon I had to go to Brooklyn and the hotel's proximity to the plethora of subway lines in and around Union Square made travel a breeze. Quiet and cozy on 13th Street, yet quick and easy proximity to food and cafes on Sixth Avenue and all around. Hotel is lovely; staff is incredibly helpful; my girlfriend really appreciated the relatively large bathroom in our queen studio room, which had enough room for a cozy sitting chair plus a desk. Housekeeping does a great job with personal touches like chocolates or macaroons each night; complimentary bottles of Saratoga Mineral water, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I decided to go into the city for an evening to celebrate her birthday. We were tired of the usual midtown/times square experience and chose to look for a nice hotel in the Greenwich Village area. I found the Walker Hotel and the pictures on their website seemed really lovely and so we decided to stay there. From the minute we walked in it felt like a private club in London. Really caring staff who did everything to make our experience be terrific. It was clear that working there was a good experience for them. The lobby where we had drinks was comfortable and welcoming. Our room was extremely comfortable. The beautifully renovated bathroom was a joy, and the big surprise in the morning was the gushing shower and I didn't want to leave it. Comfy bed, fairly quiet street for the city, Nice period furnishings. Would definitely stay there again. Ken Potter, Valley Cottage, NY

First-rate service, clean, and a charm that reminds of some small & beautiful hotels I've stayed at in Europe. Nightly turn-down service with sweet treats. I intend to stay here everytime I need to be in our NY office.

We chose this for a quiet alternative the other busy/noisey hotels in Manhattan. It's clean, and comfortable. It's a little outdated in my opinion (art deco-ish theme), but suits the age/era of the building. Rooms are small.

This classy boutique hotel is perfectly located if, like us, your favorite parts of Manhattan lie below 34th street. The Walker is nestled right in between the West Village, Chelsea and the Flatiron districts with Soho and the trendy Meatpacking District within easy walking distance. The front desk staff were super - welcoming and helpful. Room was comfortable, if a bit small. Overall, well appointed and quiet, with an intimate boutique flair. Thanks for an enjoyable weekend!

Booked the hotel online because of special price. Initially took a standard room, but with the help of wonderful reception desk staff Nancy and Natalia, upgraded to a southern view superior on the 17th floor. Great view of southern Manhattan, enough room to feel comfortable and lovely amenities.

We stayed at Walker Hotel for my daughter's wedding since her new house was just around The corner. It was 450per night and The room was quite tiny Before I had stayed at Fitzpatrick hotel where We paid less for a much spacious room.But to The benefit of The hotel The front desk was really great. MR. Ivan spared a big time and bought us train tickets to Washinghton I really appreciate that.The hotel is walking distance to Whitney museum and There are many Good restaurants near by.

This hotel was fantastic! It was so centrally located that we walked everywhere we needed to go. Rooms were just great! A little on the small side but we didn't need more. The washrooms were great, modern, fantastic shower. I would have liked some counter space but managed without it. The beds were super comfortable! I highly recommend this place! I will stay there again when in NYC!

From the moment you are greeted at the door and throughout your stay the staff at this small, intimate hotel goes all out to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. Located in Greenwich Village, you are away from the tourist crowds and can feel like you are living in the city. While the rooms are a bit small, they are quite clean and comfortable and have good beds. Given what you can pay for a hotel in NYC, you get great value here for your money. Book directly with the hotel for even better value. We will definitely come back. The place is charming.

It's a teeny tiny hotel but fantastic service and very cute rooms. Everything you need. The location is perfect for everywhere. It's very quiet and the staff are all great the the service second to none. Highly recommend. Also used local laundry to do service wash as we'd been travelling which was returned in perfect condition and on time etc. Loads of nail bars around and so close to all the fantastic restuarants etc int he west village.. try The Meatball Shop in Greenchwich Ave,

This hotel is so cute. The rooms are adorable and the bed are comfortable. The restaurant is amazing - i recommend the flatbreads or the chicken sandwich. The staff is also very accommodating. Anastasia, Victoria, and Linda are all very helpful. I absolutely adore this hotel. Great location as well. Only a block or so up from Union Square.
user_name:
afelric1
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. The staff were very considerate, and the room was bigger and more quiet than most I've experienced in NY. The location is great. Only downside was we left a sign on our door to say we would like the room cleaned at 10.30am, and got back at 4.30pm and it hadn't been done yet.

Hotel was great location to walk to SoHo, Meatpacking, Chelsea and Greenwich.Rooms are very small if travelling with friends. Two double beds seemed more like two large twins. It's small and quaint but all you really need. KERON (spelling?) was a lovely gentleman who helped walk my bags up a block to get a taxi. Staff overall is great.

My mother and I stayed at the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village for 11 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. One day we returned to our room before it had been cleaned. After enquiring at reception they promptly had the room cleaned and provided us with a free beverage in the lobby whilst it was being cleaned. On our last day they provided us with a late checkout so that we could shower before getting on the plane back to Australia.The hotel is also very cute and beautifully decorated. The beds were comfortable and the rooms quiet. The location was excellent. There were plenty of good restaurants within a km of the hotel and it was close to several subway lines.

Stayed at this hotel for over 3 weeks...It has a great location....very close to TNS and NYU, Union Square etc. Great comfortable rooms... Few things to note... no electric kettle int he room, no complementary b'fast

Great location, super friendly staff, lovely clean room(although a bit small) just great overall. I really liked the art deco look and the hotel was quiet and even had a great view. I didn't try the breakfast but ordered dinner and was very good also.

The hotel is very central to Greenwich Village and located off 6th Ave. lots of bars and restaurants near by and a short walk to nearby 7th and 8th Avenues which have plenty of shopping.The hotel itself is clean and very well decorated and the service is good. Prices are on the high side but it's all about location.The restaurant was closed for renovations so am not able to comment on the food. Breakfast was ok not brilliant. It's location was ideal for my business meeting. For tourism, you may want to look for a hotel closer to Times Square but this hotel has good transport links.Great group of guys who manage the hotel and they were very helpful.

We had a wonderful experience at the Walker Hotel. We were greeted by Ari at the front desk. She was very friendly and conversational. We mentioned to her that we were staying at the Walker for our 17th anniversary. When we arrived at our beautiful, clean room that afternoon, there was a bottle of champagne, cheesecake and a lovely note from Ari wishing us a "Happy Anniversary" and welcoming us. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Walker and will definitely be staying there again. The location is perfect and offers great views

The location and views are fantastic! The staff is accommodating and gracious; the bartenders were fantastic! The rooms have a great feel to them, the art deco theme and overall vibe of the hotel..loved it!!!!

I looked for something close to NYU and settled for Walkers hotel as it was walking distance and inside my budget. Essentially I have nothing negative to say. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was clean, nicely furnished and actually pretty good size. The street was fairly quiet so although it was on the sixth floor I was not disturbed during night hours. The breakfast was good quality with a broad range of choices. The area where the hotel is located is very nice, walking friendly, plenty of restaurants and cafes.

The Walker provides a great location combined with value and surprising quiet.....easy access to MTA....rooms are small(it is NYC) but well appointed. Larger bathroom with good shower. Flat screen TV serviced by HD reception. Would stay here again..

We were in a lower level room which had a bay window and was larger that other rooms, room for desk and two large chairs. Beautifully decorated and nice bathroom. The building from the outside is also lovely. Our room looked out onto the street which was very quiet. Not many bars or restaurants in the immediate area but Main Street with lots of transport options only 20 meters away.

The walker hotel is charming. My rooms (1602 & 1603) had INCREDIBLE views of the city. Rooms are small and art-deco style. Hotel is spotless and feels new. Breakfast was delicious. Service was great (THANK YOU ARI from the front desk)! Housekeeping forgot to clean one of our rooms one of the days we were there. Would definitely stay there again- great value.

My boyfriend and I were celebrating our one year anniversary. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay! When we first arrived I was sick with a stomach bug. The manager on duty Frahd (apologies for spelling) noticed my pale face and with concern asked if he needed to call ambulance but I declined. The staff around brought me water and then I believe Frahd had the front desk speed up the check-in to get me into my room. They took us in and before check in time and before you know it I was in a great room with lots of space for me and my boyfriend. They attended to our every need and had a mini fridge brought up for us upon our request. The breakfast included was a pre-fixed menu and it was very exciting trying out different options I would normally not order for breakfast; overall very delicious. On our actual anniversary day, we return to our room to find a hand written letter congratulating us with a sweet amenities to eat, fruit and chocolate. I was just so thrilled it made our stay even better! We will definitely come back to The Walker when traveling to NYC.

The Walker Hotel is in an ideal location for parents dropping off college student at NYU/The New School. Staff is helpful and attentive, our room on the 6th floor was quiet. Room service and lobby restaurant food was always excellent. Double room beds are pretty small, was hard to share one until our daughter was in her dorm. Overall, we had a really pleasant stay!

My college-aged kids and I stayed in The Walker (formerly The Jade) during a trip to take my daughter to college. This was my second visit to this lovely boutique hotel and my husband and I will stay there again in October. The staff is exceptionally helpful, generous with their hospitality and incredibly attentive. We're "bed snobs" and these beds and sheets were wonderful. The breakfasts are delicious, as is the 24-hour room service, which offers the same menu as the lobby. I highly recommend the Blood Orange Cosmopolitan and my daughter highly recommends the Chocolate Lava Cake. The Walker is, literally, nestled in the heart of Greenwich Village with excellent access to campuses at The New School and NYU. The Walker Hotel is our New York Home Base for the next 4 years and beyond.

We stayed at the Walker Hotel for two nights to bring our daughter to start college at Parsons School of Design. The hotel was perfectly located for the events we had to attend at The New School. The decor was charming and there were nice amenities. The staff was gracious and very helpful. Good value for the money in NYC. We are looking forward to our next visit!

Two nights in this well restored Georgian were great. Well appointed, retro rooms are super sound proofed. Nice toiletries and lovely service staff. Location is super convenient to downtown...west village, james beard house, union square...recommended!

This hotel really does have everything! The rooms are wonderful and have everything you need. The location is excellent. There's plenty to do in the immediate area or you can walk anywhere in the city once you've exhausted all there is to do in the village. You are also less than a stone's throw away from subway stations, bus stops and yes, you can even rent a bike at the end of the corner. You have plenty of choices if you want to dine out. Everything from bagel places to pizza places and fine dining establishments. They also have a restaurant behind the lobby. When traveling, of course the room and the location for the first things we think of. We want to be comfortable and we want to be in a great area. But, this place has something with a lot of other places just don't have. And a time when I find a lack of customer service almost everywhere you turn, this place is really the exception. Their staff is exceptional!! They all have super dispositions and a smile on their face at all times. We were there over a very, very hot Time during the summer. They could not handle us enough water bottles when we walked in or walk out of the hotel. This, was on top of making sure there was always bottle water in the room! But, they did not have to give water on a hot day to be sincere in their efforts in wanting their patrons to be very happy staying there. They went out of their way to make sure we were very comfortable. On our last day, I was concerned about the weight of one of our pieces of luggage and they even had a luggage scale downstairs and weighed my bag for me. I'm so glad they did, because I was right. It was 3 pounds overweight and I much preferred realigning everything in our luggage in the hotel lobby rather than at the airport terminal. I can't say enough about how friendly the staff is to their patrons. And, it does not appear to be a forced or insincere passing gesture. All in all, it was a great stay. As far as the cost, it is a bit pricey, but then again you are in New York City and it's all relative. And, I would certainly rather stay at this hotel then with any relative :-)

I stayed at the Walker Hotel on a business trip where my family (husband and baby) joined me. The hotel was beautiful and conveniently located and the staff at reception and at the hotel bar were very helpful and friendly. While not a "family hotel," they were very accommodating for a 5 night stay with a baby, providing a pack and play and a refrigerator at my request. I look forward to staying at the Walker Hotel on future business trips!

Stayed here while doing an event at The James Beard House and it couldn't have been better. Beautifully appointed, quiet rooms and an absolutely stellar staff. Located just a few blocks from Union Square, it's perfectly located for shopping, restaurants, public transportation and anything else you could possibly need. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

We have stayed at The Walker Hotel (formally the Jade Hotel) four times. Each time we love it more and more! The best thing about this hotel is the wonderful staff! Keron was so thoughtful. He made sure we had champagne to celebrate our 20 year anniversary. From the front desk to the doorman - everyone is friendly and helpful. Rooms can be a bit small but we are hardly ever in the room! We love sitting in the lobby area and enjoying happy hour each night before heading out to dinner. It is the perfect hotel to enjoy the Greenwich Village area and there is a subway on the corner so it is easy to get around to other areas as well.

My wife and I had a great stay at this lovely little hotel. The hotel's strength is its staff. Nancy, Josh and Brent treated us well at the front desk, and really every employee that we interacted with, right down to the busboys and housekeeping staff, found ways to show us little kindnesses. I love this hotel's location. It's obviously convenient to anything in Greenwich Village, but is also an easy cab ride from Penn Station, convenient to the subway, and easy walking distance to anything in Chelsea, the Flatiron District or the Meatpacking District. I preferred the location at the edge of several neighborhoods to something a few blocks deeper into the Village. Other strengths of this property...Our room on the 15th floor had a great view... unusual for a hotel in the Village. The hotel lauders their towels and linens in-house. It's a nice quirk that makes a noticeable difference.The hotel overall was spotlessly clean. (Someone is a cleanliness freak, in a really good way!)Overall, the Walker does a great job of delivering a lovely small, downtown-hotel experience. We'll absolutely return.

Wow! Fantastic hotel! We stayed here for a whole week and loved it. The location is ideal for sightseeing. The room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean and luxurious in its presentation. Best of all - quiet at night and a superb mattress! - much needed after long days of sightseeing. The lobby and public areas have a lovely (1920s?) charm to them and the staff were faultless throughout our stay: friendly, polite, helpful and accommodating. We also had breakfast and dinner in the adjoining restaurant most days - the food was fantastic. They do an excellent eggs benedict! The restaurant and bar had a nice feeling in the evening but still ideally placed for a night time stroll afterwards. Overall we felt that our choice of hotel was a very big contributing factor to our enjoyment of the holiday and we wouldn't hesitate to book here again. It gave us an authentic greenwich village feel and charm and it did not skimp on quality or comfort. Oh, and all the photos are accurate.

Traveled for business at NYU and stayed at the Walker Hotel, chosen by my host. I found it perfect for my trip. My room was stylish and had everything I needed. It was small which was fine for 1 person, tough for 2 if you want to spend more time in the hotel but if you were just wanting to crash, could be ok. The staff were super friendly. Even though my room was on the 4th floor facing the street, it was quiet. (It's a quiet block.)

I booked this hotel months ago in preparation for our 5 day visit to New York (incidentally our first visit). On arrival, it was raining hard and there was no doorman to unload the taxi for us or take our cases down one floor to reception so we did it ourselves. When we got to reception, the doorman was very apologetic but was dealing with another guest. As it was so warm, he offered us a bottle of water which was very welcome. I was a bit worried as we checked in but we had a great stay. The hotel is very art deco and somewhat dark but it is beautifully furnished and very clean. Bathroom with shower was lovely, toiletries were nice, large white soft fluffy towels which were changed every day even though we were happy to keep them, a little sweet treat left in our room during the evening, bottles of water (free) in the room which were replenished daily. The bed was gorgeous, not large but we slept so well. We had a couple of meals in the evening at the hotel which were excellent but skipped breakfast for a local bagel bar. Staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable and we were ideally located for seeing all the sights New York has to offer. We would definitely go back. Only downside, they started to refurb the bar/restaurant towards the end of our stay but no mention was made of this when we checked in although they are still doing food in the foyer. It's going to take 10 weeks to complete and we'd be interested to see what it's like when it's done. It looked great to us before they ripped it all out! Nevertheless, it didn't spoil our stay at all.

Family of 4 in 2 adjoining rooms as requested. We like the location in Greenwich village, very close to subway. Service was good reception very nice . We had a very good time. Free water bottles !that is not for granted. 2 minor comments: check in for our second room was exactly at Three.
