Yes, that is the designated time but we saw it was ready earlier just miscommunication from housekeeping. Also, we had a room with a bathroom that was disabled adapted. For some reason it is not adapted to people who aren't disabled. It seems the hotel knows this is an issue and immediately agreed to change. Adapting the bathroom or at least mentioning this ahead of time would have been preferable.

The rooms were beautifully appointed, but the services provided were beyond expectations. Because it was my birthday (a special one), the desk sent up complimentary champagne and cheese cake, at night they have a turn-down service, and each night they left little sweets for us to enjoy. Arielle and Natalia were especially helpful in making our stay a memorable one.

Ultra charming and stunningly beautiful Art Deco boutique hotel nestled in the heart of Greenwich Village, my favorite neighborhood in NYC! I just love kicking back with a Blood Orange Cosmo in the restaurant after a day of exploring the city. Located walking distance to Union Square, the Highline, Meatpacking District, Washington Square, and SoHo. Also, the staff is top-notch -- they always remember my name so it feels like I'm coming home! Speaking of home, they also told me the hotel is named after Mr. Walker who bought out the building and now lives there. What a lucky guy... :)I highly recommend Walker Hotel if you'd like an escape from the craziness of Midtown Manhattan yet be walking distance to the best of downtown.
user_name:
jlin113
New York City, New York

review_body: The Walker hotel is perfectly situated for exploring New York, but the best thing about it is the friendly and professional staff. The rooms are small-ish but functional, nice and clean. We have received so much quality intel on what to do and eat and even help with table reservations. Btw, don't hesitate to try the hotel restaurant too, it's good!

To be fair, this is a beautiful old hotel, personnel is really nice and the rooms are adequate size. I loved the products in the bathroom.We had a problem with my boyfriend's credit card from Australia but the hotel staff was super helpful.. The beds. Oh the beds are a dream (literally) and the whole decor oozes charm. I did not have the chance to try the restaurant, Grape and Vine, but it looked very inviting.It is a few blocks from Washington square park and the action on Bleecker street so be prepared to walk a bit after a night out!Cheers.MONICA

A nice and peaceful little hotel in a nice neighborhood. A great hotel for those who are around and about in the city and want a quiet hotel when you tired get back to rest a little bit before you go out to dinner. Warning, the breakfast is expensive.

Spent 5 nights here on business. Hotel is very well located. Excellent, friendly and polite staff. Rooms and building in general are in a very good condition. The only thing I would highlight is that rooms are quite small and have no minibar & coffee/tea making facilities. Depending on your budget, this could be a top spot while in the big apple.

I loved this hotel. It may not be for everyone as the rooms are very small. I used to live a block from here so I know the neighborhood well. This is the best walking neighborhood in NY. There are so many great coffee shops, restaurants, shopping nearby. The subway stop up to the theater is very close (1-2-3 Red line at 14th/7th). Even though the rooms were small and quaint I loved it. Let's face it when in NY you mostly just sleep and shower at your hotel. I was fortunate to get a room with a view, and enjoyed watching the city from my room. I was traveling solo and booked this last minute and got a room with the 2 beds and I actually loved it. The 2nd bed turned into my mini closet. I enjoyed hanging out in the lobby. They offer free water here and traveling in NY you are always parched with all the walking, nice touch. They have Bigelow bath products, and I loved the decor in the bathrooms. The service is superb, including the guys at the front door. Although beware, and flag your own cab to the airport hmmm or at least make sure they take credit cards (before you arrive to JFK!). Not sure how being under the Walker name changes things here, but in November as the Jade it was perfect for me.

I used to live in the West Village and it's my favorite part of NYC. Of course, being back for a visit, I wanted to be close by, and there's limited hotels in the area. I booked the Jade Hotel (Walker Hotel) purely for the location, and I was expecting that with it being an old boutique hotel the rooms would be small. I called ahead asking about the room types and asked for the largest one available. This is what I booked for 4 nights and at a price. The rate was an average of $600 a night. A splurge, but worth it for the location I wanted. The minute I walked in the door, I was shocked at what I was getting for the rate I was paying. It was late, and I convinced myself it would be fine "how much time are we going to spend in this room anyway?" With 2 adults and luggage, you couldn't move anywhere around the bed. The small armoire was full. The desk was covered, duffel bags on the one chair available, suitcases on the floor. The next morning, my boyfriend was kind enough to get up early to shower and get ready and get out of my way so I could do my morning prep. I didn't even have counter space for my makeup bag, I had to set it on the toilet to do my makeup. This was the kicker for me. I immediately looked online at my options uptown, finding a room triple the size for less than the rate I was paying at The Peninsula! Decision made! We checked out that morning. I can appreciate a character hotel, I know Boutique = Small, but at that rate, it wasn't even fair.

Love the area ! The hotel was clean and everyone was so helpful along with it being in a great location. They pay attention to detail. We had a great dinner in the restaurant and started every evening off with their Happy Hour ! I would stay again ....

The 113-room Walker Hotel is a charming retreat on the tree-lined streets of Greenwich Village. Upon entry, a grand staircase that draws you in the drawing room-like lobby below. The space is a mixture of modernity and sophisticated charm, where cozy nooks appear at every turn. Our favorite area is the small, dimly-lit lounge area immediately to left when you deceased the stairs. Here, a rich-blue, velvet sofa sits facing an old brick fireplace, and bookshelves with NYC-themed books line the walls. Most of the author featured lived in the iconic neighborhood at some point in time. The rooms at the Walker Hotel are big by any standard, some even offering deep soaking tubs and private terraces. We loved the old rotary phone in the room and suggest using it to order breakfast to the room! Great, central location in NYC!
user_name:
lindsrides
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a 3 and a half star review - a bit better than 'average' but not 'very good' despite the many positive reviews. This really makes me wonder about the veracity of many reviews.Positives: 5 stars for location - outstanding if you want to feel as close to what it might feel like to actually live in NYC/Greenwich Village but still close to great restaurants, bars and subways.5 stars for the bar and the bar staff - a great atmosphere and great service from the barmen.Ambiance - grungy and artistic - I kind of liked this at first but then thought it might be just an excuse for not updating the place. We were there for 11 nights and the dark furniture and paintwork really got me down. Also, it's so dark all through the hotel and in the rooms that visibility is poor, especially on the stairs going down to the bar toilets - be careful. Cleanliness was OK - but dark carpets in common areas and in the lift had the same mess on them for days at a time e.g. there was a cigarette butt on the front stairs in reception for 24 hours - it didn't feel like anyone was in charge of this.Room clean - OK - had to continually ask for toiletries and 'complimentary water ' to be restocked. Reception OK - they accommodated us into a bigger room (smaller bed though) at the front of building for the same price which was appreciated - we knew we couldn't live in the first one we were in for 11 nights as we could couldn't move around the furniture and suitcases.The rooms were very quiet and the beds were comfortable but the mattresses sit on a slab of timber that we were constantly walking into - pretty badly bruised on the shins by the time we left - watch out for this too.Invoicing - we left early one morning at 6am and were told the computer was down so they'd email an invoice to us. Didn't receive it so a week or so later messaged them through trip advisor - no reply. Emailed them directly another week or so later - no reply. Finally rang them because our credit card number was being used illegally in the US and I wanted to check the hotel account - on the phone for about 10 minutes while they found it (racking up a phone bill). They emailed it and I found we'd been charged for a breakfast and room service drinks that we didn't order. This was a pain because if we'd received it on departure we could have raised it with the hotel. It was probably an innocent error but for US$35 or so it wasn't worth the effort of trying to get it corrected.I'm heading back to New York with another family in January 2017 for a week but I won't be revisiting the Walker Hotel in Greenwich Village.

I've now stayed several times at the Walker, every time I've been really pleased with everything I see in a hotel.Rooms okay size, good amenities, particularly Wifi, clean and reliable.Good service.Well placed for everything I need to get to, particularly subway.Appreciated, and thanks!

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights. The hotel is not geared for 'long' stay customers, so when a lot of people check out on the same day, your room doesn't get cleaned till very late afternoon..and then it's just a quick wipe round. We had to ask for our bathroom to be re- cleaned when there were smear marks round the sink; towels and bathmats were forgotten to be replenished after they were removed. The lifts were always very grubby. We were given vouchers for breakfast to compensate for their poor hygiene, then found the breakfast cup had someone else's lipstick on it. There are plenty of other hotels in good locations in NY which have much better standards and value their longer staying customers.

My company hosted an event at the Walker Hotel for approximately 50 guests and the customer service throughout the whole process was beyond exceptional. Everyone I worked with at the hotel, from reservations, to front desk, to bar, was helpful, enthusiastic, and accommodating of our many last-minute requests. They made us feel like we were the only group booked (though I know we weren't!). The Walker was such a pleasure to work with and I would highly recommend them for any group or event booking.

I have stayed here a few times for work trips - The rooms can be small but they're stylish and cosy. I recently had to cancel a trip and when the cancellation didn't go through they were very understanding and waived the fee. I was also given a free upgrade on my last stay and the room was amazing with a balcony, view and the biggest bath I've ever seen! I'm also a big fan of the bar/restaurant downstairs, and service generally is good.The only issue I've had is that the air conditioning is very loud and woke me up a couple of times in the night.

My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Walker Hotel. One of the staff members, Keron, called a car for us for the airport and even weighed our heavy bags just to make sure they were under 50lbs. The Hotel is in a great location and there is lots to walk to! The food is fabulous! The waiters and staff are all very courteous and kind. They felt like family when we left!

Chose this hotel mainly based on location and value. For the money, I thought it was a very nice hotel. Quality was comparable to a Hilton or Marriott but in a boutique hotel. Pros: Clean, good onsite restaurant, quiet rooms, good location, unique and well done architecture/design, friendly staffCons: Small rooms (even vs. other NYC hotels I've stayed at), pricey drinks in the restaurant, housekeeping didn't show up so we had to call for towels and deal with no room cleaningTip: If you're driving in, ask about the validated parking garage. Rate was $40 per day for an SUV which is NYC cheap.

We decided to stay in the Village on our 6th trip to NYC having previously stayed in Soho, Midtown, the Upper East Side and Lower Manhattan. We came upon the Walker [back when it was called the Jade] and made our reservations 10 months in advance as we wanted to be sure to snag one of the Barrow Queen rooms. For the price and the space, a Barrow Queen at the Walker offers tremendous value in NYC. We had not only the Queen bed, but also a separate sitting area with two leather chairs and a table that we could use for breakfast. And then there was the bay window which had its own cushioned bench. The extra space comes in handy for extra storage because the closet is on the small side.You know what they say in real estate: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. You can't beat the Walker's location on W. 13th. You are a block and a half away from the 14th Street Subway station and 3 blocks from Union Square and its station. From those 2, you can get almost anywhere you want in the City. It's also a great neighborhood just to walk around in and explore.Others have commented on noise. Occasionally we would hear doors close, but it never kept us awake or awakened us. There's a nice bar in the lobby that came in handy on some of the warmer days for a cool late afternoon drink. There's also a Murray's Bagels just around the corner on 6th if you want a quick [and cheap] breakfast.We really loved our stay and will definitely consider coming back on our next trip.A few quick odds & ends:--Great HDTV with extensive channel selection.--Turndown service was hit and miss.--Some days we got our two bottles of water, some days not.--If you are staying during the summer, you might want to request they change out the heavier duvet cover for a lighter summer blanket. We did and it helped.

The Walker Hotel Greenwich Village is a fantastic boutique hotel in a great area of NYC with plenty to see and do in the surrounding area. The hotel itself is excellently furnished in an art deco style, and the staff were incredibly helpful and attentive to all of my needs. This was especially apparent during my stay, as my wife and three-month-old son joined me for the duration of my trip, and the staff could not have been more helpful in making sure that we felt both comfortable and welcome.Extra touches, such as the nightly turndown service, were also greatly appreciated! I didn't get the chance to sample the food as there are so many great restaurants in the area, but this is only testament to the hotel's fantastic location.Overall I will certainly be looking to stay here again on my next business trip to the city.

This is a very attractive boutique hotel decorated in art deco fashion. The location was excellent with easy subway access and was within walking distance for Greenwich Village, Chelsea and the Highline. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room, while comfortable, was small (cozy?) with limited storage. Since we were travelling with just carry-on luggage the size was fine for us. By New York standards, it was good value for money. For a weekend getaway to New York, we'd definitely come back.

I stayed at the Walker because of business meeting near Union Square. This hotel is on a (relatively) quiet street. My room was extremely quiet, small but efficiently furnished, with a small terrace. The A/C was fabulous..... especially since it was almost 100 degrees outside. Very convenient to Union Square, Greenwich Village, & West Village. Very friendly front desk staff & concierge was able to get us sought after dinner reservation when opentable couldn't. Bar & dining area small & dark, but super nice staff. They advised that major renovations are happening soon in the common areas. I would return to this delightful boutique hotel.

We stayed here for four days. It was lovely and in a fab location. We really enjoyed the lush shower and bed. The bar out the back is lovely too but we didn't spend too much time, as were exploring the city. If I had to complain, I would suggest that the aircon in the common areas was set to arctic, so I almost died of cold everytime I passed through but I think that's an american thing, as I noticed all the places had the aircon cranked as cold as possible. I promise you that this is not a major problem though, just an observation! Great place to stay and totally recommendable.

We stayed here recently for a short 5 night break. The hotel staff were friendly, kind and very attentive, Josh always seem to go that extra mile for us with bags, doors and seeing what our plans where. Hotel is clean, great facilities, a fabulous bar and restaurant. As a couple with no kids the hotel was perfect as there were no kids running around, quiet and peaceful but still great atmosphere in the bar. Great wifi. Cant really find fault to be honest, would happily stay here again.

The Walker is a beautiful boutique hotel, with friendly staff and a fantastic restaurant.My room was lovely, the interiors evocative of the art deco era with special details and furnishings. The view over the city makes you feel like a downtown new yorker, but not at the expense of sound proofing. It's perfectly placed in the greenwich village area with lots of shops and places to eat near by. The room amenities were great - the mini bar had a selection of everything you could need, including an EmergenC (vitamin pack), power adaptor (they'd obviously researched where I was coming from as had the right adaptor), and other local snacks. The turn down service was also very good. I was there in July and it was very hot so coming back to a cooled room with delicious snacks on the night table was perfect.The staff are also wonderfully helpful and made my stay all the more enjoyable. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay somewhere special that will give them a taste of the city.Thanks Walker Hotel :)

The Walker Hotel is located in a great location. Close walking distance to the heart of the West Village as well as Chelsea. The staff was very friendly and the Art Deco decor of the hotel is beautiful. We stayed in a double room and it was definitely an adequate space for two people. The room and bathroom were very clean and although we were directly across from the elevator, very quiet. My only complaint was that the shower did not drain well and filled up with water while you were bathing. I would definitely stay at this hotel again though and think it is very well priced for the accommodations.

I found this hotel to be beyond awful. 1. Room 507 which I am in has mold in it! (Picture included after they have cleaned it!) Apparently because of a leak in the shower. 2.it has no air conditioning but air cooling. 3.you cannot change the fan speed. So it is always on hi. 4.air constantly hitting the bed so when you are asleep you have blowing in your face. 5.room 402 which I moved from you cannot even change the thermostat so you are stuck with the temperature the hotel decides on. 6.you can finish a book by the time an elevator arrives. 7.i had to run after the cleaning staff to replenish my shampoo. 8.towels are removed even though they are not thrown on the floor and not replaced. 9.my tooth brush was thrown away for some odd reason 10 I was shown yet another room to change to for the 3rd time. 11.the mattresses are so old you sink in the bed. 12.the duvets are clumpy so basically the bottom have of the duvet is as this in as paper. They have changed the duvet! 13.the pillows are so old and hard. I heard a few people at reception asking for new pillows. 14.worlds smallest closet Never again. The place is very very unhappy.

I have to start out by saying that I had a wonderful experience at the walker hotel. I stayed for three nights, and was traveling solo. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted warmly by the concierge staff. My room was small but not cramped at all and would have been the perfect size for a solo traveler like myself or a couple. The decor of the hotel was charming and the area even more so. I didn't feel like I was surrounded by the crazy, stressful hustle and bustle of Manhattan and there were still many cute restaurants and bars nearby. I had a wonderful last night drinking and chatting with the bartender at the hotel restaurant - so much so that I didn't even leave the hotel that night! I also need to give a big shout out to the bellman, Josh, who was extremely warm and gave many great suggestions! I will absolutely return! Thank you for a wonderful stay.

What a great hotel! It is so charming and is hidden on 13th between 5th and 6th Avenue. I had a pretty quick trip and was bummed I didn't get to explore the hotel more. There is a really cute lobby area where you can sit on the couches, grab a drink, and hang out. There is a great restaurant in the back that I wanted to explore. And, it is super close to some key subway stations.

We've just enjoyed a wonderful five nights staying at this great spot in Greenwich Village. It's the ideal location for sightseeing wining dining and shopping as its really close to so many great options. We mainly walked everywhere and my son uses a wheelchair and most places we visited were reasonably accessible. The NYC buses are all accessible too. The hotel staff were really friendly and so helpful -hailing cabs, organising a car to the airport, providing us cold water before we headed out for the day, just lovely touches that made us feel very welcome. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast and dinner in the hotel's restaurant. Whilst the rooms are pretty small we were fine and enjoyed the really comfortable beds, powerful hot and reasonably accessible shower with just a small couple inch border to step over. We will definitely be back and would highly recommend it as a great place to base oneself to explore New York.

From the moment you pull up at the curb with the doorman, thru check-in, eating at the restaurants, and to check-out with the bell man's help, everyone working at this hotel truly cares that you have the best and most hassle-free stay in NYC. Extremely friendly is probably not what comes to mind for this city. Rooms were adequate sized for Greenwich Village (in fact like a suite-size in Rome) and quite ( on back side away from street with a view south). They even found my son's beanie baby puppy and mailed it home to him!

I had great experience at Walker Hotel Greenwich Village last week, when my flight to Brazil was cancelled and I had no place to stay on Sunday. The hotel is well located near Union Square, and the service was impressive. People open the door for you at the entrance and the employees at the check-in are well trained and give all the necessary instructions to you in a ver clear way. The room is beautifully furnished and clean. Gym is small but well equipped. Even the hotel guests are polite and seem to bw happy. Other good thing is that the hotel is near the 14 Street Subway and there are good restaurants around the hotel. Although I had to spend time alone in NY, the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village provided me comfort and security. I am very happy to share my experience with any tourist who comes to NY and want to enjoy the city. When I come back to NY, I will definitely choose the Walker Hotel Greenwich Village as my priority and I do recommend this to all of you! Thanks to all Walker Hotel Greenwich Village family who did great job of hosting me!

my stay at the walker hotel was phenomenal. The staff was friendly and accommodating. It felt like staying in a little castle. The bar is open late and the guys working there were great. The location is conveniently located.

We enjoyed our stay at the Walker. Had a room on the 16th floor with a great view, very quiet. I was surprised that some of the girls complained they were charged for coffee in the morning even after telling them we were guests? Our room was cleaned up nicely each day but we were surprised they didn't refresh our products in the bathroom. Front desk staff were very efficient and informative on the sights to see.

This was our second stay at this hotel. We stayed her when it was the Jade Hotel. Love the boutique hotel ambience and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are a little small, but not bad. Beds were very comfortable. The location is perfect! Walking distance to restaurants and parks. Also, had no trouble getting an uber. Will definitely come back to the Walker Hotel!

+ Exceptional customer service: early check in and helped us print theater tickets. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Balcony made the smallish room seem much more open. Location: great home location for Greenwich/ west village/ Washington square visit- smallish rooms (queen bed), but we knew that when booking. Balcony is ok, nicely kept, but no view. Balcony doors never locked (even followed instructions). And the shower: impossible to turn on without getting wet. Highly recommend as a boutique hotel.

When we arrived late night at the hotel We were greeted by a friendly door staff and a courteous and extremely professional desk staff. We stopped at the bar for a cocktail and were again impressed by the wait staff. The lobby itself is beautiful and our room was nice, neither too big or small. Right in the heart of the west village, the walker was perfect for our needs and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

The customer service was outstanding! From the first greeting by Josh, the bellman, when we arrived until we were put into a car to the airport three days later, arranged by Brian, everyone was welcoming, helpful, warm and engaging. This kind of treatment is not expected in New York City! Ari helped us with check-in, gave dinner recommendations and other general suggestions when we arrived on Thursday. Each encounter when leaving the hotel and returning was warm and friendly. Even the last morning as we were leaving, when we rode down in the elevator, the room service delivery man who joined us was friendly and engaging. We had many, many bags to get to the airport and ended up leaving one behind (through no fault of anyone on your staff). The call I made to report the problem and its prompt resolution was handled with courtesy, professionalism and skill. I was so impressed! We have stayed at many hotels in New York City. All the rooms are small in this city and this hotel is no different. But the room was comfortable and the amenities were very nice. No New York hotel has impressed me like the Walker Hotel. Each and every employee we encountered did an outstanding job of making this hotel stay a truly memorable one! We will be back.

I've been to NYC dozens of times. I've stayed in as many hotels and I've always said that I wouldn't return to one as there's just too many to experience.Walker Hotel is now that exception. Slippers in the room, good wifi speed, the most comfortable beds you could hope to sleep in, a fantastic shower... Sure, you could get this in any other hotel in the City. The location isn't half bad either - but again, other hotels have great locations, so what makes this place so good? Simple. The staff.From the minute we walked in we were greeted with smiles and cool drinks to combat the heat of a summers evening. From that point on, despite a slight mishap for my partners birthday (plans that were made that didn't unfortunately happen) the hotel staff did everything they could to make our stay a pleasant one. Even the way they dealt with the mishap made us come away praising their attitude and commitment to high levels of service (which is ironic in hindsight).This is simply a great hotel that's made fabulous by its staff.

Great location; step outside and you are in the heart of the Village. Everyone at the hotel so friendly and welcoming. Comfortable rooms and very quiet. The room was slightly small but not really a problem as it felt very luxurious. Will definitely stay again

beautiful little hotel..., stylish rooms, nicely appointed, my room had a great patio...but the best thing is the staff...could'nt be more helpful and nice...Nancy Liang and Ervin [ I hope I got his name right] were terrific...also has a cool little restaurant and bar, and a really interesting lobby....if you want to stay in Greenwich Village check out this hotel

The room, while small (it was New York), was exceptionally well appointed. The desk was magnificent, the bed extremely comfortable, the views from the 13th floor fine, and the TV could be hidden behind sliding panels to completely transport you back to another time.The old dial-up phone in my room didn't work - after trying a few different ones, the staff gave up and used a modern phone. I appreciated the effort behind the antique replica, but I appreciated the quick service and efficacy of the new one more.The bathroom was very nice, though I do wish there had been a soaking tub as in some f the pictures, instead of just a shower.The room service from the attached restaurant was high quality, tho the menu was a bit limited.All in all, a great spot, well worth the cost.

Nice, clean, boutique hotel, but the amenities and aesthetics were overshadowed by the noise. We could hear conversations (and snoring) from the adjacent room. The drywall seemed like a mere formality. The HVAC also made a loud knock every time it cycled off. That said, I would presume the issues we experienced were room specific.

Most New York Hotels are overpriced. The Walker hotel is no exception. unfortunately, despite being newly built 3 years ago in a style that makes you think it is original art deco, it has all the drawbacks without any of the advantages. The furniture is tacky, the utilities don't work properly, the staff is friendly but unhelpful, the hotel lacks but the most basic facilities. Much promise but little delivery. Unfortunate, as it promises more than it delivers. Compromises were obviously made in producing a "chic" 18 story hotel out of two townhouses: endless waits for the elevator, claustrophobic narrow passages, non functioning air conditioners, showers that overflow. If they were balanced out by something positive apart from the good, but not great, location, then it'd be worth more than 3 stars. At the price, 2 may have been more appropriate, but this is New York and you take what you can get.

While this part of the city is unmatched in terms of charm, hotels here are sparse. I was thrilled to have come across the Walker Hotel - it's a true reflection of the charm of the area. The service was fantastic, the room clean and comfortable and the location can't be beat. I also had dinner at the restaurant downstairs and loved the staff and the atmosphere. Will definitely be staying here again!

I traveled to NY with my two teens. We had a fabulous stay in the heart of the Village. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was convenient to many wonderful eateries. The beds were comfortable and the shower was awesome. I highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I stayed last week in the Walker Hotel with our five month old son for a week. I can't recommend this hotel enough... The staff upon arrival were so friendly and helpful with all of our luggage. Our room was lovely with two double beds and a travel cot. Our room had a turndown service every night with delicious pastries left on our pillow! The bathroom was very nicely decorated with good quality cosmetics and the water pressure in the shower was divine! This hotel was exceptionally quiet, a big surprise given it's a Manhattan hotel! No traffic noise at all! Great location with Murray's Bagels just around the corner and a short stroll to all the Manhattan sights/subway! We will definitely be back and thanks again to the staff for a superb welcome to NYC!

This was our first stay at The Walker Hotel Greenwich Village and we'll be back for sure. The location was excellent, the staff very friendly & accommodating, and as someone else said, they have a hipster vibe. Like so many NYC hotels, space is very limited and that was the case with our room. With that being said, however, they made very good use of the space and we had a comfortable stay.

This is a boutique style hotel relatively small in the NYC village.The rooms are not cheap (in the range of 400$), so you could expect some quality.There are some positive details. The location is good (in my case I had meetings nearby) and the staff try to help. There is a small but in good condition gym.But, unfortunately there more negative details. Rooms are quite small (well this NYC!), the air condition could not keep the temperature low enough and in the New York summer this is a problem. There are not even a small refrigerator in the rooms, so your water or anything will be very warm!You need several minutes to get the elevator... so do not be in a hurry!The free wifi is also really slow.

Our chef was recently invited to cook at The James Beard House and they recommended The Walker Hotel for our staff to stay at while we were in New York City. From the first moment of contact the sales coordinator Anastasia was incredibly helpful and answered all of our questions regarding the rooms, upgrades, etc. and helped to get everything booked. We had also been put in touch with a local kitchen to utilize their space however that fell through leaving us with no where to store or prep our food. The food & beverage director at The Walker Hotel, Liam Wager went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. A big thank you to Chef Kevin and his staff as well, without their accommodating our needs we could not have had a successful event. Our experience at The Walker could not have been better, all of the staff, from the doorman to the front desk to bell service, was so friendly and helpful. What a wonderful experience we had at The Walker Hotel!

The Walker is a cool boutique hotel with a hipster vibe and an obliging staff, but if you are thinking about staying there there are a couple of things you should know. First, to get to the lobby there's a big flight of stairs. You can take the luggage elevator which is right by the front door so don't freak out when you arrive and think that you're going to be trotting up this staircase morning noon and nightSecond, the rooms are very cleverly decorated but TINY, especially for the price (even by New York standards). I was travelling alone so it wasn't a big deal but if I'd brought my husband along I'm not sure where I would have put him. They are also flawed. For one thing there is no clock in the room. I know it doesn't sound like a big thing but it drove me crazy. They also have a "minibar" which consists of a basket of stuff that takes up a third of the already minimal desk space which has decorative drawers that don't open, The drawers of the desk in my room were purely decorative, i.e., they didn't open so there was no place to put stuff when I was working and bizarrely there is also nothing in the room with the hotel address on it and no instructions about how to make phone calls.That said, my bathroom was enormous with a huge deep tub and a fabulous walk-in shower. Just glorious. So, bottom line, would I stay there again? Yes, but then again my daughter lives two blocks away so the location is perfect. Would I recommend it to a friend? I don't think so. All the things that bugged me were little, but there were too many of them for the price.

This hotel is a really quaint find in the hustle and bustle of New York! The staff is extremely attentive. I was travelling alone, and before they would let my son come p to the room they called me to make sure it was ok, which was very comforting. The accommodations are small but adequate-typical size for a New York hotel.The only thing I would mention is that there is not enough lighting in the room, otherwise I really enjoyed my stay. The location is excellent-I will definitely be back.

The Walker is beautifully furnished and very clean. All of the staff - front desk, door, restaurant - were welcoming and friendly. Breakfast at Grape and Vine was delicious. C.O. Bigelow shampoo, conditioner, etc., complimentary bottles of water, free wifi (fast enough to stream Netflix), iron/board. Bring your own hairdryer as I could not locate one in the room. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

I like this place a lot. I've stayed here several times on business trips to the Union Square area, including back when the hotel was called the Jade. There aren't that many hotels in the Village. This one is unique and cozy. The rooms are small (what do you expect? it's NYC), but the bathroom is mercifully reasonably sized. It's located on a quiet street (13th b/w 5th and 6th). If you haven't lived here or visited frequently you may not pick up on the difference between 13th St. (quiet, pleasant) and 14th St. (crowded, honking chaos). It's an easy walk to the West Village. Staff are nice and attitude-free, which is not always the case at boutique hotels in NYC. The bar serves pretty good cocktails. All in all, one of my go-to hotels downtown.

This gem in the Village is a pleasure to experience. From check in (fabulous staff, with special thanks to Ari) to room service, to the beauty and cleanliness of our rooms, a lovely respite from the bustle of nyc. With our daughter living nearby, we hope to make this upscale, yet cozy, art deco find our go-to hotel.

I stayed just one night at the Walker, but it was a great experience. The staff was very welcoming, professional and service-minded. The hotel is comfortable, eclectic and in a perfect location for excursions both north and south of Greenwich Village.The restaurant, Grape and Vine, has a great atmosphere. Food and service at breakfast were great.

From check-in to check-out, there was nothing about my stay here that wasn't on-point. The building is beautiful, on a quiet street, and from my room on the 13th floor I had an unobstructed view of the Empire State Building. Nice. The room was small, as others have noted, but comfortable and nicely appointed with windows that open to let in fresh air. Love it! The bathroom was large with a huge walk-in shower and high-end, great-smelling amenities. Even the shower-cap was classy! The hotel was quiet, the front desk staff was super friendly and gracious, as were the restaurant staff (the food at Grape and Vine, by the way, is outstanding!). I've been to NYC many times, but have never stayed in Greenwich Village, and really loved the general vibe of the neighborhood and all the wonderful restaurants nearby. I have not a single complaint about my stay at the Walker Hotel, and plan to stay there next year when the conference I attended is once again in this part of NYC.

Stayed here in May 2016, fab hotel looks exactly as it does on website & photos. We had a Bedford double room that was lovely & very clean. Bathroom was spacious, loved the huge shower & water pressure was great. Towels changed every day. Hotel staff were lovely and very helpful & friendly. Had drinks in the bar a couple of times, it's a lovely area and staff again very friendly. And the beds were so comfy (tho it could be we were so tired lol) no honestly they were fab beds.The only thing I can say in a negative way about the hotels is there is no storage space, I can only think a man did the interior decorating as no woman would ever think that a wardrobe with a rail going half way through the wardrobe would be a good idea!! PLEASE change this. Also the desk in the room dump it and put some drawers in the room. We had a Bedford double which is obviously a room for friends travelling together so why is there a desk, a weirdly designed wardrobe and 3 tiny drawers? Also the bedside table was taken up by a huge lamp & telephone. No storage at all. I did know from reading other reviews that this would be the case but hoped it wouldn't be as bad. We were staying for a week and we struggled. BUT it didn't detract from this fabulous hotel and if and when I come back to New York I would stay here again. My friend who has been to New York 7 times said it was her favourite hotel. The aircon was a little noisy but we didn't mention it to the hotel as we liked to sleep with the window open.Also lovely touch of cake & prosecco for my birthday tho i didn't get to drink it as we weren't in the room enough, but thank you.All in all a fabulous hotel in a great location with very comfy beds and very friendly staff. Would definitely recommend

We booked the Walker Hotel on a whim, and I am so glad we did. First, it's a beautiful property on a quiet Street in Greenwich Village. Easy walking to the subway, and easy walking to most everything in the Village. Immediately we felt welcome as the doorman greeted us and quickly handled our luggage. The lobby is elegant old world, but the service is very current world: friendly, helpful, welcoming, and just plain fun. We were on the fourth floor -- only 7 rooms per floor. The room was well appointed with a king bed and a sitting area with a bay window overlooking the street. The bed was terrific. The bathroom was also delightful. We were there six nights and we will definitely return. Now the rooms are small. Hey, it's New York City, but comfortable and well laid out.Further we enjoyed the restaurant. The food was better than I expected from a hotel restaurant and the service was superb. The service throughout was superb.

Welcoming and friendly and very helpful. The room was small but pretty, quiet and clean. No long corridors in this hotel. Each floor only has a few rooms so it feels cosy. The street is quiet, there are several restaurants nearby, and Greenwich Village is lovely to walk round. Subway is nearby.The change of name since we booked had made us anxious, especially as we had not been informed, and therefore might have spent some time searching for the Jade had I not looked at their website a few days before arriving.Promised email receipt of bill has never arrived.

The location is great and near both subways and PATH making it easy to get anywhere quickly if you're not walking around the neighborhood. The neighborhood itself is great with lots of shopping and dining options and leans a bit to the younger/mid trendy crowds. You're greeted first by the gorgeous gas lamps on the outside of the hotel and the decor inside the lobby with the chesterfield sofa, cozy sitting areas and the fireplace. The rooms were comfortable and almost spacious..I've stayed in far smaller rooms in NYC. There is space on the sides of the bed, ample windows, and there was a desk to work on. The rooms were clean and well maintained! They also provide free bottled (in glass :) ) water. 13th Street is pretty quiet in the evening so sleeping wasn't an issue, 14th is the main street with traffic and noise. I had breakfast in the hotel in the morning and I was blown away with the service. The young gentleman that helped me and a few other tables was proper yet warm and approachable. I hope management sees how great they are! It was unfortunate that there was an old guy there complaining about everything.. (his decaf coffee had a few bubbles on the top and insisted it wasn't decaf, then his omelet was flipped correctly, etc etc, berating the server) yet the server was delightful the entire time and tried over and over to help this guy. He was attentive, polite and kept composure even under a stressful situation out of his control. The fruit was sweet, the coffee was delicious, and the avocado toast fresh. Can't complain about anything. The only thing I can say is that I found a significantly (hundreds) cheaper rate online compared to calling and asking for a good rate. I wish that a charming hotel like this would be able to provide better service with making a reservation at a good price without having to go to other booking websites. In addition, I never noticed the doorman that was suppose to be 24/hours. Perhaps he was talking to his colleagues at the front desk,but I never had anyone open the door or welcome me to the hotel.
user_name:
PBJennifer
New York City, New York

review_body: We had wanted to check out the Jade Hotel for a while and we finally had a chance to visit the renamed Walker Hotel this week. The lobby and entry theme still screams, "Sanctuary!" The common areas and even our room were tight, but space is tight in NYC. The design and materials used in the hotel made up for the space issue; the plumbing fixtures were nice and the tile work was classy. The Speakman shower head (or look-alike) was a particularly nice touch. There were two issues that the friendly staff addressed--a small shower drip/leak (blame the Speakman!) and correcting our registration at check-in to a room with a queen bed rather than two twins--but they took care of all that quickly. Best of all was the breakfast at the Walker's hotel restaurant...one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while.

We stayed at the Jade (as it was known) for 4 nights and loved it. The decor is quirky yet appealing with a real vintage feel. Every member of staff was polite, friendly and super competent. Particular compliments to the barmen....room had a great view, it was compact as some others have said - but this is NYC! The walk in shower and Bigelow products were fabulous. Good wifi, free water and room well maintained throughout visit. Good to meet locals drinking and eating there as well - sure sign of good hospitality and food. We ate at the restaurant one night, food was awesome and the restaurant is cool with its art and fireplace - do try the southern fried chicken, one of the barmen recommended it and it didn't disappoint. Breakfast was a bit of a let down on the day we had it but only a minor wrinkle. Gym was compact but sufficient to do a workout. Neighbourhood is quiet, lovely and with plenty of restaurants and Chelsea Market close by. Definitely recommend this hotel!

We chose this hotel at the village as it was near the house of my cousin whom we are visiting. Upon entering the hotel one really feels that this isn't just any hotel but a nice boutique hotel. The lobby as well as all common areas were nicely designed. The restaurant and the bar is also a work of art. Staff were all well trained and courteous. From the Bellman to the front desk to housekeeping all were properly trained and friendly. We got a room with two double beds. Even though it wasn't that big it was nicely arranged. Sleep quality was very good especially with comfortable beds and heavy blackout curtains. Lighting throughout the hotel was very good. Unfortunately we only stayed for two nights as we had to be in Florida for a family reunion. Will definitely recommend this hotel to friends wanting to stay at the village.

Rooms at the Walker Hotel are small but adequate. I had requested a room on a high floor, and was rewarded with a spectacular view of lower Manhattan from the 16th floor. The reception desk told me that I had been "upgraded," which was sort of surprising since the room still was quite compact, though fairly typical of NYC. You enter to a set of steps leading down to the reception area. Cozy, with couches and a fireplace. Friendly service from the desk folks to the doorpeople. Bar service was excellent, with attentive service, but not overly so. No mini-fridge, which I've gotten used to, but that's one of my few criticisms. Comfortable bed, good-sized bathroom with old-fashioned black and white tile. It's always nice to get complimentary water, too. Great location; quiet street with lots of restaurants just steps away.

I am a project coordinator for a small non-profit. Every time I need to fly guests in to NYC I always book them at this hotel. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. And the hotel itself is wonderful. Can't recommend it enough.

Stayed at the Walker for a girls' weekend that included dinner at the James Beard House (just a 5 minute walk). Great service, great retro art deco look. Clean room and bathroom. Small rooms, which isn't unusual in NYC so no problem for us. Super friendly staff. Could have used more storage for our clothes (a side-effect of small room!). Great shower. We were on 16th floor, so an excellent view of Freedom Tower and QUIET at night! I love downtown NYC, and only ventured above 20th street for dinner at Le Bernardin. The rest of the time we were on foot - The Village, Chelsea, Soho, Meatpacking, etc. super walkable. So if you're a downtown denizen, the Walker is a great spot.

We visited New York for Memorial Day weekend this year and stayed at the Walker Hotel. From the first phone call the staff were friendly and helpful, and meeting them in person was no different. The hotel has all the charm in the world, and legitimately the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel - which is fantastic when you're logging over 20,000 steps a day in Manhattan! The room was cozy, which makes you feel like a true New Yorker, but there was perfect space available for all we needed to do. From our first moments there to our last, the friendliness and kindness of the staff permeated every interaction, and they were most helpful when we had questions.

Since they changed from Wade, I was not satisfied. Rm 1604 The bathroom door knob kept falling off, the shower door didn't shut properly flooding the small bathroom, the pipes need cleaning as I was showering in three inches of water. The housekeeping didn't clean our room or give us fresh towels but did leave two bottled waters and turned our sign to to do disturb. The coffee dispenser pour spout was filthy. Food was very good. Service and politeness ok. Wine per glass very good.

Friendly and intelligent service and a nice place. Great location and a good price. Overall a great little hotel which I will return to without hesitation. Breakfast also good and sets you up for the day.

This hotel is really lovely...on a quiet street in Greenwich Village, it truly feels like you're coming home to your own place every day/night. You enter and walk down steps into a romantic, dark and luxe reception area. The bar and restaurant serve delicious food and drinks and room service prices are not bad. The rooms are on the small side, but have lovely linens, a great shower with subway tiles, marble, etc. Nice little perks like free Frette slippers, Saratoga water and Bigelow products. We've dinged them one star for the quirky and rather confused service. Everyone was nice and helpful, quick but there were numerous missteps. Room service breakfast was delivered missing the coffee, and a promise to deduct the coffee never appeared. A doorman knocked on everyone's door asking if we had a "rotary or touch" phone...really disturbing everyone for no reason. Another doorman came to our door to take our luggage and we had not made a request - confused with someone else, then a follow up call again disturbing us...asking if we had or had not requested someone to come and get luggage. We left an empty tissue container and lotion bottle signaling that we needed more since we had to call to front desk the previous day, and the empty box and bottle were put back on the shelf with no replacements...and no washcloths either. We took to leaving notes for the maid to replace things so we didn't have to call to the front desk. On the plus side, the bartender made a spectacular margarita that was very specific to my request, and all of the various hotel services were quick. So, a lovely lovely place, but their well-intentioned service could use some work.
user_name:
Diane D
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: Such a cute boutique hotel with a gorgeous lobby, quaint furniture and nice and tidy rooms. We checked in at night and despite the restaurant and bar inside, it was quiet and cozy. The staff was very nice as they helped us in and complimentary robe and slippers waiting in your room!

Walker Hotel's Service is 5 Stars!!!! We have a corporate account with Walker and the two ladies that helps us with bookings (Linda and Anastasia) are superb! Best customer service we can ask for. They get back to us about all our needs in light-speed time. We love working with them. The restaurant is one of the most delicious ones I've been to in NY, and very fairly priced.Thank you so much for everything!
user_name:
Kate S
New York City, New York

review_body: Great boutique hotel. Easy access to 5th avenue. Stylish. Friendly staff. Doorman and bellman Josh is the BEST. Made us feel so at home. Took extra care to make sure we had everything we needed. Appreciate his service, friendliness, and professionalism.
user_name:
Gms728
New York City, New York

review_body: we stayed two nights in a room with two double beds. We were two adults (sisters) and a 13 year old daughter. The beds/pillows were comfy, the "double" beds seemed smaller than a normal double bed, but it was fine w/ an adult and child sharing. Not an overly spacious room, but not unusual for NYC. Beautiful city view w/ large window. Very nice bathroom with WONDERFUL water pressure in shower. Very "boutique" hotel atmosphere in the lobby, nicely decorated rooms.

Very convenient location, very friendly and accommodating staff- just what I needed. The room was large enough to not feel like I was in a dorm room, and room service helped a ton. Couldn't ask for a better place in the city.

I really loved this great boutique hotel situated in a great neighborhood. The staff was great, very helpful and accommodating. The bottled water in the room and super comfy and well decorated rooms were perfect for our last night in NYC. Josh was really super great! I would definitely go back to this hotel!

This hotel is convenient and a beautiful, quiet escape from the busy avenues of 5th and 6th. We could walk anywhere, or conveniently eat downstairs. The hotel is across from the our son's school, making it quite convenient to attend his performances. Bed was comfortable, and hotel staff was very welcoming and most important to me - not stuffy - they seemed happy to relate to the guest, and we found that above all most impressive. I give this hotel a 4 out of 5 rating only due to these 2 minor issues- 1)The breakfast staff is slow, though the menu is a choice of 4 possibilities. Food was good, but not at all complicated enough for the slow service...especially for coffee service and ordering. On our last day, there were 2-3 servers, but they seemed way too overwhelmed and took forever to even bring us coffee or take our order. 2 tables on either side of us were very frustrated. I didn't understand, as the breakfast menu is not complicated (only 4 possibilities, and 3 are combination of basic toast with a combination of avacado+ poached egg )or salmon atop), and side of a potato like latke + mixed greens, or a pancake order). and shouldn't have affected the wait staff in being inattentive for coffee or refills. 2.) While it is nice to have the bed turned down for you early evening, often we'd been out all day and returned exhausted and desperately needing nap only to be bothered by a knock every.single.evening/time.just as we were nodding off. A nice gesture, yes, but a bit much. Other than that, I did LOVE the hotel and will be back!

My partner and I recently stayed at The Jade (now known as The Walker) on a Saturday night of our anniversary weekend in late March 2016. Wanting to be in the heart of the Village, but not on a loud block, The Jade was perfect. Situated on W13th between 5th and 6th Avenues (aka Ave of the Americas), the block is quiet but also just around the corner from stores, restaurants, and cafes. Washington Sq Park and Union Sq are only a few blocks away, providing for ample access routes to many subways to the rest of Manhattan and beyond. Seeing as it was a special weekend, I reserved the Greenwich Penthouse Room, which offered amazing, unfettered views uptown, including the Empire State Building from our own private terrace. If it wasn't windy and 35-degrees Fahrenheit, we might have spent our entire stay taking in the view from the terrace or from the giant soaking tub with the same views as from the terrace. It just doesn't get more romantic. From check-in to check-out and all points in between, the staff were friendly, amenable, and even wished us a Happy Anniversary upon arrival and later sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne to the room. Just perfect. A week after staying at The Jade, I received an email that the name was changing to The Walker. I'm unsure if the management was changing hands or had already done so, but nevertheless, our stay was excellent. Many thanks to the hotel staff for making a special weekend all the better! We will most definitely return.
user_name:
mastodfow
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A gem of a hotel, lovely neighborhood, the staff were always helpfull, beautiful rooms, we even had our own private outside area. The bar and restaurant is a great place to relax after a long day of exploring. We were also lucky enough to enjoy restaurant week in the area, so many great places to go nearby. Also a short stroll to the sub way, very convenient . I believe the hotel has changed names, now part of the Walker group of hotels.

Location is great. Hotel staff are just fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble. Rooms are very nice but as in NY on the small size. Would stay again. Being British we booked a Queen Size bed, thinking it was a large bed but it was smaller than our double beds. Have never slept in such a small bed. Book King at least.

Comfortable, quiet and in a great location. Good value. Bedrooms on the small side but very clean. Restaurant food good. Staff friendly. Decor dark and masculine. Free bottled water in bedroom and umbrellas for rainy days

Came to the city for business and pleasure. Our room was perfect. The customer service was awesome. We especially enjoyed the little bar and all of the staff members who took care of us. The location was just right. We will definitely return to The Jade.

This is a charming boutique hotel, very well located on West 13th Street across from The New School. It has a lovely lounge and restaurant area decorated in soothing velvets. Wine and snacks are available in the lounge and there is even a wine happy hour. The lounge has little nooks and crannies for privacy. The rooms are on the small side, but clean and pretty. The staff ids friendly and accommodating. Like all NYC hotels, it isn't cheap, but put it on your radar for deals.

As a frequent traveler to NYC, I have stayed at dozens of hotels, starting in the early 1980's and continuing to the present. I don't think you can find a smaller, more cramped hotel room in the city. The hallway to my room was barely wide enough to fit the modest luggage I had. No dresser to put your clothes in, just a closet for hanging (bring hangable underwear.....). On top of it all the employees and very young, inexperienced and clueless. You cant do worse for the price, and that says it all in this city. I will never consider staying here again.

My wife and I just spent three nights at the Jade Hotel. It was a good stay, and a very good value given the price of hotels in New York.The staff were really nice, the bartender (Ian) was friendly and good. That locals go to the hotel bar and restaurant is evidence that it's a good place to get drink and dinner.The rooms are very small, even by New York standards, but that's fine. They are comfortable and convenient - and one doesn't got to New York to hang out in your room.The location was great for our interests (galleries, an event we were in NY to attend), really convenient.A heads up that our room was very dry (we were in the 3rd floor). The windows open a bit, which helped bring in fresh air and let out some of the dry, but we both drank a lot of water. Not a reason not to stay there - but know to bring water.We would stay there again.

My teenage daughter and I had just spent a weekend at the Jade. We had a charming room with an amazing view of downtown manhattan. We had the best service in every way from front desk to porter to restaurant staff. Felt like home as soon as we checked in. Loved being downtown. Thank you.

This hotel is in a great location. The staff was on top of absolutely everything, two double bed room was spacious. Beds were very comfortable. Bar and restaurant very hip space. Would highly recommend.

I was overall happy with the Jade. It was very clean and had a great location. Only reason for 4 stars is because they wouldn't allow me a late check out which I've never encountered in my life. Also night staff tends to be more friendly then the morning staff. I'd stay here again and recommend to a friend.

We stayed 2 nights here for our anniversary. The service we received was impeccable. I've stayed at many hotels over the years and stayed in 5 star hotels who never gave me the wonderful service I received here. Everyone was friendly and the hotel itself had a really cool vibe. It had a vintage glamour feel and even though it was a small hotel it had such huge personality in the details. They even brought us complimentary champagne for our anniversary with a handwritten note. That detail alone made our day even more special. Thank you jade!The location was perfect and lots of places within reasonable walking distance. We visited all the way down to the 9/11 memorial and then over to the Chelsea Market. We walked everywhere and coming back to the jade was nice at the end of the day. Our room was on the 13th floor and we had a queen size bed. The size of the room was way bigger than I was expecting. It was very roomy and the bathroom was nice too. The water pressure was amazing. It is a weird thing I have about places I stay. I am picky about the water pressure and how quickly the sink drains. The jade got an A+ in both lol The room also had two robes and slippers. We also came back early from our day to watch the finale of The Walking Dead and the reception was perfect. I had other hotels that constantly list signal but it didn't happen during our stay there. We also had dinner at the restaurant downstairs in one of the red velvet booths. Dinner was amazing and the drinks were fantastic. Reasonably priced as well. Make sure you leave a good tip for the wait staff here. They have excellent service and are very helpful. It was a bit slow that night we went but we were sat immediately and given undivided attention. I will be staying here again the next time I visit New York. Thank you for a perfect anniversary stay!!!

Stayed in the West Village after a few days staying up near Central Park. Could not wait to get back to The Jade. Quiet, calm, lovely, welcoming. Like a breath of fresh air. I've stayed at The Jade before, but wanted to show my husband the hotel on this trip. Another great stay! Lovely room, delicious cocktails and flatbread . . . helpful staff. All made for a perfect visit.

The Jade Hotel is a very nice boutique hotel. Our room, however, was really small - just a couple of feet to navigate your way around the bed. Furnishings are nice, bathroom was good, staff professional and friendly. Most of our activities were in the theatre district and uptown, so The Jade's location was not the best for us. Nearest subway stop was a bit of a walk. I would compare price point and location of your intended activities with other hotels - The Jade might suit your needs. I like The Jade Hotel, but its location did not suit us.

We stayed at the Jade Hotel while my daughter was touring NYU. It was a spur-of-the-moment trip. Booked at 11pm the night before, rate was very good for NYC -- under $280. We arrived around 11 am and were able to get into our room right away. We had two doubles, which was perfect. The beds were very comfortable, with nicely starched sheets. It was very clean and cozy. I appreciated the free bottled water. The front desk staff were professional and efficient. The 5-7 pm happy hour downstairs is a good deal. 1/2 off on wine and flatbread. We ordered the smoked salmon flatbread and were surprised when it arrived -- it was the size of a small pizza with generous portions of salmon on top. Delicious! We didn't need dinner afterwards. Definitely take advantage of this offer.

The hotel is lovely and appears modern. Nice balcony in my room. I was upgraded to the penthouse. Rooms are small but there is enough space. Complimentary wifi and bottled water was great. Service was great.Will stay here again

Everything about our stay at this little gem of a hotel was terrific. My boyfriend treated me to a birthday weekend in NYC, and the staff made sure to make it special! A bottle of wine with a delicious desert and fruit was there upon our arrival. The rooms are small but very clean and well appointed with very soft sheets and a comfy mattress. Breakfast in the restaurant was wonderful and the service impeccable. We love the West Village, so the location is great...so many great restaurants, galleries and shops. We are already planning another trip for May!

The hotel is nicely located close to very nice restaurants. Area is pretty quite.For our standards the rooms could have a bit more place to store luggage. The bar is excellent and the burger in the resto is a must

My wife and I were planning a NYC trip to do some sight-seeing and to attend an event at some friends' apartment in Greenwich Village, and discovered The Jade Hotel on a map when looking up the location of our friends' apartment. The hotel's location on W. 13th was perfect for our needs and when we saw the photos on the website, we were hooked! From the lobby to the bar, the restaurant to the rooms, the art deco theme throughout the hotel is stylish and classic. We were warmly greeted upon our arrival by Brian, who helped us with our bags. The check-in experience was very pleasant. Every staff person we met was congenial and expressed interest in the comfort of our stay. We stayed 3 nights, and every time we saw Brian, he inquired about our daily experiences. He provided very helpful information about the area. Our room was on the 12th floor with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. We found the one queen room to be spacious for a NYC boutique hotel room. It was quiet and there was plenty of light. Our room was made up each day and the beds were turned down each night with a piece of chocolate on the pillows. There are only 2 elevators and they tend to be slow, so allow time for a wait, especially in the mornings. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant each morning and enjoyed the decor as well as the impeccable service. The attractive lobby with the warm fireplace was a welcome sight each time we returned from our sight-seeing. We had a late afternoon flight out on our departure date, so the hotel staff was gracious enough to store our luggage. They even offered to have a cab ready for us that afternoon. There was a mix-up with our luggage and another guests' luggage and the transportation to the airport, resulting in the necessity of our taking a more expensive mode of transportation than we had requested. When we arrived at the airport and called the hotel, they not only agreed to refund our credit card the difference, they credited us the amount of the entire ride! This is a classy hotel in looks and service, and the rate is within the range of what one would expect in NYC. We have stayed in Times Square on our previous visits to NYC, but we will definitely return to The Jade Hotel in the future.

The hotel has good-sized rooms (for NYC or London!) and is a good location on the lower west side. The rooms are in very good condition and include the usual amenities (tv, robes mini bar etc).Staff are very friendly and overall experience is a positive one, but I do have to mark them down for their housekeeping. One day our room wasn't made up at all - we got back from a day out and someone had taken the "do not disturb" sign from inside the room & put it on the door. this can only have been house keeping as we hadn't used it all trip.also on the last morning, housekeeping knocked on the door before 9am to try to clear the room (despite the fact we hadn't checked out) rather than waiting until we'd left the room and doing it then.Overall a good hotel, which would have been a great hotel, if it wasn't let down by its housekeeping staff.

I've been to the Jade before and it has great rooms. This time around, however, my travel plans were constantly changing and the reservation person, Kitty Ching, was not only incredibly patient with several reservation changes, but also, in the end, helped me select a great room with a complimentary upgrade. It is this type of personal touch that is only one of the reasons that makes the Jade a great hotel - you feel important as a guest (and the room amenities are great, as well as the bar and restaurant).
user_name:
Doug G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at the Jade to celebrate her birthday. The reviews were good and the hotel seemed interesting. To say we enjoyed the stay would be an understatement. The hotel itself is very comfortable and appealing. The downstairs lounge areas, decor make it unique from most other hotels. We chose to treat ourselves with a penthouse room, with a balcony that had a great view of the city and Empire State Building. But room aside, what made our time there extra special were the people. Staff was incredible - the front desk team, especially Nancy, were awesome - as were the bellmen and Kitty, who set us up with the reservations. They were all true professionals, and sincerely cared that we enjoyed our visit. I travel a lot, and often stay in the city for business - and I can honestly stay this was one of the better experiences I've ever had. Thanks to all at the Jade for making that happen!

This was a beautiful boutique hotel hidden in the West Village. The staff front desk staff were extremely nice and accommodating as well as all of the bellmen. Nancy, Adrianne, Irving, Brian and Joe all went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful room and a fantastic experience all the way around. The only one negative that we experienced was housekeeping. Although the rooms were made up everyday on two separate occasions we had to request toilet paper and it took quite a while to get it. Other than that one small issue, I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this beautiful hotel.

Great bar and food. Staff are lovely and really helpful but..the rooms are just dreadful. Painted brown, dark, small double beds, glass door to bathroom, hardly any storage space at all A great place if travelling on your own and just staying for a night or two but anything longer I wouldn't recommend

Really liked this hotel, was very cozy and oldish on a good way. It's charming. :) The room I had was very small but it was OK for me. I went to the resturant ones and was very satisfied. And the service was good from all. Would def recommend this hotel. :)

The crew at the Jade are professionals in hospitality. Bob, in Maintenance, Nancy and Brian at the front: all were very friendly and conversational. Joe was generous in helping us out with some special needs we had for our James Beard event. I loved staying here. The lobby is comfortable and quaint. The team at the Jade Hotel sets the bar in Service Professionals. A very admirable crew. The shower is powerful, spacious, and hot as hades. The bed was soft and comfortable. Thanks Jade!

I strongly recommend this hotel.The service is very good, the employees of all areas are very nice. I had a problem with the heating system (it was very cold), an engineer came two times to try to fix it, he couldn't and they immediately change my room helping with everything.The room is quite big compared with most of the hotels in NY, the furniture is modern bout cozy. The bathroom has a standard size but very nice decorated. The shower (pressure of water) is amazing.The restaurant of the hotel is really nice and very well served.The location is good but is between Union Square (3 blocks) and Meatpacking District (6 blocks). You can walk even to the Soho (13 blocks).Free internet for as many as devices you have.

The decor is Art Deco 1930's. The bathroom is gigantic done in black & white subway tiles. The bed is comfortable and the view from 1705 is fabulous - the Empire State Building is directly up the street (about 30 blocks). The staff is very friendly and helpful. I regret I was only there one night and look forward to returning!

This is a pleasant and chic hotel in a good area. Clientel and staff are mostly young and, particularly at night, it swings. But, the young and enthusiastic staff often get it wrong. Twice our room was not made upby 4.30 pm and until I complained, mostly bad co ordination.Tried to fob us off with a free drink. Insulting. Sound proofing also needs attention. We learnt alot about the lovemaking of the room adjacent couple. Still it was comfortable and the rate was acceptable. Stan.

This is an ok boutique hotel in the northern section of Greenwich Village. The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and furnished in an Art Deco style. When we checked in, our room was warm, around 74 degrees and when I switched the thermostat to cool, the setting was already down to around 60, but warm air was only blowing out. I know that some hotels switch to heat only in the winter and I thought this must have been the case, so I thought no big deal- I'll open a window and turn on the fan to drown out the noise and we will deal with it. However, the fan on the on setting only blew out warm air also and soon the room was at 77 degrees. As it was late and my wife was already in bed, I did not wish to call the front desk and have an engineer come in, so we left the Windows open, but because of our proximity to 6th avenue and the foot traffic , it was pretty noisy all night and the room never cooled off that much. Needless to say, we did not sleep well.The next morning, I immediately reported the problem to the front desk and the front desk person said he would report the problem to engineering. As I sat in the lobby drinking my coffee that morning, at least 2 other guests complained about the same issue and were told by another front desk worker that the problem was that the system was in heat only mode, but that engineering would be making an adjustment that day. Temperatures were expected to rise to the upper 50's that weekend. Don't they pay attention to the same weather reports we do?Anyway, when we returned back to our room late that afternoon , it was obvious that nothing had changed with the heat situation, so I reported that to the front desk and she apologized for "our inconvenience" and suggested we turn the system to off and the fan to auto and somehow this was supposed to moderate the room temperature . Huh? Shortly thereafter an engineer knocked on the door and flipped the setting to cool and said that the room would cool down. I felt the warm air coming out of the vent and told him I don't think so. He was pretty short, so he put his hand on the return in the hall ceiling and said feel this, it's not hot. I had to explain to him that he was feeling air being sucked into the return . That's where the warm air enters the cooling system . I had him stretch to feel the warm air being expelled from the vents and he still insisted we let the system run and the room would cool down. Ok, right. An hour later, and the temp rose from 73 to 75. I marched down to the front desk and asked if we could try another room . I once again explained what we went through the previous night and again was told "sorry for your inconvenience". I explained that I consider this much more than a mere "inconvenience" . I would consider not having your room serviced an inconvenience . This was much worse. I paid for something I did not receive- a good nights sleep. She was helpful and took me to a room on a lower floor. And immediately upon entering it was much more comfortable temperature wise. It was a handicap accessible room which was larger. The only down side was the whole bathroom was basically open with only a curtain separating the shower, but there was cool air coming from the vents and my wife and I slept like babies. Only an OK place, probably will avoid in the future. If you want to stay in the Union Square/Greenwich area pay a little more and stay at the Hyatt or the W.

This hotel is a trendy well run gem. Cool bar with a good restaurant and excellent service. The rooms are SMALL! At least mine was. Even so, I will be back. You can't beat the location as it was close to the clubs and restaurants we wanted to visit.

It is very well positioned and it looks beautiful, but I just thought that it wasn't very well run. Apart from it taking over 2 hours to get our room service, and on another night the hotel bar and restaurant being off limits to guests - there some things that really nagged me, namely he fact that noise in the hallway seems to be amplified into your room and unfortunately the service maids like a good chat at 7am so we got woken to the soothing tones of two loud Spanish ladies probably pondering when these lazy gringoes were getting up so they could clean our room. The rooms were a little small compared to hotels in NY we have stayed in for similar rates.Also, one thing that really surprised me was how the fire stairwells were cluttered with chairs, cleaning equipment, rubbish bags and paraphasia etc. it is a real dumping ground for the staff. Too bad if they are actually needed one day.When looking at the menu, don't forget the mandatory service charge on top of the self imposed tip they will charge you. You have no choice in what they charge here.I wouldn't stay here again.
user_name:
EdS942
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent service. The front desk staff was very helpful, and gave lots of good tips on places to visit, nearby restaurants and travel. Clean and very well-appointed room (small but comfortable). Excellent independent restaurant in the lobby with a varied menu. Great location, a wonderful place to stroll around. A warm and inviting lobby where they also serve drinks and food.

I thought the jade was nice. The rooms had an appropriate size and the decoration was nice. I did however find the service not so good - the reception had no clue and nobody helped to carry our heavy suitcases up and down the staircase to the street.

Smallish and stylish, The Jade has everything we enjoy for a quick trip to the city or a pre or post flight perch.The West Village location affords accessibility to a great mix of must-visit shops (Bigelow! ABC!) And favorite neighbor restaurants while retaining some of the feel of a familiar neighborhood.A big plus is the very good restaurant, ideal for business or social connections. Looking forward to our next visit.

The Jade is a small hotel with excellent service. Great bar,nice looking dining room although we didn't eat there. Close by the James Beard House. Rooms are small but well done.It's a great location to access other New York amenities.
