Had a quick weekend trip to NYC and chose this gem because it was near where my sister was staying. What a find!! My room was perfectly spacious and really comfortable. Bed was dreamy! Even the bathroom was just the right size. I have to add that as a solo traveler, the room and bathroom may have felt tighter if my SO was with me, but I really enjoyed the space. The service was very, very good too. Everyone was thoughtful and accommodating. The one glitch I had was when I went down to the restaurant to get a cup of coffee to-go on Sunday morning at 7 am, and there was no one in the restaurant -- manager or wait staff -- to help me. The poor night shift cook had to come up from the kitchen and scramble around to find me coffee, and it was lukewarm at best. Nevertheless, my stay was delightful and the staff was really pleasant and welcoming. Would totally stay here again and will recommend it to anyone looking for accommodations in the Village/Chelsea/Soho/Downtown-ish area. I thought it was a great value (got my rate from their "specials" page) and I hope it remains so!

Stayed for 4 nights last week and the hotel is perfect for a city break! Perfect location, not even a 10 minute walk from Greenwich/Meatpacking districts but very accessible to all other districts too.The hotel itself is small and decorated in an art deco style with friendly staff and a lovely bar. The hotel was cosy and warm with a lovely fire in reception which helped as it was so COLD! Our room was on the third floor and actually surprisingly big for what I was expecting from an NY hotel. Price was okay for New York considering the calibre and location of too. Very happy with our choice and would stay here again.

I stayed for 4 nights last week on a business trip. I had such an amazing time, the hotel is beautiful and Martha Anne, the sales manager, was very kind. I felt well taken care of by the friendly front desk staff and the bellman. I cant say enough about the service and the quality of the hotel. Great design and extremely clean.

We stayed here on and off for 2 weeks while using NY as a base for some travel. The staff are amazing - every single person on th team made us feel welcome and it was like a home away from home. Rooms are on the smaller side but perfectly appointed for comfort and had everything we needed. The location couldn't be better - It made you feel like a real local rather than staying in more traditional tourist areas. The local bars and restaurants are amazing and we found our regular favourites all within walking distance. Thank you to all the team at the Jade - we will be back !

Gorgeous room and very clean, great bed linens. Size good per New York City standards. Awesome friendly staff. Close to subway station. Great location, friendly area. We had a gorgeous view from the 16th floor. Nice bar with good happy hour for drinks and appetizers. I did not use the restaurant.

I spent two nights at the Jade Hotel on a business trip. The bellman, front desk and general staff could not have been friendlier. The room was tight, but there was room to walk around both sides of the bed and the bathroom was more spacious than I anticipated, however it was a bit tight with my make up, curling iron, etc etc and probably could have benefited from another shelf somewhere in the bathroom. My in room safe was also bot functioning, but I didn't worry about it enough to alert he front desk. I used the efficient and clean gym twice on my stay. There is two treadmills and one eliptical with a small area for the use of free weights. I never had to wait to use a machine and people came in and out quickly. I really could not have been happier with the room, staff and location of the hotel.

I arrived early a.m. and wonderful front desk staff were very accommodating. It snowed all day, making the cosy welcome even better. Decor in my room had a touch of the bordello (velvet, dark colors) but not overwhelming. Great bathroom. I also enjoyed very much the restaurant on site where I got great green juice. Location is great, easy access to walk all over West Village. Staff were very helpful to get me to an early train the morning I left.

New York is hit and miss. It seems even the worst hotels have a good photographer. The Jade is simply a great hotel. The rooms are clean, well maintained and decorated true to it's DNA. The rooms are cozy - but normal size for New York. Bed is VERY comfortable and no noisy AC/Heater unit. Only negative: Wireless never worked.And true to my name: the shower rates EXCELLENT. 10/10 for water pressure. 10/10 for products. 10/10 for design and size.

Arriving at the Jade from the outside very nice. Has the look of a Paris/New Orleans hotel. Staff very nice but that is where is ends. I did read that the rooms were small, but you can't even change your mind in them. Maybe good for 1 person for 1 night but any longer than that and you would go crazy. There is no place to put anything. I thought only 1 night should be OK. The walls so thin at 3 in the morning when another guest was knocking on the door down the hall it was like they were in your room. And the doors all slam shut. The heat when it goes on and off makes a loud bang. The beds very low to the floor. We were resigned to get up early and out. When my husband called for the car we were told we had to walk to the garage to get it ourselves. That meant taking your luggage with you and walking to get your car. REALLY!! Wasn't sure how they took the car there for us but we had to get it ourselves. We could have left the luggage behind, but try going around the block in NYC in the morning. Luckily the bellman helped us carry to the garage. Wow for 450.00 a night this is really not acceptable. Either lower your prices or find a way to get the car out of the garage. PS not told this when we checked in. Probably the first and last time staying there.

Loved staying here. A beautiful boutique hotel which offers the sort of service that only can come with these smaller hotels. Extremely professional service on the front desk from check in, to answering queries and check out. The vibe of the hotel is magnificent. Truly art deco, very comfortable and very cool. Loved all the old photos in the bar/restaurant which reflected stars who used to hang out in the area (Andy Warhol for example). We also had, in passing, mentioned in our contact with the hotel before arriving that we were coming back to NY to celebrate our first year of marriage - for which we came from Australia to NY to do in 2014. On New Years Eve we received a lovely complimentary bottle of champagne to celebrate this occasion. Such a kind and lovely gesture. Only very minor issues - firstly - no tea and coffee facilities or mini bar (I find this common in US hotels). You have to pay for tea and coffee which we find a little unusual (most hotels we've stayed in around the world offer this complimentary and god knows when you're traveling a good cuppa is super important!!) and the rooms, although beautiful and true to the art deco character, were really dimly lit. I understand this may be to keep to the theming of the hotel but at times it was a bit ridiculous. An extra light in the room would be beneficial.But really these are minor things - the rooms were exceptional clean, extremely comfortable and quite spacious by NYC standards. The bed was super comfy, the shower had awesome power and heat and the complimentary bathroom products were beautiful. We also had a room with a balcony which was a lovely touch. And location was fantastic - close to the subway, easy to hail a cab, fabulous to walk through but also in a quiet enough spot not to be woken by anything noisy. Love this city and love this hotel. Would highly recommend and we'll definitely stay there when we head back.

Top notch service from the doorman to the front desk, everyone was super nice. They found out it was my wife's birthday and when we go back to the room from our night out we found s bottle of champagne on ice with a handwritten note. Can't get any better. Thank you to the entire staff!

Really lovely hotel outside of the tourist trail. Rooms were an okay size for New York standards. Immaculately clean and stylish - Art Deco theme runs through the hotel. Staff were friendly and genuinely interested in their guests. For me, the location was perfect. Close enough to 5th Avenue and a 20 minute walk to mid-town. 10 minutes walk to the High Line. Fantastic.

We were greeted as soon as we stepped out of the cab and our luggage whisked off to Reception. Located in Greenwich Village between 5th and 6th with plenty of places within walking distance or via Subway. Art Deco style with friendly bar and restaurant. We had breakfast in once and couldn't fault it. The hotel is small by American standards but very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. They organised a spacious car for our return flight at JFK. Nothing was to much trouble.

Located on a fairly quiet side street, this older-but-renovated charmer of a building has the benefit of being close to a variety of attractions and multiple subway lines (F, M, 1-3, 4-6, possibly some others). The lobby is down a set of stairs into a softly lit, interestingly decorated space that is warm and inviting. Described as "Asian Art Deco", it could go very wrong in a tacky, Chinese restaurant way, but completely avoided this pitfall throughout the property. It was lovely.Check in was smooth, and the staff were very friendly, explaining the hotels amenities and services. My request for a high-floor room got me 1401 on the 14th floor with a fairly open light view south towards (but not of) the Freedom Tower/World Trade Center area. The room and storage space is indeed snug, as the other reviews point out. But it was a very comfortable space with a very nice, modern bathroom with C. O Bigelow products. I don't know if if would be good for people with small children, tons of luggage, or those who really want to be able to stroll around their rooms, but it was great for me.The location also put you within close range to a variety of restaurants, the big box shopping of Union Sq south, and other GV attractions. You really felt like you were in a a neighborhood and not just a commercial area frequented by tourists, which is a plus in my book. Though perhaps not for everyone, this is a delightful boutique hotel with a convenient location, helpful staff, and stylish interiors. Well worth considering for a stay in the area.

As a hotel professional my standards are very high and my eye for detail often comes off picky. However... This hotel experience was outstanding. The 1920s theme was executed so well, I loved the throwback! Room was very clean and well maintained. Only issue we found was the window open and latch broken upon check in, but Engineering was responsive and had it resolved in 30 mins or less. Room had a lot to offer, nice details and extra touches. Room service was very quick and food was delicious! For dessert I had ordered a peanut butter cheese cake but brought a regular cheesecake with a yellow sauce, was not good at all (but was not upset as I probably didn't need dessert anyways). Check in/out was smooth, all staff was very attentive and professional. Would definitely return in the future. Kudos to the Jade team!

it is a lovely hotel in a nice quiet location.The decor is beautiful in the hotel and rooms.We had a high floor room (15th floor ) and had a great view of the empire state building.My only concern was in leaving to travel to JFK i asked the reception desk to sort me a taxi and to get a fixed price.This they did and confirmed it was $65,including all tolls but not a tip,brilliant I thought.I got into the taxi and he was on his phone all the way to the airport,a little dangerous I felt and he demanded $85,I explained it was sorted through the hotel for $65,he knew nothing of this and I had to pay the extra fare and when I asked for a receipt he couldn't provide one.I was extremely unhappy that this excellent hotel use such taxi firms that ripoff customers ! or is it they are in it together.I have sent a complaint to them but have received no response.This is a great hotel but be wary of this taxi scam.

My Girlfriend and I stayed at the Jade for a few days over the New Year period and can't recommend the Jade highly enough. The hotel is set in the perfect location. It's close enough for all of the bright lights of Times square, the uptown 5th Avenue shopping and the calmness of Greenwich village. The staff were absolutely fantastic and helped make our stay wonderful and totally unforgettable. The hotel is beautifully designed and maintained and must have been recently renovated - its stunning from the outside too. The lobby and rooms have lovely designed touches and the large shower is impossible to leave once you turn it on. We never had the chance to dine in the good sized restaurent but it looked really cool - as did the bar. The Jade has got the lighting just right - its the perfect cosy retreat after a cold day exploring this unique and magnificent city. In fact they have got everything right. An absolute Manhattan must. A BIG New York portion sized thank you from both of us and hope to see you again soon!

Parked a block or so away and loaded with luggage and shopping bags, my friend and I were wondering aloud how to navigate our trip on foot to the garage as we were checking out when the young man behind the desk simply said, "i'll take the bags and help you get there." We both almost fell over, But before we did, he simply whisked our bags into the elevator, met us at the street side door, and escorted us to the garage. The most each of us carried was our coat and purse and perhaps a small shopping bag. The most amazing service ever and an even more memorable end to a memorable visit to the Big Apple. Loved loved loved this place!!!!!

This neo Deco hotel near the Village is a gem. The room is stylish and comfortable. The bar and restaurant have a great ambiance with a lot of clientele. An easy walk to attractions such as the Empire State Building. Good value!

I was looking for something nice, but wanted to be near the West Village and Soho. We had stayed previously at the Trump Soho, but never again due to our principles. Trip Advisor showed me the Jade Hotel (not to be confused with the Jane Hotel! I learned you have to give an address to the taxi drive or end up in the wrong place!). I booked it because the reviews were good, and the price was right for a boutique hotel. I am always a little leery of boutique hotels because of little things like bed squeaks and room service options that might not be right for us, but I went ahead and booked the family (5 all together) 3 rooms for three nights to try it out. I was pleasantly surprised. I fell in love with this hotel for several reasons. The location can't be beat. It is very central and walking distance to so many great restaurants, shopping... Union Square, Washington square Park, Village and Soho. The hotel staff were ALL very nice. I asked for names, but there were too many to remember and list! From check in to check out, each person was wonderful. They weren't just courteous, they were really nice... the front desk, the bellman, room service, housekeeping, and bartenders! That makes such a difference! The hotel is fairly new, so everything was very nice. It seems they spared no experience in the materials used to build and decorate. The rooms were spacious for NYC standards. All were nicely decorated, red/black exposed brick, tastefully vintage. The views from all of our rooms were great. The Empire State Bldg. views from our room on one side and the Freedom Tower view from my kid's rooms on the other side of the building. The bathrooms were clean, new and beautiful, marble and tile work floors and showers. The water pressure was great! The beds were comfortable, the sheets were fine, seemed new, they weren't luxurious, but weren't scratchy or bleach smelling, the towels were soft. Room service was very prompt. I loved the Grape & Vine Restaurant/Bar off the lobby. It was charming, quiet, great lighting, red velvet booths, exposed brick, beautiful tin ceiling, just the right ambience, with nice staff. I would like to say there is nothing wrong with this hotel. However, I will give a balanced review and say there was minimal that might cause a concern depending on what someone expects... such as, there was no minibar refrigerator, just a snack basket, and no ice machine, but 24 hour room service will bring ice up to you very promptly. The walls were a little thin, so you could hear everything in the hall, but our hallway was quiet as there are only about 5 rooms on a floor, so this didn't really bother us. I would recommend the higher floors for a better view. The penthouse is a bit more spacious, has an outdoor balcony area with views, and the bathroom has a very nice tub, but minimal counter space for makeup, etc. There is a magnifying mirror (not lighted). Also, sometimes the elevators can take a bit of time (not too bad), but only if you hit it at the wrong time - check in or check out. These are such minor things, that this place scored big with us, and we will be back. I almost didn't want to share this review for fear that once people become aware of this gem, it will become so popular that availability would be an issue.

Stayed for 5 nights with family in two twin rooms. Everything about the hotel is excellent . The rooms are quiet ,clean and very comfortable. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful . The manager went out of his way to ensure that we had a great stay ! Hotel is ideally situated for Greenwich Village and downtown Manhattan. The metro was a 5 minute walk giving easy access to Time square ,shops at 5th Avenue etc.Loads of bars and restaurants and plenty to do. Would recommend to anyone (but take loads of money.... You will need it )

For me personally, The Jade has to be the most perfect hotel I've visited. The decor is classically deco and the service is attentive but also subtle, exactly as it should be. I can also recommend the room service which is on a par with top quality City restaurants. One of the highlights of my stay in NYC.

In our most recent visit to NYC in early December, we decided to stay in Greenwich Village for the first time. We found The Jade Hotel on line and loved the quaintness of the hotel's appearance. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, the customer service we received was excellent! Not only is the hotel smaller and more quaint than the others I've stayed in during past visits, but the staff make you feel like you're their most important guest and make sure all your needs are met and then some. We loved everything about this hotel, from the cozy lobby with the seating area around the fire (where they will also serve you food and drinks) to the excellent bar and restaurant in the back, to our hotel room with the view of One World Trade Center. The room was small and if I could change anything it would have been to add just a few more square feet so there is somewhere to sit other than on the beds, however, with the great lobby to relax in, it was less of an issue. We would highly recommend staying at The Jade hotel for anyone who wants a nice relaxing place to stay while in NYC with the best customer service!

Yes, the rooms are very smal, including the closet and dresser. And if I was staying a long time, it might make me reconsider this hotel. But that is the only complaint I have. Everything else was top notch. Clean, well decorated, well appointed with a safe, robe, and lighting (why are so many hotel rooms too dark?), and some of the nicest staff members I have ever encountered from the moment we walked up to the front desk until the man greeted us at the door as we left. And I thought it was a great value. Even free bottle water and wifi. On top of it all, they were especially kind to my wife when they discovered it was her birthday. The Jade is now my number one hotel in NYC.

We stayed in the Jade Hotel in September 2015 when we visited NYC for the US Open tennis. It is a fabulous small hotel with extremely friendly staff which we would stay in again and again when we return to NYC. Everything about this hotel was great: from the beautifully decorated rooms, to the fantastic food (fried chicken to die for...), the amazing bar staff (especially during happy hour 5-7pm every night!) and the excellent location for navigating around Manhattan. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel a little more intimate but with great service and style!

The staff was lovely; decor was very classy, rooms were very clean. We expected small rooms--this is a boutique hotel in Greenwich Village, and we wanted character. The art deco vibe is very tastefully done, and the restaurant on-site is gorgeous, if slightly overpriced. Our room was street-side but there was no street noise at all. Now, this is an older building, so there are issues to be expected. I mentioned the small room, and this did not bother us, but be aware that storage for big bags in the room is non-existent other than a small wardrobe. The free in-room wifi was very slow to connect and connections dropped frequently. Our room had some plumbing issues--the shower was very slow to drain and the toilet was sometimes reluctant to flush completely, and the hot water was ENTIRELY too hot--as in scalding hot--and the shower controls were very temperamental. Also the walls are very thin, as they often are in old buildings--we could hear our neighbors having a very romantic time late, late into the night. No big deal, but a little soundproofing would go a long way. The biggest issue for us was the thermostat in the room, which we set to 70 and put on "cool," but which continually blew out warm-to-hot air. Our room was frequently stifiling--remedied by opening the window, but certainly not ideal. We would consider staying again, but I'm not sure the price matches the quality and/or the amenities. But nice location and lots of good character.

I arrived at about 11 pm after a long trans-Atlantic flight. So I got real deflated when I got to my very tiny, stuffy and dreary room. I was too tired to do anything but shower and sleep. After talking to a number of front desk staff and another unhappy sleep, it was a pleasant surprise that Alex at the reception allocated me a bigger, lighter and airy room with great views of NYC. Thus restored my faith in people and instantly turned a miserable stay into an exciting holiday. I was able to appreciate the interesting decor, old styles radio and Telephone. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The gym though small was adequate as there were virtually no other patrons using it. The only downside was not having coffee/tea amenities in the room. Breakfast was great served by very friendly staff. The location is accessible to all modes of transport and in a quiet area of the village.

The location of the Jade Hotel is great, walking distance to great neighborhoods, easy access to cabs, busses and subway.Our room was on the 16th floor with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building.But, the room is just too small to accommodate two adults for a week….. The room has a tiny cabinet - filled with ironing board, iron and a safe. That leave no place, as in absolutely NO place for any clothes. Living out of 3 suitcases on the floor, we had to jump to the bed and bathroom. To open them, we had to put them on the bed- as the floorspace wasn't big enough to open any of them.I know New York hotel rooms are small, but in this case…too small for comfort or just getting dressed.

I stayed here one night. It's a perfect location of you're spending time in the Village. The hotel was quaint. The front desk was wonderful and helpful. The rooms were not typical NY small. My room was clean with all the amenities that were advertised. The bed was comfortable. Great night sleep. The hotel bar and restaurant attracted a very fun crowd. Great food and atmosphere. Put this hotel on your list for your next visit to NYC.

Cannot praise highly enough.Gorgeous hotel with wonderful staff and in a great location to a more village feel New York.I'd highly recommend and would stay here again without hesitation.Super clean and the restaurant was beautiful with delicious food.Room was small but perfectly formed...

Stayed here in October 2015. The hotel is charming and comfortable, the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but clean, and the location is perfect if you like the village. There are great restaurants and shops within walking distance. I'd stay here again.

Sofia and the desk staff here are absolute pros!!! The Jade Hotel speaks for itself in terms of luxury, hipness and style - but it's their staff that separates them from the pack. It can be pricey but if you can secure a room well in advance on a slow week night, this is the place to stay. Thanks Sofia!!!!! You're great at what you do... Johnny
user_name:
John P
New York City, New York

review_body: Really nice part of the Village. Very nice people running the place. Housekeeping does a great job. Love the room decor and amazingly comfy beds. The place is so altogether attractive and well priced. A very good value, unbeatable location.

What a charming hotel in so many respects. It's Art Deco style means it looks charming and the staff are charming too. Situated at the edge of Greenwich Village it's has a charmed location to boot. You can simply turn left or right out of the hotel and set off investigating and you won't be disappointed.New York hotel rooms can be small and our queen sized room was just that, but it was lovely. With a great ensuite and powerful shower to help relax those stiff legs, tired from all the walking the day before. Thanks Jade et al - we love you and you helped make ours a truly wonderful week.

This hotel is a reasonably priced hotel in the west village. I usually like to stay in this neighborhood or nearby. The hotel is on a quiet street in the west village. Upon entering one encounters an unconventional lobby on different levels. The reception desk is around the side and the staff at the desk are quite pleasant and helpful. The bar area looked cool but I didn't experience it. My room (1307) was on the 13th floor and had a great view of the Empire State Building! Nice treat to have some view in NYC! The room was small but not uncomfortably so. It was easy being the only person in the room. The bathroom was smallish but the shower was larger and comfortable. The water was quite hot! Overall I was quite satisfied with my stay and I will be staying here again in the future. Free wifi was a plus in this day and age. There was complimentary bottled water, which was replenished upon housekeeping and by request. Nice touch.

I was dehydrated from the long hall flight and greeted on arrival by attentive staff who immediately offered me a drink whilst waiting to check in - fabulous service from the outsetRooms were comfy and cosy with lovely toiletries and plenty of complimentary water/teas etc.The staff were excellent in recommending restaurants and a local nail salon! I didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on quality.Fast checkout and the bill copy in email all bonuses!Highly recommend.

The Jade Hotel is a lovely, inviting and very chic boutique hotel. While the rooms are on the small side, they are beautifully appointed, with comfortable beds, a state of the bathroom and most importantly to me...my room was QUIET! The restaurant and bar area is intimate and pretty...we had made dinner reservations elsewhere prior to our trip, but I wished we had had the opportunity to dine there!

Well this didn't work out.I chose the Jade because a friend had stayed there and recommended it to me. I was in the city for one night and I saw that it popped up on "Hotel Tonight" at a good rate, so I booked it. On arrival I requested a king sized bed. Nope, the young woman at the desk said they don't have any. Ok, how about a queen I asked. Nope, she said they had them but they don't give them to people who book through Hotel Tonight. (!) She actually put it that way. So she gave me a double. Well I went up to the room to check it out. The elevator took, no kidding, about 5 minutes to arrive. The room was so tiny the two beds barely fit in it. I only stayed in the room long enough to book another, much better, hotel (about the same price WITH a king bed) on my phone. Then went back down gave her back my keys and left. Since Hotel Tonight charges you immediately it was an expensive lesson.

Some many hotels define themselves as 'boutique hotel' today but this is the case. Nicely refurbished, not-so-small rooms, beautiful fireplace in the lobby: all with excellent taste. Weakest points: room cleaning not impeccable and room cabinet practically inexistent.

Definitely stay there again. Room was nice. Staff friendly. Clientele pretty nice too. Had breakfast in hotel rest. and it was also good.You won't steal it. It "ain't" cheap but, it is NYC, nothing is. It is a decent value though.You won't feel as if you got screwed.I think it's probably nicest hotel in Village.

We usually stay midtown when we visit NYC for business but this time we opted for something different and I'm so glad we did. The Jade Hotel from arrival to departure was excellent. We had a problem with our room and they made our move to another room pain free. The staff were so apologetic and offered us all sorts as a sorry. They bent over backwards to accommodate us which was so sweet as doesn't always happen in hotels.Our room was a good size. The bathroom perhaps on the small side but had everything we needed. The location is excellent. Right by the Subway. Easy walk to Greenwich, Union Square and surrounding areas. The bar/restaurant in the hotel is good and gets quite busy. We will definitely stay at the Jade on our next trip!

We stayed the weekend at this hotel as we wanted to join the Village Halloween Parade. And this hotel is just at the corner for 13st and 6th Avenue which is where the parade passes through. So it's really excellent choice for us. We can just run back if we need anything or to use the bathroom. Also save us the hassle of getting transportation to the parade. The hotel is very classy, artsy and service is excellent. Everyone from the bellboy, reception to waiters had been excellent. Our room is small but cosy and what I like is it provides slippers and high end toiletries. Only thing that I didn't like was the air condition/heater in our room which was very noisy and also the pillow which was a bit lumpy and does not provide good neck support. We ended up not using the heater as we couldn't sleep. I do have to warned that on Halloween night it can get very noisy with the police/ambulance sirens going off till 5am!

On a quiet (there is such a thing!?!) street in Greenwich with shopping and great restaurants nearby, this small hotel is well appointed. The staff is friendly and competent; the beds are super comfortable. The rooms are well furnished and reasonably sized considering location.

The staff’s cheery attention to excellent service is unmatched. The restaurant/bar is cozy and cool. Awesome happy hour specials, including delicious salmon flatbread. Rooms are small, but clean. Beds are very comfortable. Love the small touches like slippers and robes, and warm cream for your morning coffee. Shout out to doorman Josh who went above and beyond to hail us a cab, so we wouldn’t be late for dinner, and kept us entertained with funny stories. Another night, a waiter quickly navigated a bustling bar scene and brought us cocktails to take back to our room. Seriously! As an anniversary treat, the hotel surprised us with dessert and a complimentary bottle of champagne. Wow! One small ding - elevators are too dark inside. All in all, love the Jade! Can’t wait to return.

Chose jade hotel months ago after a fair bit of research. Decided to go with Greenwich penthouse room. I think you probably pay $100 more per night for a great bathroom and view (no problem with this)Rooms are not huge. But big enough for a 3 night stay. I will suggest to hotel that they put a little more storage in by way of hooks ( wall by door/ side of wardrobe/ bathroom) (nowhere to hang big jackets for example ) easy fix. Also a small table in bathroom would be useful.Nowhere to put cases in room/ designers should have spec'd beds with storage under ;) (guess you could store empty cases on balcony or in luggage storage) Bathtub fills super quickly and its massive! Shower is really powerful. Housekeeping should have topped up bathroom products a bit more.Beds are super comfy. Sheets/ pillows/ duvet - lovely. Towels fluffy.Radio in room is great so you can have some entertainment without TV on.Lift is fast. Bar is relaxed- and good happy hour. Staff have been super friendly and accommodating. A credit to the hotel.Location is great. Pretty easy to walk where ever from hotel. Only one thing I have noticed would could be annoying is I think Maintenance or staff rooms are on top floor so a few times I heard chatter early in morning and doors or radios - staff shouldProbably bear in mind people are chilling/ sleeping.Slept with door to balcony open. It was not too noisy at all and loved hearing the sounds of the city.Overall. I felt looked after. Happy with stay and would choose the jade again.(Ps. If Art Deco isn't your style, it's not overload, more accents in room so don't let that put you off of the rooms)Ohhhhh and go to Murray's bagels just around the block!

I have stayed with the Jade Hotel for the last four years for work. I consider myself loyal. The Hotel is a good location, and rooms are well designed. However, the bed mattresses are cheap, the linen is cheap and over the last two years they are struggling with bad bed bugs. I made it known to the hotel recently. They told me its mosquitos even though every time you get in the bed its itchy. I was prepared to stay with them recently, just expecting they would deal with the pest, but they ignored my reservation requests. When I finally caught Linda she told me I was a customer that did not 'fit the hotel'. I would strongly advise new residents to choose another hotel unless you want love bites all over your body.

I thoroughly enjoyed this boutique hotel. The decor is charming, the rooms are well appointed and clean and for New York, I would say an average size for the category. The staff were friendly and helpful. We went for happy hour in the bar and had Veuve at half price - a nice little bonus! The neighbourhood is fantastic for restaurants and music clubs. I didn't find it too noisy.

Have stayed here a couple of times for business. Great location. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Clean rooms. Great product in the room, which is always a plus. Nice restaurant and bar. Check out the happy hour. Sometimes tough to get a cab, but bellmen are super helpful and will take care of it.

Great hotel - rooms are the size you expect in NYC but are very well presented. Excellent service - a small issue with the air conditioning in the room that was dealt with very professionally. Brilliant location - close to subway and lots of great local restaurants. Fantastic bar downstairs with good food. The bar man is great fun. We'll go back to this hotel again

I loved this hotel for its location and its cleanliness and great service but lets face it- its not a business hotel. There is no business center - if you want to print something, you have to mail it to front desk. The wifi is good though. The prices are quite steep but the decor and the rooms and the bar and the restaurant is quite good.Not so good - The gym - its in the basement with no windows and no natural light. And worst of all - it reeks of frying oil constantly as it is next to the kitchen - makes it impossible to work out.

But no. I've just returned from a longer-than-usual stay at the Jade. From arrival to departure, nothing was an issue. My request for a higher room was met without question (though I did book and request it in advance). The room was smallish but perfectly formed (but I understand the larger of the Grove Queens) - this is New York so if you're looking for a spacious suite, you need to fork out more or stay out of Manhattan. The bathroom was immaculate and the shower was gorgeous at the end of a big day out. Perfect pressure and instant hot water makes me a happy camper. The bed was super comfy and room service spot on.I only had breakfast in the restaurant but it was delicious - thanks to the efficient staff who whizzed my breakfast out as I was in a hurry. Much appreciated.Location is terrific - right near 14th Street subway stations which from 8th Ave or Union Square will get you just about anywhere. Fantastic shopping and restaurants all within an easy walk. Door staff are fantastic - they'll not only direct you to handy places for a quick meal, they rustle up a car in no time and give you a quick weather report on the way out the door. Awesome - thanks guys.Thanks Linda for taking care of my reservation - you and the staff at The Jade helped to make my trip seamless, comfortable and safe.The only thing I would recommend is that you update the photos on your website - they don't do the amount of light in the foyer justice. It really is a lovely space and much lighter than expected!I'll definitely be back.

I haven't even sleep one night here that I am already fed up with this hotel. I arrived at 2:40pm and decided to wait the 20min (checkin is from 3pm). Got the room at 16:20... 1h40 waiting in the lobby and I got nothing in return apart from a "we are really sorry"...

We stayed two nights and only booked the week before. Like other people have said, the rooms aren't massive but I'd rather have a smaller stylish, beautifully appointed room than a large, basic and boring one.The staff were fantastic, very friendly and always ready with a smile. The location of The Jade is ideal, we walked around Soho, Chelsea, Greenwich and Meatpacking district enjoying the sites and sounds without having to ever get a taxi. It really is central if you want to shop, eat and get the real feel of Greenwich.Now the things that could be improved on. The rooms A/C didn't get cold enough for us, not a big deal as we only slept there but opening a window meant we had the noise of the city to deal with.Coffee!!!! There are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room so had to go to downstairs and order one, having to pay over $10 for two coffees didn't impress us at all. Upon leaving the hotel we had to get our taxi to wait as our luggage (which was in storage) couldn't be found and it took them 15 minutes to get it to us. We even said that we'd be back for 3pm so had to pay extra whilst the taxi waited.Overall.....we loved our stay. Please don't be put off by my gripes as this really is a beautiful hotel with great staff.

We had a lovely stay here at the end of our holiday in the US. The staff was very friendly and helpful - we arrived early in the morning after flying in from the west coast, and they did their best to get our room ready as soon as possible, which was much appreciated. The room itself was not very large, but probably reasonable for New York. Very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The only downside was that sometimes there was noise from people going in and out of the other rooms. We also enjoyed breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Overall we really liked the style and atmosphere of the place, and will probably be back on future visits to New York.

We will stay here again because of it's location, but we son't love the hotel. The staff is amazing and location is great, but besides being small (which we expect in the city) the rooms are SO DARK! There are two small laps and am one entry way overhead and that is it! We have turned on the TV just to get a bit more light (it is muted because we aren't interested in watching it). Not sure why they don't just add some more lamps. The darkness makes the small room feel even smaller and more cramped.

This was my family's second stay with the Jade Hotel. This stay was just as great as the last. All of the staff is superb but I was most impressed by the bellmen/doormen/lobby staff who were very friendly and personable. Each time I sat in the lobby someone offered me water, coffee, wine (yes, please!) etc. The attention to detail is what separates The Jade from the rest...everything from the décor (super chic and puts you in a New York state of mind) to the service and food is perfection. Their signature candle that fills the lobby with a warm and sexy scent is such a great touch. After a busy NYC day, one must try a "Meg-a-rita" in the hotel bar/restaurant...all I can say is, thank goodness for taxis and ubers!!!

Checking the Jade Hotel online have a much different vibe than the actual stay in it The room isn't small (The picture of the Bed attached is actually the room size ) it's tiny - not very comfortable even for a couple, tiny closet not for a longer stay than few days There is no Fridge In the room - it's 76 degrees outside and you want the drinks to stay cold for you all day (Honestly there is no real spot for a fridge ,Maybe under the desk )The Smoke detractors, a motion sensor - I guess for theA/C have flickering lights all night and there is not much you can do about it - make sure to bring eye mask so you can sleep (not provided in the room )The walls are thin and every time some walk in or out of their room our door is shaking and we hear the doors open and closed anywhere on the floor.The location is ok - it's Not in the heart and cool part of Greenwich Village,not much of the Village feel in the area On a positive note - The staff is friendly and do try to accommodate - they will keep stuff in their fridge for you, Buckets of Ice will be brought to your room anytime and relatively fast.The Shower is Modern,Clean and quite roomy compare to the size of the room Product in the shower is great The public areas in the hotel - mainly the lobby is nice and comfortable
user_name:
ShyEft
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here due to its proximity to the west village. I was not disappointed. It was reasonably priced compared to the other hotels in the area. The room was very small, but its New York! It was clean, and the decor was very cute. If you are looking for a hotel near the west village, I definitely recommend this one.

Great hotel, and I was very happy with my 3 night solo stay. It was a very last minute booking and I didn't even have a chance to review the hotel online, nor see what it looked like before arriving - but WOW - super impressed! I like boutique hotels which offer something a little different, and overall this hotel was very impressive, the staff were all extremely friendly and it was in a great location. The downstairs Bar was a great place to have a few drinks with fellow guests after a long day.

Stayed several times in the autumn (fall) in 2014. The staff are very friendly and helpful.It has a lively bar next to the small restaurant which serves reasonable meals if you come in late from a flight and do not feel like venturing too far. Yes, the rooms are small but this is New York.

We stayed at the Jade Hotel for a few days last November to celebrate my son's 18th birthday. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating from the minute we walked in the door. The decor in the lobby was gorgeous and it really felt like we were in a boutique hotel in Europe. The rooms are very small, but we can get past that fault as it is NYC and the rest of the experience of staying here is superb. The bar and restaurant on site is very good and service overflows into the lovely lobby area. We sat by the fireplace and sipped hot tea or wine on several occasions.

See above An excellent place to stay right in New York City near restaurants, shopping and. Entertainments I would reccommend it to anyone Whois going to New York this year. I would certainly go back if in New York again..

My daughter and I recently stayed at the Jade Hotel and were extremely impressed with the customer service, cleanliness and ambiance. What a great place! The front desk staff was very helpful and when we needed to extend the stay for two nights before my daughter could move into her apartment, they were able to accomodate her. The bartenders in the Grape & Vine were gracious and so helpful with advice about rentals in New York and suggestions for places to visit. My husband and I have traveled extensively and I would rate this hotel one of my favorite places.

The Jade is a gem. The gas lanterns set the tone for the NEW hotel that is retro. You will be warmly greeted by Mr. Andrew Brown. He was so helpful, informative and gets the above and beyond award for service. The room, view and neighborhood was truly special. Great dining there too !

Tucked away is this charming boutique hotel. Reception is down a flight of stairs, which is also where the bar and restaurant are. Really cosy as it gets colder I imagine, but I wanted to soak up a little NYC street life at breakfast time so just stepped round the corner to Murphys Bagel shop - which does a great breakfast bagel. Room was compact and bijou, but to be expected, they're clean and decently specced. V powerful shower which was great though I do like a soak in the bath and there was no bath in my room.Staff were friendly and helpful, I would go back ....

Sleepless in New York,first night awakened at 6:00 am phone conversation coming thru air ducts.Second night neighbor's TV noise at 3:00 am ,more phone conversations thru air ducts at 6:30 am.Third and final night pretty good phone conversations started at 7:00 am thru air ducts.In fairness to staff,both managers tried to help,gave me a small discount for the unpleasantness and allowed a late checkout,considering my bill exceeded 1300.00 for three nights,I will have to try other hotels.I truly like the staff but, the hotel doesn't offer king size beds, coffee in every room,extreme shortage of drawers and closet space.The hotel lobby is below ground level,which makes check in complicated .The hotel pricing varies from day to day making it difficult to determine if you're getting the best rate.If I return to the area I will stay at another hotel.

A great boutique hotel set in a quieter area of Manhattan it was the perfect base for our week long stay. Staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel has a great atmosphere. The bar and restaurant inside are great and the food was delicious. Our room was of good size and clean and comfortable. It was nice to be situated close enough to everything but far enough away from the crowds.The subway is close by as are restaurants and shops.

The ambiance when you walk in is enchanting. I throughly enjoyed just sitting in the lobby with a espresso people watching. The rooms are comfortable I really do love the decor. The hotel restaurant seems a bit confused but the skylight in it is a reason within itself to eat in there. The artwork on the walls is amazing. The hotel staff is very nice and accommodating. The interior really just wowed me.

Stayed here with my girlfriend for a week this summer. Excellently situated, outstanding vibe of relaxed charm, great service from all the staff. Everything you could want if you're after that "New York" hotel experience. This place has bags of charm, unlike the faceless rooms you get in the big chains around time sq.

This little Art Deco gem is probably a building you could walk by 100 times and never notice, it's discreetly tucked away in a quiet stretch of the West Village. It really has been restored and designed with great care and the rooms are very elegant. (I thought the headboard was cleverly designed). Rooms are compact but not tiny, the basics, but very pretty. I had a quiet, restful stay and the location is very convenient. Everything was neat as a pin, and they discount your glass of wine in the afternoon during their wine hour, making it a nice place to meet your companions. I loved the Jade.
user_name:
PigsFly
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We celebrated our 55th anniversary, and found the hotel perfect -- in service, location, quality of food & drink, and accommodations. When they learned of our anniversary, we were surprised with the gift of a bottle of champagne and a plate of fresh fruit. Be sure to inquire about parking because it is available at a reduced rate.
user_name:
RobertoIV
New York City, New York

review_body: The Jade hotel is a boutique-ish hotel in a great location in the Village with walking distance of the Freedom Tower and 9/11 museum (half hour walk). The rooms are small but stylishly appointed and who wants to be in the room anyway in NYC. The staff was friendly and very helpful but I did not try the restaurant. Would definitely recommend.

It has a wonderful location.Rooms are small, maybe too small, at least for me as I was with a friend. Very clean, though.It's a bit noisy, but that's normal in NY.Staff friendly and a beautiful building.But I think, for the money, it's worth to look a little further to find a better hotel.

I went to NYC for a week with my partner to see his brother and family who live out there. We stayed at this hotel as my partners sister in law manages the hotel. This hotel is lovely and in a great location as you can walk to ground zero or times square really easily. Otherwise there are plenty of subways within walking distance to catch.The decor is lovely and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We were welcomed with a complimentary bottle of gin in out room along with the tonic water and limes which added a nice touch to our visit. Also on most evenings there would be treats left on our pillows which was lovely.The bar is fairly small but great for pre dinner drinks. This is linked to the restaurant which serves a fab brunch menu. I could really recommend the eggs florentine and the orange juice. Yum!There is a gym in the basement which is small but pretty much has all you need to work of all the calories consumed whilst on yout visit to NYC.I cannot remember any staff names unfortunately but everyone was great. However on a few occasions the staff went out there way to recommend local restaurants to eat, printed off the directions and also went out to the street to grab us a taxi. Overall, great hotel

very nice but felt very cramped in the room and bathroom. There was virtually no storage for our stuff exempt a tiny closet behind the door. But,staff was accommodating and restaurant Grape and Vine a pleasant surprise. Convenient to everything!

I loved staying at this little gem of a hotel between Greenwich Village and Union Square. The location is lovely, especially if one desires a quiet neighborhood away from the crowds and noise of midtown Manhattan. I could walk everywhere and Metro stops were close by. The hotel styling is sleek - definitely a boutique style. The staff was all friendly and helpful. I was delighted to have an upper floor room where I had a view of the Empire State Building, which was all lit up in red, white, and blue for the 4th of July holiday. I will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Jade for five nights in early July and found the hotel and its location perfect for us. We stayed in a Barrow Queen room, which was quiet and good sized, and made frequent use of the hotel’s restaurant, the Grape and Vine, for breakfasts and a late dinner. Both the food and the service were excellent. One suggestion for the room would be more light; the lamps are stylish but provide inadequate ambient light.The location on a quiet, tree-lined street in Greenwich Village was more like being in Europe than in the New York we were accustomed to in mid-town and the upper west side. We walked in the evenings to venues like the Village Vanguard, Blue Note, Comedy Cellar and Cornelia St. Cafe and found the streets inviting and busy with pedestrians. The subway is a short walk from the hotel, and taxis were easy to find. We will definitely stay at the Jade again.

Great hotel - friendly staff, comfortable beds, quiet rooms, strong showers, cute restaurant, and excellent location. And the bagel place on the corner is a convenient and delicious way to start the morning. Stayed for a week and was very pleased. I'll be back.
user_name:
Jess_Bkln
New York City, New York

review_body: Nestled in the quaint residential area of Greenwich Village, but so close to shopping, great restaurants, and small theatres, The Jade Hotel offered us pleasant accommodations, fabulous food, and a super attentive staff! We would never stay anywhere else in New York City, as it is great to get away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. You are only a short cab ride or Uber ride away from where you need to be! However, it was so refreshing to walk to a restaurant or a gelato shop close to the hotel. Our room was clean, and the staff attended to our every need. The Grape and Vine waiters even remembered our special orders for breakfast! We found the rates to be extremely reasonable as well. We will most definitely book again when we travel. In fact, my husband has already booked his stay for a business meeting, as their rates were quite competitive with other locations. Do yourself a favor. Experience The Jade Hotel for any of your travels to New York City.

Stayed at The Jade for the first time last night: LOVED it! Had a brief stay - 11 hours in and out - but will definitely be back. What I loved:> Cannot beat the location in the Village. > Staff was awesome, from front desk to restaurant server to bartender.> Very late meal at Grape & Vine - oysters, salad, cheese plate - was delicious (and didn't break the bank). > Even later cocktails at the bar with bartender Daniel - nice wines by the glass and excellent mixed drinks.> Beautiful and stylish decor.> MY BED. It was not especially long - the rooms are tiny: this is NYC - but it was so comfortable I emailed the manager afterwards to find out what kind it was..I need to own one!Looking forward to my next trip back so I can stay again.

We have stayed at The Jade Hotel several times and we love it more each time. We originally chose the hotel for it's Greenwich Village location (which is perfect!) but we quickly discovered the hotel itself is very nice with a wonderful vibe. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little small but the amenities and location make up for it!

Lovely boutique hotel with quirky art deco room. The room is a bit small but it's New York City folks - why are you in your room other than to sleep and shower!50 yards from the corner of 6th Ave with lots of bars and eateries nearby (Murray's Bagels just round the corner is amazing) and the rest of Greenwich Village.The service is the usual North American high standard without being in your face or fussy. Just what we like.Like other reviewers I really shouldn't be telling you about this wee gem - you might over book for when I want to go again but as I found it on TA, I suppose I should say if your anywhere near the area, stay here.

It is against my better judgment to write this review since I don't want everyone to learn about this amazing hotel. As someone who travels to NYC several times a year, I keep looking for the right hotel. I like boutique hotels for that unique style. I also try to avoid the boutique hotels that cater to the young, party scene (aka pretentious douchbags and the "bridge & tunnel" crowd). I always stay below midtown since my NYC experiences tend to entail exploring the West Village, Tribeca, Soho, Chelsea, etc. If you have been disappointed by the "too cool for school" attitude of places like the Standard Highline and don't want to stay somewhere where the hotel bar is over crowded or subject to lines and velvet ropes - again, this is your kind of hotel. The location is phenomenal for roaming the city (a short block from 14th & 6th and the subway). The small bar area is excellent - comfy sofas, tables and chair in a stylish cocktail setting - for excellent cocktails in a quiet setting with free wifi. I completely understand why the bar has been listed as one of this city's hottest and best cocktail bars; I am also grateful that the trenders have moved elsewhere and left this amazing lounge free of crowds.The room was great. My room was actually a handicap room - it was thus quite spacious for a NYC hotel. Also note, but for the penthouses, the rooms have what I call a European style bathroom - i.e., no bathtub but a shower that is essentially not separated from the rest of the bathroom. I understand that most rooms have a partial glass wall and lip on the floor to prevent flooding the whole bathroom. In my handicap room (NB: I am not disabled and did not ask for this room but enjoyed the space.), there was no partial wall or lip on the floor - just a shower curtain. All that said - this style of bathroom does not bother me. I am used to them in my travels in Europe. I know that some Americans are not used to them and do not like them. So - while it does not bother me - it may bother others. The wifi in the room was decent (I never find any hotels have great wifi) for using your phone or devices. The rooms included free bottled water, a safe, an iron (& board). The room service was 24 hours. And the staff was friendly and helpful. The turndown service (tasty gourmet cookie included) was a nice added touch. The doors may be a little thin so don't expect complete silence. Fortunately, I am a heavy sleeper and these issues do not concern me. Finally, the room prices are well below many other (inferior) boutique hotels. There is no doubt where I will stay on my next visit to NYC. But shhhh - let's keep this place a secret.

I recently stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon and I have to say that we had a lovely time. We stayed in the Greenwich Penthouse suite on the 17th floor - while the room was rather smaller than we expected (as a penthouse suite, it was smaller than some standard hotel rooms I have stayed in!) the view of the Empire State Building was priceless. The bathroom was a great size, with a deep luxurious bath and a great shower.All the staff were very courteous and polite and we received nothing but great service from them. The food we had was delicious and, when ordered as room service, arrived very promptly,However, there were a few slight annoyances with the Jade Hotel. Firstly, there was NO minibar in the room. They provided fresh bottled water each day, but, in New York in the middle of summer, all this meant was warm water when we returned to our hotel room. There were no ice machines available either. I'm sure I could have asked room service for some ice, but this was not something I wanted to do each time I wanted a drink.Secondly, there was no coffee machine in the room. If you wanted coffee, you'd have to order it from room service - like the mini bar, a bizarre oversight. There were also slight irregularities in room service. Our complimentary shower gels and bath salts, which were so heavily promoted on the website, were never replaced. Twice housekeeping removed our dirty water glasses but didn't replace them with clean ones and sometimes housekeeping left a single complimentary biscuit on the bed, sometimes two, sometimes none. It was irregularities like these that gave the impression that, as a new hotel, the Jade is still finding it's feet.I would still recommend coming here - the location is great, the staff are fantastic and the decor of the hotel was wonderful. However, I have never stayed at at hotel (even cheap ones!) that have not provided a mini bar/fridge or coffee making facilities. If you are aware of this and can live without them, then I see no reason why you will not like the Jade Hotel!

Really like this boutique hotel. Great location, near so many bars and restaurants. The rooms are not huge but are very comfortable. It is a boutique hotel after all and not a large chain hotel. The staff are really great and accommodating. The bar area and restaurant in the hotel was very nice, good food.My only negative point (only small gripe) is the room wasn't cleaned one day and had to ask for clean towels. Would return to this hotel.

We stayed 7 nights at The Jade -- they had a great 7-night deal working out to $252/night for a couple sharing. No breakfast included.I had heard that New Yorkers are brusque and rude. So I was so surprised to be met by a very nice bellman who carried my suitcase down the staircase to the lobby (pity the lobby is not at street level) and by the very sweet staff at the reception desk.The staff in the restaurant were also wonderful and we had a delicious dinner on our first night (it was pouring with rain and we were reluctant to get soaked looking for a restaurant in the neighbourhood). The atmosphere was romantic and the service excellent. Pricey though -- $100 for two vegetarians!Our room for the rate we had booked was exceptionally tiny! Literally just walking space around the bed, not even space to put your suitcase. Because we were staying a full week we asked for an upgrade and were graciously given one! The new room was spacious, can you believe it in New York City?! And it also had a nice view with the One World Trade Center in the distance.The block-out curtains were amazing and we had a pitch dark room at night giving very good sleep. But the mattress was so soft that by the end of the week I had terrible backache. The mattress is also foam so it was very hot. I asked the hotel staff if the mattress could be changed but was told they were standard mattresses throughout. We had 11 nights in NYC and spent our final 4 nights at The Marlton where the very firm mattress thankfully returned my back to normal. The bathroom was spacious and the shower very powerful! The room was well insulated from outside noise, very quiet, but you can hear people in the passage or when another room door is closed -- it makes a very loud click. One weird thing: the bottom sheet on the bed doesn't reach all the way to the foot of the bed! So it would crumple up during the night, not comfortable. It took three requests to get a sheet that would actually fit the mattress, and even then it barely did.The hotel location is on the edge of Greenwich Village -- I wouldn't say it is IN the Village. There were about three supermarkets and plenty of fast-food joints just outside the closest subway station which was several blocks away from the hotel, and this didn't make for a pleasant walk back to the hotel, especially at night/early hours.When we were deciding where to stay, it was a choice between The Marlton or The Jade. We hedged our bets and stayed in both over the 11 nights we were in NYC. In retrospect, I would make a hotel choice based on proximity to a subway station, ie no more than one or two blocks away, because invariably you will be travelling up and down the island each day. After a very long tiring day the last thing I felt like doing was walking several blocks to a place where I'd sleep (we hardly spent any time in the hotel). But if you are choosing a hotel specifically for Greenwich Village, then The Marlton is better located because it is so much closer to vibey streets and cafes.All in all The Jade is a very good hotel: trendy, spacious bathroom with powerful shower, well appointed rooms, excellent restaurant, sweet staff. Pity the mattress lets them down.
user_name:
Traveller123CT
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Decor was dark wood and rich burgundies in a 1920s style from the lobby to the bedrooms, which I found charming. Shower excellent and the bed was comfortable. Wide selection of TV channels including HBO.Service was always friendly and helpful, and I particularly liked that when I arrived there was a plate of chocolates and personalised welcome note on the desk. Again in the restaurant the service was of a high standard, and the breakfasts were good. Excellent location, right in heart of Manhattan by the lovely Greenwich village. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

The Lobby and restaurant is lovely, we especially enjoyed walking back to the elevators and restaurant/bar as it seemed like a speakeasy alley! The Bar has Happy Hour prices on wine, beer, and delicious flatbread appetizers every day 5-7. The rooms were a functional size typical to NYC. The bathroom was large in comparison. The showers nice except the door was only a half glass wall so it was awkward and wet but we were told those are being steadily replaced (about half the hotel had been changed). The staff were helpful and nice; although I reported the phone didn't work and the loud bathroom fan was constantly running and no one came to investigate as far as I know. Our friends did not have the fan issue but did have cookies left for them which we didn't so I was a little disappointed with the inconsistent service. Overall, I would stay there again- especially because of the convenient location to Union Square, subway stations, and the Highline.

A hotel with great staff, clean and well equipped and maintained rooms, all with a fantastic vibe. The couches and sitting areas in the lobby was inviting and relaxing. Perfect location with many attractions, subway stations and eateries at your doorstep. Certainly a place to consider if this is your first or upteenth time in NYC!

I personally love the village and therefore the place is perfect. Service is ok, people are friendly and helpful. Rooms are very small, typical for NY. Stylish lobby and cafe, good breakfast. I will go there again.

A gem! So small but so thoughtfully designed. A rare treat.I enjoyed every minute I was there. The food and service were great. The lobby and restaurant were welcoming and excellent quality. So nice to see so many things done right!

I wanted to love this hotel. I wanted this to be "my hotel" in the city. I may go back but not likely and with much altered expectations. I appreciate good service and it began with none. There was no doorman in site so it was confusing on where to go with your luggage - debating whether to navigate the staircase or the side elevator. Once finding the front desk off to the side, again there wasn't much help. The person there didn't know how to check me in and finally someone emerged from behind the curtain still eating, while the other was playing on their phone. Trust me, I'm not a complainer, but after a long day traveling I just wanted to get to my room. The room looked very much like their marketing photos and I expected a tiny closet/wardrobe based on other reviews, but boy was it tiny. I asked the bellboy for extra hangers (more than the 4/5 stocked there) and it seemed to be no problem, though they never arrived. There were very nice touches like cookies & treats with a beautiful note on nice stationery, and bottles of water.I paid a fair amount more to have an outside terrace that was entirely disappointing. My trip was the end of May so there was no reason temperature wise to not love it, but there were cigarette butts in the paver cracks and the wall of ivy/plantings that you see in their photos was a wall of dead leaves. Just really bad first impressions overall. And I'm afraid to say it continued. It isn't on a major street, though close to the corner to find a cab, but I do appreciate the services of a doorman for this reason and probably 8 out of 10 times, he was missing. I came to rely on UBER, thankfully, and of course then the doorman would show up. The frustration was more that the staff seemed constantly texting or talking to one another than helping the guests. I'm young-ish, I get it, but I also paid and chose this hotel for a reason. My previous stay was at The Dream Downtown, and their service was exceptional, and yes I compared it the entire time, but I was looking forward to a more intimate experience.The room service from their restaurant Grape & Vine was wonderful! It's not a large menu, which I thing is a good thing, and everything I tried was delicious.As I said there is a chance I will go back, but if so at a base price room, which I expect to be quite small, as this room was without the terrace, and have UBER ready at all times.

I loved the vibe of this sheik hotel. The location was great and I loved the neighborhood. I looked a bit ragged when I approached. And felt lifted when I got a pleasant welcome from the bellman to the front desk. This is a small, very well appointed boutique hotel. My favorite thing besides the decor and view ( freedom tower in clear view ) was the water pressure in the showers.Also, the restaurant, Grape and Vine was very good.

This is our second visit to The Jade and it didn't disappoint. The rooms are clean and quiet. There are plenty of power points and the bathroom is of a good size. The free wifi is easy to join and we didn't feel the need to pay for the hi speed option.The Grape and Vine restaurant downstairs serves terrific burgers and fantastic shoe string fries! If you want a great Cosmo, have one in the lounge before heading out for the night, they are fabulous! Close to restaurants and the subway, we are looking forward to our next visit!

go to this hotel if you want to get out of the more "touristy" areas of NY. The neighborhood is great! The atmosphere is very luxe and unique. However, the rooms are TINY, with only a little walking room (even for NY standards they are small). The bathrooms are very modern and up-to-date. Really a great option, but if you are staying with children I would recommend a larger room.

Stayed here with my husband in May 2015. Have to admit I was disappointed. The room was fine (very small but I anticipated this), however the staff does not appear to care too much about the guests. There's no bellman to indicate where to check in, or how the elevators work. When I checked in the receptionist didn't even tell me where the elevators were (if you stay here you'll understand the elevator system is not straight forward)! I would only stay here again if the rates dramatically decreased.
user_name:
Karla W
Nassau, New Providence Island

review_body: Adrienne checked us in, realized our cards hadn't been activated and caught us before we made the lift and returned them to us at the lift. I thought that was great she caught it also herself came to find us. Sonya checked us out and was helpful in keeping our bags til we left later that day. Returned at 3p to grab our bags and the desk still offered a taxi . Beautiful decor. Wonderful shower.

The Jade Hotel's style and vibe grab you right off the street. Tucked into a nondescript block between 5th & 6th Avenue, its impressive and highly-stylized exterior suggest the great look and feel within. The lobby does not disappoint. While not big, it feels as though you've stepped down into a very chic west village brownstone. Like being in someone's fabulous living room. Rich colors, comfortable sofas, nooks and alcoves filled with books. Extremely well done. Through the lobby is the hotel's restaurant and pocket bar, again so beautifully decorated with exposed brick, velvet booths, a beaux-arts looking skylight that lets lots of light through, and wonderful light fixtures. Rooms have the same comfortable, dark exteriors - maybe a bit too dark for a hotel room - but high-style, all the same. OK - breaking it down to pros and cons...Pros - the vibe and the staff. We ate at the restaurant every morning and generally had a cocktail or glass of wine at the bar before or after heading out to dinner. The bar & restaurant staff have got to be the hardest working team. Always so polite and helpful. Bartenders lots of fun, making you feel very welcome, and offered us some excellent tips on restaurants. Tho sometimes difficult to get a seat at the bar – best to go early or later. Another pro is the location - for shoppers - 5th Avenue between 15th & 21st has pretty much everything you need - from Anthropologie to Sephora to Banana Republic and J Crew. Heading the other direction, or left out of the hotel, you are just a few blocks away from the meat packing district with its cool designer shops and restaurants and the hi-line. My husband was staying at the hotel for about 9 nights on business, so the hotel gave him a larger version of the entry category room – the Grove Queen. Facing onto 13th street, our room had a little sitting area, which made it feel pretty spacious. However – in keeping with the rich and dark style of the hotel, the rooms are dark. Very moody, but not maybe as practical as you’d want. Which leads me to the Cons – no mini bar or mini fridge in the room. And no coffee maker. Yes – there are delis around the corner where you can nip out and grab a coffee and bagel, and yes, you can pop downstairs into the restaurant and grab one, but sometimes you just want to stay in your PJs. Another con about the rooms – poor closet organization. Like IKEA with the bars that pull out, rather than run side to side. Not only can you not fit anything in, but what does fit on a hanger can’t be seen. And minimal drawer space, as well. Bathrooms small but well-designed and easily manageable. Maid service, as I have found pretty much everywhere, is spotty. Sometimes they’ll take those dirty wine glasses; sometimes not.Bottom line – if you are looking for style and comfort in Greenwich Village – this is the property for you.

This is a beautiful and well maintained hotel in Greenwich Village. Staff are friendly and professional. Rooms are impeccable and gorgeously decorated. A Parisian feel in the middle of Manhattan - cosy and elegant with sumptuous style and top notch service.

A nice boutique hotel in a great location, in the west village, where you can find very nice restaurants, jazz bars, & shops. Rooms are quite small, but the hotel is very quiet (at least in the upper floors). You can have good breakfasts at the restaurants. You can even walk towards Central park, about 1h30mn, and you can run or walk along the west river, at only 10 mn walk.we had a wonderful stay.

We visited New York with family and friends. This was probably my 15th trip to the city. We had never stayed at The Jade before but liked the pictures that we saw online. It did not disappoint. The hotel is beautiful. It's not in a touristy district at all and made us feel like we were much more "hip" and local than we actually are. That might sound a little intimidating but it was the opposite. We felt very included. Little details, like the fire in the lobby to the flowers to the actual rotary phones in the room, were fantastic. The staff were very friendly and helpful, even going so far as to look for a lint roller for my daughter, who had somehow gotten fuzz all over her jacket.The room itself was gorgeous. The colors and bedding were luxurious. The view was exceptional. The bathroom was lovely with subway tile and very nice fixtures. The rooms weren't overly large - but I've never stayed in a NYC hotel with huge rooms. I only mention that for people who might not be aware of that.There's a bagel shop just around the corner, and this is within comfortable walking distance of one of my favorite restaurants - Tea and Sympathy. It's a short walk to the subway, but the staff is always helpful and willing to get a taxi for you. In short, I would definitely recommend this for anyone visiting New York. It's definitely an experience you couldn't get in a Times Square chain.

I've been to many hotels over the years. The service with a smile is awesome here. Warm, friendly and a hip young staff! Highly recommend to anyone coming to stay in this area. The New School is here as well as NYU within walking distance. The hotel even offers discounts to relatives of students

This hotel is amazingly.The staff are super helpful and friendly. Irving couldn't do enough and was extremely attentive. The bar and restaurant was excellent, lovely cocktails!!! I recommend My Friend Trouble. The rooms are a little small, but fine if you are used to Parisian hotel rooms.The bathroom was beautiful - lovely decor.The cleaning isn't brilliant, but then neither is mine!It was my birthday and the hotel gave us a complimentary breakfast and bottle of procsecco...delicious. The location is terrific, 10mins from Washington Square (the coolest park in NYC) and 5 mins from Union Sq.I'm not sure what else I would want from a hotel?I will be staying here again!

Expensive, but to be honest: that was only to be expected for a hotel wedged in between Soho and Greenwich and a penthouse suite with a bathroom (with a huge bath!) and a balcony that both (!) offer a view to the Empire State Building. You certainly get your money's worth! The style of the hotel is wonderfully faux art déco, and it shows in everything: the colours, wallpaper, furniture, lighting. It all just breathes 1920/1930s.There are plenty of nice little cafés and restaurants in the neighbourhood. You won't get hungry or bored.

Recently (beginning of April 2015) stayed at the Jade on 13th St. between 5th and 6th Avenue. A nice little hotel, rates were discounted for a 3 night stay, making it competitive with surrounding hotels (not that many). Rooms are on the small side, but nicely appointed and very comfortable. Restaurant is good and bar service is good, if a little slow. Staff is very friendly. Terrific location, near everything. Good value, good service, plan to return when I am in that area again.

The location is fabulous, the happy hour from 4-7 pm is a welcome stop after a full day of NYC and the staff are very friendly, but for the price - the poor housekeeping, extremely dirty bedroom windows, very dim lighting and small rooms just don't justify!

The people at this hotel could not have been nicer, more professional or more accommodating - thanks to all of you for the 5-Star service! My husband and I celebrated my 50th Bday here. We had a 1965 Barolo shipped directly to the hotel and the coordination of it all was handled beautifully. They even offered us a complimentary cheese plate to go with it which was incredibly thoughtful. The staff is kind & friendly and really want to create the enjoyable experience for you. The location is excellent, great base for walking around and exploring Chelsea, Hell's Kitchen, East Village, Grammercy Park, etc., etc. The lobby & restaurant are beautiful, servers were top notch & the food was very good. Thanks again to Linda, the executive coordinator, for everything you did! It was a pleasure meeting you in person after all the emails!

We were told that the West Village has very few hotels. We now have family members living there and were determined to locate something close by for a family celebration. Up popped The Jade Hotel, one street away. Loved the location and, for the most part, loved the hotel but we thought it was very expensive. Of course, everything is ridiculously expensive in NYC, so maybe we should not have been so surprised. We had booked thru Booking.com where you reserve but don't pay ahead. They quoted us a higher rate at Reception upon arrival but quickly backed down when we showed them our printed out reservation. We did not take advantage of the restaurant although we peeped in and it looked charming. Our room was clean and beautifully decorated but small. This hotel definitely has the charm and ambience for romantic getaways, but is not too practical for families.
