My children and I had dinner at the Grape & Vine to celebrate my mother's 90th birthday. The experience was fantastic and our expectations were exceeded in every way. The staff was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. Their recommendations were spot on and our meals were superb - from presentation to taste. This is one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. The restaurant's ambiance set the perfect mood for our celebration and as a place to want to linger. Although we didn't stay at the hotel, it is a lovely building and beautifully decorated. Based on our dining experience, I would definitely recommend staying at the hotel as their standard of service in every way was quite clear - excellent!

The restaurant staff was abysmal. I had a very long flight and decided to have a quick dinner at the hotel - and that was a big mistake. I was parked in the lobby to eat (I guess the algorithm is that you should not waste a restaurant table on a single guest), and forgotten there without a menu for a very long while. Then a menu arrived... but it was the brunch one, not the dinner one, and took another 20-30 to attract the waiter's attention and ask for the correct menu. Getting the blond waiter to come to take the order was also a very lengthy process (and she was clearly not very busy). Similarly, I never managed to get a drink for my meal: by the time the waiter on "duty" (sounds like an euphemism) came to my table, I was done with the food and had no use of a glass of wine anymore, and never managed to get some water either. Baseline: I tried to have a quick dinner there, and it took only 2 hours and 45 minutes to get a cocktail and one dish, and no water nor wine for my meal - I could have used a dessert too, but I was not ready to wait until the morning after for the waiter to pay attention.I left very unhappy (even left a note - with a tip - on the credit card payment slip), and in the next 5 days there I never used the restaurant again (once, coming back after a very long day, I decided to rather order food to my room). The location is great, but since they are not the only ones well placed and it is not the cheapest option out there, I don't see why one should go there for being treated like that by the restaurant staff: I clearly won't be back.I understand that waiters, being probably on minimum wage, have stronger incentives to pay attention to tables with many customers (rather than a table with only one person) to make a living out of tips, but the all experience was really beyond rude.

The location is perfect, close to stores and restaurants, few steps from the metro station, in a quiet and charming street. The staff of the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant is very good, healthy breakfast and with a fine selection of wines for happy hour. Why not a five stars? Because the rooms are very very tiny. My husband and I stayed one of the largest rooms, and the closet did not have enough space for our clothes (we only carried clothe for 4 days). Because of the lack of space, heating system is via the air conditioning system, which made our eyes and skin very dry and uncomfortable.

Located at 13th Street between 5th & 6th Avenues, The Jade Hotel is a charm-filled boutique hotel with a super convenient location. The moment you descend into the lobby, you are inundated with the moody, dramatic ambiance and the positive vibe and welcoming atmosphere begins with the doormen, carrying you thru check-in and beyond.Restaurant and lounge service were professional and warm and we enjoyed just hanging out in the public spaces.We specifically want to mention the utterly efficient and professional care we received one one staff person in particular - Qeron. On our second night of the four we would be spending at the hotel, we returned to our room to discover the air conditioning wasn't working well. Qeron speedily remedied the situation when, after checking the thermostat and air flow personally, he sheparded us to a fabulous penthouse room with a stunning balcony and grand views of the city. He was charming, delighted to be of help, and is a credit to the hotel and his industry. We felt well-cared for and will definitely be returning to this unique hotel.

My wife and I booked in to stay, along with another couple, the hotel itself looks great and is in a fantastic location. However the room we had was incredibly gloomy, the hotel itself is set back slightly from the buildings beside it and the window to our room was partially covered by the roof to the entrance, not necessarily a problem in itself except that there was no main light in the room, only the desk lamp and the 2 bedside lamps (see the photo looks like we took it in black and white but we didnt). Also for the amount we paid I expected to have better in room facilities, there was no chilled mini bar, just a couple of drinks and snacks on the desk to choose from, also no in room coffee making facilities, no in room guide covering things like how to call reception. For a break in the city especially somewhere like Manhattan its nice to be able to chill out and relax in your room, we actually ended up checking out early and moving hotels to a similar priced hotel.On the plus side, the bed in the room was really comfortable, the bar in the hotel was good, all the staff were faultless, also looking at the photos of our friends room who paid for a room with a balcony it looked light and spacious, as well as having cracking views.

It's definitely a boutique hotel with an interesting ambiance and a super cool bar/restaurant. The location is great, and the only cons I found were that breakfast was not included on the fare and that the rooms are very small (though is NYC, so US size standards may not be different). I think is great for one person on a short trip, but if you are a couple doing a lot of shopping it might feel a bit tight. Restaurant/bar has a great menu but on the expensive side.

This is a really nice hotel in a great part of the city. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming and were great for recommendations. The room The room was small, but nicely decorated and surprisingly quiet to, which was a really pleasant surprise. Unfortunately though the bathroom was a wet room and the shower didn't really seem to be able to cope with all the water, so we had to put towels by the corner to stop the water flooding into the room!! We also regularly chose to take the stairs to our room rather than the lift and we often found that the stairways were blocked with stuff from house keeping or decorating materials - which I could understand, but not when some of the things were left there all day. A definite fire hazard!Having said the above, if I visiting New York again I would absolutely stay here and would recommend to others.

PROS - Nice property, great ambiance, excellent bar and restaurant. Interesting menu definitively not hotel standard fare. Nice rooms, wireless internet works well and is free. Great staff (except front desk see below), nice facilities all good. Good location and housekeeping is fine too. Reasonably sized rooms for NYCCONS- shower head (awful and cheap), wardrobe (tiny two drawer unit and the worst designed hanging rod so you can't see your clothes as it runs front to back not sideways), long waits for the slowest elevator service on earth, disfunctional front desk design (tiny and only one staff can process at a time so there is ALWAYS a line). Front desk staff too cool for school feeling so you end up not asking them and trying to figure work arounds. Worst feature - no coffee maker, kettle or mini bar so you have to get up and schlep somewhere to get early morning coffee or call room service and have to deal with that first thing. I haven't stayed at a reasonable hotel for years that doesn't offer coffee machines even if only on a request basis. That is a huge error IMHO and will rule it out for a return . I am in NYC a lot and was searching for a home away from home hotel such as I have found in other cities but this just makes it a no return option.If that stuff isn't important to you then fine but as business traveler I want get up, make a coffee and get going not hang around for room service or schelp somewhere to get one. That is a real fail at this property.

Everything is outstanding about The Jade - location, food, rooms, etc. But the staff go out of their way and should be congratulated! Keron, Peter, Brijette, Samantha, Romeo, Sally and Mia and others all made my trip outstanding in every way! Thanks to you all. I can't wait to go back. The surrounds of the hotel made my trip all the better.

We stayed here at this Greenwich Village hotel for four nights. The hotel is newish but made to look old and hip. Perfect location for our visit to The New School and Parsons--which are literally across the street. The service is excellent. The decor is fun. The rooms are tiny, but welcome to NY.

The staff was extremely accommodating. They were so friendly and eager to please. The atmosphere is very warm and inviting, but modern. You can't beat the location. My room was on the 9th floor. It was very quiet. I'll definitely stay there again.

Loved this hotel. Super cute boutique hotel! Phenomenal location. The staff was wonderful, food and drinks were great. Loved the restaurant/lounge in the hotel. Yes, rooms are small but I feel that's the norm in NYC. Cool design, clean, comfy beds and great shower. Would highly recommend!

Beautifully designed rooms, very friendly and professional staff, great amenities like free WiFi and bottled water, 24 hour room service. The rooms are very small but that's to be expected given the location. Overall feels a class above most other hotels and especially most larger or chain hotels.

Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Jade. Very cool, hip vibe and helpful staff. Everything you could need for a New York stay -- close to the metro, NYU, New School, 5th Avenue shopping. The restaurant is very nice and we had a dinner and several breakfast there. The staff is professional and very helpful. The rooms are small, but this is typical for New York City. The bed was very comfortable. We will definitely return!

We are a family of four including two teenagers and stayed at the hotel for one week. We had two rooms on the fourth floor and although not high floor the street outside is quiet at night unlike others we have stayed in. The staff were welcoming and professional and the hotel was stylish but comfortable. Rooms cleaned beautifully everyday even the teenagers! Beds comfortable and large showers with good pressure. You could at times hear muffled voices through the bathroom vent! but not as bad as mentioned in other reviews. The wardrobes were a little small especially for two teenage girls but when we asked for more hangers they were delivered promptly. I would stay here again before any of the big chains for the personal excellent service and charming surroundings. The bars is excellent and we used the restaurant on the first night and was not disappointed.

The Jade Hotel is a chic boutique hotel is a perfect fit for us. It has a great location within walking distance/short cab ride away from many restaurants and sights. We stayed there for 4 nights in March/April and had a fantastic time! The staff was very friendly and eager to help with any of our needs. While many have had issues with the size of the rooms, we have learned that NYC hotel rooms run on the small side. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The bed was incredible soft and cozy and the shower was just what was needed after a long day of hiking around the city. It was everything that we needed. The only issue that we had was when my husband ordered a drink at the hotel bar, he didn't realize it would be $24! Lesson learned- ask for a menu with prices before ordering! The Jade is a fantastic hotel and we would definitely like to return to there to stay during our next trip to NYC!

I stayed at the Jade last week for my brother's birthday celebration in the city. The accommodations were fantastic and the staff was incredibly helpful. They validate at a nearby garage which is convenient to the front door (I was driving in from CT). I loved it and would stay many times over.

My boyfriend and I were very fortunate to book a week at the Jade Hotel in March. They are very accommodating. They had umbrellas when it was rainy. They were full of good recommendations. The location is fantastic. Short walk to lots of good restaurants and bars. There are metro stops close by. I love that it is well located, but you don't hear the busy streets close by. The only downside is that you can hear everything going on in the hallway. It wasn't a real problem until it was early in the am and two guys were chatting for a good twenty minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The atmosphere is great. Good bar and restaurant. Spot on with the Greenwich Village vibe!

I've stayed at the Jade Hotel a handful of times when in NY for business, and it's a perfect spot for a single traveler! I'm close to meetings in the flatiron, midtown/garment district and downtown, and close to great restaurants and shopping. Pros:--good location--free wifi--great shower pressure //modern bathrooms--comfy bed--free bottled water (love this touch)--lots of power outlets - can charge, phone, ipad and laptop simultaneously--good blackout shadesCons:--small room and bathroom - fine for a single, but would be very cramped for 2--no in-room fridge--small closet / no dresser--good front desk service, but the doormen are hit and miss...no one was there to help me with my bags when I arrived

The Jade hotel is the NYC heart beat hotel, it's romantic and hip with a fantastic views from the room balcony of the Empire State. You will be in for a treat believe me. We can't wait to return! You will be so close to all the main attractions and of course the city bikes are right outside the door! Enjoy the city that never sleeps.

The Jade Hotel offers a cool vibe, a handsome property and a staff that lives to make you happy. All in a excellent location -- where West Village meets Flatiron. I am a New Yorker who lives elsewhere, but I come back to NYC often and always try to find unique hotel experiences. This is the first Tripadvisor review I am taking the time to write because the Jade Hotel deserves to be applauded. I did treat myself to a larger room and I am aware that boutique hotels often have "cozy" quarters -- but I can't help but think that the service and surroundings will more than make up for it -- if the room is too small GO OUTSIDE -- it's NYC. I was in town to celebrate a big birthday (never mind how big) and the staff went out of their way to be part of the celebration. Special thanks to Linda in reservations (happy birthday fellow Aries), Chris at the front desk and Paul the bellman. My only regret is that I did not get to Grape and Vine -- guess I'll have to come back!

We're reasonably savvy travellers, and we thought this not so little boutique hotel was super - somebody, somewhere, has got so much so right. Décor, ambiance, and lighting all really work in what we consider an ideal West Village location. Add to this, there is easy access via taxi or subway to all the rest of Manhattan. Not to forget that absolute essential: a great staff. (One of them, Briant, was drafted in by the management to help me learn to work a tricky app. how nice is that?) Not to mention that the hotel restaurant, The Grape & Vine, which also has a street entrance, is way better than average and so attractive that it's obviously popular with the locals, as well. In short, we'd go back to the hotel tomorrow. Any minuses? Of course. What's perfect? You may be disappointed if you need a huge room (we don't). Or a bath (we don't) instead of a shower (not all rooms have baths). With the one thing we'd really change being to turn down the volume on the restaurant music at night. (Is this generational? Surely not!) Two further extras: just a few doors up the street is a great little indie cinema: The Quad Cinema. And then if you're a jazz fan, try Smalls Jazz Club on West 10th, just around the corner from its more famous cousin, The Village Vanguard. We loved it.

Quality was mixed. The decorations and fixtures are high quality and the bed was super comfortable. Food was tasty and well cooked. However the rooms are cramped, and the lack of tea making facilities was very puzzling - never experienced that anywhere before! I asked to move to a larger room but apparently the room I was given was a standard size!Service was excellent. Warm and welcoming, I felt right at the heart of things which is great as a customer.Cost was pitched a little too high given the room size and lack of tea facilities.Overall a pleasant enough stay but I'd look for somewhere else if I every went back to New York.

The Jade Hotel really is a hidden gem. The hotel is clean and cozy and the employees are very friendly. The lobby is very charming, and they offer a great vibe for cocktails before or after dinner. The hotel is a small boutique hotel in a great neighborhood with tree lined streets, townhouses and many great restaurants. There is plenty of street parking on 15th and 16th streets, and a garage close by. The subway is also very close. We were celebrating an anniversary when we stayed here and the hotel had a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room! The rooms are clean and nice with a big flat screen TV. The rooms are small, as some people stated in other reviews, but this is common in NYC....and if you are complaining about the size of the room than you have bigger problems...the fact that you are spending so much time in the room when you are in NYC! Overall a great hotel, will def. stay again!
user_name:
NYCGirl130
New York City, New York

review_body: The Jade Hotel in Greenwich village is a gem. From the moment you walk in, the staff do everything possible to make your stay memorable and enjoyable. The rooms are small, but well appointed. The beds are super comfortable, the linens of the finest quality although there are neither coffee makers nor fridges but you can order service or go to the restaurant. Happy hour is fabulous ( 4-7) with a great selection of wines and flatbreads ( the smoked salmon flatbread is to die for). The staff remember which wine you like and are always solicitous they did not have a first choice of wine and so we were immediately offered an alternative which was not on the menu. Sitting by the fire before going out into the cold night is so pleasant that you could stay there happily. Lovely touches that made our stay enjoyable included wonderful meals in the restaurant, the restaurant manager ( Joey) welcoming us personally, half-price wines at happy hour and personal attention ( including a birthday dessert with candle) from the front of house staff, Chelsea and John. Many thanks to everyone and I will certainly stay here again.

This is a cute boutique hotel with a charming restaurant for breakfast. Although the decor is lovely, the rooms are absurdly small and noises travel easily. I could hear every word said by the couple in an adjacent room. Not recommended for people looking for a quiet place to sleep. The hotel looks nice but the noise, and the size of the room, made it a bad experience. I won't be back.

This was my second stay here. The room is very nice. Hotel is filled with atmosphere and staff is friendly (especially the cute blonde at the reception!). Location is great as well.They would get 5 star easily was it not for the banging aircon.

The rooms are small but the amenities are very nice and the staff is professional. The doorman and his red umbrellas are a very nice enhancement to the experience and to the neighborhood. They should make people more aware of the elevator, as otherwise you need to climb a flight of stairs every time you leave, and there is no noticeable sign directing you to an elevator. This is a nice tree-lined residential Greenwich Village neighborhood that has a serious lack of hotels so this new hotel is a well-needed addition, and the rates are competitive. It has only been here about 3 years and the restaurant & bar have caught on with the locals and have a nice downtown vibe. You should leave the car home. There is very little good parking around here. This block (13th Street between 5th and 6th Ave.’s) used to be the truck entrances for all the businesses on 14th Street so that is why it is zoned for truck traffic and there is no parking during the day. With that said, the block has also had something of a renaissance in the past several years and all the truck bays are replaced by boutiques, schools and their dorms (New School and Parsons), restaurants and this hotel. There is also an independent Film Theater on the block and several other schools (much of NYU) all around in every direction. Union Square and Washington Square Park are within walking distance, as well as most of the Village and the Meat Packing District. Buses and most of the subways that link you to the entire city are also within walking distance. There are some excellent restaurants right in the neighborhood, and on 6th Avenue – and especially on University, a nice Avenue for strolling, a block and a half east of here. And there is excellent world-class shopping on 5th Avenue, north of 14th street, up to 23rd Street.
user_name:
AnalogGurl
New York City, New York

review_body: Charming hotel with a beautiful décor. Loved the location in the west village near lots of restaurants. Even though I arrived early they found a room for me right away. The desk staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Although there is no coffee in the room they had it available in the bar area and remembered how I liked it after one cup! Clearly excellent service. The weather was not so great one night so my friend and I had dinner at the restaurant and it was a great meal with a nice wine selection.

Arrived at 10:30AM for check in and requested a queen or king bed. No problem and they would call us when the room was ready. Still no call at 5 PM and returned to hotel. They forgot to call and the only room left had two small beds. Location was great. Perfect for getting to East Village, West Village, Chelsea, Meatpacking, Gramercy. Room was small, felt cramped even by NYC standards. No refrig. Had a lively bar scene on Saturday night. No valet, parking was difficult.

The hotel itself is well decorated, the restaurant serves quality food and the staff was very helpful. I have no negative feedback for the Jade hotel, it was simply an excellent place. Good location, the street is about as quiet as you can get and it's close to some very good restaurants. I would stay here again and again.

A group of us recently stayed here for 4 nights on business, whilst attending the New York Toy Fair.I've been lucky enough to stay in a lot of nice hotels around the world, and the service at the Jade was up there with the best of them.All the staff were super friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Greeted every morning at the front door by first name; reception staff remembering all our names; great restaurant and bar service - the list goes on.Sure - it's not the cheapest place you'll stay in Manhattan, but if you want friendly, personable and top notch service - look no further than the Jade.

Very cosy little hotel in a great location. I stayed there only 2 nights on a work trip and didn't have enough time to try the bar or the restaurant, but they looked nice as well. The location was perfect and the price was reasonable for NY.

Lovely boutique place, spent only one night on work trip. Pretty expensive to me, but I guess this is the standard in Manhattan. Very comfortable bed but in the wrong position. A draft of cold air (overnight temperature reached -15C!) straight on my face, had to change bed to avoid headache.

Good location, loved the decor. The personnel --from the door men to the desk to the bar-- were friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would absolutely stay there again. The price was "NY reasonable." The bartender was great. You only have to order your beverage once, and he remembers it your entire stay. Weather during my stay was awful, so I dined in the restaurant a number of times. Food and service were very good. My only caution…my very burly husband might feel like a man in a doll house in the room I had. Fine for one, could be a tight squeeze for a couple.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Jade, but there was just a few things that stopped it being a 5 star review. Positives.THE BEST LOCATION IN NYC. Being so close to 14st means that pretty much everything in Manhattan and Brooklyn is incredibly easy to reach by Subway & It's walking distance to my favourite shopping and drinking areas. The area is safe, and fairly quiet and surrounded by lovely places for breakfast. Great Service. All staff were friendly and helpful and we felt so welcome from the moment we arrived. Amazing Lobby. I loved coming in from the cold to the hotel reception, which smelled incredible, and felt super stylish.Great Decor in rooms. Loved the art deco (i think) styling.Negatives. Bathroom. Needs some kind of shower door. Too small to be a wet room - everything just gets wet!Wardrobe Space. Reduce the size of the desk and get a bigger wardrobe - it's tiny. Its a shame there wasn't space under the bed for suitcases. Restaurant. You can read my review of this separately - it's poor. We would most certainly stay here again - in fact we probably will next time we're in NYC - but we'll always be out for dinner!

We stayed at the Jade Hotel in July and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Excellent location - close to shops, restaurants and subway. Small but beautiful rooms, lovely bar area and fantastic staff - we will be back!!

My husband and I stayed at the Jade Hotel for three nights last weekend while we visited our daughter who lived nearby. It's true that the rooms are tiny compared to the Chicago hotels that we've stayed in ( we're from the northwest suburbs of Chicago) but they were very comfortable and quiet! From the moment we arrived in the cute lobby, the staff was very helpful and more than willing to please. They helped us secure discounted tickets for a Broadway play on Saturday afternoon and guided us to great breakfast and pizza spots. We worked out in the very well appointed gym downstairs after a cup of delicious coffee from their restaurant, happily served compliments of the hostess! We loved the bar and the bartender, Joe, who helped us celebrate our daughters engagement that night. They make killer Margaritas, by the way! The Jade is located in a cute neighborhood and you can walk to restaurants, drug stores, church etc. I would be sure to stay here again!

great location, fantastic lobby, helpful staff very elegant, but.... I stayed there four nights and my room was only cleaned once or twice at most - I actually had to ask the front desk for the room to be cleaned, and the receptionist just acknowledged this issue in a matter of fact way, giving the impression it is quite a common issue. I had two consecutive 2-night bookings, but the first 2 nights were charged to me without being able to see and endorse the invoice, which I requested days later. the room itself was way too dark, and had minor issues (like the toilet lid not staying up) - basically, all the effort seems to go in the amazing lobby and other common areas, but other details are a bit too sloppy for a hotel of this caliber and price

We stayed in the Jade for 3 nights in early January. We booked a Barrow queen room, based on advice from sites like this, because it looked like the standard rooms were tiny. Maybe I'm used to European hotel room sizes (has anyone ever stayed in Stockholm?), but I found our room to be rather spacious, although storage space was limited (why do hotels fit wardrobes with bars hanging front to back??).The only issue with the larger rooms is that they are on lower floors, so if you want a room with a view, you'll be sacrificing floor space. I loved the Art Deco decor and the quirky little touches like the rotary phone, and window seat. Also - cookies at turn down were a nice touch. I agree that a mini bar and tea/coffee facilities would have been useful - there was easily enough space between the bed and the window to fit something in. We ate breakfast there one morning, and it was fine, if a bit limited. Our last night there was during the really cold spell, so we stayed in had dinner in Grape & Vine. That was delicious!! The best things about this hotel are definitely the quirky charm, and the cosy atmosphere - it makes a nice change from the formulaic chain hotels. Would definitely recommend.

I have to say that I came across this hotel with low expectations. I didn´t read particularly good reviews, the pictures were just ok and I wasn´t really fond on the location. It was just for one night and the price was good so I said: why not?It turned out that was far better that I expected. The location it somehow in the middle of nowhere which in NYC makes it perfect because is a quiet street and is close to everything! You can walk in less that 5 mins to the Soho, Greenwich, Fashion district, the village... it´s great.The staff is very friendly and efficient, the common areas are quite trendy, the restaurant downstairs is great and the rooms are far better that I expected; still smalish for american standards but good enough for NYC.

My friend and I just returned from a 2 night stay at The Jade. We were in love with the place. The room was cute and well decorated (we got the smallest room available and it was still larger than some other places I've stayed in the city). The bed was comfortable and the shower was great. The lobby was warm and comforting, but it was the people that made it the best experience. The folks at the front desk were happy to assist with anything and constantly trying to make our stay more pleasant. And we absolutely LOVED the bellmen. We were obviously aware that it was their job to help us but they did it in a way that made us feel as though they were thrilled and/or honored to assist. We really thought they were fantastic. During out trip to NYC we had some mediocre customer service at stores and restaurants but The Jade was wonderful and we will definitely come back next time we are in town.

What a great find, across from The New School. The room was great, a nice size for NYC, comfortable, and sophisticated. The lobby is very stylized, and dramatic. At night, it's very busy with locals, guests, and diners at the restaurant. The staff is friendly and accomodating, from the front desk to the restaurant. Every request was handled professionally and promptly. We were there for a conference in the area, but would go back to hang out and have fun.

I stayed here as it was close to where my daughter is living. I stayed in a double room which was very small especially by the time we put our luggage in the room (travelling for over a month with summer and winter clothing). I must say I was very surprised that the room did not have a bar fridge. Beside no fridge and a small room (smallest I've stayed in New York out of 6 hotels) the hotel was beautiful. The front office staff were great but rarely did I see a doorman. Would stay here again on my own but not with a family. Loved the free wi-fi - thank you! Our room had great views downtown. Very cute hotel indeed!

Overall the hotel is pretty nice, and in a good location if you want to be in the west village. Generally, the service was pretty good, but they were frustratingly unaccommodating. Specifically, I paid up like 3 classes of rooms above the cheapest class to the Hudson class. I thought this would get me a decent amount of space, perhaps a view. What it got me was a tiny room on the ground floor with a small patio next to a bunch of air conditioning units surrounded by buildings. And that patio was covered in snow and totally worthless in the winter (with or without snow). When I went to talk to the front desk, they basically shrugged their shoulders and said "Sorry, I know the patio is worthless right now, but that's the Hudson-level room". I would expect that in the first week post New Year's, when they are clearly light, that they would offer to move me up to a different room when I was clearly dissatisfied with the situation. So poor job of service in my mind. Next time I will go back to the Marlow.

I am from Long Island and have had many experience visiting New York City. Recently my girlfriend and I booked a night at the Jade as a romantic get away to be follow the next day by a Broadway show. It was fantastic. The atmosphere was very hip. The rooms were luxurious, and the the staff was attentive. If you get a chance eat at the restaurant too. It is called "Grape & Vine". The food is to die for.

This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are small but this is NYC, so most hotels rooms are small. The Art Deco is really fantastic, the resteraunt and bar is really good, but the hotel shines because of the great staff. I really think I am appreciated here. The staff goes out of their way. I will stay here again when I come crack to NYC.

New Years Week in NYC! The hotel staff greet you at the door and take it from there. They made us all feel extremely welcome and comfortable. Everything from suggestions for restaurants, making reservations, and giving directions was graciously given. The lobby area and bar are cozy with places to be in the midst of it all or to hide away for a little privacy. Happy hour with half off on wines by the glass and flatbread pizzas was a must.The only downside was space. Our family of 5 stayed in two "double" rooms (i.e., 2 beds in the room). The decor is wonderful, but the double rooms feel very small, especially for an extended stay with a few pieces of luggage. Hardly enough space to pull out the chair and sit at the desk. Our Aunt and Uncle stayed in a "queen" room, which did have a bit more space (same sq.ft. but one less bed), but still only a very small closet. We were on lower floors (5&6) so there really wasn't anything to look at through the window, but no problem with street noise.Would we stay here again. Yes. But probably for a shorter stay in a queen room (or larger) and preferably with a confirmed room on an upper floor.

We arrived to the Jade hotel very late at night, the front desc was very nice to as. The hotel is very clean the rooms are modern and chic. I liked the bathroom the most. BUT the room was very very small, its not easy to be a couple in the room with more than two luggage's, there iss no space....

My husband and I stayed at The Jade Hotel over the holidays for two nights for business and pleasure. It was incredible. The staff was completely amazing. I can't go on enough about how wonderful the staff at The Jade hotel were. They were friendly, helpful, and just down right cool all at the same time. When we walked in the bellman immediately picked up our accent and started a friendly conversation. It was a twist of southern hospitality twisted with a swanky NYC twist. We stayed in the penthouse, and our view was amazing. We will definitely be staying there again when we go back. The food at the restaurant downstairs was delicious. I recommend the salmon flatbread. Drinks, of course, were tasty.. everything was perfect! Oh, and perfect locations - walking distance to great places to eat and shop. Five Stars all the way. You will not regret it.
user_name:
Carlyle T
Oxford, Mississippi, United States

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Jade. The staff was very friendly when we checked in. This is the first time we stayed at a boutique hotel and we really enjoyed it. The décor in both the room and lobby are a very nice art deco style and very clean. The room was quiet - no noise from the street/neighbors/elevators. Although the room was small (which is to be expected for NYC) it was comfortable and quaint. However I don’t think the bed we had was really a queen – it seemed small. The bathroom was a nice size and had really good water pressure in the shower. We had drinks in the restaurant one night and dinner another night. The service and the food were very good. The location was very convenient to 2 different subway lines. All in all a good stay! We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights (original booking for 8) and wonderful friendly staff, and nice location but problems were numerous:- new build hotel should have got the small things right - this one didn't- design kitch and supposed to be a mock of the Great Gatsby but is so over the top and feels like Disneyland- hallways on all sorts of angles and the poor bellmen cannot get through (scuff marks and chips on corners everywhere)- walls paper thin and move when next door room shuts their wardrobes- lots of little details skimped on - e.g. cheapest and worst elevators ever. All of the above combines to ruin the experience. Rooms are very small also - no fridge. Moved to Gramercy Park instead, unfortunately. Could have been much better.
user_name:
Matt J
New York City, New York

review_body: Very pleasant and clean hotel. Rooms a little small, but typical for New York. Room upgrade worth having to get the small bay to sit in and watch the world go by.Bar OK, happy hour good value, the flatbreads are excellent.The Rep theatre next door is excellent and worth checking out. Also Murray's Bagels is just round the corner and a great alternative for breakfast to the hotel.

I stayed at The Jade because it was close to a friend's house- what a great find! The hotel was tucked away and I enjoyed a nice quiet glass of wine in the lobby watching people come and go. The front desk staff and bellmen were so kind. My room was at the back of the hotel, and was very quiet. I could hear not street noise or elevator traffic (even though my room door was literally right across from the elevators!)Two very very small complaints:- the wifi was very slow, and kicked me off many times- the elevators were slow and frequently full.
user_name:
Alexandra D
West University Place, Texas

review_body: Three weeks ago I rang the hotel jade new York and told them we had just booked a room on Travelocity.com for check in on December 24th check out on December 26th I asked to be put through to the chef because we wanted to eat in house but I have very serious dietary restrictions.I was put through to the chef and was told it was no problem, I told him for medical reasons I was strict vegan and also was allergic to tofu and all soy and mushrooms. He assured me within a week he would email me a sample menu to approve we were over the moon, remember no tofu no mushroom the menu should have been our warning.I received a message from my daytime manager that you are going to be staying in the hotel and were looking for vegan options for 3 meals a day for your 3 day stay. The chef has put together a list of dishes that we can execute for you but we are otherwise limited in our ability to offer anything more. We’ve included all the pricing for these dishes and hope that they meet your needs. If for any reason these won’t work for you, please don’t hesitate to reach out and I’d be more than happy to help find you reservations somewhere you’d prefer.The Chef’s one request is that you let us know the day before which dishes you’ll be ordering so he can make sure that they are prepped for you and that we have everything in house to prepare them for you.The list of menu items is as follows:Breakfast items:Steel cut oatmeal with fresh berries – $8Vegan pancakes with apple compote and maple syrup – $12Chocolate steel cut oatmeal with bananas and almonds – $9Vegan tofu and spinach scramble – $15Smoothies:Kale and banana smoothie – $9Blueberry and orange smoothie – $9Juices:Beet, ginger tomato juice – $10Orange, ginger, carrot – $10Kale, pineapple – $10Lunch Items: (all bread for sandwiches is vegan)Hummus and Artichoke Sandwich – w/ olive-caper tapenade – $15Black bean & Tofu Burger – $16Winter Vegetables – with quinoa and balsamic syrup – $14Soups and Salads:Sweet and spicy peanut soup – $12Soybean and basil syrup soup – $12Eggplant and onion soup with fresh thyme – $12Salads: (available in app and entrée portions)Spinach & quinoa – w/ apple cider vinaigrette, apples alfalfa sprouts – $12/$17Mediterranean kale salad – with hummus, pomegranate, spaghetti squash, sunflower seeds, white balsamic vinaigrette – $12/$17Union Square marker salad – made with market greens and vegetables – $11/16Dinner Items:Buckwheat noodles – grilled king-oyster mushrooms, baby bok choy, miso broth – $22Root vegetable lasagna – with pickled mushrooms and mushroom broth – $22Vegetable saffron risotto – with winter vegetables – $23Sides:Spinach & spinach mash – $10Roasted garlic mashed potatoes – $10Blistered shishitos – with coarse sea sald – $10Crispy Brussel sprouts – with hazelnuts and apples – $10Desserts:Selection of sorbets – $10Chocolate ganache cupcakes – salted caramel & dark chocolate “buttercream” frosting – $10Fruit sushi – with wasabi, agave syrup – $10Fruit plate – with red wine syrup and cocoa nips – $10Hope this is acceptable. Please let me know if you have any questions!Liam WagerGrape & VineAt The Jade HotelGreenwich Village52 West 13th StreetNew York, NY 10011Phone: 212.300.4525grapeandvinenyc.comthejadenyc.comNotice the constant of tofu and mushrooms? This should have been our first warningI contacted the hotel they said I never told them, hmmm I never told them about two food products that could put me in intensive care? Yes I do that all the time I love the ER.So we arrive at the hotel and we check into a room yes the bathroom was amazingly ADA compliant and huge you could throw a flash mob in there, but would you want to?When we walked and rolled in and there was a smell and the toilet in a $600 room was full of human poop and a large chunk of hair as if someone had a haircut and put the cuttings in a toilet?We rolled to the bed it was accessible, I could roll all around it and we pulled back the quilt and as Ella touched it her hand was black, there was a puddle of ink as if from a broken pen all over the sheet where the pillow sat.?Wonderful we turned around to unpack and the wall behind the door was cover with paint splatter as if someone had shook their brush to get the excess of it was also all over the carpet in the door way.Ella stepped back and something made her trip, the door jamb normally screwed into the floor to stop the door hitting the wall came unscrewed and she almost trod on it with two sharp screws sticking up she turned to look at a 6ft by 3 ft. mirror held on the opposite wall by corner brackets of anodized steel and it was crooked that this was an 18 sq. ft. mirror weighing 50-60lbs and it was crooked and the bottom bracket holding it on was hanging on by only instead of 4 screws?We called for housekeeping they said they would clean the toilet in 4 hours when we went out so Ella had to clean the toilet herself, the mirror the same and the sheets also in four hours?We came back after the early dinner the wall still looked like a Jackson Pollock. The carpet had snowflakes, the mirror was sort of fixed but still loose and dangerous.The sheets were changed, no ink just a 2 inch circle of someone else’s blood? All before dinnerDINNER-Remember three and a half weeks to organize the menu? So we have a wonderful kale salad, it was really good I thought wow this guy made this just for us that was the appetizer.Entrée came, it was roasted root vegetables on tiny pasta, the kind a knowledgeable chef would only ever use for soup, never an entrée, it was disappointing heavy and oily. We bought our own wines all Australian so at least that was good but the bill was $180 for salad and gluggy pasta?We went back to the room and had some Australian tawny port we were still hungry so I rang room service and asked did they do French fries and the call went like this-OPERATOR- jade hotel room service how can I help?ME- do you do friesOPERATOR- yes we doME- what size is the serve? Is it big enough for two?Operator- I don’t know are you an over eater?ME- I beg your pardon?OPERATOR-well if you pig it down it won’t be enough for you, if you eat normal maybe there’ll be some for your wife.ME- Enough with the rudeness, all I’m asking is, is the serve size a side dish or entrée?Operator- how big do you eat when it comes to sides?ME- I’m calling a manager.So we called a manager and we asked also for two extra pillows, the pillows arrived bare with no pillow cases, we asked where they were? they gave us tow and said put them on yourselves?The manager Chris came in and we told him everything showed him everything and his response was free fries?The pillows, as we were looking at them had black mold on them? We showed Chris, he photographed them and rang for two more they came up also without pillow cases and we were told again to put them on ourselves.Christmas morning came we went three blocks to bean for breakfast, and we had a 1 pm booking for lunch we came back to the room to kill some time and started watching a movie something was wrong with the volume we tried to increase it it would no go higher than 50 out of 100, on the volume level we rang for someone to come up thinking it was broken we were told "well just watch louder channels" they finally sent someone he took an hour to change the program and three times told us "mtv is loud watch that" so we gave up and went down for dinner. you know remember the specially organized just for us menu?Another great salad was served for appetizer and the identical roast veggies as the night before except the gluggy pasta was changed out for gluggy rice so oil sodden that when the plate was knocked the oil splashed.We called Liam the manager over, he asked us what he was meant to do. We suggested it go away and something else replace it. Thirty minutes later two plates of pasta cut up like you were feeding a baby with a sprinkling of cherry tomatoes, caramelized onion, garlic and basil? Strange it was so sweet it was almost a desert but we were ravenous we ate it, it was a very small serve.Before it was finished I was clammy and sweating and nauseous, we asked for the manager the replacement meal was it strictly to my diet restrictions? He thought so but his quote was they can only do so much on short notice? Short notice they had three and a half weeks and two emails back and forth to get it right.Within five minutes I was on my back in bed distended stomach vomiting diarrhea feeling like someone was twisting my intestines till I yelled I stayed that way till I slept exhausted.That night Liam said he would take the entrée off the bill? He said no culinary professional could guarantee no cross contamination? Really in Australia and Europe we call that mandatory health education for all cheffing apprentices, you don’t learn it you don’t graduate.I awoke at 11pm able to eat so with all we were paying and a so called international chef the only way to guarantee my health was to roll for ten blocks find a vegan Chinese restaurant and buy ourselves vegan dumplings? Three weeks and we get takeaway?We checked out this morning and we got the bill, we never ate breakfast once in house but there was a charge for breakfast, the bill he was removing wasn’t it had to be adjusted from over three hundred above the room cost to $150.Now don’t get me wrong like every other hotel Ella and I have reviewed there were some redeeming qualities, some.Paulina on front desk was amazing and she organized the chef even if everything after her was screwed up.JOE The barman extraordinaire in the Restaurant during both screw ups was world class and I would steal him in a heartbeat.The unknown Hispanic waiter who made coffee in the restaurant he not only made the perfect quad espresso but he was the kind of professional that even with all the Christmas patrons 24 hours later he greeted us and smiled and said to us “would you like another soy cappuccino for your wife and quad espresso for you?” a true professional who remembers people orders and makes them feel specialApart from that the staff at the jade hotel would be lucky to make the worker of the month wall at Popeye’s chicken definitely not Mc Donald’s. They would never ask “do you want fries with that” without first insulting you!Finally to the décor, when I first entered I assumed it was a revamped brownstone so I forgave the scratched paint the dirty glass the raggedy carpet and the generally lackluster upkeep of the address I figured after all it was a couple of hundred years old? That was until I was informed it was barely 18 months old? Someone yelled “just get it damn well open” so they did paint bleeds everywhere paint splatters on the wall paper, painters tape still left on stone work painted over fractured tiles scratched chrome work in the elevators tiny narrow hallways and a check in counter barely 6ft long with a 3 ft. square pillar blocking its view leaving a gap so narrow that half of the counter is obscured from the customers and definitely wheelchairs!In the native American community jade has holy qualities, in jewelry it sparkles and is precious unfortunately in 13th st Manhattan it stands for a hole in the wall a blind man would be glad to see as long as he didn’t put his glasses on because the owners must surely and sadly be jaded to let things stand as they are I would say close but no cigar but if the cigar was yours I’d probably get sick from it we won’t be back jade and neither will anyone we can tell.P.S. when we double checked what was in the replacement bad pasta he informed this chef made caramelized onions by deep frying them? No matter the meal sucked.A further foot note- we later when bored went through the room service menu and found to out dismay the extra special personally designed just for us vegan menu thta took three weeks was actually standard room service items just with the dead animal removed? so lets correct one thing about this story they are good at lying
user_name:
Mia V
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I flew in last minute and wanted to stay someplace comfortable in Greenwich Village. We prefer the boutique hotels to the trappings of the big hotel chains as a personal preference.The room was smaller, no real surprise, but not uncomfortably so and the bed was very comfortable - for us perfect. The location was great and the staff was friendly and attentive. We talked to the staff and they told us how to reserve the bigger rooms with a terrace in advance. Again, we booked our trip only a week or two before arrival.We look forward to coming back to The Jade.

I stayed here two weeks ago with a girlfriend and loved the whole experience - a great location for our second trip to NYC and I would describe the hotel as everything we could have hoped for and great value for money. We walked everywhere from here including late at night. Some great little restaurants nearby and as it was cold it was always a cosy friendly retreat to come back at the end of each day! Only complaint was we didn't find out about the great happy hour deal until our last night - would have been nice to have been informed about that on our arrival! It was only a new staff member who informed us on our last night. Otherwise a fab little boutique hotel! Would definitely stay there again.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Jade for 9 days over Thanksgiving along with another couple.The hotel is situated in a nice peaceful street (as far as New York is concerned) at Greenwich Village, away from the hustle of Times Square. The rooms are comfortable, clean and warm although on the small size. The bed was really comfortable and the shower/WC adequate. If I return to New York or should I say, if can afford to return to New York I would stay here again but opt for the larger room. New York is quite expensive and the hotel bar is best avoided except for a drink before going out to a more affordable bar maybe. The breakfast was good but just a walk one block takes you to the French Roast cafe bar which was excellent value. The hotel staff members were very obliging as were all New Yorkers we met, offering advice without you even asking. Getting around the city from West 13 St is easy using the Metro. Buy a card at the machine and top up with 10, 20 or 30 dollars. Each train journey costs 2.50, so is there were four of you you can get to your destination for 10 bucks avoiding all the traffic jams. However when the traffic is quiet you can get to Times Square or Battery park for 10 bucks with 4 in a cab and dropped off at the door. Don't be afraid to walk around even in the evening we never saw any problem. We had a guide for our first day who showed us how to get around and the sites of downtown Manhattan her name was Betty and can be contacted on betty@ontimenewyork.com, highly recommended.Would definitely recommend the Jade Hotel and Greenwich Village.

Neighborhood feeling with easy access to all forms of transportation to all parts of the city. Such a great area in NY to stay. Great area to walk around in. Clean and very comfortable rooms, great views, very nice and helpful staff.

This hotel has lovely art-deco decor and the rooms are very nice also. However, be aware that the rooms are SMALL, so if you have a lot of luggage you will have problems finding places to put it. My boyfriend and I traveled with just a duffel bag each so we were okay. The location is very convenient, you can walk to Union Square or Chelsea. There is plenty of shopping, good food and bars/entertainment in the area. The lobby area of the hotel is very nice for lounging or having a drink with friends.

The Jade is a very little cute boutique hotel in one of the best city's areas.Conscious - thanx to reviews - that the rooms are small we booked here.The hotel is very nice as you can see on their web site but we have been disappoint since the beginning. We checked in very late so we asked for a late check out. After insisting they accorded us +1h. The room was very small, as the so if you have more than 2 luggages is gonna be complicated to turn around the bed.Queen size bed, bathroom without window but spacious. Unfortunately without any kind of furniture or shelf to place beauty products and stuff.The first night one of the towels was dirty; they are not generous with bath products (had to ask replacements as if is not done they don't add).First time that I stay in a hotel without mini-bar. Not at all. No kettle. We have been disturbed a couple of times by the room service although No disturb was on the door. The check out day they start to call us at the expected check out time although they agreed for a late one.WIFI is for free but in 3 days I got connected just once as it never works. Not an experience in terms of design and especially not in terms of service. But the location is perfect. nevertheless I'm sure you can get better hotel for the same price in the area

Hotel is perfectly situated near the village and walking distance to many wonderful restaurants.When I arrived to the Hotel their computers at the front desk didn't work and could not use wifi that was a bit annoying. When the computers were fixed everything worked perfectly during my stay.My room (1604) was small but cozy on the 16th floor which had a very nice view to the Empire State Building. Aircon in the bathroom was quite noisy but when you close the bathroom door it was ok. Power socket was placed awkwardly inside the bedside table so that it was bit of a hassel to find where it was. Comfortable bed and room had everything I needed. Staff at the front desk, housekeeping and at the door were very nice and helpful.Overall experience was wonderful and I would come here again.

Great location in The Village, walking distance to everywhere, easy reach of the subway, the Hotel is absolutely gorgeous, if you have any doubts about staying here then don't, you will not be disappointed. The rooms are small but have everything you could want and more, the bathrooms are amazing, I want this at my home, the staff are excellent first class, from the door men to the reception staff, bar staff, cleaners, nothing is too much trouble, we had a 40th Birthday and got to stay in what I would say the best room of the hotel 1607 amazing view of the Empire State Building it really has the wow factor. Thank you for a fabulous stay in NYC.
user_name:
Katie0104
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

review_body: Very nice rooms and excellent location. If you get a room with the aircon banging every 5 minutes ask to move (as I did). Also, the computer at the front desk did not work properly. So, when asking to leave at 1130 instead of 11, the key was not updated (despite the front desk "taking care" of it). So I had to go between the 15th floor to reception just before checkout. Pretty annoying. And they had other computer problems.

Great location, in the village, walking distance to NYU, Washington Square, and one block from Union square. Nice European decor, with bar and restaurant in the back. The rooms are modern, however, I think design was prioritized over practicality. E.g. Not enough light to read in the room. Also the old fashioned phone is by the bed and I thus I could not take a business call by the desk. Service was very good, and the lobby is very warm and welcoming.

You could almost walk by The Jade- it's unassuming and charmingly elegant and easy to miss in the behemoth of buildings that typify NYC hotels and stand adjacent in nearby Union square. The classic and easy style exists in the operations and services throughout -just as it doesn't look like a hotel -more like an old townhouse- it effortlessly doesn't fell like it either. Had an excellent experience gathering a group and hosting a great little party in the cozy, casual and chic. We all had a great time and everyone loved their clean and comfortable rooms. Wonderful and helpful and cool staff! Great, classic NYC experience.

Booked this hotel for a quick getaway with my daughter. Love atmosphere? This hotel has it in spades! Every detail of decor has been meticulously attended to. The graceful art deco interior is reminiscent of bygone days, yet still has quirky modern touches that set it apart. And it's not short on the mod cons, either. We had everything we could need for a pleasant and luxe stay in the big city. And a great neighborhood right outside the front door. Quiet? Check. Discreet? Check. Understated yet attentive service? Check. Free wifi? Check. Cool rotary telephones? Crazy check! (Loved this touch)My only issue was that the "validated" parking was hard to find and not terribly convenient. I wound up parking at a closer but more expensive garage, but as it was a rainy and busy evening, I wasn't up to the hassle of the inconvenient parking area. So be warned if you're driving in.This minor incident did not at all detract from our enjoyment of this lovely property, and the vibrance of the Greenwich Village neighborhood.
user_name:
VReynolds61
Patterson, New York, United States

review_body: The Jade is the perfect hotel in a perfect location. I was thrilled to discover a hotel in my favorite neighborhood that provides stylish elegance and intimate charm. I've stayed in many NYC hotels as a visitor, with the high expectations and insider knowledge of a NY native who lived in Manhattan over 25 years. The Jade wins top billing on all counts. It has it all. The room was more spacious than many with a super comfortable bed, crisp linens, great spacious waterfall shower and a view of lower Manhattan made for a movie. The lantern lit entrance takes on the beauty of a small European hotel at night with classic, not campy, Art Deco style. I loved starting or capping off a long day lounging by the lobby fireplace and lounge areas, with the NYTimes or alluring library corner of gorgeous books. Grape and Vine is a "real" restaurant and bar with energy and authenticity that's destination worthy; fantastic, fresh food for breakfast and dinner. I joined a friend in a velvet booth and we could even hear ourselves talk. My favorites and the best local cafes,restaurants and jazz clubs of NY are an easy walk. Above all, the staff are gracious but without attitude. Everyone from the front door to the front desk to housekeeping were professional, alert, attentive, can-do, thoughtful and kind. They create an atmosphere of contentment, care, safety, style and serenity. This is rare, and I was amazed by the service for a small hotel. It's one of the most charming neighborhoods of the city and a walkers paradise from chelsea art galleries and the High Line to all of downtown. I lived in the area years ago, and The Jade felt like the perfect NY apt. I will be back, soon!

I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It is a beautiful hotel with a 'boutique' feel. The rooms are larger than ones I have stopped in previously in New York and the finishing and decor of the rooms is excellent. I also had an unfortunate incident at the hotel and the staff couldn't of been any more helpful. They are so courteous and completely went above and beyond to help me. A truly wonderful hotel with the greatest of staff.

A superb boutique hotel with superb and friendly service in an excellent West Village location. Comfortable rooms ( small but New York standard size for the price). Good value. Excellent breakfasts. Good Bar with friendly and helpful barman. Beware the Bourbon!

Im not a super big fan of going to N.Y. Too many people, too much noise, too much smell. I really like being in N.Y. Highline in the fall is a new classic right up there with Central park in the fall. The Jade made me feel like I could enjoy more of why I like being there and less of why I do not.The village is away from the major crowds and The Jade is an oasis in the middle.Great service, clean, not too noisy, comfortable beds. I slept well. Grape and Vine serves farm to table and it tastes great. The Cheeseburger tops it.Rooms could be bigger, king beds would be great. Doors slam a little loud. WIFI should be free or rooms should be cheaper.I will be back.

We just spent a very enjoyable weekend at the Jade when visiting our daughter for NYU Parents Weekend. This hotel is in the perfect location, making it easy to stop back for a rest and a change of clothing before going out to dinner. The room is a bit "cozy" but that is NYC hotel accommodations. We were greeted with smiles on check in and check out and the staff is very willing to help and ask about your day. The place has a great feel to it and the location is fantastic. It was quiet and the bathroom was nice which is essential!! This is a small boutique hotel that makes you feel welcome and it is a great option for visiting downtown areas as well as uptown because you are steps from every subway line. It was clean and comfortable and cozy and convenient and you can't ask for more than that.

We have just returned home from New York, having stayed for 4 nights at The Jade. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this wee gem. The front of house staff went out of their way to help us, giving great advice on dining options etc. The staff were always professional and polite - in particular Kyle at the desk, and Peter at the door. Thank you both very much. Outstanding service!The room was small and compact, with everything carefully thought out and decorated beautifully. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. The nightly turn down service with complimentary biscuits and bottled water was a nice touch.The room was very clean.I look forward to returning to New York in the near future, and will most certainly be re-booking this hotel.

We were very pleasantly surprised with our recent stay--even though we were probably in the smallest room type, we had a spectacular view, spotless room. Staff young and energetic. Did not check out the restaurant. Location probably tricky for where my business trips take me, but if you are interested in being near the Village, it is a great choice.
user_name:
Dianne V
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed at The Jade on the recommendation of my nephew. I was traveling with 3 friends and wanted a boutique hotel in Greenwich. Much to my delight he suggested The Jade. From the moment we arrived until check out every person we encountered was friendly and helpful. The hotel is warm and comfortable. The rooms were small but outfitted and decorated beautifully. The front desk staff went out of their way to help us with restaurant recommendations (all great) and making sure all of our questions were answered. I will be returning to The Jade next time I am in NYC!

Stayed at the Jade for 4 nights, and although the room and hotel is beautiful, I didn't get a single good night's rest. I'm not sure if it was the paper thin walls, or the vent that amplified everything from the room next to mine. Went down to the restaurant for lunch and late night cocktails which was great - a good crowd.

Next time I'll go back to choosing my NYC hotel on Expedia not Trip Advisor. We paid @$450/night for our room, which was claustrophobic (and yes I have lived here and know rooms are small), and included the tiniest bathroom ever. The room was decorated in greys and black with almost no lighting. Upon checkout, we were told that the dimness is part of the decor, but they have lamps available upon request. The shower and sink did not drain and apparently couldn't be fixed (we asked on Day 2 of 4). I didn't find the hairdryer (probably because it was so dark) but apparently it was in the closet. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was clean. If the price had been in the $200-300 range, I would have been satisfied. I've stayed in much larger nicer NYC hotel rooms at less cost, using Expedia.

The art-deco inspired hotel can best be described as flaming red lipstick on a crisp white collar--it's got as much class and sophistication as it does bite and sass. The facade and lobby are bathed in darkness with strategic low lighting, emphasizing inspired architectural detail and expertly curated corners of plush furniture and coffee-table books. Between the fireplace, marble and velveteen textures, it's hard to discern where the hotel starts and the wine bar begins.My room (The Barrow Queen on the 5th floor) was well appointed and made excellent use of space. Where room was needed, room was given. The bathroom was spacious, and I was pleased with the extra linens and luxurious shower essentials. The bed was crisp and comfortable and the level of cleanliness was platinum standard. The 1920s design touches were tasteful and not the least bit overdone or suffocating. The noise level from within the hotel was low to average as one would expect in any hotel, and we didn't hear so much as a whisper off 13th Street. Staff blended lightheartedness with real know-how in the most genuine and least pretentious ways possible--a lost art among other franchise hotels. The free wifi was much appreciated, but the staff served to be the best guides, giving specific advice on transportation, sightseeing, and food (not least of which included the exceptional hotel restaurant Grape & Vine).The booking experience was painless through the Jade Hotel's website. Pay close attention to the extras for each room type as some boast patios or soaker tubs. There are also notes as to which floors certain room types can be found so that you can customize your stay. If a view or added pacing room is important to you, it can be found at an exceptionally reasonable price considering your location in one of the most sought-after neighbourhoods in New York City.I had an exceptional stay at the Jade Hotel--one that I'd like to repeat very soon. The value for dollar greatly exceeded my expectations, and I wish them nothing but continued success as the Village's best accessory.

I was in NY for a business trip and my girlfriend took the opportunity to join and do some shopping while I was in the office. We stayed in NY for a couple of days when the business part of the trip was done, and we liked this hotel so much that we stayed here instead of finding something cheap on airbnb or such. The staff was very nice and friendly, everything felt warm and welcoming and the location was great with a lot of restaurants in Greenwich Village and with walking distance to a lot of great areas (such as SoHo and Chelsea district).Our room was quite big with a queen size bed, but my colleagues said that their rooms were almost half the size. The free wifi worked great and the noise level was very low.+cozy interior+stable and reliable wifi+low noise level+very comfortable bed-would've preferred a kingsize bed-no view whatsoever in our room

The Jade Hotel was the perfect location for my annual New York business trip. I will definitely be staying there again. The knowledgeable and helpful staff were fantastic day in and day out. The rooms were lovely, and the lobby space, with free wifi was the perfect place to work in the morning or have a glass of wine at night.
user_name:
Anna C
Jackson, Wyoming, United States

review_body: My boyfriend and I just spend a night at the Jade and we were so happy with it! The hotel is located in a great part of the Village and just steps away from some great eateries and bars. The service at the Jade was some of the best I've experienced. Everyone was warm and friendly and went out of their way to make you feel at home. While the room we stayed in was a bit small (it is NYC, after all) the decor throughout the hotel was lovely, warm and inviting. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat. A shout-out to Carlos, the bellman....great service!!

We arrived at the hotel following a 7.5 hour flight and a 1.5 hour car journey through awful traffic to the Jade Hotel. We arrived at the hotel after 2pm to be told our room wasn't ready and would be ready within the hour, but that they would put a rush on. We were fobbed off, told there were linen issues (!) and then eventually offered a temporary room to shower and rest in as we were going out at 5pm. As we settled in, our booked room was miraculously ready. We had booked a Hudson Queen - it was tiny and dark, not even a mini bar and ridiculously minute wardrobe, but with a good patio. Music in reception, bar and dining room (at breakfast - irritating!)The staff were very sweet and helpful (we were given a voucher for a complimentary breakfast) but inefficient and not trained to deal properly with any problems, however minor. At the end of a long flight the last thing any traveller needs is to have to sit in the lobby or to be told to 'go out for a while and when you return the room should be ready'. Shame as the hotel itself had a lovely atmosphere and was in a pretty good position.

The Jade Hotel was extremely accommodating to our group. We had a large group with several requests during our stay. Each person at The Jade Hotel truly made our business stay easier!Visit this hotel is your are looking for a unique stay.
user_name:
Caitlin C
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: The Jade Hotel is a boutique hotel that delivers at a good price point ( given that nothing is really reasonable in New York except relative to other NY hotels..) You could almost miss it ; its tucked away in a street in the village that is pretty quiet at night ( not so much in the day, since a design school is across from it) - but it's worth a visit both because of it's restaurant , the Grape and Vine ( or vice versa, I forget) and because it's just so cute. You walk down the stairs to get checked in which immediately makes the place seem cozy ( but on the other hand, is a pain in the neck if you have luggage and no bellman is there to help you) and immediately you can see little nooks where it's easy for a couple to have a private moment together. The first floor however is bigger than it seems on your entry; if you go through a low archway ( it almost seems like the entry to a speakeasy) you come out to a charming restaurant, bordered by booths and light and pretty. You will get a great breakfast there ( fresh fruit juices, smoothies and many perfectly done egg dishes including several great iterations of Eggs Benedict ) and imaginative food later in the day and evening.. I had perfectly done salmon and a Kale salad that would have been a yummy main dish all by itself. Both breakfast and dinner had friendly servers that were attentive and fun to interact with.The room sizes vary a lot- so be careful if you get claustrophobic in boutique sized spaces. But mine was a nice size, cheerfully decorated, with a good desk and an especially comfortable easy chair next to the bed. . It had a nice peekaboo view of the Freedom Tower and several roof gardens ( a plus) and a big shower ( a minus for me- I need a bath tub in a romantic room) but still the over all effect was cozy, sensual, and a bit chic.( I don't like a lot chic or trendy- it makes me feel like the hotel is only aiming for someone 25 , which I definitely am not) Overall effect, not luxurious but sweet and tastefully done and a room you could spend some hours in and feel taken care of. It's a great neighborhood too. Final comment: when I was there both the desk clerk and overnight staff were really personable and helpful.

I recently stayed at The Jade Greenwich Village with my best friend on a girls weekend to NYC. This hotel was perfect for what we were looking for- stylish, affordable and well-located. The decor is great with plush velvet couches and exposed brick in the lobby and retro touches like an old dial phone in the room. We had a great view looking south over NYC from our room on the 18th floor. Super water pressure in the shower and comfortable bed. We walked each day over to West Village to eat and shop, and was only about 5-10 minutes walk from The Jade. One day we had lunch at The Jade's restaurant, Grape & Vine, and it was delicious!! Highly recommend a lunch or dinner there. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at The Jade in NYC and definitely plan to return there in the future!

Arrived back yesterday from a fantastic 3 night break in NYC staying at The Jade for my friends 40th birthday, everything was just perfect, the staff we're excellent and so friendly, nothing was too much trouble and the attention to detail was amazing, they even surprised my friend with a bottle of wine and a beautiful cake for her birthday. The location is perfect just a stones throw away from Greenwich village, Soho etc yet within easy reach of Midtown. My friends and I couldn't have wished for anything better, I will definitely be returning. Also we had a standard room for 4 adults with 2 double beds in each and it was plenty big enough for a city break, plus the our shower didn't leak, the lifts were also very efficient, Don't listen to any bad views this hotel is just the best !!

We stayed here 8 nights. We upgraded to the larger room, and glad we did as they were still very small, but it's NYC, you expect that i guess. But the room is also near to the street and despite the bay windows never had a lot of light so small and dark is not a great combo for me. Being near the street turned out to be ok since the lifts were so slow we took to using the stairs most of the time. The location is excellent with everything you want nearby, the rooms look great and all the staff were very nice. The only other small problem was that the house keeping didn’t replace the toiletries very often, if I had a sticky note I would’ve put it on the mirror asking for more body lotion please as we had run out.

Having spent a ridiculous amount of time reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we finally settled on the Jade as it seemed to have everything we were looking for; great location, unique style, and and interesting character. There was not a moment when we doubted our decision to stay here. Upon pulling up in the taxi, the building has a rather unassuming presence on West 13th, but the lobby is very impressive. The art deco theme runs throughout, and has been completed to a very high standard. Food and service are both excellent, and the overall feel of the hotel is very intimate and personal. Everything here seems to be tailored towards optimising the experience of the people staying here. So, so much better staying at the Jade rather than one of the big name hotel chains which all seem to run a business based on a past reputation, rather than one that is properly oriented around the experience of the guests. We will definitely be staying here again when we next visit New York...although next time we might treat ourselves and splash out on one of the upgraded rooms to get a little more space. However, ultimately having a room that is a little on the pokey side is a compromise I think it's probably worth making when staying in a hotel that offers everything you need when you're in the middle of New York City.

Our first trip for 10 nights to the Big Apple and we were recommended The Jade Hotel. As a result we also recommended it to some relatives and friends!What a great decision...ideal location, beautifully built and presented, wonderful friendly & helpful staff, rooms clean and beautifully maintained, great happy hour every day, restaurant attached (a little expensive) and just like a 'home away from home' to be honest. Special thanks to Nancy and Paulina on front Reception and the door guys who were a delight to see every morning!Book it...you wont be disappointed!

We had a wonderful stay of 6 nights here during a family wedding. This boutique hotel locatednear 6th Avenue on 13th Street in the Village is a welcome addition to the NY hotel scene.The staff was always very welcoming. The front desk made making reservations (and changingthem) a breeze. The bellmen were very personable. The place has a wonderful, happy vibe.The rooms are not large (typical for a Manhattan hotel) but they are very comfortable and well set up. The lobby is inviting and had a good diversity of patrons going in and out.We did not try their in-house restaurant but it appeared to be very inviting.
user_name:
Karen and Doug S
New York City, New York

review_body: Nicely placed hotel in Greenwich Village between 5th Ave and 6th Ave on 13th Street . Attractive entrance and lobby area. The rest of the hotel is similar in style.With the exception of one of the rudest bar staff I have ever experienced, anywhere, the staff were friendly helpful and attentive.The rooms are of a small nature as all big city hotels. Our twin room had two large beds and a more than adequate bathroom.If in NYC again I would like to stay here!
user_name:
Martyn B
Market Rasen, United Kingdom

review_body: I researched countless boutique hotel options in NYC well beforehand so I was prepared for a very small room in a great location, cool vibe, great bar, big shower, comfy bed, etc. - and The Jade delivered. But I wasn't prepared for the total fail in basic guest services. The staff was super friendly but the little things just kept adding up to make my nights totally miserable:- Massive banging noise - like a heavy closet door slamming in my ear - every time the air conditioner cycled off. Every 5 minutes all night long. Worst night ever. I asked the next morning if someone could look at it. They said yes. Even so, I left with the feeling that nothing would be done.
