Came back that evening, asked the front desk if someone had fixed it and the gentleman said he thinks it is a 'customary noise'. I said we would have to change rooms or hotels so I could get some sleep. He called engineering. They recreated the noise, brought in ladders and tools and fixed it. Perfect. - After three mornings of waking up with puffy red eyes and sniffles I asked the front desk if they could possibly have missed my note of a feather allergy when I booked the room. Yep, the pillows were fluff but my comforter was full of feathers. They changed it out right away. My fourth night was bliss - quiet, comfortable - and I could breathe. Too bad I had only 1 good night out of 4.- Turn down service showed up at 5:30 every evening. Isn't that when most guests are in their rooms resting or getting ready to go out? When I asked them to come back later, like in 15 minutes, the answer was now or never... or we'll try. Didn't happen.Even without the problems I'm not sure if the stay was worth the thousands of dollars I paid for 4 nights. I really wanted to love it!

We just spent one week in the hotel and overall it was a wonderful experience with attentive staff, that cared about our well-being.The location is great and provided an easy venue to explore the Village along with great access to the subways and other public transportation. Our room was clean, great view, had a small terrace and quiet. However, I found the wooden bed frame corner to be a hazard and in the way as we walked in the room. Unfortunately, I banged my shin early during our stay which resulted in annoying pain and discomfort. I suggest that hotel management try to correct this design defect in the room. Here is a picture of the wooden corner of the bed frame for your reference. Notwithstanding the above inconvenience, I would certainly return to this hotel.
user_name:
Sandy L
Coconut Grove, Florida, United States

review_body: Perfect location and great ambience to the hotel. Staff were excellentHowever, it's very very small and the lift takes forever. The A/C has 2 settings off and very cold, which exacerbates the space issue.

Had a great stay at the Jade! All the staff were great. All were very helpful and just add to this attractive boutique hotel. Love the location too. Very quiet and we were able to walk to many great restaurants.I would recommend this and plan to stay next time I'm in NYC>

Son lives in the village so I stay at The Jade. Small, retro hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Close to great restaurants and the subway. Easy walk to Chelsea, Tribeca, Soho. I feel safe staying here, even when traveling alone as I did this time to attend USOpen.

Attractive boutique hotel in a good location. Staff friendly, welcoming and helpful. Lots of restaurants nearby and easy access to several subway lines. Rooms are small by American standards but well furnished and the bathroom is well fitted. Bed is very comfortable. Other reviews said bathroom floor flooded, this one didn't. It's the little things, all of which have been mentioned in other reviews. The air con is efficient but turns off with a loud clunk which will disturb lighter sleepers than me and it's a bit irritating during the day. There always seemed to be a wait for the lift although I don't agree with the reviewer who described them as small ( they have clearly never been to a similar hotel in Paris). Toiletries were not restocked although after I had to ask for them they went overboard and left loads. The lighting in the rooms could be improved. A lobby coffee service would be nice, most NYC hotels I have stayed in have one. I thought $4.35 a bit pricey for a small take away coffee from the restaurant. Don't let the niggles put you off, the hotel is good but be aware of these issues.

Chose The Jade based on previous reviews & was not disappointed. Friendly & efficient reception staff despite the IT issues they were experiencing. Free upgrade to room with patio and although the room was small - hey this is Manhattan - it was clean & perfectly adequate for one night. Nice link up between receptionist & doorman on leaving, and the attention to detail was such that they were scraping gum off the sidewalk as we left. Great breakfast with very wide choice.

As I entered the Jade, I was thrown back to the early 80s...like walking into an off beat new wave night club. It took me back in Time and that was so much fun! We stayed over one night, our son was moving into NYU. The staff is great, very helpful. The rooms are clean. The location is really great if you want to walk to the village or up lower 5th ave into Chelsea or over to Union square. The bathrooms are a bit cramped and there was no curtain on the shower so beware of a puddle floor when u get out of shower. The morning complimentary coffee is at the lobby level of the elevator and it's too weak and definitely not worth the 13 minute wait for the elevator. That is something they should improve on...the elevator..for a building over 5 stories..way over 5... It has the tiniest elevator I've ever seen. Oh well, we would go back, though, for the cleanliness and location...hopefully they can make stronger coffee and invest in another elevator.

The roooms were small but pleasant and shower was excellent! The staff and service were great. Stylish decor and great location. Food for dinner was pricey but good and the atmosphere in the bar/restaurant was lovely..

I stayed at The Jade in August on a girls get-a-way in Aug. The staff was amazing, thoughtful and informative. We called the front desk while out and about inquiring about restaurants and their recommendation were always spot on. We had a room(standard cozy small... NYC style) on the back side of the 16th floor with a slight view of the Hudson river. The beds had pressed cotton sheets and comfortable and supportive mattresses....important to me! I suggest you try it...you'll love it!
user_name:
Nancy L
Annapolis, Maryland, United States

review_body: I had a single, handicapped accessible room and was told it was larger than most. The room was very clean, the air conditioner made a loud clanging noise when it automatically went off. It sounded like a metal bar hitting a metal bar. It kept waking me up all night long. I asked if the engineer could fix it. Never happened. This is a classy hotel on a beautiful street. Plenty of great restaurants and shops...nearby buses and subway...and taxis a plenty. However-My third night there, a breaker blew in my room and the room went dark. I'm a disabled senior, who sleeps with a c-pap machine and I had no place to plug in my machine, so I couldn't go to sleep. There was no one to fix it, as the engineer went home at 11pm, so I did not have lights restored to my room. Thank God the bathroom light was still working. I had an important meeting in the morning and I had to sleep. Finally, I called down to ask if there was a long extension cord I could use. They brought it up and I finally went to sleep. It was awful. I asked to move to any other room but was ignored. I was moved the next night to a double room where the air conditioner still made the clang noise when it turned off. So I wasn't happy. The next day, the manager took the entire day off my bill. Would I stay there again? Not sure. But if you stay there, be prepared for a very small room. There is no dresser and only three tiny drawers in an armoire which doubles as the closet. So I lived out of the suitcase.The staff is super nice and polite. I got used to the small room, and the delicious free breakfasts delivered by room service daily. The beautiful street coupled with the very nice, polite staff made it a better than average hotel experience...but would I recommend it? Not so sure.
user_name:
CAROLE W
Los Angeles, California, USA

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights. The hotel employees were really professional, and the hotel is very nice. The location is excellent, right near a subway and many restaurants. The rooms were extremely small, but well appointed. The only thing that really annoyed me was the noisy air conditioning in our room. We stayed in July, so the weather was warm and humid, so an air conditioner is a must. When the air conditioner kicked in it was so LOUD, like really, really loud. Also, we had to ring housekeeping at times as they would not leave enough body wash.I would not stay here again because of the noisy air conditioner and that's why I only gave it three stars.

My daughter and I stayed at The Jade Hotel for 4 nights in August 2014. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Hotel is very clean, well decorated and a delight to stay at. Any questions we asked, they answered and assisted with directions of any other information we required.I had never been to New York so it was wonderful to have booked into such an amazing spot. The location of the hotel is perfect for subways, buses shopping, restaurants and touring New York.There is a scented candle burning in the lobby at all times which is lovely.

Small, boutiquey hotel - very friendly staff. The hotel has an Art Deco theme and all rooms are decorated in a similar style - room sizes do vary. Location is excellent - away from the hubbub but round the corner from the West Village with lots of bars and restaurants and great relaxed vibe. Easy to walk to many sights and close to subway for access elsewhere.

Very nice hotel situated in a great location. - Nice lobby and helpful and welcoming staff. Room was ok not cleaned properly though as the bathroom door was full of dust after housekeepers cleaned the room.

From the moment you walk in to this charming hotel you know you are in for a pleasant experience. They have the most wonderful scented candles burning and the decor is quite dramatic as you go down a staircase into the high-ceilinged lobby area with an open fireplace (not sure how that works for people with disabilities), which is beautifully decorated in rich, dark colours. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and charming, although the reception desk is behind you when you come the stairs, which means that you have to seek out the staff as you don't pass the desk when you exit. I would say that space is a little tight in the hotel; the passageway to the restaurant and the lifts is a bit narrow and our room which was one of the larger ones, was a bit just for 4 people, but no more so than you would expect in this part of NYC. They need to get better lighting in the rooms as we found it too dark for comfortable reading in bed and there is very little storage space in the room, but everything else was lovely. We stayed 4 nights and had breakfast there on the last morning which was excellent. We would definitely stay again, but rather as a couple than 4 in a room.

My family, who hales from Alabama, made a trip this past week to visit my sister who lives in the West Village area. We were so pleased with the Jade Hotel. From the moment you walk in the door the Jade is the perfect mix of old New York charm with modern luxury. We were very impressed by the outstanding staff and their exceptional customer service. The beds are very comfortable. Every detail has been thought out i.e. wine openers in the room, turn down service with chocolate chip cookies on your bedside table. We love the Jade and we will be back!

This hotel was in a great spot to be part of Greenwich Village and Chelsea. I would stay there again and am so happy we picked this spot. The quarters are tight, however! Don't go with anyone you don't want to be with!!! It really is a boutique hotel feel. Nice lobby - only wish is that there were bathrooms on the lobby level instead of going downstairs to the basement that seemed a bit like it should have been a restricted area!
user_name:
Amy Y
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Spent 4 nights at the lovely Jade Hotel. Great location on a quiet residential street, convenient to subways and shopping (and the New School and NYU). The staff was excellent, rooms clean. we will be back without question!

We chose The Jade because of its close proximity to our son's new dorm at NYU, and due to the great reviews here at Trip Advisor. However, we will come back as often as we can because of the STELLAR customer service! We were here during NYU's move-in weekend and the hotel was very busy, yet every single staff member we encountered had a big smile, answered questions intelligently, and just basically went out of their way to make sure we felt special. From our first encounter with Irving dashing out to get our bags from the car, to Joe at the bar giving us great restaurant advice, to Jackie and ALL the front desk staff and front door staff making sure we had everything we needed - I just can't say enough about what a fantastic experience we had! Kudos to the management for hiring such friendly and helpful professionals. You have a great team!We stayed four days and three nights, and are extremely pleased with the value and service that The Jade provided. Beds were super comfy and hard to leave in the morning! Yes, the rooms aren't giant, but ours was big enough for 3 people, spotlessly clean, well-appointed, and the Deco touches are to die for. This is NYC and the rooms were just as nice or nicer than places we've stayed in previous years. Yes, the showers do leak a little on the tile floors because of the solid glass decorative wall, but the heat and water pressure are fabulous. It was very hard to take a short shower because it felt so good - just what was needed after hours of walking! Terrific shampoo/soap/lotion, too. Just throw down the bath mat that's provided and no big deal. Best water pressure in NYC!Elevators could be a bit slow, but we were up and down to our room on the 7th floor very often, and only had one experience where we had to wait a bit. Really not a problem for us, and certainly not worth complaining over in light of how fantastic the rest of the experience was.The restaurant is very tasty - we ordered the salmon on bruschetta from the bar and it was delicious and was served promptly. The only less-than-stellar experience was the breakfast on Sunday. Service was a bit slow, and breakfast for 3 was $100 with tip and no cocktails, just water and coffee. It was good, but not $100 amazing. The restaurant wasn't crowded (4 tables) but food took between 30 - 45 minutes to arrive. Probably will skip that next trip - perhaps dinner is different. Our appetizer at the bar was fantastic, so I know the kitchen is capable of great things.Because there WILL be a next visit - as soon as we can schedule it! The Jade is in the best location in the Village - a 3 minute walk to 6th and every possible drug store, restaurant, cabs and shopping you could need. Five minutes over to 5th, less than 10 minutes walk to Washington Square, Union Square and subway stops. Highly recommend the delicious family Italian across the street, Da Andrea, for terrific service and affordable, scrumptious food.Overall, I would rate the Jade a 9.5 out of 10 due to the staff's unfailing friendliness, great location and general cool Deco vibe throughout. Breakfast was the only slight negative. We plan to visit our son at NYU as often as possible, and in The Jade, we have found the best NYC/Village hotel! No need to look further. We are extremely satisfied, found it to be a great value, and cannot wait to return!

Great location, excellent restaurant and great staff! Kilby and Florence were outstanding and worked very hard to accommodate my husband and I. My husband needed directions and planned a wonderful evening and Kilby was able to help him make our stay special. Overall a good hotel, small rooms but hey its NYC.

The Jade Hotel, located in a quaint neighborhood in Greenwich village, is a boutique hotel with an intimate, artistic vibe. From the gaslight on the ivy covered wall outside, to the exotic spicy scent you are greeted with upon entrance down the lit alabaster staircase, the Jade demonstrates attention to detail. My husband and I won a package to New York that included a three night stay at the Jade, which is why we ended up here. Contacting the Jade to reserve the room was no problem. Check-in was a breeze and they had our room available early (we arrived at 1 pm). They explain at check-in that they have a restaurant in the hotel with 24 hour room service and Happy Hour from 4 to 7, with half off drinks and flatbreads. The two blue bottles of Saratoga water in your room is complimentary and they serve coffee in the lobby until 9 a.m., which was appreciated. You also get 3 gluten-free chocolate chip cookies on your bed with the turn down service. When we emerged off the elevators to the 12th floor, I felt a little claustrophobic, as it is a narrow hallway and tight quarters. The room itself was on the small side, but like a cruise ship cabin, they made use of all the space available. The room was beautifully decorated, with art deco touches of gold, black and chrome. There's a desk with an alarm clock, light, pen, outlets and snacks (for a charge). The room is equipped with a safe, iron, hair dryer, robe and slippers and nice toiletries. The pretty mirrored closet had adequate hangers and some small drawers. When I couldn't get into the safe, someone arrived quickly to fix it. The bed was extremely comfortable with a heavy comforter and nice pillows. The room was quiet except one morning (early), when we could hear the people next door talking. We took advantage of the Happy Hour, filled with an eclectic crowd of middle aged people (like us) and New York hipsters. One night we sat in the lobby and the hostess brought us our glass of wine to drink there. All the employees at the Jade were extremely friendly and helpful. The New York Times is available in the lobby and there are red umbrellas located by the entrance, which came in handy one rainy morning. There is no concierge, but the Front Desk employees were able to help us in navigating the city, finding the subway and train station and suggesting places to eat. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood, not far away from Chelsea market and the Highline. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning. While it was good, it was expensive but there aren't really a lot of breakfast options around the hotel. I really enjoyed my stay at the Jade, although they did forget my wake up call the morning we were leaving. It came a half an hour late, but I was already awake and sorry to leave the Jade. Oh, this may sound weird, but I really liked their pens. The door man gave me his and said to keep it and it's orange, plastic and writes well. As a writer, I appreciate this fact and it's the little things like that- attention to detail- that sets the Jade apart.

This hotel is in a good location and is attractive, externally and in the lobby. The staff were nice but not overly so. The 2-double bed room we had was clean but really small. Bathroom is tiny and very inconvenient. How small? I'm sitting at the small desk now but have to sit sideways because i can't back the chair up since it is against the bed. The bathroom has no room/shelves to put anything and no extra TP or tissues if you run out. The shower has one of those european half glass doors, which means the bathroom floor gets wet. There is a tiny closet - doesn't work well if you have much stuff. No coffee maker in the room. They have coffee urn on the first floor but the elevator is so slow it took a long time to get a cup in the morning. The bed was very comfortable and no bug issues. Overall mixed feelings about The Jade. If you are alone and staying short term then this might work well. Good restaurants and shopping nearby. Convenient to NYU. Longer term and more people - not so much. Small room/BR gets annoying.

At our son's suggestion who lives nearby we decided to stay at The Jade for our most recent trip to NYC. The location is first rate - 13th Street is lovely, quiet, and picturesque. The hotel lobby (which is downstairs from the front entry) is an inviting spot. Since our stay was short we settled on a Grove Queen room (though the desk clerk told me all rooms except suites are under 300 square feet). It is small but as others have noted nicely appointed and thoughtfully decorated. If we were staying longer I would definitely have felt claustrophobic in that space. We did, however, get a room on a higher floor which I had requested so we had a nice view and plenty of natural light. The downside of an upper floor is the very slow elevator. During our stay one of the two elevators was out of service so it was even slower than normal. One guest complained of waiting ten minutes!We found the staff helpful and cordial. The room was exceedingly clean. We had no noise issues from the hall or our neighbors and the blackout curtains on the windows meant we weren't awakened by the early morning sunlight.Because we are fans of boutique hotels and love this particular NYC neighborhood I imagine we'll return to The Jade.

My wife and I just returned from a stay at the Jade Hotel. The Jade is our preferred hotel when we visit NYC. It is located near both the 14th Street and the Union Square subway stops. 14th street is one stop from Penn Station. It is on a nice residential street with a number of good restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are cozy but very well appointed and comfortable. The common areas are welcoming and the staff was helpful. Wonderful boutique hotel. We look forward to our next visit.

This was my second stay here, and both times I've been impressed. The rooms aren't huge - but none are in NYC in my experience - but they're comfy and adequate. The hotel has some good restaurants nearby, Murrays bagels is <1 min walk away and Hollywood diner is <5 mins walk away so I wouldn't bother with room service which can be pricey. It's close (<8 mins walk) to some large US stores like Marshalls, TK Maxx, Levi's, Urban Outfitters, and just a short cab ride away to Times Square. There's also a great nail salon called Buddha across the street ($25 for mani-pedi). It's quiet, and in a safe neighbourhood. I'd definitely recommend it.

Stayed at the jade one night last week with my daughter. Wish we had been able to stay longer! This little place is a gem! The lobby is small but very cozy yet chic at the same time. Size of the Grove Queen room was absolutely fine for the two of us. Very quiet even though the room was on a lower floor (at my request because I do not like heights) and faced 13th St. My daughter thought the AC fan cycling on and off was too loud but I was not bothered by it. Ended up just setting it to continuous fan to avoid the on/off cycles. The room was very clean and the bed was very, very comfortable. The outstanding staff was super friendly and helpful. This place is perfect for families with older children as well as couples or friends. But if a solo traveler would be comfortable here because there is a very welcoming and homey vibe. I hope I have the opportunity to stay there again!

This was our 2nd visit to NYC and we wanted to stay in the Greenwich area. After looking at various hotels we decided to opt for the Jade and were glad that we did.For us it was perfectly located; walking distance to the various metro stations and also walking distance to bars that we were going to be drinking in.It's a fairly new hotel, although it looks like it's been there for years (I think the concierge said it had only been there about 18 months in its current form). The whole hotel was very clean and has a high level of finish. It was pretty much perfect; good size room, shower and bed. Quiet street. Good day rate etc. There were, in our opinion, 2 things that could be improved on (which we did share with the reception at check-out); the lifts are really slow (nothing major) and the walls are a bit thin (as in you can hear a 'lot' of what happens in other rooms, if you get my drift!)Would we stay here again? Absolutely.

After staying in Midtown on our last visit to New York, we decided to opt for somewhere a little quieter while still being central - and what a great choice! The Jade Hotel is lovely, with gorgeous decor, and friendly and helpful staff. Handy for the subway, but also easy walking distance for the whole of Lower Manhattan, we found we had plenty of options for eating out, with cafes, restaurants and diners aplenty within a few minutes' walk. The room we had was comfortable and clean, and being an older building the walls were nice and thick, so we weren't listening in on other guests. My only minor issue was the lack of storage space: the wardrobe was small and the bathroom had very little shelf space for putting your own stuff. But as problems go that's nothing, and we will definitely stay there again the next time we're in the city.

I booked a night in my home town for a romantic get-a-way. The Hotel was perfect. We booked the Greenwich Suite with a wonderful balcony looking over the city and The Empire State Building. The room, though fairly small, is gorgeous retro Parisian chic. The marble bathroom is to die for with walk-in shower and a gigantic tub. Although there was a TV I kept in hidden behind sliding wooden panels, it really felt like we were in a pre-digital era. The manager, Ms. Godwin, was very welcoming and helpful. The room service breakfast was delicious and hot and made all the better sitting on a table on the balcony on a beautiful morning. The hotel is located on a quiet Greenwich Village Street with lots of access to the neighborhood and transportation. Definitely a low key boutique hotel of high quality.
user_name:
Paul J
New York City, New York

review_body: For our first trip to NYC I think we happened upon a gem of a hotel that we won't hesitate to return to again and again! We didn't want the touristy madness of Midtown so Greenwich Village was the perfect location - within 10-15minutes walk there is a countless selection of great restaurants, bars, cafes, boutique shops etc -all with a personal "neighbourhood" feel to it (Bleecker Street, Hudson St!!). The subway is conveniently located a block away giving ready access uptown and downtown. If you enjoy walking as we do, then there are numerous interesting suburbs all within walking distance (Chelsea, Soho, Noho, Tribeca, Little Italy, Nolita, Chinatown, East Village, Meatpacking District......). The hotel itself is beautifully decorated in the Art Deco style throughout - the lobby, downstairs bar and restaurant oozed 1930's cool. We stayed for 7nights, and while our room wasn't large (Club Deluxe) it catered for our needs more than adequately and with style (safe, ironing board, desk, seating and table etc). Loved the old world phone!! It also had a pleasant view of the street and School at the front of the hotel. The staff were ALL friendly and attentive, personable, interesting and importantly competent and eager to help in any way. My wife and I actually eloped in Central park while we were there and the staff were very excited for us and provided a bottle of champagne on the house in our room and shouted us drinks at the bar. The restaurant and bar staff were fabulous (Lyndsey!) and they contributed wonderful memories to our time in New York! Thank you all!

Small hotel in a fantastic location. Terrible staff, got served Tang but was sold (and charged) fresh squeezed Orange Juice. Unbelievable. Was told by manager it would be credited, never happened. Worst hotel experience I've ever had, I can't recommend this hotel to friends or enemies! And the walls are paper thin, got to hear and get heard by everyone near us.

Great location-never been to NYC before so this was perfect. Close to the subway-great bars and restaurants and shopping. Lovely staff-very helpful and our room pretty good for New York. Price great on booking dot com. As all the reviews say it 's very well done with the Art Deco theme- but our standard room was a little dark and started to feel claustrophobic after a few days and had no view. No where to put bathroom items and we could hear doors slamming outside our room. But all in all we loved our stay and would recommend it.

I travel to NYC quite often for work and have stayed at countless hotels within the city over the past 14 years. Jade hotel exceeded my expectations by far. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and attentive to all my needs. Room was clean and the decor was very welcoming yet unique. I ate two meals at the restaurant and the food was fresh and delicious. Great location in Greenwich village and I was able to quickly get to the jogging trail along the Hudson. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a perfect boutique hotel in NYC!

Stayed at The Jade what a nice surprise. The staff is young, friendly and happy to help. The restaurant and bar were great, good ambiance and the food was an added surprise. Try higher floors, our room was small but very functional, my husband and I we were not cramped. The location, we had never stayed in the Village was fun and practical. Union square, the subway right around the corner. We will stay there again.
user_name:
Teresita G
Humacao, null, Puerto Rico

review_body: ...but then again we are talking New York. Really like decor and style nice boutique - but the room ( for 4 of us) and beds seemed very small. If you can cope with that - then this is a lovely hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was central for all main attractions

I travel to New York for business and this is my most favorite hotel that I have stayed in to date. The staff is wonderful, very attentive and helpful. The design of the hotel is just a feast for the eyes, just lovely! The rooms are a great size for New York, you don't feel crammed into a tiny space, you have breathing room and space to spread out. The bed was so comfortable and the room was so quiet. I slept great here, which is so important for me to be fresh to work the next morning. The restaurant, Grape and Vine, was wonderful as well. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. I will stay here again, love it!

I am a New Yorker living in Europe, visiting NYC regularly! I recently "found" The Jade Hotel.Perfect location with very friendly and genuinely helpful staff. And trustworthy! Left my wallet in my room upon checking out and it was found and returned with all my cash and cards safely in it!It really is the best of what New York has to offer. Gabriel Z

beautiful lobby. and beautiful rooms, but still on the small side (coming from europe, this is normal!).we were there early morning (overnight travel, no sleep yet) and were only expecting to leave our luggage. reception said they'd ring if the room was ready - never got a call, and I don't think they have an idea if our room was ready until I asked.If your luggage is not waiting in your room, ask that you bring it up yourselves - we waited for an hour for our luggage before we can finally sleep. So yes, it wasn't a good start.for 2 people, there wasn't enough space to hang your clothes or to dry your towels. whole bathroom floor would get wet as you shower.Bar downstairs can get busy, but drinks and atmosphere is great. Service there is brilliant!It's in a wonderful location. we walked to the high line and chelsea market. the subway is just around the corner. and the jazz bars 3-4 blocks away.I would stay here again, now that i know that i should avoid checking in early.

This is a gorgeous little boutique hotel in one of the nicest parts of Manhattan. It's close to subway stops, and the area is safe. it is within walking distance to many nice restaurants in Greenwich Village. Rooms are very clean, and the hotel staff is more than willing to see that clients are happy. I noticed that the noise level is very low, and the sounds of a big-city traffic didn't keep me awake at night. Two points to consider: First, the rooms are almost too small to accommodate 2 people with luggage. My friend and I were constantly in each other's way. Second, the hotel offers wi-if, but no computers on the premises. Therefore, if you don't pack a laptop, or if you need to print something, you might be out of luck. Other than that, the price is comparable with other hotels in the area, and it's a nice hotel.

The service was very good and the food was very good. However, the rooms are small (typical New York), and on the darker side. We travel quite a bit, and while the room was well appointed, it felt a bit claustrophobic. It is a great place to stay, if you don't plan to be in the room much. The bed also wasn't as comfortable as a Heavenly bed or other high-end beds. The hotel is near the Village and very convenient to NYU.
user_name:
Kristyn F
Chicago's North Shore, Illinois

review_body: Stayed 7 nights in 1403 - great views of Downtown and a larger room. Service First Class, great shower, TV, wifi, aircon, quiet and clean. Friendly staff, nice reception and decent drinksGood quiet location walking distance to bars, jazz clubs, food, shops and away from busy Midtown3 couples traveled - good value for NY prices

My three best friends from high school had the most fabulous NYC weekend thanks to the Jade. Everyone at the Jade was friendly, helpful, and full of good suggestions for eating, drinking, shopping and sight seeing. Admittedly, the rooms were small, but what they lacked in size they way made up for in charm! We put four girls with lots of luggage all in the same room and were very comfortable (which is near impossible to do in NYC). I would stay there again and I would recommend it to others! Thanks Jade!!

We spent six nights at the Jade, partly business, partly leisure. Charming, comfortable, excellent location, on 13th Street between 5th and 6th - easy walking to the village, Chelsea, the Highline, Union Square, and good for subway or buses elsewhere. The rooms are small but well-equipped - good bed, good wifi, lots of electric sockets, terrific shower - and nicely decorated in deco style. The lobby bar is good for meeting friends or just hanging out, the restaurant pleasant, and the staff and service welcoming and helpful. Highly recommended.

Just came back from a great weekend stay at The Jade Hotel in NYC. It's our annual anniversary stay in the city, this was our first try at a boutique hotel and downtown. Fabulous...we got in before check in and the room...a penthouse was ready for us...beautifully decorated room and bathroom...The hotel and The Grape and Vine restaurant has a great ambiance (Deco)...the staff was nice and friendly...and the food was good as well....Great Location for shopping and just walking around. Just Everything was Beautiful!!! Thank you both the staff of The Jade and The Grape and Vine for a Wonderful stay...Right up there with The Bryant Park Hotel.
user_name:
Susan M
Scotch Plains, New Jersey

review_body: My husband and I along with 2 other couples stayed in The Jade Hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is located on a quaint quiet street on 13th street between 5th and 6th in Greenwich Village area. It is a small boutique hotel with a lovely lobby, a bar and restaurant on the first floor. Upon arrival we were promptly given our room keys and took the elevator to the 12th floor. There are only 4 or 5 rooms on each floor. The rooms are very small ... but for European standards they are pretty average. We had a room with two double beds. There is not a proper closet .... but an armoire cabinet that held about 10 pieces of clothing tightly packed. The bathroom is small but adequate. There was a very nice, large big screen TV, free wifi, room service, free bottled water in the rooms. The hotel was very clean and had a clearly chic and trendy feeling. It was easily within walking distance of dozens of bistros, bars, coffee houses, etc. I would highly recommend this as an alternative to some of the high rise big name hotels.

As others write, nice hotel, really boutique experience, and perfect neighbourhood. There is a great variety of restaurants around, for every specialty taste, within 3-5 min distance. That's a releif as the hotel restaurant is VERY expensive. That was a bit disappointing that you wont get a decent breakfast under USD 25 or even 35 perhaps; so you'd better go out. It is also not the most ideal place if you have young chidren. The room is SO small that a baby cot barely fits. It was squeezed in, but then you really have no room to move around or put down your suitcase, and there is not a lot of place to store your stuff. As for the TV offering, there is nothing really quality; although there is a nice huge TV screen, but you can only watch junk (unbelievable that there is not a decent international news channel, or a quality kids channel, have not found PBS although that maybe our inexperience, have not been back to the US for a while. Otherwise it is true that the hotel is very pretty, nice decor, good service.

This will now be my go-to hotel when visiting New York. The hotel is in a tree lined neighborhood and around the corner from bagels in the morning, cafes, restaurants and shopping. Greenwich Village is a great place to stay and explore. The Jade is relaxing and elegant. Rooms were spotless, beds were plush and was total comfort after walking around town all day. Well done Jade Hotel.

We stayed here for 5 nights. We were on the 15th floor. Have to say this hotel will take some beating for us. It's fantastic. Ok,small room but that's New York. There is no expense spared on the decor. It's stunning inside. Staff always helpful and friendly. Clean room,everyday, fresh towels, great turn down service. Comfortable bedding. The restaurant possibly a little extensive but very good. Recommend the French toast! Lifts are a little slow. Waited up to 8 minutes just to get downstairs! Did mention this on our departure. The location is just awesome. Away from the noise of Times Square but in the middle of the beautiful part of New York. Shops,restaurants, parks,bars all nearby. Would we stay here again.. Absolutely. Loved it. Well done The Jade. Love Robert and Victoria

Super friendly service. Close-ish to all things West Village and beyond. Rooms are good; they have everything you could need, nice crisp sheets, nice amenities, except the rooms really are tiny even by NYC standards. Restaurant food is good, both eat-in or room service. I have stayed here 2 times in the last month, for a total of 9 days, and would definitely come back and recommend it.

Great location near union square. Wifi sucked and was patchy the entire time I was there. The walls were thin, so I woke up every morning at 5 as the hotel guest next to me was talking on the phone loud enough I could hear it in my room. It's just okay. I am not sure it was worth the price I paid to stay the two nights there.
user_name:
Jenny W
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: My friends and I just spent three nights at the Jade Hotel and we absolutely loved it. Location was great, the rooms were thoughtfully decorated and the hotel had such a warm and friendly vibe. We were especially blown away by the thought and care provided by the staff. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. All the little touches, like accommodating our room changes to the champagne on my birthday, made our trip to NYC a spectacular one.

The hotel is nice, but the service is what really sets it apart. From the check-in desk to the restaurant staff to concierge, everyone was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. I haven't enjoyed any other stay in New York as much.

A funky hotel in a great location, the decor throughout the hotel is beautiful and rooms were really nice - the most comfortable beds - yes small but that's NY. We stayed for 9 nights and loved it. Great bar for a drink after a long day of discovering such a big city, happy hour from 4 - 7pm. The staff throughout the hotel are all really friendly and immaculately presented. Couldn't fault this hotel and will definitely recommend it to our friends.

We had a great time at The Jade Hotel. The room was great except the way the shower was designed. When you shower there the floor gets all wet. The shower door only covers half the shower stall. The room is so adorable. The location of the Hotel is excellent since we spent time at NYU and the Hotel is right down the street.

I used to live in NYC and am always on the lookout for good hotels downtown. This little place is tucked away near everything I like in the West Village. The staff is very nice, rooms are a good size for NYC, but I found the decor a bit odd. The lighting in the rooms is terrible and the shower is open, no door. I didn't mind so much but my husband who is a big guy hated the shower. He felt that the water went all over the place. Restaurant in the hotel was great for breakfast.

We spent 7 Nights At The Jade in June. Our AirBnB Host Canselled, and I Had Had My Eyes On The Jade for a While, as I Love Their Web Site, Presentation And Location, Location, Location.I Will Write This Short & Sweet. We Loved It There. From The Street Through The Entrance Through The Carefully Scented Lobby, Into The Secretly Located Grape & Wine Bistro to The Wonderful, Profesional and Attentive Staff At Front Desk And Everywhere. How Do You Cast Your Staff, Jade Management & Owners? I Would Have Put Them All in a Movie About How Much I Love New York - Any Time. To The Staff: Thank You. Beautiful Design, Lovely Beds and Bigelow Amenities Aside: You Are The Best About The Jade. Thank You For Making Our Stay Memorable. We Have Never Felt So Much At Home In Any Hotel In Any Other Part Of The World. Our Daughter (12) Senda Her Very Best Regards. We Hope The Jade Pay You Well. My Summer House Is At Your Disposal Any Time.

We loved our stay at The Jade Hotel! We couldn't find fault with anything from check-in to check-out! The doorman Brian was so professional and upbeat - he is truly a great representative for "first impressions" for the hotel! Kilby ran that front desk so efficiently - he is the "get-it-done-guy!! The staff is polished. The hotel is beautiful. Our room size was perfect for two. The tub in our room was THE best and most comfortable for soaking out of all the hotels we have stayed in. People previously mentioned that the semi-open shower door got their bathroom door soaked, we didn't find that to be true in our case. The hotel is in the center of a great neighborhood - Murrays Bagels, Bar-6 restaurant which both allowed for great people watching! There are a couple spa's within two blocks - Silk and Rohobeth Spa. There is a Rite-Aid down the street for any toiletries you might need to pick up. We spent 5 days there and couldn't see everything! We would love to stay at The Jade Hotel again!

We have stayed twice at the Jade Hotel over the last year. The situation is great in the Village and if you are reasonably fit within walking distance of shops on 5th, many restaurants, and if you are up to it even to Central Park. The staff are friendly and really helpful. Breakfast is good with choices ranging from simply coffee and bagel through amazing greanola fruit combination to full USA style meal. The bar has an early evening 1/2 price session for those who like an early drink. The rooms are very big city boutique and so the standard room, though well furnished, is small. If you need more room its worth paying a bit more for amore space. All in all - a cool place to stay

My wife and I spent our 2nd Anniversary in the Jade Hotel in May this year. From arrival to departure the staff could not have been any friendlier or more helpful. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and the bar/restaurant is a really nice, atmospheric place to have a drink or eat.The hotel is ideally placed in Greenwich Village next to Metro links and is withing walking distance of both Uptown and Downtown.Also, the flatbreads that they make during happy hour are absolutely delicious!We would definietely return to this hotel if we visit New York again.

Just returned from Manhattan to celebrate our 27th anniversary where we spent five nights at The Jade Hotel which we learned about on TripAdvisor. We had a wonderful stay at this boutique hotel. After checking in, the hotel sent a bottle of champagne to our room! Beautiful decor and, yes, the rooms are on the small side but it's NY! We had read some reviews about the shower design allowing the floor to get wet and the bathroom door being frosted glass and just a bit see-thru. Yes, that's true. However, after many hours of walking everyday the shower was fantastic! We also ate in the restaurant, breakfast and dinner, and each time had fabulous meals. Great little bar area with a good Happy Hour - delicious flatbreads and more! We also loved the location - just a block to the subway and walking distance to so much the area has to offer. Will definitely try to book there again on our next trip. We're hooked!

Excellent service from the concierge and pure new york style. All what u need for a week end. Ideally located room are a bit small and you can hear the room service outside or the neighbours but clearly one of my top adress in Manhattan.

A little pricy but its worth it. Its walking distance to 5th avenue for shopping, about 10 minutes: JJill, H&M, Gap, Coach, Banana Republic, Anthropology... and more. The hotel is very charming. Rooms are small, bed wasn't very comfy but its still good, don't take me wrong. The shower is one of the best ever had.. Its powerful. Its 2 minutes to a Chiplote on the corner of 6th and W13th were you can have Burritos and beers and watch walkers! There is a little restaurant on W13 walking west towards 5th too, with nicer meals. A/C noisy and its so small you need it on all night otherwise it gets stuffy.

I stayed here for almost two weeks during a renovation of our apartment nearby. CAN I PLEASE MOVE IN?This place is perfect. It's trendy and comfortable without being obnoxious. From the warm gas lamps drawing you in from the street, to the staff that are so kind and helpful. The restaurant is pretty good, although strangely empty most the day. The room (1703) wasn't huge, but it had everything we needed: a comfortable bed, desk area, large TV, big closet, a modern bathroom, and the bonus of a killer view of downtown. The wifi situation was slightly annoying (I had to re-sign-in every few hours), but I imagine that wouldn't bother most guests. The gym is small but sufficient, with all new equipment, so bring your workout clothes!My only gripe is that there are 100+ rooms but only 2 elevators. Not only are the elevators slow and stop at most every floor, but at one point there was just one elevator. There were a few times when it took 10 minutes just to get out. Overall, I loved this place and you will too!
user_name:
ZuzziTravels
New York City, New York

review_body: If you are looking for excellence at affordable prices, look no further - The Jade Hotel (Greenwich Village, NY) is what you need. The Hotel is wonderfully furbished, rooms are spacious, comfy and fully equipped, the restaurant offers great food and an interesting crowd. The staff is extremely kind and supportive, and last but not least... the hotel smells delicious: fresh flowers are changed every day and makes you feel home every time you walk in. The borough is the best you can get in NY: walking distance from 5th Ave, Soho, Flatiron and Meatpacking. The block offers more restaurants and shops and opposite the Hotel the Silk SpA is what you need to unwind from a busy day. An excellent experience! Definitely coming back.

Love this place. I had the front desk help me find a lost item and sent back to me to my home! They go above and beyond. Bedsides that the location is perfect. It's located in such a perfect area where you can easily go anywhere in the city. And the hotel itself is so charming. With it's warm lobby, generous staff, and beautiful rooms. I will definitely be back.

Stayed two nights over Memorial Day weekend in this relaxing hotel on picturesque side street, close to Washington Square, Hi Line and Meatpacking District. Many European visitors and multilingual staff. Tasty brunch in beautifully designed dining room. Room clean and quiet on 5th floor. Criticisms include elevators constantly having breakdowns, so-called Queen-sized bed which seemed definitely double sized and somewhat cool staff. We were told elevator problems were being addressed. Will look for another boutique hotel in Village next trip.

It's hard to add anything to the reviews already here. I had wondered if the Jade could actually be as food as it's website suggests, but actually it is. The people are lovely, really friendly, help when you need it, but not overly intrusive when you don't. We enjoyed the Art Deco styling, and found the room comfortable and well equipped. The room is a bit on the small side, but I think that's par for the course in NYC, and a bit more storage for clothes would not go amiss. However, the beds (we had the Bedford room with two doubles) were very comfortable and we slept incredibly well. The Grape and Vine restaurant downstairs has an interesting menu, and the food is good quality and well presented. The location is ideal, just a minute from 5th avenue where regular buses take you uptown in no time, and a short walk I the other direction to all the nooks and crannies of Greenwich village. We shall definitely return.

It's great to be in New York and stay at a place that is not corporate (or at least doesn't feel corporate) but rather is small, cozy and embedded in a neighborhood. The rooms are perfectly adequate and rather European, AKA a bit on the small size. But who goes to New York to stay in their room? My husband and I felt perfectly comfortable, the bed and linens were great and the bathroom had a good shower. They put little treats out at turn-down service like cookies ot truffles. It's the little things that count.More important, the staff was terrific, working very hard to make sure all was well. We travelled with my elderly mother and her aid, so there help was indeed needed and cheerfully offered. We also had brunch in the house restaurant & it was delicious!

This boutique hotel in Greenwich Village has an art deco flair, and is actually quite new. Located on West 13 street, it is conveniently located to Washington Square Park and Union Square with its greenmarket, Whole Foods, and numerous restaurants. The in-house restaurant offers very good breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner, as well as good room service. The rooms are small and well-appointed; wifi is free with sufficient outlets for your electronic devices. The staff is courteous, helpful and considerate, and anxious to make you feel at home.

We stayed there for 4 nights during a company trip, the location is great, near supermarkets, restaurants, 10 mins walk from bars and places to hang out, near Meatpacking district, High Line etc. - Don't pay for breakfast as there are plenty places to explore near the hotel. - Rooms were ok, normal size to small, internet/ wi-fi was working ok (10th floor), there is security all the time and didn't have any problem. - Only issue I had with my sleep, one night the heating was extremely annoying and I am 100% sure that I didn't turn it on. - There is also a bar-restaurant in the ground floor (Grape & Vine), had a couple of beers there.We paid around $1,800 for 4 nights.

This place was just perfect.My sister and I agreed that everything went smooth and they make the trip so relaxing. The place is adorable and decor as cool as can be. The only con is the bar a little expensive but that's NY. And I left my curling iron and did not get it back, a very expensive one, so check before you leave my fault! Other than that I'll be back for sure great location.....

Wow. This hotel rocks. Have had brunch there a couple of times, and dinner as well. Love it. The rooms are meticulously designed to be comfortable and aesthetically pleasing. Nice views. Comfortable beds. Amazing, attentive staff. Good value! You won't find a better location that's close to everything!
user_name:
MichaelBNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: As you will see by my other reviews, we visit NYC a couple of times a year and have stayed at many different hotels. Even before arriving, I had to call the hotel and was pleasantly surprised at the friendliness of the individual who answered the phone and my questions. From the moment we arrived and we were greeted by Bryant the doorman who opened the cab door and grabbed the suitcases before I had even paid the driver to the time that we checked out it was the best experience we have ever had at a NYC hotel. Bryant hailed cabs for us, grabbed umbrellas to cover us as soon as he saw us when it was raining, made great restaurant suggestions and when we asked about where the ice machine was had a bucket of ice sent to the room. Tamika, the hotel manager went above and beyond to make sure our stay was pleasant. We arrived very early and check in, as with most NYC hotels was at 3:00. My daughter wasn't feeling well so we asked if our room was available early. Tamika made it happen. It was by far one of the largest rooms we have ever had in the city, Including our stay at the Waldorf. This hotel is brand new and beautiful.They provide robes and slippers. We love to be able to hear the sounds of the city and you could open your windows in the room. We were able to make the best of the rain and fell asleep listening to it on the nights it rained. Black out curtains were amazing. Completely dark. Bed and linens were extremely comfortable.There is no tub in the rooms. Only showers. Room was very quiet once the inconsiderate morons in the room next to us left. Even when I complained about them, Tamika was willing to move us if the problem continued but we loved the room and fortunately they checked out. They have a half price happy hour for wine and flat breads which was very nice. Nancy is the hostess and has an amazing personality and was very helpful with new restaurants to visit in the area. There is a restaurant in the hotel and room service available. The only complaint, if I had to have one would be the prices in the restaurant are outrageous even by NY standards. Breakfast- OJ- 7.00, english muffin, yogurt w/granola and fruit and coffee over 35.00.. There is a restaurant for breakfast right around the corner with awesome food called HU and another one called Gray Dog both affordable and great food. This is our new go to hotel. We will DEFINITELY be going back to this hotel (as long as the cost and great service doesn't change) The professionalism and customer service is at a level that other NYC hotels could learn from. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel. Oh... our favorite area is in the village and The Jade is perfectly located to Union Square, great shopping, subways and good restaurants and bakeries. The cost for this hotel is affordable and a great value for what you get. You won't be disappointed.

This is quaint little boutique hotel in Greenwich Village (W 13th Street) within easy reach of Union Square and Washington Square Park, the two major landmarks close to it. Rooms are a bit small, but clean and well furnished. Wifi is free; there is also a restaurant opposite the main reception which we didn't try since there were so many places to choose from in the general area of the hotel. Hotel staff are helpful and friendly, and were able to help with booking cabs and luggage. If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel right in the heart Greenwich Village and close to subway stations for commuting this is a very good choice.

We stayed here for 8 nights and really enjoyed it. The location is fantastic - to the left you can explore character neighbourhoods such as Greenwich Village and nearby Meat Packing District and Chelsea (don't miss the High Line and Chelsea Markets). To the right you'll find yourself on 5th Avenue amongst the more commercial retail/business areas. There is a subway station one block away with easy access to all corners of Manhattan.The hotel is new but built to look much older, with all the modern cons you would expect. The lift is very slow, which was a bit frustrating but that is really the only negative I can give. The staff are generous, the restaurant/bar is great and the beds are extremely comfortable. We met many travellers during our stay who had opted to stay in a more 'central' location around Times Square. Personally, I was so pleased we opted to stay in the village where we could retreat to a quieter and more residential area when the crowds and neon lights became too much. There is still plenty of activity in the streets but you get the impression there are more locals here just getting on with their day. Everywhere is so accessible via the subway and taxis we didn't feel we needed to be in the thick of it to get the best out of our trip. Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for 4 nights. The staff were extremely friendly, polite and helpful. The hotel is quite stylish and aiming for a "boutique" look, both in the public areas and the rooms.The public areas (foyer and bar / restaurant) are quite dark as they are actually below street level - the foyer in particular can seem very dark even on a sunny day. There is a lift from the street level to the foyer level if you require, but there always seemed to be staff available at the door to help with luggage.I had a room on the 15th floor (I think it's 18 floors in total) and as there were only 4 rooms on the floor the room was very quiet. The rooms are not big but considering the location I thought it was fine and it was very nicely decorated with an excellent shower and nice gels and shampoos.I had dinner once in the hotel restaurant (they serve until around 11:45pm) and thought it was pretty good quality and not ridiculously priced.The only thing I didn't like was that there were no tea or coffee-making facilities in the room. Instead there was complimentary coffee in the foyer in the morning. Apart from that, I'd stay there again and recommend it to others.

My wife and I stayed here for 10 days and were extremely pleased with it. It was only recently built, and while it looks like a small hotel from the street level, the rooms are in an 18 story tower behind the street facade. The lobby, bar, restaurant and the elevators to the rooms are one level below street level. One can enter the lobby down a staircase from the street entrance or via a side elevator off the street entrance. In spite of its recent construction it has an old world charm about it which may account for why it seems to appeal to the many well dressed and well spoken foreigners who were staying there. The entire staff from the Reception desk, to room service (24 hours) to the restaurant was uniformly friendly and accommodating. Unlike the Marlton Hotel on 8th Street, where the rooms are so tiny that there is not enough room for a suitcase, a chair, a desk, a bureau or for that matter anything at all except a bed, the rooms here are quite comfortable and have a lounge chair, desk, an armoir for hanging clothes and storing clothes and a fabric covered bench. The bathroom is modern and clean and the housekeeping service is very good. The larger rooms face south, and I would recommend a room on a higher floor for the sun to stream in during the day. The food is quite good in the restaurant. The location is perfect with lots of typical Greenwich Village restaurants very nearby. If I had to note a negative, it's the elevators. There are only two elevators that service the rooms and the restaurant. Because the designer did not spring for a staff elevator, the two elevators are constantly used by the staff housekeeping, maintence, room service and for transporting luggage in and out of the hotel, resulting in rather long wait times. Give yourself an extra 5-10 minutes if you have to be somewhere.

Went to NYC for business trip. My employer choose the hotel, and I have to say I was very happy with their choice. First, the location is just great. Near to metro station, easy to access from LGA, close to a few neighbourhood I love to go by walk. There is everything you need around it. At first, when a found out that I was on the second floor, I was disappointed. But I had just one of the best room I could ask for. It come with a private balcony, full of sun. And there is no noise because it's not facing the street. The room was big enough for 1 or 2. The bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom well equipped. And everything was super clean. The staff is overall very nice, and the room service is quick, and the food is good. On the bad sad, nothing that cannot be improved. The elevator are way toooo slow. There is no recycling ben. I would have been grate to have one, instead of putting all in the trash. Also, I didn't see any coffee maker. I'm not a coffee drinker, but for those who are, it could be a bit of a problem. But overall, I would definitely go back again.

Beautifully designed, great location. *Very* little closet space (good lucok if you're here for more than a couple of days), tiny room even by NY standards, totally inaccessible outlets (as in bumping your head under the table when looking for it). Probably better for leisure than a business stay.

I've stayed here at least 5 times over the past two months for business. The staff is friendly and greets me by name. Elevators are slow, but this seems to be consistent with many NYC hotels. Nice sized rooms for NYC. If you can get a top floor, you'll have great views of the Empire State bldg or the Freedom Tower. Nightly turn down service with vegan, gluten free cookies. Restaurant is much better than the usual hotel restaurant, some nice healthy choices for room service. Gym is a decent size, always seems to be empty.

Our friend who lives on fifth recommended this hotel because of its location, so we gave it a try. Pro's: location neat, but still 8 blocks or so from the heart of Greenwich village west. Newer hotel. Great staff! Outside noise not an issue as with many NYC hotels. Con's: elevator is SSLLOW! We were on the 10th floor and it was quicker to take the stairs going down. Noisy hallway. You could here everything going on in the small hallway because of the granite threshold with large gap under door. Stairwell to basement restrooms shared with restaurant staff bringing up food. This sounds petty, but a problem if you spend time at the bar, restaurant, and lobby. Shower did not have a door and water on the floor an issue. Overall probably would not stay again because location was our biggest draw and I can't say the location was really good enough to make up for the flaws.

The Jade is a fairly new boutique hotel at the edge of the West Village in New York. It is tastefully done, although like most boutique hotels in New York, the rooms are fairly small as are the baths. Still, if you use your room to put away your things, sleep and shower, and find most of your time out on the town, this is all you'd need from a hotel. It's location is great. The Flatiron District and Union Square are slightly to the Northeast, Chelsea to the Northwest, the Meatpacking District and the West Village to the West and Southwest, and the East Village and Noho to the South and Southeast. In other words, you are in east walking distance of arguably the most interesting neighborhoods in the city, full of great restaurants and one-off shops. Every evening, I would walk off in a different direction and be caught by the distinctly NY charm of the surrounding areas. But the Jade is about more than just location. The rooms are comfortably and afford you everything that you need. There is a small but inviting lobby that greets you at the bottom of the stairs, and in the back, a great little restaurant, the Grape and Vine, a rare find for a NY boutique hotel. The room is very well put together and the food very good. The hotel staff is young, what you would expect at the smaller, newer hotels, but the work hard to provide you what you need in the way of service. With all of that, the Jade will offer you rooms at less than what you would pay at other good hotels in the city, and chances are, a better experience.

Recently spent a weekend here whilst in NYC on a leisure stop over. On arrival the hotel looks grand from the outside, pulling off a bit of a throwback vibe to the 20s and 30s. Down the stairs and the lobby/lounge area was a little crowded by guests with drinks which made check in a little awkward, but c'est la vie. I was joining my better half who had provided my details to reception a few days earlier, but they had not recorded them properly which meant I needed to be "verified" by said better half - minus one for the sloppy record keeping, but plus one for keeping an eye out for guest security regardless. One other minor annoyance was the lack of a late check-out option, leaving me with no choice but to vacate by 11am and work in the lobby - although perhaps this was because they were fully booked, not due to a rigid policy.The room itself was very small, although I'm sure there are bigger (more expensive) rooms in the hotel. We didn't spend very much time in our room, so again, not a huge issue for us. I did try to get some work done on the Monday morning, which was difficult in the cramped confines though, so I'd suggest if you intend on staying here on business you may want to consider a bigger option on the room size. Very well appointed - the interior designer definitely had a good eye. One specific comment - for some obscure reason the shower was semi open (no door), which meant that the bathroom was flooded each time I showered...not a huge annoyance, but difficult to go in there again unless you're wearing shoes!Location is great (presuming you want to be in Greenwich Village obviously), with lots of bars, restaurants and shops within walking distance, as well as the subway.Staff were by and large friendly and helpful, and Liz and Pablo specifically looked after us very well in the bar in the evenings before or after our adventures out. Great cocktails, and a good wine selection, as well as some good bar food (although I'm not sold on the pickled pineapple!).I'd probably give this hotel a 3 ("good") in the context of all the hotels I've stayed in over the years, but that's probably not really useful given that each hotel should be judged in relation to the offerings in its specific market - so for Manhattan/NYC, I'd go with "very good". We enjoyed our time here and will most definitely consider The Jade Hotel again when we're going to be back in the city...NYC has some worse offerings out there, be assured. Recommended.

If you need to be in this area and if you like boutique hotels, you should try this hotel. The hotel has small but well decorated rooms, a great bar / restaurant and excellent service. It sure beats the typical Hilton / Marriott type of hotel for the same price (or even less).
user_name:
Eric d
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Great location, great staff and excellent restaurant and bar. Yes, the rooms are small but this is NYC and they're more than adequate in size if on business or vacation. The location is key - great for transportation, bars, restaurants and shopping. Couldn't ask for more really!

I went 4 days and 3 nights at this hotel for business reasons. It is very well situated and if you didnt know, you couldnt guess it is there because it blends through the buildings around. Even if everything was booked through a travel agency & the company I work for, I was not aware that you need to give 100$ in deposit (that you are given back when you leave), so this fee wasnt planned in my budget. When I mentionned this to the front desk, and that I didnt have a credit card to leave a deposit, they didnt want to check me in, and kept on repeating the same phrase over and over again. Maybe they thought I didnt understand english well... When I mentionned that I didnt have a credit card, I felt a little snobbish attitude going on. My roomate came-in just in time, this way I could go in the room. About this room, looked very nice, very small, two double bed, a small armoire, tv, desk and a chair. The beds are VERY comfortable, made my nights easier. I wish there was a small fridge for convenience. Now about the bathroom, had to call to get toilet paper because it wasnt changed or refilled by the maid, neither were the tissus. The shower looks nice, BUT : the head pressure was very little, the water runs outside the shower and goes all over the place in the bathroom... not very hygienic. We didnt really have a view, what we saw on the 8th floor was the appartment building and all the people looking at us. Because of where it is situated and because I didnt have to pay for it, it is overall a good experience but I would never go back again knowing how expensive those rooms costs. There is a huge gap between the floor and the bottom of the door, by chance there was only about 6 rooms on each floor, not too much traffic & noise. Another bad thing is that I spotted mascara stains on the sheets and on my pillows... I could tell it had been washed, but it is still nasty to find those when you have your face on it!

This place has its charms. It is quite a typical NY hotel: small and trying to be trendy.But for all its coolness, it is quiet and tucked away and you do feel you are getting away from it all even though it is right in the heart of the city.Some of the basics could be better: wifi is temperamental and the rooms are incredibly dark with no option to turn on more lights or get some natural light in.On the whole then: good, especially by NY standards, but a few more human touches and this could be a real gem. Right now, it is trying to hard to be cool and not hard enough to be personal.

Located at the top of Greenwich Village, this beautifully decorated boutique hotel is conveniently situated for easy access to subway and taxis; doormen like Keenan (sp?) made our visit more than comfortable. We opted for the breakfast addition and though we only used it twice (of four possibles), the choices, preparation and service were very pleasing to this chef. The rooms are well appointed and except for the half-door in the shower that allowed water spray (no matter what you did) to travel to the bathroom floor, I note no flaws as the beds were very comfortable. My adult daughter would have preferred a small fridge to save her meal remainders; an in-room coffee maker, as other reviewers have mentioned, would have been nice.

The Jade is beautifully tucked away in Greenwich Village. The staff are absolutely amazing people. Bourke Lee is one amazing AGM and person all around! Briant at the entrance of the building makes you feel warm and welcome upon arrival and couldn't be more helpful! I had an amazing 1 night stay, even ate at their restaurant, The Grape & Vine. Delicious! We had the oyster and salmon tartar, the burrata, mac & cheese and short ribs, with a great bottle of red. The whole experience was fantastic and intend to return yearly!Thanks for an amazing evening!

Very good hotel with attentive service and as I see it perfect location in New York. The restaurant also was very nice and the ambience in the hotel was great. The rooms are rather small but the location is however the best part of this nice hotel.

This was our second trip to NYC and having previously stayed in Midtown, we decided to stay in the Greenwich area. Having trawled through Trip Advisor reviews, we decided on The Jade and what a great decision that was! It is a small, quiet, beautiful, new (only a year old) hotel that suited us perfectly. The staff are incredibly helpful and polite, the hotel décor is stunning and trendy (but not uncomfortably so) and it smelt amazing due to the fresh flowers and scented candles. We had a Bedford double on the 17th floor which had incredible views looking south towards Lower Manhattan - definitely worth asking for a room on the higher floors to get the views! The room was on the small side, like many in Manhattan, and a bit of a squash with two adults, two children plus bags and a pushchair! But to be honest we didn't spend much time in there and it was spotlessly clean and the beds were super comfy. Breakfast was good, the juices are incredible and we loved the granola with fruit. They even prepared a bowl for us to take away when we left at 5am! The hotel is in a fantastic location - 5 mins walk to the hub of Greenwich/Bleeker Street, 10 mins walk to Chelsea Market, Meatpacking District and the High Line and just off 5th Avenue with a good range of shops ranging from Gap, Zara, American Apparel and Aldo to Seven, Michael Kors and Kate Spade. If you don't mind walking you can walk up 5th Avenue (past the Flatiron and the Empire State Building) to Bryant Park, Grand Central etc in about 40 mins and just a little further to Madison Ave, Park Ave and Times Square. If, like us, you are travelling with small children there are lots of eating places really close by including fast food like Chipotle, burger & pizza places but also juice bars, bagels and healthy snack bars. The room service menu was limited but the food we had was very tasty and arrived about 15 mins after ordering. We would highly recommend The Jade for anyone who wants to stay away from the chain hotels and likes somewhere with a bit of character and comfort. We thought it was excellent value for money and would definitely return.

My son was playing a benefit concert for The Youth Arts Forum in Greenwich Village so we decided to stay at The Jade because of the close proximity to the venue. We are very pleased with our decision. The entire staff from the front desk, cleaning crew, dining room, and front door men, were very pleasant and helpful. The front door men were very courteous and friendly, and were not intimidated with all of the equipment we had to transport. It is a beautiful hotel. The huge floral arrangements, with real flowers I might add, was a welcoming sight as well as aroma as you walked into the hotel. It is also a short walking distance to restaurants and unique shops. We travel to New York a few times a year and will definitely stay at the Jade again.

As a frequent traveler I really enjoyed The Jade Hotel. Friendly faces from the moment I arrived, from the doorman, front desk staff, housekeeping and room service. Lovely room, comfy bed and terrific neighborhood. The bartender was happy to serve cocktails and the drinks were delicious! One drawback...one of the two elevators needed repaired the morning of my check-out, but the hotel staff were extremely helpful despite the challenges.I would definitely stay with The Jade Hotel again!

- Large hotel very few front desk stuff. Constantly a small lineup - Staff seem irritated by almost all requests. Asked to borrow an iPhone 5 charger front desk look annoyed and confused. Her suggestion was to "google an Apple Store"- Room service painfully slow (i.e. One order of white wine never showed up even after calling the front desk and restaurant repeatedly)- Rooms small, dark, and not very stylish considering the marketing - Even the mere act of smoking outside the hotel seemed to elicit a passive aggressive response from the front desk, at this "non smoking property" - don't ask for a match, they don't like that- Bad shiny fabric on window seat and somewhat uncomfortable fake-feeling leather chairs - Slow elevator - 5 min wait times Tiny, crowded gym- cleaning staff and other misc staff feel to dominate all the hallways. Very crowded. Unappealing staff hallways/thoroughfares with bad harsh lighting open on to floor all day- For the money, you can do much much better in NYC. From a service level perspective a huge disappointment - very sub par service by North American hospitality standards - Other similar hotels i.e. Nomad and Bowery = better value, better decor, better value

Just stayed here. Love the neighborhood, room decor, and staff. Pretty clean. Drawbacks include the size of the room (small) and noise from the hallway (doors slamming, staff talking, etc.). Still I would recommend it. The area is great--with Union Square nearby, easy access to subway, and GREAT bagels down the block (Murray's). I would probably give this place 3.5, if Trip Adv allowed for it, but since it doesn't, I'll go with 4. It was better than average.

My friend and I stayed for a long weekend, and everything was terrific: the warm and friendly staff, the excellent drinks and food, and the extremely comfortable bedding and bathrooms. it was luxurious, comfortable and had a wonderful atmosphere in a fantastic location.

Hotel is located in a great location, not usual for hotels very chick since only nice apt building are located in the area.People are friendly , easy and professionals , lobby is clean and modern , rooms are comfortable with big beds and high level linings and bathrobes very spacious with working table included and chairs plus sofa in the corner of the room.Safety lock, frigo bar and and complementary water .Nice spacious and clean bathroom .I'll be back !

Jade Hotel is made by it's boutique design, friendly, funky staff who cant do enough to help and its great position. If you want to experience real New York away from the mainstream tourist areas Greenwich is the place to stay. Near by Soho and West Village, all the best shops and restaurants are within ten to fifteen minutes walk. The hotel is a boutique hotel and depends on style and individualism as opposed to size and glitz. The room are smallish, but big enough. Decor pleasing without being amazing but it is the whole feeling of The Jade Hotel that is its strength, The lobby and restaurant are funky in rich colours and warm velvets. The bistro is good for breakfast/brunch although a little pricey. Great dining room though with fab black and white photos everywhere. The staff really were superb and couldnt do enough to help. Professional and smart. Loved the whole experience and thought the hotel room rates were very reasonable for a Jade experience!

The Jade Hotel really is super-duper! Upon our arrival we got the warmest welcome from the charming doormen only to then be met by a truely beautiful interior with the constant warming aroma of candles burning in the reception area. The whòle hotel is immaculate, opulent but not pretentious. Its also quirky enough to make it individual. We didn't end up eating in the bar or restaurant but enjoyed a few drinks during our stay and found the staff to be really friendly & helpful. The rooms are small but well equipped and you just have to remember it is Manhatten! Bed really comfortable, good freee wi fi & everso clean. Great location, will happily return!

My wife and I needed a break, and took our first adult trip away from our 3 year old last week. We wanted to be away from Time Square see a more real side of the city. We landed on The Jade, and really lucked out! First class customer service, very nice rooms(we were on the 17th floor with a balcony, well worth the splurge), and the location was perfect. Great Restaurants and Shops in walking distance, but also got to see parents(and Nanny's) picking kids up from school, etc... Just want we wanted/needed. With out a doubt one of the highlights was coming in both nights, settling up to the bar, and hanging out with Gene the bartender. Everyone in the hotel did a great job, but Gene made us feel at home!

This hotel was recommended by a colleague as being really convenient for our office which is just around the corner and I was pleasantly surprised, from the initial welcome through to check-out I have only positive comments.
