The room was clean and comfortable (albeit slightly small, but hey, this is NYC right?) and the view from the 14th floor of the Empire State was great. I ate in the restaurant on three occasions, twice for breakfast and once for dinner, service was very attentive and the food good, typical prices for a hotel of this standard. Would I stay here again? For sure, both because of the location (ideal given the snow) and the standard of accommodation.

I love the location of this quaint hotel. Food was excellent and service very kind and good. Beds were very comfortable and I loved the very fresh pillows. Turn down service was delightful and courteous. Everyone was very friendly for New York standard.

My mum and I stayed here in January 2014. What a terrible experience. My mum is a bit older (76) and I had treated her to trip to NYC and a few nights in what I thought was going to be a lovely hotel. What a disaster of a hotel stay. The first room we got was immediately opposite the lift doors so incredibly noisy. We were moved to another room - this one had stains on the bed covers and the bedside table was broken such that raw wood with splinters sticking out of it. When I called front desk the staff member replied: oh, that room is out of service, I cant imagine why someone put you in that room (!!!!). Third time lucky we hoped when moving to the next room. All seemed fine until we returned from dinner...we got back quite early as mum was very tired (930pm) and our room door was wide open. Shocked, we went inside to discover that the maid had been, turned down the beds, left a chocolate on the pillow and the left the door WIDE OPEN. We found it quite unbelievable. When I called reception I was given a non committal response with the desk person saying oh my really? I will inform the manager when I see them. We waited a few minutes expecting the manager to phone...nothing. I went down to the desk and was provided with the response: oh, no the managers not on, they'll be in tomorrow. Nothing further was offered in the way of an apology or compensation. The manner of the staff was quite unbelievable - this is not a cheap hotel and the attitude of the staff working there was just awful. Eventually the next day I got hold of the manager and we were reimbursed for one night and provided with breakfast. I thought this was very poor. I strongly recommend not to stay at this hotel if you are looking for a safe, secure and enjoyable place to visit.

This is a small boutique hotel that was built a few years ago but designed to look "historic". It is very pretty with well appointed (though small) rooms, a charming lobby, and an excellent restaurant. Given that it is new, however, I was surprised that there were several issues with the condition of the room. The most significant was the lack of caulking around one if the windows, which made the room very, very cold (this was in early January on one of the coldest days of the year.) informed the staff about the temperature and was told it would be fixed but apparently not until after we checked out because nobody came to fix the window while we were in the hotel. If you are in search of a small boutique hotel I think there are better choices in NY (see my other reviews). I will say, though, that it had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever stayed in.
user_name:
etcarlton
New York City, New York

review_body: I stumbled upon the Jade Hotel when looking for a hotel close to my company's new office. I was intrigued enough both by the decor & the price to book a night, and I have now found my new go-to NYC hotel! The Jade Hotel is a gorgeous art deco boutique hotel nestled in a prime Greenwich location - close to just about everything, but secluded enough to afford privacy and much-needed peace & quiet. I stayed on the 4th floor facing the street & still had almost no noise - it was wonderful. And the staff! Every one I encountered was friendly, gracious, and went above & beyond to make sure my stay was enjoyable. Oh and the Brioche French Toast for breakfast was DELICIOUS! I can't say enough wonderful things about the Jade Hotel!

I stayed at the Jade for 4 nights and LOVED every minute of it. The entire staff was friendly and accommodating. (Especially Brian at the front desk and Justin in the lobby lounge). My room was small, but that is pretty standard in NYC. It was beautifully decorated and was exceptionally clean. The restroom was also spotless, had beautiful tiles, and the water pressure in the shower was awesome. I stayed on the 13th floor, and did not hear ANY noise from traffic. I'm in NYC a lot for work and that has never happened. They have a great happy hour every day during the week and the breakfast prices were completely affordable. You can not beat the location! I will definitely be back!

We came up to the city for a long weekend to visit family and stayed a night at The Jade Hotel. We had a lovely, yet quick one night stay at the hotel. From the moment we walked into the lobby, the wonderful staff and elegant interior welcomed us to the hotel. Like those of many other hotels, our room was small. What it lacked in size, the room on the 18th floor more than made up for it with decor and the most wonderful view of the Freedom Tower. We stopped in the bar for drinks and had a friendly bartender and great service. The ambience of the bar and restaurant was warm and cozy. We had a lovely weekend in the city with snow and festive holiday celebrations. Its a lovely boutique hotel located in the Village!

I stayed from 5th to 7th July 2013. The location is brillaint, the atmosphere almost theatrical. It is a short walk to restaurants in Union Place, the Strand bookshop and Forbidden Planet on Broadway and live music venues in the Village (The Bitter End, Thompson St / Bleeker St). The hotel is a design classic in New York Deco and cocktail style - James Thurber and Dorothy Parker would not be out of place, though I suspect that much of this is restored or retrofitted. The staff could not have been more welcoming. The rooms are small but the radio was pre-tuned to public service broadcasting - while I was there they were broadcasting the complete Ulysses (Joyce, not Homer). Although the restaurant was excellent, better value and NY style could be had nearby - breakfast at the Grey Dog in university Place, lunch at The Human Kitchen, a 'fat Greek' burger at a diner round the corner.

I stayed at The Jade Hotel with my mother when I was in the process of moving to New York last year in May. My brother, who reccomended the hotel, lives in the West Village so the location was perfect for us. The hotel has an understated elegance with a very warm feel. It is the perfect example of a boutique hotel. Some would say the rooms are a little "small", but this is the expectation when you are in New York. From the lobby decorations to the restaurant downstairs, everything was beautiful.But, what made the lasting impression was the genuine service from the staff. I wish I remembered all of the employee’s names so they could get the recognition they deserve, but unfortunately I do not. I do remember Olympia at the front desk who was very helpful and kind. Once the staff found out I was in the process of moving they were extremely welcoming. They offered everything from restaurant reccomendations to tips for living in New York. I remember after my mom left and I was heading to my new apartment, the bellman called down from the street to wish me good luck, and to let me know that I was always welcome at The Jade Hotel.As a hospitality professional, this service meant a great deal to me. The Jade Hotel employees provided me with a very memorable experience.
user_name:
EmilyTap
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed 3 nights with my daughter in a Queen Bed Room. I did not think the room was too small as many have written. Staff amazingly helpful with everything, including assistance to arrange limo transfer from airport. AC/Heater is quite loud (annoying at night) but apparently they are trying to do something about it. Great location, clean room, comfy bed, nice ambiance and something more than what you get at the typical "chain" hotels. I would happily stay again at The Jade Hotel.

We stayed at the Jade hotel in December, the location is fantastic! The rooms are really small but you do not find hotels this cute in this area very easily. The neighborhood is fantastic and very close to the Union Square subway. We never tried the restaurant, but there is a great breakfast place Hü two streets over that we lived at, being vegans. I love the art deco feeling, and the authentic rotary telephone were a nice touch. If you go on a shopping spree plan to repack your suitcase. I would definitely come back.

The Jade hotel is great. It's basically in the perfect location, really easy for transport and with everything you could possibly need only a short walk away. It's also on a quiet street, so it feels nice and secluded. The hotel is brand new (it's a brand new building) an everything is pretty much well appointed and well thought out. The rooms are about average size for NYC but very comfortable, and amusing with their deco features. All the appointments are of a high standard. I had a fantastic view from my room, even though I booked their standard room. The hotel is quiet and peaceful and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful, though at times a little clueless and there wasn't as much information in the room as one would expect, so the various services on offer weren't always clear. The bathroom was great - though taking a shower meant half the floor would get wet - but it was handsomely appointed. The bar downstairs wasn't very busy - which may or may not be a good thing depending on what you are after. Would definitely stay again - the location is second to none, the rooms are very comfortable and smart and the staff were genuinely responsive. Great place.

Very good location at 13th street, close to Union Square, metro station, and a lot of restaurants. The room is preety clean, with a typical New Yorker decoration, although little small, but very quiet. Confortable beds and nice shower.

What a beautiful little boutique hotel, full of charm and historic grace, great location in the Village. It's a pretty as the pictures.. The hotel has a restaurant but we didn't eat there. Room was beautiful, staff were attentive and friendly, really everything was terrific. The only negatives are that it's a little pricey and the rooms are very small. But the room and the hotel are very well appointed. Also, our room was quite warm, better than the alternative and we were able to open the window a crack to cool it down which is unusual these days and was appreciated. So it's personal decision as to what's important in where to stay. I really liked this hotel, would return and would highly recommend without hesitation.

We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Good location near the bars and restaurants of West Village, cool decor, friendly staff. The restaurant was excellent. Only quibble is that the room was a little small. Very good value for money. I'll be coming back next time I visit NY

The Jade was found on Trip Advisor. Some of the sites said there were no rooms, so I called. The receptionist convinced me to stay in a slightly larger room than the standard. With the comments online about the small rooms we decided to upgrade to the larger gueen room. The room is still extremely small. The proportions of the room are unusual and it is so narrow it is hard to walk by the bed without getting banged by the frame. The room was very dark. There was not enough lighting. The art decoration decor was charming but did not make up for the size of the room.The hotel is in a fun area of the City and near great restaurants. The Jade has a wonderful bar. They have happy hour that is classy. The servers are polite and friendly. When we arrived it was in the middle of a main water break. We had a hard time getting to the hotel. Within one day the internet, tv and phones went out. The people at the front desk told us to go to Starbucks as if this was a normal thing to do. My husband asked if we would be compensated for the inconvenience but the young receptionist acted as though he was insulting her. We are both dependent upon the web for work and do not plan on camping out at Starbucks. We found another hotel and left paying full fare. This is an example of how not to treat your customers. They are a young hotel but it is no excuse for treating customers this way. It is not inexpensive for the size of the rooms. Think if a college dorm room...even small for New York.The entry to the hotel and the restaurant are lovely. Hopefully they can change things in time.
user_name:
Christine F
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a great stay at the Jade Hotel. Beautiful, very comfortable, very clean and well located. The staff was friendly as well.There was no shower curtain which bothered us a little since the bathroom got completely wet. Other than that it couldn't have been better.

My husband and I recently spent 9 nights here. Beautiful hotel, fantastic position, great staff. It's plush, dimly lit and welcoming. Highly recommended.It was a warm and cosy oasis after days of walking. Close to the more interesting parts of NYC. Loved the village atmosphere of the neighbourhood.We got a great rate ($200) and considered it excellent value.

Loved this hotel. The location is perfect, the staff was so kind & helpful, the hotel was beautiful, and the beds were so comfortable, which was perfect after days spent walking. I would stay here again & again. In fact, I didn't want to leave.

Great spot. Well located, nice Art Deco theme, rooms are a bit small but workable. Friendly, helpful staff. Good food, nice bar. I enjoyed the wifi in the lobby with my morning coffee. Elevators are slow but work.

stayed here with some friends on a business trip.It's Art Deco style and is plush and also a little quirky.As expected service was good and the rooms were very comfortable if not a little dark due to the decor. That said dark is conducive to sleep!The concierge team were great and ready to help. The hotel is in one of the cool but earthy parts of town and ideally located to immerse yourself into NYC.Only downside I could say it the bar and restaurant were closed for private parties on two consecutive nights - which means that we couldn't use them. We could get drinks in the lobby but it's not the same. Management ...This should be something that doesn't happen!!!

Spent only one night at The Jade,attended company Christmas party nearby.We arrived quite early but a room was made available to us by pleasant front desk.Room small ,clean,attractive.After check in we had a drink at the bar,staff was great.Short walk to Union Square.

I have stayed with my family for New years. Its a lovely hotel in a very nice area with very welcoming and nice staff.Better to stay there if you are a couple or a single travelling for business because the rooms are very small for a family. we could not fit our suitecases anywere...

Stayed here for five nights with my wife, great hotel and would have scored it 5 out of 5 but was slightly let down by the hotel bar staff. The door and reception staff were fantastic, very helpful, friendly and professional, the bar staff barley noticed you were there and made no effort at all, pity. The hotel is worth staying at, great location (3 blocks from subway) and near lots of great independent bars and restaurants. The rooms are also great....no complaints what so ever, will be recommending to family and friends and would stay here again.

I spent a lot of time researching hotels in NYC before I booked the Jade. I wanted somewhere cool and comfortable that was close to downtown bars and restaurants without being too far from midtown for one or two touristy things. The Jade ticked all of our boxes and we were really happy with our choice. It's decorated beautifully and unlike some other boutique hotels is also quiet, comfortable and friendly. Yes, the room wasn't big but we went for the smallest category and it was bigger than others in Manhattan. Staff were very helpful and we couldn't have asked for more.

My family stayed at the Jade Hotel from Dec. 26-31, 2013. Although it's a new building, it feels like it has long belonged to the neighborhood. The decor/design elements are quite impressive in the lobby, bar, restaurant, and rooms. You can tell they paid a lot of attention to details. Our room had two beds, and was comfortable but small (which you would expect in NYC). We had a great view of the Freedom Tower from our room on the 17th floor. We were most surprised at how quiet it was in our room, which was a first for us in the city. (We suspect that the quiet room was a benefit of modern construction and insulation.)The location of the hotel is the best. We were just a short walk from three subway stations (14th St, Union Square, and 4th St), where we could catch trains on 5 different lines. Very convenient.

Great hotel with a lovely location in GW! Small rooms, but the staff was nice and the design was warm and nice :) I`ll definitively stay here next time I`m going to NY again. Easy access to all of manhattan with the subway-station next door, and a nice neighbourhood with lots of restaurants.

Great service, beautifully decorated and good location. I expect a smaller room whenever I visit New York City, but this room was ridiculously small. The closet and storage space is virtually nonexistent, yet there is a lot of opportunity to improve. They need to get a designer in that knows how to utilize space.I would stay again, but only for a couple of nights. Too small for a longer stay.
user_name:
Ken W
Hilton Head, South Carolina

review_body: Fabulous intimate hotel that is in a great location. The staff are warm and friendly and really make you feel welcome. The rooms are quaint and the bed very comfortable. I was there for 11 nights and never tired of it. My adult daughter joined me for a week and loved it too. The restaurant served one of the best burgers that my New Yorker friends had ever eaten. They are going back! Also for the great cocktails in the lounge! Amazing stay can't wait to go back.

My short stay here was great. I really liked the interior design, very unique and it felt really cozy. The French lady at the desk was really helpful and genuinly kind. Definitely I would recommend this place!

As a business man who travels over 150 days a year it is always a pleasure to find a small oasis of charm and good grace within the hectic, never-ending speed of NYC! And the staff of the JADE certainly creates such a great atmosphere. From the moment one arrives and is greeted by Brian's smile at the door to being checked in by Annika or one of the top flight attendants, the guest feels "at home." Everything about this boutique hotel says "service" whether it is a cappuccino offered up by the cozy fireplace on a cold, brisk NYC wintry afternoon or just a warm smile by one of the many fine concierge - the JADE makes my days in NYC as comfortable as possible. It is truly a hidden gem right in the heart of Greenwich Village!

This is a great hotel, well placed, reasonable value for the location and with excellent staff, who could not be more helpful My adult daughter and I had a fabulous 4 days hereThe restaurant is also very good, not cheap but good

This hotel was beautiful and the staff was delightful at every interaction. I wish they had a shower curtain to avoid making a huge mess on the floor during showers and the bathroom door wasn't opaque enough to make it a truly private space. Fine for me and my husband, not so much for the coworkers we travelled with.The bed was comfortable, sheets were soft and the decor was glorious! I had a beautiful window with great, deep and dark curtains that shut out the sunshine for my jet lagged self. The rooms were small, but in the end, it was more than I needed. I wish they had a more robust dresser rather than the closet, but considering the small room, I can see why that was necessary. I would stay here again for sure!

The Jade Hotel is an excellent boutique hotel conveniently placed in Greenwich Village. We had a Barrow Queen Deluxe room and this was spacious particularly for Manhattan. The room was beautifully appointed. The staff are friendly and professional whenever you meet them. The bar/restaurant area has a great atmosphere and the lounge area although small is cosy and equally well appointed as the bedrooms. It is not cheap, neither the accommodation nor the drinks nor the dinning could be considered a bargain (although weekday happy hour between 4-6pm is reasonably priced) but it is an utterly relaxing indulgent experience. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a luxury boutique hotel in NYC excellently placed to enjoy both the culinary and shopping delights of Manhattan.

The Jade is in a superb location - within a 10 minute walk of all 4 subway lines making it very expedient to get around. It is a lovely oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city. We stayed in a Greenwich penthouse which whilst expensive was more than made up for by the uninterrupted view of the Empire State Building from the balcony. To lie in bed watching the lights of the city change was truly memorable for us. Room was a good size and we had a bath. The staff were courteous and discreet. The noise from the elevator can be annoying when you are awake but we were so shattered every evening it did not stop us sleeping. We had a marvellous time and the memories will live with us forever. Great location for eating in the evening away from the tourist hot spots.

Stayed at the Jade last week for the second time. The Service is wonderful. The restaurant is fantastic! A little pricey but too be expected with this great location and great service. My one recommendation would be to have a vanity mirror in the bathroom. It would be helpful to put on makeup. I'm looking forward to staying here again on my next trip!

Everything about The Jade Hotel was fabulous. Here on business and a little pleasure. Staff so accommodating from early check in to assitance with luggage and cabs. Everything spotless. Very quiet and great location to everything. The restaurant - Grapes and Vine is phenomenal. Wonderful farm to table. Staff extremely attentive. Best cappuccino ever. Highly recommend and will stay next time in NYC.
user_name:
Paula M
Grand Rapids, Michigan, United States

review_body: We really enjoyed our four night stay at the Jade Hotel in November. Although the rooms are on the small side, they are clean, nicely decorated and beds are really comfortable. Surprisingly, the room was very quiet, especially for being New York. We never heard any street noise or noise from other rooms in our floor. One small downside is that rooms are on the dark side (need more lamps!). Overall, the service was superb. All the staff, and especially the bell boys, were so friendly and helpful. We were sad to leave and hope to be back.

Loved this hotel, location is convenient to all subway lines, a few blocks to Sheridan Sqr, across the street from Chelsea...really great staff. Our room 1701 had amazing views of Freedom Tower. Would have given it a five point rating, save for some billing issues upon checkout, which were later corrected by the manager. Be sure to save your confirmation room rate, as they may vary it daily.

This is my first time at the Jade.Check in staff were great and was upgraded to penthouse. The room was perfect for one night however longer stay would be tough as there is no storage. Great view and bathroom with a soaking tub. Heat is not adjustable in the room. Room was warm so I opened bathroom window to compensate. Comfortable bed and very clean. There was a private party in the restaurant that evening and staff were not very accommodating. A great location to explore the village.I'd definitely stay there again.

Great location.Beautiful decor and a great ambience.The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful. Unfortunately we did not get to eat at the hotel, but if the cocktails were anything to go by I am sure it would have been very good.

Just got back from a brilliant trip, The Jade is in a great location, Greenwich Village, our room was so quiet......... front desk very helpful, all staff were excellent very friendly........ décor n ambience first class. Will definitely be going back.

We stayed there several nights and all was nice : people (nice service), rooms (a bit little as in NYC but with nice decoration), food (excellent diner and great pan cakes for the breakfast). The location was perfect for us. Just enjoy.

Stayed one night, 2 rooms. Both rooms were very comfortable and well-appointed. The rooms are small but we didn't spend much time in them. Also, had dinner and breakfast at Grape & Vine - both were delicious! If you are looking for a nice hotel in the The Village, this is the place!

My son and I had a lovely stay at the Jade. The room was small, which is to be expected, very quiet, which I loved, and had comfortable beds and great linens. The bathroom was modern and lovely and the hotel was very clean and in excellent condition. There is a lovely lobby bar where we had drinks and some delicious flatbreads, and Monday to Friday, 4-8pm, I believe, the wine and flatbreads are half price. The room was too hot and it was difficult to regulate, but we opened the window. Breakfast was expensive but good. Loved our stay and would stay there again above many other hotels.

There were many things to like about this hotel - lovely quiet room, comfortable bed, great location for transportation. My only complaints were that the room was too warm and one could not turn down the heat; when I told the front desk, they told me the heat had been turned on in the entire hotel and since it was in the upper 40s outside, it was probably too warm and the best thing to do was to turn the heat completely off and perhaps open the window. There was no mini-bar/refrigerator of any kind so bringing back left overs was out of the question. The staff were all great. When I checked out, they asked if there was anything they could do to improve my experience and I told them it was too warm and they repeated the instructions above. Also, it's not really so much in Greenwich Village as it's the beginning of Chelsea, but minor comment there.

This is a great place to stay in manhatten!! The Jade has all of the characteristics of a quality hotel - well designed and clean rooms, excellent service, eagerly helpful staff and a high quality restaurant- making it a top choice. It is also in one of the best neighborhoods of the city, conveniently located in the west village. The hotel is very well managed and everyone we encountered who works there was helpful and friendly. We felt welcome, which is an important part of a hotel stay!The restaurant serves excellent breakfast and conveniently serves dinner late. Our room had an exceptional view of downtown manhattan, where we experienced gorgeous sunrises and sunsets.This was our first time at the hotel, but we would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it for a relaxed and high quality hotel experience.

I've stayed at the Jade three times. The only reason I did not give it four stars is that the standard rooms only have walk in showers. It would be nice to have a bathtub too. Apart from that - everything is perfect.

This is a cute hotel. Ideally located between 5th and 6th avenue in walking distance to Soho. I've stayed at this place earlier this year shortly after it had opened so this is my second time. In short - it was like coming home. Nice rooms, good restaurant and enjoyable lounge. I got back to the hotel pretty late one evening and found the restaurant to be still open. We we were able to choose from the entire menu and had an enjoyable late evening dinner. Marvellous. Recommended.

I popped in here a couple of Fridays ago with my daughter originally for a quick drink before moving on to another establishment. From the get go the place impressed me. It started with the very helpful doorman, to the maitre d' and then finally to the two barmen.This place has a great atmosphere. Its not big but its so friendly and the energy the staff bring to the place enhanced our experience. We were lucky enough to meet the owner Youri Djorkaeff the former world cup winning French footballer [soccer player] and his son. He made us both very welcome.So if you are looking for one of New York's best kept secrets, make your way to the Jade Hotel on West 13th Street. You wont be disappointed.

We recently stayed 6 nights at the Jade. We are ever so grateful that we were upgraded because to stay for 6 nights in any room smaller than ours would be pretty uncomfortable. The location of the hotel Greenwich, is great. Close to good shopping and restaurants and easy access to central NYC. Enjoyed good nutritious meals at the Hu "clean organic food" just a block away, and had a special meal out at "Rosemarys", again just a short walk in the opposite direction. Our hotel room on the 11th floor was comfortable and retro, though we had very limited closet space and no where to store our cases. Perhaps this is because most do not stay many nights. The shower had no curtain and we were never able to manage to shower without getting water all over the floor. The lifts were quite slow, especially at peak times as there appeared to be only 2 and the staff also used these to service rooms. The restaurant served breakfast which was fine and also dinner. There was a small bar also though at times we had difficulty getting served here. The hotel offered a "turn down service" because we were staying 6 nights which we accepted though it was not forthcoming for the final 3 nights! This hotel is mid range expensive, especially when all the TAXES are added.Our problem being from Australia is that we expect the tax to be included in the stated price (it is not) and we do not understand the constant tipping that is expected. After 5 + weeks travelling in the US that is one aspect of our travels that we were very glad to leave behind. Why not just pay your staff a decent salary? Why is it expected that we tip % of the bill when the service provided for something costing $10 is often the same as given for a bill of $80. We could not understand this.All in all, we would recommend the Jade, the welcome was warm and most of the staff were very helpful. Great location for us.

Never thought of myself as a complainer and certainly have never felt strongly enough to write a review but in the case of the jade it is merits a mention. Firstly the positives, nice looking foyer and bar, pleasant front of house staff, modern fittings in a deco style. Rooms were nicely fitted albeit a bit small but I suspected that would be the case. Great location right between east and west village and a shirt stroll from Chelsea market in the meatpackers, also not badly priced compared to similar hotels in NYC.So why only 1 stars? Mainly really poor attention to detail in client contact, our housekeeper left our room consistently dirty and un replenished, we had to beg for our breakfast or meal or drinks on 3 occasions. And it's not that they were understaffed one morning we saw 3 waiters a manager, 2 bus boys and a hostess, with no more than 30 people having breakfast we had to wait 30 mins for coffee which had to be sent back as it was disgusting and then another 20 mins for food. Believe we chased it several times in this period. One evening we were prevented access to the hotel bar and restaurant as it had been sold for a private function which meant the only place to have food or drink in a 4 star hotel charging over $450 per night was the lobby. No pay tv option in the room and a tv with no guide so very limited places to go/ things to do. The straw that broke the camels back was the maid who stole money from our desk. It was only a small amount but maybe that's what happens every day? Anyway when I complained my friends in an adjoining room found an envelope with some replacement money in it shoved under their door not mine..... With no note so again not the best attention to detail. On check out it also appeared that they wanted to overcharge me by 450 because they had changed the system mid way through our stay and charged my credit card before check out without authorisation...... I explained these issues at check out and they made no effort to make amends at all, Unfortunately they are pretty full so I doubt this review will have any effect but between myself and my friends we paid nearly $10000 for our stay at the Jade and we all thought it was extremely poor and will never go back or recommend it to anyone.
user_name:
Simon J
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: My stay at the Jade Hotel was a superb experience. The location of the hotel was ideal, sandwiched between Union Square and Washington Square Park while staying close to shops, restaurants, and art galleries. Both exterior and interior design were impressive. I loved the warm atmosphere that I was greeted with upon entering the lobby. The restaurant was amazing. All staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The rooms were well designed with great views. I would definitely return!

The staff is very kind and nice. Good location, close to subways stations, restaurants and shops. Quiet neighborhood. The room is very comfortable, charming and clean. Spacious bathroom, powerful shower and good products from CO Bigelow. Perfect place to stay in NYC. I loved it.

The location of the Jade Hotel is absolutely terrific. Whether on foot, using the subway or using a cab, I was constantly surprised by the ease of getting to and from the hotel in the course of what was a busy business trip. Loads of good restaurants around too. The rooms are really clean, and quiet and rather elegant, and the lobby would be a great place to meet either for a brief business meeting or with friends. Staff were really helpful when I needed advice or anything done, and were unobtrusive otherwise. The room was small... but this is Greenwich Village, and I suppose you've got to be realistic! Given the space limitations, the lay-out was good. I used the restaurant just once, and that wasn't a great experience - very slow service though the restaurant wasn't busy, but food was fine, they were apologetic, and I think they just lost my order somehow. Budget permitting, I'd definitely use the hotel again.

Wonderful boutique hotel. Great staff, amazing location, charmant. Do not know if it is the deco style or the young and excellent staff or both..but I had a great feeling and will definitely come again.Rooms and common areas are small, but adequate considering location/hotel style.

The hotel opened in March 2013, so it is new. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful (I am from Michigan, so I had some questions about how to get around, where to eat, etc.). The rooms were surprisingly quiet, which gave me a restful sleep. Great, central location in Greenwich Village. Highly recommended.

One of the best things about this hotel is its location - great place in Greenwich Village with easy access to awesome restaurants. I felt very much like I was part of the neighborhood and not a tourist.

Fabulous hotel, centrally located in Greenwich Village. Beautiful quiet rooms which are small but wonderfully comfortable, particularly the beds. Staff are very helpful and well informed, providing local information on request. The adjoining restaurant is fantastic, we enjoyed a great breakfast every day and found their staff so friendly. All made for a very enjoyable experience for our New York trip. Would certainly visit again.

This was my first time to New York. The Jade Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They made my stay very pleasant. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Easy walking to lots of "must see" sights. My room was clean, even had a view. My sister and I had a room with two double beds and we had adequate room for all of our needs. After all, we were in New York to experience the city, not sit in our room!

A surprisingly hip hotel. Yes, the rooms -- and the corridors -- are rather small, and there were a few operational issues. But I think of it like a fine, old English hotel. Accept it as it is, and enjoy the great design, the quiet but interesting street, and the short walks to too many restaurants to count.

Have had the occasion to stay there three times now and have been very impressed. The rooms are really well designed, with beautiful tiled bathrooms and a warm deco feel. The location is good too as you're no more than a 5-10 minute walk from anywhere you're likely to go (Union Square; West Village; subways etc.)I also like the restaurant Grape & Vine. Excellent American fare that is kind of like high-end comfort food. I ate the Fried Chicken and it blew me away! All in all a great hotel that isn't pretentious and yet feels special.

Nice rooms (we had a "grove queen" room and could fit two large suitcases) and wonderful service, perfect location for our vacation - cool neighbourhoods nearby and Subway a couple of minutes away. Quite expensive, but that's to be expected.

This is an oasis in a busy city. The Decore Very '20's fresh flowers beautifully fill the foyer. Staff friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are comfortable with superb views. Space is not generous, however it's okay as your only there to sleep. The French bar man makes great cocktails and the restaurant is good. A definite place to stay.

The Jade hotel is centrally located on a relatively quiet street and within easy walking distance to many good restaurants, bars and shopping areas. The rooms are quiet by New York standards and the beds exceptionally comfortable, however the rooms are VERY small and do not provide enough space for 2 adults with 2 large suitcases (even in a double room with 2 queen beds). It is odd that the beds are placed with the headboards against the windows - especially in a south-facing room - somehow this should have been planned better. The staff in the restaurant need to get their act together; in the 4 times we had breakfast there, the waiters got the orders wrong twice and it took more than 15 mins to get juice and a bowl of oatmeal even though the dining room was almost empty. The lobby has an intimate feel with a fireplace but the music playing constantly is far too loud and inappropriate. Overall disappointing experience.

We can't recommend the Jade highly enough. We felt waited on from the moment we walked in until the moment we checked out - as a matter of fact, our arrival was delayed (we got last-minute tickets to an evening Broadway show) and they kept trying to reach me on my cell phone to make sure we were ok! The room was surprisingly spacious and very comfortable. Will certainly visit again.

Needed to stay nearby where our business event was taking place and the Jade Hotel was just perfect for my needs. I checked in late and was warmly greeted and professionally served. Lobby and ambience was cozy and warm - the place is not large. The bar/restaurant was jumping with patrons who seemed to be enjoying themselves. I did not partake and went to my room on the 11th floor and facing the street. It was a small room and appointed nicely with furnishings and accessories. My requirements are a nice decor, very clean and quiet. It met my needs. Breakfast was good and, at 6:30am, the waitstaff was alert and professional. I checked out with the sentiment that I would gladly return for another stay.

Stayed there for 4 nights and had an excellent experience. I really love this hotel: it is so clean and quiet. My room was big and the complementary internet is good. The team is very and helpful. The gym is nice, wooden decorated and well equipped. That's the place I'll stay next time in NYC.Love this hotel!

Spent 8 nights Stayed in Greenwich Penthouse recently an am very glad that chose this hotel and the room. Great location, stylish but cozy design, comfortable bed, great service all around, lovely in house restaurant for breakfast and even dinner = perfect stay. Would definitely come back.Still,one has to remember, everything is small in this hotel. If you want space to stow away luggage from view in the room, have a table where two can have a room service meal or spread out to work at a desk, this is not the hotel. But the public spaces though small are well arranged and pleasant to meet people for drinks or a short chat and bite in the lounge or for a longer meal in the restaurant. Appreciated having a gym downstairs which was well set up tho tiny.As others have pointed out, the service is attentive without being overly present. For long stays for more than one person I definitely recommend the Greenwich Penthouse for the extra space in the room, a large bath with tub and the balcony which is good place to have breakfast in good weather or just to have access to outdoors on the 17th fl. Downsides: AC/mechanical is very noisy. Almost a dealbreaker if the positives are not so overwhelming. Wardrobe is too small--I really don't want to look at luggage in a room no matter how good lookingFrench doors in room had no way to be kept open without banging in wind. Too bad as part of being in penthouse was to have open air at night.

Lovely boutique hotel, beautiful art deco design. The gorgeous aesthetic of the lobby and restaurant carries in to the rooms with period styled furniture and wall treatments. The rooms are small, in true Manhattan fashion, but very comfortable. A friend and I stayed for 4 nights in a double room with two double beds and had a great stay. The beds are super comfy with high quality linens and pillows, and the staff turns them down for you every evening and leaves truffle chocolates on your pillow. We had no problem with the length of the beds, but as we are both average height females, I could see that your feet might dangle off the end if you're tall. The bathroom has nice fixtures and they provide C.O. Bigelow bath products, robes and slippers. There are 4 small glass shelves near the mirror and a larger shelf under the sink with extra towels etc. We had enough room to store 2 toiletry kits, and lay out some of our cosmetics. The curtains work well to block out light at night, and we found the room to be quiet and restful (we were on the 10th floor). I would suggest requesting a room on a higher level that is away from the elevator, to reduce the amount of noise from hallway traffic late at night. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is not a lot of closet space; it's about 2ft deep with a single hanger bar, 3 small drawers at the bottom and an area for shoes. Upper shelf has a bit of space but also contains the in-room safe. This is more than adequate if you are only staying for a few days but I will admit it gets a bit squishy when you've got two people's clothes for 5 days. In order to make the most of the closet, we both packed extra wire hangers and hung up as many of our clothes as we could. The rest we managed to fit in the drawers or on the shelf. Once we were unpacked, we put our suitcases one-inside-the-other and stored them in the space above the closet. This really helped with keeping the room free of clutter and maximizing the space. There is a bench seat and desk in the room which provide enough surface storage for putting down purses and daily shopping. The hotel is 2 blocks from a subway station on M, F, L and Path lines, so it makes getting around pretty easy if you want to avoid cabs. It's also in easy walking distance to the Meatpacking district and Highline. There are some nice restaurants in the area and I would highly suggest Murray's Bagels, right around the corner, for breakfast. Finally, I'd like to mention that the staff at The Jade is really friendly and helpful. Everyone we met there, from the desk staff to the bellmen, to the waiters in the restaurant and the housekeepers, were courteous, smiling and more than willing to help us with anything we needed. So overall, we had a great experience and would definitely stay at The Jade again. It is expensive, as most good hotels in New York are, but I felt that they delivered good quality for your money.
user_name:
Melissa Z
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: I stayed at the Jade for nearly 3 weeks and had an excellent experience. Loved the overall stay and felt very at home but the stint was not without a few minor issues. It was a work trip but I also had some friends staying for leisure too at the same time. Firstly, it's a really cosy living room feel to the entrance - dark, sexy and homely, the restaurant is great and has the same vibe. Food is excellent. It's like a mini-Bowery Hotel with a slightly more vibrant personality. Rooms also had the same darkness to them and not particularly condusive to any working in the evening. They are fairly small too - this extends to the size of the closets (literally can hang about 7 garments) and the beds are quite short. My male friend staying in a double room had his feet dangling off the end of the bed (he is 6 foot).Bathrooms are bright and well-equipped and maintained. Rooms are fully equipped besides having a minibar. This was a little frustrating if you wanted a late night soda and didn't want to leave the hotel or call room service.Another irritation for me personally was faulty air-con system that clattered on and off when on auto mode. Not great for a good night's sleep but the helpful front desk were quick and willing to move me to another room.Location is fantastic and close to all the great restaurants and bars of Greenwich Village. Also close to the subway, which was convenient.However, the thing that really makes this place are the staff - shout outs to Matt, Keron, Andy, Julia and the lovely hostess at Grape and Vine. This was definitely one of the main reasons that will have me returning here.

I don't travel to NYC often, but I recently went for one night my sister who was visiting from Israel. Searching the Internet we happened upon this boutique hotel and chose it based on the reviews we read. It is a small jewel, tastefully done down to every detail. I would recommend it to anyone. I loved its location in Greenwich Village; walking distance to numerous in restaurants, cafes and shops. I loved the attention to detail in the rooms (rooms are not large, but the overall design and feel make up for it and help add to its charm), the tasteful common areas with fresh flowers and the bedroom linens and comfy beds. Also, the service was impeccable, every person that worked there was helpful and eager to help in every way. It all helped to make our one night a perfectly wonderful experience. I am so happy we stayed there.

We found the Jade Hotel to be a fabulous oasis in the West Village. From there we were able to wander over the High Line, then Chelsea Market, then wander the village all night. The lobby is very inviting and the front desk staff were very warm and helpful. The art deco decor of the rooms was very fun and the rooms were fully equipped with everything you need. We found this via a Hotel Tonight offer, but will definitely be back.

My boyfriend and I stayed a night at The Jade Hotel and we were very pleased. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the staff was wonderful!! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and will definitely stay here again when we return to the city.

I loved this boutique hotel in New York, but the price was way too much.Lovely reception staff, they were willing to stow our luggage for a day as our flight back home was late at night.Small room, bathroom was clean and well equipped.COmfortable beds, quiet roomsCoffee available in lobby in mornings, free of chargeFree wifi which was awesome

Gave 5 stars on everything except for the room bc our room was across from the elevator and it was a little noisy when in use. I loved our room, though. We are staying at The Jade again this weekend to celebrate my 50th birthday and my daughters 16th!! Will post an update since I asked for a room away from elevator this time.

The Jade Hotel makes living in the Village a delight. Very friendly and helpful staff - a room on the 16th floor with a view of the Empire State building was delightful. Although pretty much brand new, the hotel has the feel of a boutique and 1930's friendly establishment. Great breakfast at Grape and Vine, the in-house restaurant. Quiet street with lots of good restaurants, casual cafes and Union Square a short walk to the east with Washington Square a short walk to the west. Definitely now my favourite for a Manhattan stay.

The Jade Hotel is a great addition to the NYC hotel scene, and it delivers on many levels--first and foremost being the terrific staff. The lobby is elegant but inviting (hard to believe that the hotel is new construction). The Jade gets extra credit for being a boutique hotel that offers some double rooms in addition to the ubiquitous king. And extra-extra credit for having top sheets in addition to the equally ubiquitous comforter, thereby giving the guest a temperature option between roasting and freezing. We were in a Bedford double on the 18th floor with a fantastic southern view.I can't really find any flaws with the Jade, but travelers should be aware that the rooms are indeed small (including the doubles), as others have noted. Also, the immediate neighborhood, while within a easy walk of Flatiron, Union Square, and the heart of the West Village, is somewhat dead and mostly students from The New School. On the plus side, we never heard any street noise. Finally, the beds are comfortable, but we had one issue which made sleeping difficult. It was mechanical and I am hopeful that it can be easily fixed (I reported it while checking out). The a/c blows quite hard (which was ok with me), but when the blower cut off, it was followed (precisely 3 seconds later) by a loud clank. Maybe the fan shutting down? I'm not sure what it was, but it meant that if you weren't dead asleep, you couldn't help but steel yourself for the clank each time you heard the blower stop. I highly recommend adding the Jade to your list of NYC hotels. I'm certain I'll go back--clanks or no clanks.

We stayed in the Jade Hotel for 5 days in August 2013, at the end of our 3 week fly /drive around the U.S. Having stayed in New York in the early 90's & not being impressed with the hotel we chose all those years ago, we were determined not to have a repeat experience, so researched many hotels & boy, all that trawling through the internet certainly paid off .Upon arrival, we were greeted by 2 very friendly ladies on the front desk. We had booked 2 rooms, for our stay, a double for our teenage kids & a Queen room for my wife & I. We were allocated these rooms on the 12th floor, the kids rooms with 2 double beds was not huge by other U.S. hotel rooms standards but ok, Our Queen size room was too small, for 2 adults , with suitcases. As we were booked in for 5 days, I went down to reception to see if we could be moved to a twin room. I was told that the hotel was fully booked, & a twin room would not become available for another 2 days, but as soon as it did, we could move into it. Ok, fine, it wasn't the hotels fault we'd booked a small room. By the time I got back to my room, the phone was ringing, it was the front desk, advising me there was a double room available the following day, next to our kids & if we left our suitcases packed up, they would transfer them over, whilst we were out the following day. Brilliant Service. The hotel is in a very quiet location, & we heard no noise overnight ( v. unusual for N.Y) .However this hotel is in a brilliant location for sightseeing. Less than 2 blocks to the nearest subway, no more than 10 mins walk to Washington Square ,couldn't fault it. Toiletries of a high standard, bed turn down service. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel as it was quite pricey & to be honest we were out & about for 12 hours at a time so tended eat on the hoof, so to speak. The attitude of the staff was a "can do " one, very refreshing, nothing was too much trouble . My only criticism, is that there are no coffee making facilities in the rooms, so if you want a hot drink you have to ring down to room service .$5.00 for a coffee, I don't think so . Every hotel we stayed in prior to arrival in N.Y offered room & lobby coffee, so was a little disappointed with this aspect. However they do provide complimentary bottled water . If you are looking for a hotel in New York I would thoroughly recommend this one !

We loved this hotel. The little touches were amazing... Fresh flowers, exposed brick walls. The decor, fireplace, the times. The staff has thought of everything youcould want. The people at the front desk were exceptionally helpful and friendly as were the staff in the grape and vine. Loved it!!

The Jade is our favorite Hotel in NYC! In fact, its the only hotel we stay at anymore! The staff is excellent and EXTREMELY helpful! They are very knowledgeable about the subways and places to eat in the village!Great location in the city! You can walk just about anywhere from The Jade!A MUST STAY!

What a treat this hotel is, it even makes us middle aged parents feel cool! Yes, the rooms are small but so well organized we never really cared. The beds were comfortable, I loved the Bigelow products so much my shampoo and conditioner stayed in my suitcase. I did wish that the products were replenished daily, we used them up and actually ran out one day. The staff of this hotel is so friendly and helpful, there was not a question they could not answer and always had a smile. The bonus was our view of The Freedom Tower.

The Jade Hotel is on a nice, quiet (for NY) location in a great neighborhood. The hotel and the rooms have an appealing art deco design, The rooms were not big, but offered sufficient space to move around (though I should add I travelled alone) and the beds were quite good. The staff was very friendly and helpful and made guest feel welcome.

The Boutique Hotel is new, the room was very nice , the location was perfect, and the staff was very polite and helpfull. It's in Greenwich so you can walk to the Highline Park, Washington Square, Little Italy and Chinese district. We enjoyed our trip very much.

My husband and I spent three nights here very recently and enjoyed our experience. I'm a huge Art Deco fan so that was really the driving force in booking here; the room was beautifully designed and I loved the retro touches. The bed (albeit not quite a full queen as I had understood) was very comfortable as was the pillow and the sheets were clean and soft. There was no noise from the street below at night (we were on 10th Floor) and the restaurant had nice options and the food was very good. The best part of the experience was the customer service. From the doorman to reception to the restaurant servers, everyone was friendly and helpful. A few things fell below par which was the shower - the glass wall was not long enough and even when angling the shower head away from the 'door' it still sprayed all over the floor, so that wasn't the smartest design element. The room lacked a hair dryer (perhaps you could call down for one?) and no tea/coffee/kettle in the room. It was quite small but that is to be expected so no big deal.Overall the experience was pleasurable and the neighbourhood is fantastic!

My wife and I had a very nice stay at this friendly boutique hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village. Particularly enjoyed the delicious breakfasts served by people who seemed genuinely happy to be there. Cool music plays in the background everywhere in the hotel.James and LindaCanada

A friend and I traveled to NYC with our daughters to celebrate a 30th birthday. We have always stayed close to the theaters and Times Square, but found we were always traveling downtown for dining and shopping. The Jade Hotel is close to a subway stop that takes you to Time Square so one can easily make it to a play. The staff at the Jade Hotel was wonderful. The doorman always greeted us with a warm smile and offered directions as needed. The accommodating staff arranged a car to take us to the airport for a reasonable price. When we found we were returning to the hotel later than we expected, we gave them a quick call. Upon our returned to the hotel we found the car loaded with our luggage, and we arrived at the airport with time to spare!

My husband and I have just finished our 9 night stay in one of the hotel's Grove Queen rooms on holiday. The Jade Hotel is a gorgeous art deco boutique hotel in Greenwich Village which is very reasonably priced. Our room was massive by New York standards and contained everything we needed. It was very quiet with little noise throughout our stay. It was clean and extremely well maintained for an older building. The staff were friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. They have 24 hour reception and room service from the lovely Grape & Vine restaurant downstairs. The concierge was very helpful in booking town cars, printing flight plans and providing recommendations of local restaurants and the like. The location couldn't really be any better - two blocks walk from Union Square Subway station, lots of amazing restaurants close by and easy access to the West Village, Soho, and Meatpacking Districts where we spent most of our time. The area is safe and welcoming.I will have no hesitation in returning to The Jade during my next stay in New York, which hopefully will not be too far away!

Before a holiday / conference trip to New York, I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews about New York hotels, conscious that for the amount of money you have to spend to stay in Manhattan, I wanted to stay somewhere I would actually like.The Jade Hotel has a bit of everything; its trendy but not pretentious, central but not noisy and the service was near impeccable. Breakfast was reasonably priced and draft beer in a hotel bar will always be a hit with visitors from the UK.Other reviewers have complained about the size of rooms. I think the rooms are adequate for a city hotel and to be frank, if you are coming to NYC to spend your time in your room, there is probably something wrong with you rather than the hotel.In terms of the local area, The Jade Hotel is located 15 mins walk to Soho and Tribeca, 10 mins walk to Chelsea market and the high line and 5 mins walk to Greenwich Village. If you want to experience more than just the top five tourist traps, consider this hotel
user_name:
Alain D
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Comfortable bed, great location, tasteful design, good value for your money.Room was very small, the wardrobe hardly had space for the clothes of one person, let alone two people staying for 9 nights. Also, the shower had no glass-window or curtain - maybe very good for aesthetics, but certainly not very practical.

Great boutique hotel - small bedroom but perfectly adequate - good size bathroom - we had the penthouse room - room itself was small and limited wardrobe space but great views of Empire State Building , large bathroom with great facilities.Staff all excellent - friendly , helpful and well informed didn't eat in restaurant at all but had a drink one evening - lively bar but does close at midnight.Hotel in great location for Union Square , Washington Square - getting to Soho and uptown - ideal spot - safe neighborhood with good quality bars and restaurants.,

What a find...amazing staff...courteous, helpful, quite fabulous...wonderful ambiance, beautiful decor more than make up for the tiny rom..but that's New York. Truly well located. Can't wait to go back.

We had a wonderful view and terrace from our 18th floor room. The rooms were clean and service impeccable. The restaurant was great too. Staff were friendly and helpful and the location was a great base for trips around downtown and the Village - we will be back!
user_name:
Anthony E
Scarsdale, New York, United States

review_body: I stumbled upon the JADE last minute while in NYC. I have been going to NY every year for over 20 years, and stay at all sorts of different places. The Jade was the best! The staff is so kind and helpful, each one as nice as the last. I kept thinking they must be very happy there to be so universally great! the room is a little small, and lacks storage space, but the experience makes up for it. The beds are comfortable, the property is spotless, the Bar and Restaurant were great and the location is top notch. I will stay there again, for sure, and will look forward to knowing I have found a true gem. The Jade is boutique style, so if you are looking for large and Posh, this isn't it. If you are looking for boutique, this is the best around. Safe, comfortable and quiet. Easy access to subway, great neighborhood for walking and eating. Close to fun shopping, night clubs and the HighLine.

As a former NY'er , I could not have asked for a better find! This was our second stay at The Jade in the past two months and both stays were excellent ! Professional staff who understand "hospitality." The rooms are small but very clean with all the necessary amenities. Next time we stay I am going to try a larger room! The location is excellent. If you are looking for a great hotel with great value, pick The Jade .

Recommended! Very cute, small hotel, newly renovated with sophistication. Music a bit too loud in the lobby (they are trying to create ambiance!). A bit expensive, but look for good deals on various websites. Great location, friendly staff. Rooms are small but modern, well appointed and comfortable. Heavy duty windows keep out the street noise. Breakfast not included but there is an onsite restaurant, which looked nice although prices seemed inflated so went to other places in the neighbourhood. Great shops, spas, restaurants nearby, and close to Union Square. Would stay there again.

I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Jade Hotel. I was traveling with my mom and we shared the Bedford Two Double room. Overall, it was a fabulous stay. The location, service and quality of beds made up for any minor need for improvement. PRO'S:/ the hotel is brand spanking new, about 6 months old./ I found the staff cheerful, helpful, and willing to go out of their way./ exceptionally comfortable beds, pillows, and linens. I didn't want to wake up in the mornings. / great value for NYC. I paid approx. $1,500 USD for 5 nights incl. tax for a double room. / one of the best locations I've stayed in. It's between Union Sq and Greenwich Village, with the F/M subway line only a block away./ free wifi throughout the hotelROOM FOR IMPROVEMENT:/ the rooms were rather dark and could definitely use some extra lighting./ the rooms were quite small with limited storage space; especially for two people in a room. Our room, with 2 double beds, was around 250 sq feet. There is no place to store away your suitcase. It simply has to sit next to the bed. And there's limited counter space in the bathroom for your toiletries. / looooong elevator wait times. We once waited over 5 minutes for the elevator to arrive. / depending on your room configuration, the AC vent can blow directly on you as you sleep, which isn't the most comfortable thing. / our shower drain was plugged up the first night - but a call to maintenance had it fixed by the time we came back./ no bar fridge / minibar/ there was a radio/stereo system on the desk, but no auxiliary cable to plug your phone or ipod into for music.

A frequent traveler to New York, I had yet to find the perfect hotel. My choice is now definitely the Jade Hotel. I will certainly be back on all my future travels here. I feel at home. The staff is wonderful; so helpful and efficient. The food is delicious and the rooms, although a little on the small side (this is New york...), are very comfortable with quality beds and linens and bathrooms providing fine Bigelow products. The rooms are very quiet (soundproof windows). All perfect ! The hotel atmosphere is friendly, trendy (without being obnoxious) and the situation is ideal. Can't wait to come back soon !

This hotel was beautiful, recently updated to it's signature style, and the staff was quite polite and helpful. the couple negatives; our room not being ready; which our front desk attendant had us escorted to the lounge for a complimentary cocktail while we waited. Which was great, and at some point in the evening half the hotel lost air conditioning! Which made for a horrible sleeping experience in NYC... in July... When we inquired about a discount at checkout, we were declined. Too bad, as it kind of soured the rest of our stay. The food was quite tasty, and the drinks delicious.

I live in the area and stayed there recently while some renovations were being done on my apartment. The rooms are small but full of deco charm. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was fresh and luxurious. The bathrooms are bright and a good size with products from the local, well known Bigelow apothecary. We were lucky enough to have the terrace room with great views. The lobby is very welcoming and with a cool vibe and the staff was very friendly. I've had drinks and appetizers at Grape and Vine, the restaurant in the hotel, and its really good. I'd go there even if I wasn't staying there. My parents (in their 80's) stayed there when they came to town and were equally impressed. They said it was the best part of the trip! And I might be biased but I think the location is perfect - great for walking to Washington Square Park, Chelsea Market, and High Line and Meatpacking area and galleries. Away from the hustle and bustle of midtown but an easy bus or subway ride uptown. There are Citibikes right down the block if you are feeling adventurous. A gem.

I wish I could give this a 4.5 star as this is quite a nice property. The hotel has been opened very recently and has still has a very new feel to it. We stayed here or two nights on August and were pleased with the location, services, and upkeep of the property. We had a room on the 16th floor which had an unexpected view of the New York skyline and the Empire State Building in particular. The rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable, as is the bathroom which had a nice powerful shower.The only slight negative was during check in when the person at the desk kept us waiting as incoming calls were given priority over fatigued travellers waiting to get to their room. Besides that one person, service was above par.We would recommend this hotel over many others we have used in New York.

This was my first time visit to New York, and I am so glad we chose the Jade Hotel. You can't beat the location -- it's very close to Union Square and Greenwich Village. The room was very comfortable. There were four of us sharing one room, and at first glance we thought the room would be too small. This actually wasn't an issue at all, as we rarely spent time in the room. The hotel staff was excellent -- very attentive and helpful. They helped us with directions and getting us a car service for a really early departure. We did encounter one issue with the air conditioning, but they resolved this quickly and moved us to a new room. I definitely will stay here again for my return visit to NY.

Reall was a good choice! the hotel, the neighborough.everything perfect.... room not so big, but easy and comfortable! I did not notice this problem with elevators... not really so slow , maybe we used them in right hours...Professional Staff for everything......surely wish to come back again!

Stayed here on a glorious cooler weekend in August. We were lucky to score one of three rooms in the hotel with a terrace. So nice to sit outdoors and read and sip a little wine. What a pleasant surprise. Room was spacious by New York standards, clean and comfy. Only complaint was the shower. For some reason there was nowhere to put your soap or toiletries. Our friends were in the adjacent room and said they had some sort of shower caddy. We inquired at the desk but our concern was not addressed. We had lunch at Grape & Vine in the hotel. There is a fabulous lunch special, three courses for $20. You can choose from salad, omelette, chicken, etc. Quite a bargain and everything was delicious. Our server was efficient and pleasant. Loved the location of the hotel and the bellmen were great guys. Will definitely stay here again.

Fantastic location - close to Union Square and Greenwich village. Subway lines close. Great view of the Empire State building from our room. Comfortable bed! Very stylish decor. Quick response to a small problem - We had a problem with our shower flooding the bathroom and this was quickly fixed which was much appreciated.

Got a good early booker rate for a Hudson Queen Suite with your own private terrace when I booked in April. Seemed nice to have some outdoor space when visiting New York during the summer. The price was only just above 100$ more than for a regular room for three nights. But apparently there was a bit of a problem calling the room a suite so some time after we booked the website changed the name and just called it a Deluxe room. When arriving we noticed why, size-wise I'm guessing the regular rooms are not much smaller and in a suite you at least expect a livingroom area and a more spacious feel. This room (201) was as small as your average New York hotel room and changing the description seemed appropriate, although It would've been better not calling it a suite from the start. The terrace of course was quite nice, but it was towards the back yard and not much sun reached it until later in the afternoon since it was on the second floor. I've read reviews of people having views of the Empire State Building, but maybe those we're not from the Hudson Queen Deluxe in particular? I'm not sure if they changed the description to "garden view" after I booked or if it was there from the start, but If I had known I probably would've just a booked regular room with chances of a better view. Still, the room was beautiful. Great bed, okay pillows and wonderfully designed bathroom with ℅ Bigelow bath products. Nice to stay in a new hotel that really feels new. Being slightly disappointed with the size of the room, it not being a suite when paying for a suite, and the terrace not facing the street was not a big letdown when the interior and feel of this hotel was so good in every other way. Location just perfect. Stayed at the Mondrian in Soho earlier this year and I really don't like the hustle and bustle of the Soho streets close to that hotel. Here you're in a calm setting, just by 6th Avenue and a lot of good breakfast spots. Also you're just a few blocks from Union Square and not far from Washington Square Park. The Jade Hotel has probably the best location for any hotel I've stayed at in New York if you really like the downtown brownstone feel. Front desk staff and bell boy were kind and helpful and If I get this good deal again, we'll probably stay here next time. But in a regular room I'm guessing.

We stayed here for 5 nights in August and just loved it! Very conveniently located, a fantastic location right in the heart of Greenwich Village with Soho, West Village, East Village all within wallking distance. Loved the vibe of the village. The hotel is sorta Art Deco, kinda dark, but loved it. Very New York. The staff was wonderful and accommodating, room service was great. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was nice and updated. The room was small but that's New York, I had no problem with it. We had 4 huge suitcases and were able to fit them in around the room. Very clean hotel, and room. I will definitely go back. The only negatives were: the elevators are very slow, had to wait 6 or 7 minutes sometimes for it to arrive. We could hear people talking and slamming doors in the hallways, seemed like the noise was coming thru the vents from upstairs. That was very annoying. But we loved the hotel and would recommend to anyone. The restaurant was very nice, expensive of course and the food was good. Loved the whole feel of the hotel.

We had high expectations of The Jade, want to be fair, its a beautiful hotel with lovely frontage but its so small, recommend it for couples, probably romantic, decent restaurant, good locationFor families, room is very small, high quality but felt clostrophobic. Lifts take for ever and always seem to stop at floor 8, both of them!Its a great location, ViaPiano Italian nearby is good fun and value but having stayed at Hotel Giraffe two weeks earlier there was no comparison as a family. Rooms double size, breakfast included, Cheese and wine included, very friendly serviceIf we wanted to go back as a couple, maybe. As a family, try elsewhere

Came in town last week for two nights and could not have had a better stay. The staff was beyond accommodating, the rooms very clean and modern and the location is top notch. I also ate breakfast at the hotel which was excellent too. All in all could not think of a better place to stay in NYC.

What a great hotel! Can't say enough about the staff, atmosphere & rooms. Our family had a wonderful time in NYC and The jade was a big part of this experience. Staff is so friendly and helpful greeting you each and every time you enter or leave. Will definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Jade Hotel for one week and absolutely loved it! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was located on the 12th floor, we could even see the new Freedom Tower/One World Trade Center from our room. The room itself was spacious, clean, very beautifully furnished and the beds could not have been more comfortable. The location is just perfect - 3 min walk to subway, quarters like SoHo, Chelsea, ... in walking distance. The hotel itself right in the middle of lovely Greenwich Village, with great vintage shops etc just a few minutes away. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we will definitely come back! Thanks to the Jade Hotel and its staff for an amazing week in NYC!!

Stayed here with my family, looking to explore the West Village, Chelsea & SoHo! This was a perfect location for these places. Very friendly staff, clean rooms and very comfortable beds! We had drinks at the Grape and Vine bar which was lovely and a great setting! The hotel was very pretty and quaint we would return...::

I had a wonderful four night stay at the Jade. It was in a great location, close to small shops and many delicious restaurants. The subway is super close and the hotel staff is more than helpful in helping you find transportation. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and toiletries were nice. There's a nice gym in LL and the room service is delicious! Would definitely come back.

Staff were welcoming and helpful, room clean and well laid out (usual small NY size), good toiletries and not too many other fussy things in the room. Location is great - away from the main tourist areas but easy to get around and Greenwich is just round the corner. Restaurant and bar quite pricey, and a bit too dark in the evenings, but again the service was very good. Definitely one of the best I've stayed at in NY, would choose The Jade again

We spent three nights in the Jade and we loved everything about this stylish boutique hotel. We had never stayed in the area before and were bowled over by the location, atmosphere and vibe in Greenwich VIllage. The staff in the hotel were friendly, efficient and went out of their way to please. We stayed in a suite and our view was Amazing, looking out on the Empire State Building, it doesn't get much better !! If like us you like a smaller,unique and personable hotel you have to try the Jade. We thought it was Fab and will most certainly book in on our next trip to New York.

We stayed 6 nights in July. There was a heat wave. Room 1705 (a"Greenwich Suite")was intolerably hot. The hotel was full. The staff looked at the air conditioner and shrugged. Two nights later we were in 1805, but after one night, it too was hotter than the stated outdoor temperature. At that point the staff seemed to blame us, though they clearly noted the problem. I suspect that there is a design flaw in the air conditioning as it is located in the bathroom ceiling in these rooms. It is possible humidity condenses and freezes on the exchange pipes hidden in the ceiling. Perhaps it is an underpowered system for the upper floors. The staff was professional but indifferent to us. A manager or supervisor was never available to discuss the problem with us. Room service was great. Location excellent. Would not recommend summer stays until they sort out the air conditioning.

Our stay at the Jade Hotel was enjoyable.It's located close to the cool Greenwich village that has neat places to go at night- resturants, bar, music, comedy etc.. and far enough away from the overly busy Time Square (which I might add is extremely overrated) and other such places. However should you want to see these places it's a short taxi or subway ride from the hotel.Staff were extremely helpful and accommodating.. any questions we had, they had the time to spare to help us.Only slight negative was the rooms were very small and for some reason very full of furniture I didn't see the point in, which only made the space seem even smaller.

This hotel is fairly new on the scene - open about 6 months we were told. We chose it based on reviews here, because we prefer smaller boutique hotels to the big chains, and for its location. We had two events on our schedule, one on the upper west side and the other in Brooklyn (on the L). The Jade is within a block of the 14th street subway station which serves both lines, so it seemed an obvious location for us. We were very pleased. Our room was on the 15th floor (7 rooms per floor), overlooking 13th street. Very quiet! The rooms are small (to be expected in Manhattan), but well-designed in Art Deco style with all the amenities, including free internet access. The big plus here is the hosting staff. The front desk staff printed out our airline boarding passes for us at no charge and made reservations for us at the 9/11 Memorial; the bellmen hailed cabs and gave us good advice about restaurants. Even the turn-down lady gave exemplary service. Special shout-out to the bellman Michael, who was helpful and welcoming above-and-beyond. The West Village is thriving and bustling, with loads of restaurants within easy walking distance of the Jade. Easy walk to Union Square also. We did not try the in-house restaurant, so I can't comment on that. If you're looking for a smallish property in the Village with good personal service, I recommend the Jade.

We stayed here at the end of July for a 5 night stay. Rooms are not large but are perfectly adequate. We moved a few things around and were then able to fit two large Samsonite suitcases in the room. All staff are very friendly. We had breakfast downstairs on our first morning and it was fine but like other people who've stayed here found there were good, cheap options nearby - Murray's Bagels around the corner has $2.50 bagels which are enormous the diner around the corner on 6th Avenue is also great value. We also tried GustOrganics which is nearby - the beef fajitas were to die for and very well priced.
