All in all the hotel is in a great location (subway nearby), excellent food choices around the corner, a nail place also around the corner had a $20 special for a mani/pedi - which was perfect after a hard day's shopping. Would definitely stay here again. Also our room was very quiet - no street noise at all and we were on the 4th floor.

Amazing quaint experience in the heart of the city, they have created a step back in time with their design and architecture. The lobby creates a very homely and laid back feel, it took a few seconds to zone in on the front desk. The room faced 13th St, which is relatively quiet for Manhattan, was small, but, efficiently laid out. The bathroom was surprising large, with all new fixtures from Waterworks. The shower was oversized but was strange not having a shower door for privacy. The room temperature was either hot or cold, it was a little frustrating balancing the air conditioning.

Just returned from our NYC trip, stayed here for 5 nights. The check-in was quick, staff were really helpful and friendly and a good sized room for a Manhattan hotel and well decorated. Great Greenwich village location walked pretty much everywhere - Chelsea, Union square, SoHo being immediate walkable neighbourhoods. The village itself was lovely to walk around and soak in the atmosphere. This was our second visit so called for a lot of 'soaking-in'! Rooms were clean but the corridors were looking a little dirty and tired. two lifts for the entire building and there didn't seem to be a service lift. Fitness centre was small but adequate - 2 treadmills, 1 cross-trainer and traction machine. The restaurant was a let-down avoid. Our cocktails were very undrinkable - my Manhattan was the colour of cranberry red and came in a round glass and had a very strong taste, Husband's cocktail was plain weird .... very poor mixing. Had breakfast one morning the both our sunny side up eggs were fried and turned over, the edges on mine were crispy fried. The potatoes were tasteless. After this, we didn't bother eating/drinking here as the neighbourhood is filled with fabulous places. Had an uncomfortable experience on the day of our return with bell-hop which we intend to write to the Management about. At reception we said we will take a taxi instead of the town car. a couple of minutes later bell-hop says our town car will be here in 12 minutes, we say we wanted a taxi so he went off to get one. Then he comes to get us as the car is here....it was the town car we say we asked for taxi he said but they already called for it. We made clear we weren't happy. We saw the town car driver go after bellhop to just inside side entrance presumably to pay for our ride?! didn't like this at all, made us very uncomfortable and besides we'd rather make our own decisions. So just be aware.

My trip to the Jade, unfortunately, was a disaster. From the minute I tried to valet park- oh right, they dont do that, to the final checkout. The garage they have a "deal" with across the street doesnt take SUVs. So i had to drive around for the next thirty minutes to find one that did. So we were a little early, around 11 am. The guy at the desk said he would call us when the room was ready. We never received a call. We came back at 530pm. So we finally check-in and the air conditioner is leaking from the ceiling onto the bathroom floor. This was a room with an outside space. The only room available was a smaller room. So we took it.The checkin desk was very happy to defend themselves. None of this was their problem. It was my fault. The only saving grace for this place was the bell hop- cant remember his name- he was great.

My experience at the Jade was fantastic. The staff, the décor the food was all top notch. I loved the art décor décor of the room, everything felt very well thought out and delivered perfectly.... Thank you for such a great stay.

We stayed at the Jade hotel for 8 nights June/July 2013 and found all of the staff very friendly and helpful. The art deco style is very cool, though the rooms are are on the small side, but this is New York. The location for restaurants and the metro was perfect and easy for walking to many locations. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom well fitted with quality fixtures and thick towels. Everything about this hotel is great except for the restaurant which is overpriced and not worth it. We ended up eating out all of the time. I would definitely stay again.

Stayed at the Jade Hotel for 2 nights (July 1-3, 2013) during a brief visit to NYC. Really cannot say enough great things about this hotel! We loved the upscale, boutique feel of this hotel. The room was appointed very nicely with quality fixtures and accessories. It was also great that it is still relatively new, and it feels very clean. Hopefully that will hold true. Beds & chair were comfy.We got a great special running rate for this hotel at around $187 per night for the Grove Queen. I think I overheard mention of a recent rate increase while at the front desk. So not sure if there will still be opportunities to get in within our budget in the future though.The rooms are small, but not really for NYC standards....they were actually quite spacious in comparison to some alternatives I've seen. The location was fantastic. It felt very safe & was a comfortable walking distance from restaurants, shopping & subway stations. We were on the 7th floor with a front facing view of 13th St. It was super quiet the entire time we were there.We arrived quite early at around 11am thinking we would be storing our belongings at the front desk. However, they had a room ready & allowed us to check in early. We also requested 1 hour late check out and were granted that as well.We sought assistance and recommendations from the front desk on a couple of occasions for food & drinks and we weren't disappointed. We actually never tried the on site bar / restaurant. We took a peek in & it looked nice, but we preferred venturing out to locals spots.It was a super rainy day when we arrived & they even have a bank of nice umbrellas for guest use at the front door. That was a touch we really appreciated!

I recently stayed at the Jade and absolutely loved it. The rooms are small but very stylish and the hotel staff is incredible. They bend over backwards to help with whatever you need. The location is in a neighborhood setting, so you feel as if you're a part of what is going on. There are many food choices nearby - within walking distance. I will stay there again and again.

Very nicely laid out room, tasteful and comfortable. Small but perfect. Bathroom very nice. Excellent location for walking. Staff very friendly. Restaurant too dark and not the best. Hallways were not vacuumed upon our arrival.

The Jade is a new hotel on W. 13th near Sixth. The location in the Village is terrific . The interior is designed like a calm and peaceful refuge from the business of the street. The hotel has a quirky decor with old style rotary phones on the bedside tables. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. My husband left his cell phone on the edge of a chair in the lobby. We realized it when we were on our way to the airport. A call to the hotel brought an immediate response. The Front Office Manager Bryan Devlin immediately took the phone to UPS and sent it to us. We were very pleased with our stay.

Our recent 5 night stay in the Hudson Suite on the second floor of this new boutique hotel was a very nice experience. The room was quiet, spacious enough for two, had a very comfortable queen size bed and the french doors lead onto a lovely, private, cedar deck with table and two chairs, where morning coffee/newspaper and evening cocktails were enjoyed under a New York sky. The bathroom was a comfortable size with a good shower and plenty of hot water. Towels were plush and plenty. No coffee maker, but a nice cup of java could be purchased in a number of coffee shops around the corner. The staff at the hotel were friendly, helpful, courteous and attentive. The location on 13th Street West @ 6th was perfect, close to nice eateries and the subway, conveniently located at 14th & 6th. Washington Square Park, Madison Square Park, the Meatpacking District, the West Village, the High Line were all within walking distance. Highly recommended.

I liked the Jade a lot. I stayed here in a Grove Queen room for 6 nights in late June. This is a boutique hotel. The rooms are small but smartly designed and decorated with custom wall paper and lacquered mahogany furniture. Super comfortable bed; very effective air conditioning; and excellent water pressure in the shower. Very quiet. I could not hear other guests or street noise. Nightly turn-down service. The Jade looks and feels warm and intimate throughout. It comes across almost like a private club in Paris or London. It does not feel like a New York hotel, and that’s a good thing. The lobby is small and while you can have drinks there, it is not a “scene”. This is not a typical tourist hotel and probably wouldn’t be good for someone on business travel or for folks traveling with small children. Great location at the top of Greenwich Village between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. Very easy walk to Union Square, Gramercy Park, Flatiron, West Village, NYU, Chelsea, and Soho. Easy access to major subway lines going north and south to Times Square, east side Museums, Lincoln Center, Tribeca, and Lower Manhatan.Plenty of nifty, relatively inexpensive (for New York) restaurants, cafes, and interesting shops frequented by area residents (as opposed to visitors) on surrounding blocks. Try O Cafe on Sixth Avenue and 12th Street; Sotto 13 on 13th Street between Sixth and Seventh Avenues; and French Roast on Sixth Avenue and 11th Street (open 24 hours). Great take-away gourmet eats perfect for room snacks or a picnic basket at Citarella’s (Sixth Avenue at 9th Street). Finally, a word about the staff and service: magnificent. Special mention to Matt and Kyle at the front desk but everyone (remember, I was there for a week so I believe I met everyone…) was friendly, engaged, pro-active, solution-focused, and gracious. They all seemed genuinely glad to be working at the Jade and that makes for happy, return guests.

We had two nights of comfy sleep, with soft blankets and a variety of pillows. We stayed on the 6th floor. We had no view but we really didn't care because we loved the beds,pillows, room and the price. There is no coffee in the room and it is 5.75 a cup, but right around the corner there is a great French Bistro.

The good: great location, nice patio area with upgraded room, delicious breakfast in restaurant, town car service to LGA (not free).The bad: room not ready at 4:00 check in, VERY small room, awakened at 5am with hammering on walls/floors for 1 miserable hour, not really compensated. Should not have had to pay for first night after that. Was told breakfast was complimentary for our trouble, but didn't tell us that it was for a "certain" menu option. $68 later, we discovered that miscommunication. Also, for a new hotel, the carpets, walls etc look worn already.We are returning to NYC in 4 weeks, I wish I could say this was a wonderful hotel. So much potential!
user_name:
Janet K
Credit River, Minnesota, United States

review_body: My friend and I stayed at the Jade Hotel from June 20th to June 24th 2013.Check in was quick and easy. We were assigned a room on the 4th floor, their friendly bellhop carried our luggage and showed us the room. Loved that we didn't feel pressured to leave him tip, and when we did he was very thankful.Location was great for this hotel, as it's in Greenwich, so very close to Chelsea, Flatiron district and Meatpacking District. There is a Citi Bike station at the corner of the street, making it easy to walk out the hotel and explore the city by bike (10$ for 24 hours, no additional charges if you use the bike for less than 30 minutes). Several restaurants (including a self-serve frozen yogurt place, yum!), a 7-11, a market and a CVS minutes away. Broadway st is an approximate 10 minute walk away, with plenty of stores to shop around. Madison Square Park is about the same time, meaning it won't be difficult stopping there and grabbing some Shake Shack! Check it out, there's always a line up, but it's worth it as it's one of the most amazing burgers ever! Biking to Time Square took us about 15 minutes.Service was incredible, and which made our stay there so much more enjoyable. Emilio at the front desk was super friendly, could of chatted with him for hours! We always came back to an impeccably clean room. Bed was really comfortable. Usually when I travel I always say to myself "can't wait to sleep in my bed!" but not this time, I wish I could of brought their mattress back with me! Many good TV channels, so there was always a good 90's-2000 comedy movie that we could watch! If I had to say one "negative" about the room, it would be the bathroom. Nothing major though, but if you want to be picky, the door was transparant (frosted though) so if you're not comfortable sharing your silhouette with your roommate, then you might dislike this. The shower also didn't have a door, so water would splash out and wet the bathroom floor. Besides that, nothing bad to say, water pressure was really strong, something I truly appreciate when traveling and staying in hotels! A/C worked perfectly. I have nothing to say against the size of the room, it was comparable to other hotels I've stayed at in NYC. The bellhop was always there to open the doors as we exited or entered the hotel, and always with a big smile. We were able to have our bags stored on our last day, after our check out, so we could go out for lunch and shop a little before driving back to Montreal. Check out was a little more complicated than checking in as there was a mistake made on our credit cards, but we were well taken care of. They apologized and told us the problem would be fixed when we got back, which they did. I had a really good stay at the Jade Hotel, would of loved to stay longer, and will definitely be going back on my next trip to NYC. Thanks so much for the excellent service Jade Hotel!

A rather small hotel in lower Manhattan in quiet surroundings, very friendly and competent personnel. Rather small, but elegant rooms with all necessary equipments. Good food and sometimes live jazz during dinner time. Pricey but worth it.

location - tick. stylish - tick. great service - tick. We only stayed a night and wanted somewhere close to Chelsea. For the price (yes the room is a bit small - but hey! we got 2 full size suitcases in there no problems which is more than I can say for other NYC hotels we've stayed in for more $$$) this hotel checks ALL THE BOXES. Highly recommended and would definitely come back again.

I am writing to express my delight at staying at the Jade Hotel. I felt very comfortable from the moment I arrived outside the hotel, the bellmen greeted me with open arms and the hospitality continued throughout my stay. There was live jazz in the lounge in the evening, the Greenwich Suite was divine, and the bathroom was incredibly well appointed with marble tub and Bigelow toiletries. I wished incould stay longer, but will most certainly be back very soon!
user_name:
Vanessa Hill R
Jarabacoa, Dominican Republic

review_body: The location is perfect, the decor pleasant and the beds very comfortable but within a short time of arrival we encountered issues. We couldn't get connected to the internet so called reception for help. we were told someone would come up ' right away' The help didn't arrive so we called again and eventually it was sorted. We liked the room so our way out for dinner we asked if we could extend our stay but found only single rooms available. We found somewhere else to stay and on our return asked if we could have a slightly later check-out than 11 a.m. Most places I've stayed its 12. We were told ' unfortunately we can't help you '. I wouldn't have minded paying extra for the privilege. Since there was no fridge in the room we asked for a bucket of ice and were told it would be sent right up. It never arrived and this time we went down in person. With one section of staff saying they had asked other staff to sort out the ice but with no follow up we were disappointed. The restaurant manager saying he would sort it but then we saw him wandering around talking to other guests. Eventually we spoke to a duty manager despite being told there was no manager on duty ! He gave us a later checkout sent the desk manager with ice straight away and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine.Unfortunately at check-out we found we had been charged for the ' complimentary' bottle of wine. To add to the issues my companion found a $100 charge on his credit card once home. In a nutshell nice comfortable hotel ( if a bit cramped ) but with terrible communication resulting in poor service during our visit.

Wonderful stay in May 2013, will definitely return. what a cool hotel! When we arrived there was a fashion photo shoot in the lobby, beautiful hotel, friendly staff, great location on W13th street, Village and Chelsea around the corner. Will also remember doorman Michael with his great smile, remembering our names, great recommendations, loved the Jade!
user_name:
MarkHLM
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here last Saturday night while attending the World Science Festival. After reading reviews on this hotel before staying, we noticed many people frustrated with the elevator operation. Sure enough, the first time we tried to use the elevator to get to our 15th floor room, we experienced a significant wait (10 minutes+) for the one working elevator. Other than that issue, the hotel was clean and perfectly acceptable in all areas. I would stay here again, slow elevators would not keep me away from a nice, clean, quiet hotel in a great area of the city.

The location is awesome. Walking distance to Union Square, Meatpacking, etc. Tons of bars and cafes everywhere. The room was small but quiet and very comfortable. I had a great night sleep. The staff was friendly. Nice toiletries. I will stay here again. Small, feels more like a residence (not too small like a B&B!). Much nicer than a big thoughtless chain hotel.

Stayed here for three nights in April, thought we give it a go being a newly opened boutique hotel.First impression of the hotel is chic and young. As most people commented, the word small comes up a lot - the room was indeed compact and the lighting can be a bit dark. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was nice and clean.There are only two lifts and sometimes can be slow.The staff are friendly and helpful, there are some minor teething issues with the services when we were there but not an big problem, being the hotel opened just three weeks prior to our arrival.Jade Hotel is located in a nice neighbourhood by 6th Avenue. I recommend this hotel for holiday makers but not so sure about using this as a base for business travellers.

We stayed three days at the Jade Hotel in May. A group of 5 with two seniors and one child. It was fantastic, a very nice hotel, clean and well equiped. Great service, nice staff. Good food. Close to the metro. Would return without hesitation.

I stayed at The Jade for three nights on a recent business trip. The location was great and it was easy to get around. The front desk staff was very efficient and friendly.The rooms are done in an art deco style. They are done very well but are rather small. It was ok for one person, but had I been travelling with my husband, I am not sure how I would have liked the cramped quarters. The bathroom was done to a high standard. The beds were comfortable and the wifi was good.I had a drink at the bar, but did not eat there. It was a nice place for a drink, the service was ok, it was moderately priced

The jade hotel is in a great location with friendly employees, however we were promised a suite and we were put in a closet for the same rate. The shower head was broken and the air conditioning was broken. Plaster from the bathroom ceiling was falling down and made a mess all over the room. We told the staff and they did nothing to fix the mess. They have two small elevators and are missing a service elevator, so I was running up and down the staircase to get from the lobby to my room. The gym is small and has nothing in it, a waste of time. This hotel is only worth the stay because of the location. Go to the Bowery, they know service!!!!!!
user_name:
tsova56302
Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, United States

review_body: I've never felt compelled to write a review before but Bryan and the team at The Jade Hotel deserve ten minutes of my time. From the moment we arrived with heavy bags, they were helpful, polite, interested and fun. Within five minutes we were talking about their recommendations of things to do around the area and our bags were whisked up to our room by the lovely Bryant. Throughout our stay the team always had a smile for us and they really made us feel at home in New York. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. Thanks Bryan and we hope to see you again soon.

Greenwich Village. A great place to be to start with. The Jade Hotel's vibe is just great and comforting. The staff is extremely friendly and helpfull and they make you feel casually comfortable from the moment you step to the front door. The room we stayed in (1507) has a view on the Empire State Building. We didn't suffer from noise from the outside at all eventhough we were on the frontside of the hotel (15th floor). The room is small for American standards, but it feels really cosy and comfortable. The bed sleeps awesome. The elevators (2) are slow, but we were not in a hurry so we dealt with it. There's metro stations nearby (walk to 6th and find a Path metro and a regular metro on the corners opposite to eachother to the north). We would for sure consider to stay at The Jade Hotel again.The restaurant linked to The Jade Hotel is called Grape & Vine. The food is not that great. It's not bad, but it's not 'special'. We'd recommend to go outside and find cosy places to have breakfast/lunch/dinner in areas like SoHo or Lower East Side.

We stayed at the Jade Hotel the weekend of May 17 - 19, 2013. The Jade is located about 5 minute walk from Union Square so made most areas of the city accessible to us. I love the decor of the Jade. It has a hip, boutique feel to it. There is a bar/restaurant as part of the hotel which played great music, even though we didn't spend time there. The service was exceptional. Very friendly and helpful. One comment is that the check-in and concierge are the same desk which resulted in a few waits for service. But that wasn't a problem given how comfortable the lobby was.As others have noted, the rooms are small (much like most other hotel rooms in NYC I've seen). The bedroom was designed very well. The bathroom had a very spacious shower and the bed was very comfortable. Free internet in the room. One nit pick is that one can hear the doors of other rooms open and close.But all in all, I'd definitely recommend this location to friends.

This is a cute a cute hotel, the location is extremely convenient and the staff helpful and kind. Our bedroom was nice but too small. We were 2 adults and 1 child and we had to move one at a time. We stayed just one night, so non need to empty our suitcases, but it wouldn’t have been enough place to arrange our clothes. I found our double bed tight and shorter then normal.The bathroom was ok, with a large and comfortable shower box.Ask for a room in a high floor!.

We've checked into many hotels in the past, but can honestly say that the welcome and late check in we experienced at the lovely Jade hotel was the nicest in living memory. From the moment you enter this tastefully refurbished hotel in a perfect West Village spot, everything feels a little bit special - from the beautiful lobby through to the excellent Grape & Vine bar/restaurant. But the service is something else - incredibly helpful, genuine, friendly and fun: David Strickler, we salute you! ;) Some of the rooms are a little on the bijou side, but we were lucky enough to get transferred to a large double on the quiet back part of the hotel with big old bathroom - highly recommended. Back to Grape and Vine - again impeccable service, delicious breakfast and very good vibe for dinner or a late drink in the evenings. Any hoteliers out there who want to teach their staff how to make guests feel great, send them to spend some time with this team - we'll be back for sure!

The hotel location is prime and its appointed very nicely and very comfortable. The vibe is hip yet relaxed and the doorman remember you everyday! Nice touch. While the rooms are a little smaller the location certainly makes up for it because people don't come to NYC to hang inside. If you need a lot of space this isn't the place for you, however, if you need a great in/out room with character it mosdef is a winner.

Close proximity to subway and meatpacking district / high line (good for evening strolls). Rooms are small but clean and comfortable.The hotel has no signage and from the outside it looks like a restaurant/bar. The bar can get busy into the night, but if you are high up enough, you shouldn't be hearing anything.

Wanting to visit my daughter in NYC (where I am from originally) I wanted to stay near the west village and found the Jade. It looked lovely, small and in the perfect location. I booked through Booking.com and received a very good rate for 4 nights. Upon arrival i was greeted by the "better than ever" staff. They couldn't do enough for me. Got a larger room than was booked for........all great.Now the problems begin......I check my bank account the next morning and The Jade had put a hold on $2200 of my money (supposed to be 1017) That was quite a bit more!I was directed to the manager Brian (who was AWESOME) and he couldn't have been nicer and dealt with this situation immediately. The money was credited to my account. ALL WAS WELL!Jump to day 3 and upon checking my account, the money was DEBITED AGAIN! So now I have bounced checks and returned charges all over the place. Needless to say I spent the morning on the phone calling all of these places to explain myself. NOT a good way to spend time in NY.The only great thing about this hotel is the staff. They are charming, helpful, interesting and engaging. The service in the restaurant was slow and food was just ok. It is a beautiful place but this whole problem with the charges was very unsettling and hopefully doesn't happen often. Be careful if you book through a third party. And if you want amenities such as movies in the room and a mini-bar.....this hotel is not for you.

We've been to many hotels in the world and have received top notch service, but those words do not come close to the service we received from Keron McDonald @ The Jade Hotel in NYC's Greenwich Village. Keron was the first person to greet us at the Jade Hotel when we pulled up curbside in our limousine. He was beaming with the brightest smile, and was eager to help us get settled in our room. Whenever we saw him during our stay, he always made a point to ask us if we needed anything. Keron is management material. We truly appreciated him. Courtney in the restaurant also provided superb service; she asked the hotel chef to make a vegetarian dish for us the first night we dined there and it was fantastic. Five stars for the restaurant. (Courtney also gave us great advice about where we could find good vegan restaurants in town. Thank you, Courtney!)Now for the hotel itself. Where do I begin? It's in a fantastic location, and it's sparkling new. We made reservations for the Greenwich Penthouse, which was advertised as having a queen size bed and a separate "living area." The bed was more like a double; it's width was nowhere near the width of our two queen beds at home. Maybe the beds are some European version of a queen bed. The so-called "living area" was equally disappointing. It consisted of a padded bench & a low profile chair right next to the bed. There was no "area"-- the penthouse is one small room with a very generously sized bathroom with a bathtub spout that was improperly fitted (it was too short to direct water flow directly into the tub, and instead puddled up and dribbled down onto the floor creating a slippery mess. And the awesome tub is really high, so if you're shorter than 5'11" good luck getting in and out). The amenities in the bathroom fell short, too. Not much product to rely on, and the product they did provide smelled less than pleasing. (Of course, this is a subjective assessment; reasonable minds will differ on this point.)Again, we had expectations when we reserved the "penthouse." A penthouse is a specially designed apartment on an upper floor, especially the top floor, of a building." Imagine our surprise when we exited the elevator short of the top floor. And then to learn there were four rooms, two on each side of the building separated only by a little planter with a baby juniper between the outdoor patios. Read: little, if any, privacy. That said, we loved the outdoor space, despite it's tiny footprint, and the fact that the step leading to it did not appear to be up to code. The view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building in the distance was probably our favorite part of our stay.When we called hotel management expressing our disappointment with the queen size bed and "living area," we were not provided with an adequate explanation. Am I bitter? Probably, because we had high expectations based on the hotel's representations on its web site. For the price we paid for this pseudo-penthouse, we could have gotten a suite elsewhere. Indeed, we wound up going to the Intercontinental in Midtown and got a room with a king-size bed, and a separate living room for less money than the Jade Hotel. The furniture in the room is nothing to write home about. It seemed to us to have more of an Asian influence, not art deco. The low bedside tables don't have a lot of real estate, but there is no shortage of outlets to plug in all your i-devices. That is a big plus. Don't expect to get a late checkout. The hotel has only two small elevators that are used by the hotel cleaning staff -- there is NO service elevator. The maids have to shlep their carts on the same elevators used by hotel guests. What were the architects thinking? Don't expect a separate business/meeting room either. You won't find any business accommodations here. There you have it. Beautiful, new hotel with "penthouse" rooms that are disappointing because they are not truthfully represented. For NY standards, the hotel is pretty and clean . . . and petite. For us, the hype and hip factor of the hotel failed to compensate for the shortcomings stated above. Will we return? Probably not. There are too many other options in NYC. But if you're looking for clean, hip hotel in the Village, with no other expectations, you will likely be very happy.

My Mom and I just returned from a 4 night stay at this very boutique style hotel. The rooms although small were very elegant and quite functional. I had requested a room on the highest floor prior to coming to New York and they did not dissapoint. We were on the 17th floor and had a great view of the city. The room was very quiet. We had one issue with the air conditioning which we pointed out when we were checking out and the front desk person waived our breakfast bill as an appology. The staff certainly went above and beyond in service and I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.
user_name:
Steve M
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Staying at the Jade has been a great experience. The location is quiet and extremely convenient, the staff helpful and corteous, especialy the doormen. The rooms are a god size, compared to other Ny hotels, and the decor superb. It was a great oasis in the city! As a single traveller, I enjoyed the atmosphere - classy but not too posh to make you unconfortable. Defintely reccommended.

I recently stayed at the Jade with my sister who was visiting from over seas. This hotel is really quite special right down to the morsel of life changing deliciousness I experienced when I returned back to my room one evening. My housekeeper left a red velvet treat on my bed it was superb. The desk agent told me they are made fresh daily from a local bakery. The employees at the hotel are wonderful and go out of their way to make you feel special. When I arrived I had my wallet tucked away in one of my travel bags Keion and Brian at the front door offered to pay my taxi until I got in and settled, this is real genuine service. The location is right in Greenwich Village so we were able to walk everywhere and did not have to take any cabs. My sister had an incredible view from one of the higher floors so we could see the new Freedom Tower it was beautiful. My only criticism is the phone situation. When I called to inquire about the location I was put on hold and the same when I called back to make my reservation. When I arrived at check in the phone kept buzzing over and over and the attendant had to keep answering. The staff is professional but I felt rushed because of the phones and I did not feel comfortable to stay and ask the questions I had intended to ask. Every day I would sit in the gorgeous lobby reading while having tea and It was hard to concentrate or relax with the desk agent constantly answering the phone saying Jade Hotel. They must address this, It is dreadful. I love the Jade Hotel and will be back to stay.

Back again from a visit to NYC! We stayed at the Jade Hotel, in a very central but quiet enough location. Jade is a very elegant boutique hotel, with excellent and helpfull staff-specially the front door men. Rooms could be larger. We are tall and had a problem mooving in the room without hurting our feet in the edges of the bed. Small closets and not enough place to arrange our clothes and suitcases. We could hear people from next rooms, talking or closing doors. Walls are very thin! The jazz band playing on Tuesday was very good and the hotel bar is full of beautiful young people, especially on Friday and Saturday.Overall, we were pleased with The Jade and would recommend !

Just back from a fantastic trip to NYC and a great stay at the Jade. The location is brilliant - quiet but so central, Loved the decor and lobby, we arrived very late after issues with our airport transfer and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. It turned out that there was a problem with the air conditioner in our booked room, so we were given cocktails, dinner, breakfast and individual larger rooms for the night. I was overwhelmed by the lengths the staff went to to make our stay amazing, special mention to David our concierge who managed to get us a table at a fully booked "it" restaurant we'd never have seen without his help, and recommended some brilliant addresses for a great night out. Yes, the rooms aren't massive, but this is NYC baby, space is a premium, and for goodness sake, you're there to have a ball, not sit in your hotel bedroom!!

This is a cute and unique hotel in a fantastic area in New York. It has so much potential but I noticed too may issues in a short two night stay,My biggest pet peeve is please hire an Operator to answer incoming calls. Do not leave the calls to Front Desk. On each of my visits to the Desk, I was interrupted multiple times from agents answering the phone. Not sure why they were not politely placed on hold but it was annoying.My room was cute but very small. Nicely designed with minimum space. Bed was fantastic.The shower layout was impossible not to get the bathroom floor soaking wet.While I found the Front Desk nice, they seemed too distracted by the incoming phone calls.

Great location in the west village. A hotel with a lobby you can actually sit in and relax. Great staff. People who seem to actually care and are friendly. Art at the restaurant a couple of times and it was very good. Caught a Jazz band playing there on a tuesday. I did not expect much. They were excellent. I hear this is going to be an every tuesday nght gig there. Even if you don't stay at the hotel, catch the band. I'll stay here again.

This place is fantastic!From the second you hit the door great people like Keron McDonald treat you like family. More than a welcome hello, he is incredibly helpful in explaining hotel amenities and the neighborhood. The GM, Bourke also is awesome. Small, boutique hotel in great location that is hip and clean.My favorite NYC hotel.

We had a fabulous view of the Empire State Building from our room which was a plus to the huge minus of our very very tiny room!! The hotel is fairly new and there was a few teething problems, faulty lift causing huge tail backs and cramped lifts, so bad I got out and walk the 14 floors. We also paid cash for some bits in the restaurant and they were then charged again to the room. Lots of little problems but it is a very nice place in a great area so hopefully they will iron out the small things. I would stay again if I was guaranteed a bigger room, ours was just silly small, nowhere to put my case and hardly any hanging space!!

I loved the atmosphere of this small hotel. It was like you were in the TV show Cheers. The staff was excellent and friendly. The bar is nice and can be somewhat happening. The only thing we wish we had was more space, but other than that, we loved it. Bathroom is lovely but had no place to put toiletries. Lighting is not great for makeup application. All that pales in comparison to the way we were treated while there.

We stayed in Jade 6 nights.First of all-the bad thing from begining was bad start with the man from reception...I think that he could keep his personal opinion for himself and not share that with his attitude towards client..person who stayed with me was treated lovely but me i felt whole stay that there is something...Anyhow-the rest was fine.People from other parts like house keeping.room service and doormans were very pleasant and polite,always there for your comfort..Rooms were nice,lovely details but quite small..If you are stayimg for longer time you want so,ehow unpck t least little bit but there was no place for that,just very small wardrobe..But to be honest-it is very nice and charming hotel but small details make big things and in case that they are still very new they should learn quickly because they have great potentional but at the moment servis doesnt worth the price...And as i said-we were quite dissapointed how visible was that attitude of guy from reception...What a pitty because i would like to stay there once again-the rest of stuff just really make you feel like at home and treat you very nicely..I wish to this hotel all the best and hope in future with better service we can again stay there:)

We booked this hotel as we had a blitz of press meetings. We had lots of product delivered here ahead and it was waiting for us when we arrived. The double double was perfect. Such a cool bathroom too. Very comfy beds and really quiet and restful. We asked staff to courier product to journalists and all kinds of requests over and above the norm they bent over backwards to help us. At the end of a long day the lobby is so relaxing and we ate in grape and vine which was delicious and listened to jazz with champagne. It was bustling and atmospheric. We felt like we were on holiday!! We will be returning here in Sept for our next visit stateside!!!! The interiors are amazing too

We stayed in a Greenwich Penthouse & had a great view of the city. The lobby is very comfortable and looks like it has been there for years. They did a beautiful job making a new hotel feel warm and comfortable. The room was smaller than we expected, the shower spills water on to the floor & the elevators were a little slow. The decor was really nice & the staff was very helpful.

I recently spent 4 nights at The Jade. I opted for a queen-bedded Greenwich Penthouse room on the 18th floor, and I'm glad that I did because the bedroom area was still a bit cramped. There was only a small set of drawers inside the wardrobe, which made it a challenge to unpack as fully as I would have liked. The bathroom with separate deep tub and shower was on the larger side and nicely appointed. The bed was quite comfortable.There are two elevators; one was out of service during part of our stay. Even when both were operating, the wait for one to arrive on the 18th floor could take a couple of minutes. Due to the elevator situation, and thinking about a future stay, I did look at a room (perhaps a "Hudson Queen") on the second floor that I had considered when booking because I understood that some rooms on the second floor had a walk-out garden/patio area; however, the one that I saw had just a small walk-out concrete patio without any furniture. Perhaps there are plans to put some furniture out there or to landscape each patio. Aside from its easier access to the lobby and restaurant (e.g., stairs), there would have been no benefit in choosing one of those rooms over the penhouse rooms on the 18th floor. In fact, I greatly preferred the room that we had. We did have a small walk-out balcony off of our room, and the views from there, which you could also see from the bed, were quite nice (Chrysler Bdlg, Empire State, 1 Bryant Park Tower), especially at night. If I were to return, I would request our room or the one next to it, both of which face uptown. The location of The Jade is very convenient, as there are numerous subway lines within walking distance on 14th. Taxis are great and plentiful, but I found that it was generally much faster to just use the subway. Union Square, the Meatpacking District, and Soho are all within walking distance, and there are plenty of great restaurants close by. In part, I chose this hotel due to its proximity to the L line so that it would be easy for family coming in from Brooklyn to meet us for dinner, but it was also very convenient for getting up to Columbia, The Cloisters, the theater district, etc. An area for improvement concerns the breakfast that can be included in your room rate. While the rate that I booked did not include breakfast, I did ask about it when we arrived and opted to have it included at $15 per person/day. (Murray's Bagels around the corner is another option). Apparently the restaurant and the hotel are separately operated, as each day it was a new adventure to confirm that we did have the breakfast plan, and to determine what it did or didn't cover. The hotel and the restaurant need to have a sit-down to iron this out, as it makes no sense to reinvent the wheel each day. Having said that, the breakfast itself was very good. Overall, I was pleased with The Jade and would recommend it for its location and boutique hotel ambiance.

I have stayed at The Jade several times since it opened recently and I can't say enough good things about my experiences there. The hotel and rooms are brand new and stylishly appointed, the staff is always extremely friendly and helpful, and the location couldn't be better (right between prime Greenwich Village/West Village). It's also a surprisingly good value compared to the other high-end hotels in the area. I would highly recommend staying here if you have the chance.
user_name:
scubasteve83
New York City, New York

review_body: We just returned home from a week in NYC at The Jade Hotel. Everything about our experience was top notch! The location is awesome, in the neighborly Greenwich Village, and about halfway between Midtown and Lower Manhattan. We walked a lot--but the subway was easy to access and cabs were plentiful. The staff at the Jade were so generous, friendly, and helpful. I felt welcomed home each day and they offered so many wonderful suggestions for food, shopping, transportation. Their smiles and positive attitudes made what was already positive a superlative experience. We had drinks at the bar one night; lively, attentive bartender seemed to just know what we needed. The room is small, but well-appointed and gorgeous. The bed was magical! We loved our stay and will come again. Just around the corner: Murray's Bagels, an excellent diner, and 24-hour French bistro with wondrous French toast.

Just got back from New York last night. We stayed 4 nights at The Jade hotel and it was very lovely. The location is perfectly situated between 5th avenue (shopping) and 6th. The hotel just opened in March and they seemed to have worked out any kinks that other reviewers might have complained about! Rooms are very clean, but small. It's New York and it is a boutique hotel! The shower does have a half wall of glass so you do have to be a little careful while showering not to soak your bath matt. I did not have a problem with this but my 15 year old did until I explained to her how to shower in this situation. There is turn down service and free bottled water. The Restaurant inside called The Grape and Vine was also very good. We ate breakfast, lunch, and ordered room service from there. You are allowed to sit in the lobby and have a drink or snack from the bar menu. The lobby is decorated quite nicely. I well say the restaurant does need to be a little more aware when a guest enters the restaurant. The staff always seem to be missing behind the curtain and need to be seeked out in order to be sat.All the staff is very nice and greet you when you walk by. 98% of the time they had someone there to open the door for you when your entered and left the hotel.That being said, I would defiantly go back. The price is reasonable, the location was perfect, the hotel is very clean, the beds are comfortable, and no one is rude! Thats all I need!Thank you Jade Hotel and staff for a pleasant stay.PS- They have free wi-fi

If you're tired of staying at chain hotels and are looking for a new, unique hotel that gives special attention to all of its guests, the Jade should be on your short list.Everyone we dealt with was friendly, knowledgeable, and treated us as if we were the only guests there, as opposed to being one of many. I've stayed at other high end hotels in NYC and across the country and the service that we received at The Jade was up there. The moment we stepped out of our taxi, the front door gentlemen greeted us and briskly took our luggage inside. The lobby/hotel is a nice change of pace from the cookie cutter national chains. Check in was friendly and prompt and we were on our way to our room. Our luggage was delivered to our room within moments as well. During our stay, the general manager took time to say hello to us, and other guests, and made sure that our stay would be a positive one, which it was.The rooms are very contemporary and the beds are very comfortable. Brand new HDTV's, along with HD channels. (Some hotels, for some reason, have HDTVs but don't support that technology with HD channels). Plenty of electrical outlets just where we needed it. The bathrooms were supplied with premium bath products, which my wife thoroughly appreciated.We ordered room service twice, which was fairly prompt, and each time was delivered by a friendly, professional server. One of the times was late at night, when the graveyard shift person handled and delivered our order. Unlike most graveyard shift workers, this one was friendly, alert, and prompt.The location is ideal - close to transportation option and landmarks, but tucked away on a quiet block. It's just one block away from the 14th St. subway and PATH stations, 2 blocks from Union Square, and a few blocks from the Village/Washington Square Park. The weather was good enough that we walked to SoHo to do some shopping/sightseeing.We ate at the restaurant for dinner as well and found the food to be very good for the price. We ordered the mussels, pork chop, and strip steak, which were all very good and didn't break the bank.I have to echo Denizen's sentiments as for who this hotel is an isn't for. When you pay good money for a room, it's not just the room that you're paying for. It's the people who work there that make the difference and everything else in between. For a hotel that just recently opened, it seemed like everything was firing on all cylinders.

This hotel is awesome!!Location fantastic, in the middle of the big apple. You are walking distance to everywhere. The rooms are pretty and clean, not large but good size. Service is the best.The staff is so willing and nice, they make you feel at home. A must in NYC.

Which is my response to the other reviews complaining about the size of the rooms. Water is wet, ice is cold, and if you are paying less than $500 a night in Manhattan, you will get a small room. I found the regular queen room I stayed in to be a perfectly adequate size for a single traveler, as long as you're not trying to do yoga in it or have a suite of LV trunks with you or something.Anyway, here's who the Jade Hotel is not for: families with young kids, tourists who want to be around Times Square, travelers on a budget, or those who want the range of amenities or type of glitz that only big hotels can provide. Who the Jade Hotel is for: travelers who like smaller, boutique hotels; who would prefer to stay in more of a low-key, residential neighborhood; who would rather have a bit of elegant style instead of convenience and square feet.I was very happy with my stay at the Jade. They had been open only a month, so there was a bit of construction ongoing and the staff were still settling in, but everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was comfortable--good beds, marble and ceramic baths, vaguely Deco-style furnishings--and pretty quiet (not too much ambient noise from 13th St. or from other rooms). The restaurant/bar was not open at that point, so I can't comment on that. The only thing I could quibble with is having to pay for in-room wifi, but that's a pet peeve of mine, and an admittedly minor one. The location is good for public transport; you're blocks away from almost all the major subway lines.I will definitely be staying at the Jade again. Although I may be unduly influenced by the fact that Murray's Bagels is just around the corner...

We recently stayed at The Jade for an overnight to the City. The room was incredibly small- possibly the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The design is nice and very contemporary. The bathroom wasn't anything special. The location is great but not worth the price (or size).

I was pleasantly surprised of this jewel In New York City. I came across the hotel recently when I needed a stay following a function. It was clean, innovative, comfortable and sexy....All rolled into one. I did have breakfast there (room service was only available)and the staff was friendly and accomodating. I cannot wait to stay there again. It is in a great location and I really enjoyed the place.
user_name:
David R
Manhattan, New York, United States

review_body: My fiance' and I spent two nights at the Jade with our family members celebrating our recent engagement. The hotel front desk staff was extremely kind, and in particular, Briant went above and beyond his duty to make our stay memorable. He made sure a bottle of champaign and strawberries were brought out for us to celebrate, and then requested and made sure to upgrade our room for the special occasion. He certainly should be commended!The location of the Jade is quite excellent, serving a location that is void of quality hotels. Additionally, the lobby and rooms (although small even by NY standards) were decorated extremely well and the rooms were exceptionally clean. However, for over $400 a night, there are better options in the surrounding areas. They are going for a very upscale look and feel, and the amenities and space do not warrant the price.Our main problems were with the restaurant, bar, and room service. On Saturday evening, the bar manager came up behind the bartender and slapped her behind hard right in front of myself and 6 others sitting at the bar. This garnered no response, or apology from the bar manager. After spending about an hour at the bar, our tab was closed for the 7 of us and we walked to the lobby. One of our group members was on the phone when we closed the tab, he walked back into the bar, and the bartender tried to trick him into paying for the tab a second time! Luckily we heard the exchange and I ran in and stopped it from taking place. Lastly, on Sunday morning my fiance' and I ordered room service (Coffee, tea, an english muffin, and a bagel). It took room service 50 minutes to arrive with two pots of water (no coffee), the wrong tea, and no condiments for the breads (just toasted and plain). I called and explained and they returned to fix the order. Although this time, they did not bring creamer (after I specifically requested it) or the condiments again. I called again and they returned with only the condiments. After that, I gave up on creamer. Thankfully, the front desk attendant removed out charge upon checkout.Without major issues with the restaurant, bar, and room service, I would have given the hotel a 4. And without the fantastic service Briant provided, it would have been a 1 or 2. However, the restaurant, bar, and room service left a bad feeling about the hotel in general. I would consider staying here if you can get the place for a decent price, but avoid the bar & restaurant at all costs!

Aesthetics considerations seem to have dominated when this new hotel was designed.It is very attractive and has a nice atmosphere. Good and pleasant restaurant and bar.Room was nice, clean, cozy but, rather, small. We could do without some of the extra articles placed in the room, which would leave some space to move around and place our clothes.The 2 elevators were, sometimes, occupied for a very long time and we had to wait for what seemed to be ages.Service was very good by the friendly and highly motivated staff.Overall - a good and pleasant experience.

I stayed a few days before its official opening and got a big pre-opening discount (cost me less than $200 per night for a standard room), so I won't comment on the numerous teething problems that should disappear soon. The Jade's two big pluses are its location and decor. There are very few hotels near Union Square, but I think it's one of the best areas to stay as a tourist – close to subways to take you uptown to department stores, and also within walking distance to the cool boutiques and cafes in the Village and Nolita, galleries in Chelsea, and a short train ride away from the night life in the Lower East Side. The Art Deco interior is also a winner: stylish chrome finishes, tiled bathroom floors and Asian-inspired sliding panel to hide the flat-screen TV. I had a great view of the Empire State from my bedroom. I also appreciated the Bigelow bath amenities in the spacious bathrooms. The maid does a turn-down service, if you like that. Staff were very friendly, but service was a patchy – hopefully it smooths out soon. Minuses: Standard rooms are small (about average for NYC, though); fine for shorter stays, but you'd feel cramped if you stayed more than five days (especially if you're travelling as a couple). If you can afford it, splurge on one of the larger suites. There was a sizeable gap under my front door, so noise from the corridor/elevator travelled into my room. Not a huge problem as the hotel wasn't full, but I wouldn't want that if it was at capacity. I would stay at this hotel again, mainly for the location. I actually just tried to book it again, but prices have shot up to $390 for the weekend I want to stay, so it's out of my budget. Next time, hopefully...

This is a very charming boutique hotel that is a nice escape from bustling mid-town high-rise hotels. Our room was small, but clean and well-appointed. The restaurant is inviting with its fireplace and wood floors, and the food and cocktails we had were excellent. The Jade is in a perfect location if you want to be near The Village, but also not too far from SoHo. We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next visit to New York City.

We chose this hotel to try something new in the city. We usually stay in a chain with a good reputation. When our taxi driver dropped us off, he wasn't sure where the hotel was. We walked by it twice, pulling luggage behind us. There is no sign on the door or building. There is a hotel restaurant menu board outside, and I stopped to read it and realized that the hotel had a restaurant by the same name. We went inside, down the stairs to the small but stylish lobby. I checked us in and received our keys. We were on the 6th floor and waiting sometimes 5 minutes or more for the elevators. Only one of our two keys worked. I returned to desk to get the keys fixed, which she thought she did, but it happened again. The rooms are the smallest rooms I have ever seen in the city. We asked for a king bed and had to full sized beds. Just a tad bigger than a twin bed. There is a small armoire and desk chair combo. The bathroom was also small without any counter space. The room was clean, but throughout the night we kept smelling food being cooked. But, not in a pleasant way and not when you'd expect to smell food cooking. Not sure if their ventilation system from their kitchen gets pumped into the rooms but it was very strong. We paid over 450.00 a night to stay here, but it was not worth that kind of money. We have paid less at much better places in the city. This is a brand new hotel, but the hallways already show signs of aging. I think they need to work out some kinks and lower their rates to succeed.

Friendly staff welcomed us to this nice small hotel between 5th and 6th Avenue. Ideally located in the middle of manhattan. I asked for a quiet room when I booked and got one which is quite something in NYC. The hotel is fairly new and nice. A bit quirky but I suppose you get that when you check their website. The restaurant is pretty good too offering a nice choice. Definitely worth considering when visiting.

We have been going to NYC for 15 years and this was the best hotel experience! The staff are amazing making you feel special..so helpful and nice. Great old NY feel but with all new beautiful amenities. Cool like the Gramercy Park Hotel but without any stuffiness. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The location is superb especially if you like the West Village but also convenient to the subway and path train. Bar and restaurant are great too.

Chances are if you had your children after 1995, they have never seen a rotary dialed phone. Well if you would like an opportunity to instruct them on the good old days (when you dreaded calling that friend with lots of 0's or 9's in their number!!) this is the place to stay! It's sparkling new, beautifully decorated in retro furnishings that includes an old 40's style, rotary phone with a 1 lb. metal receiver. What a kick! The bathroom was ultra modern though and the bedding was perfect for a good night's rest. The room was well insulated and our view was magnificent - The Empire State Building. The staff was warm and friendly - highly recommend if you are touring NYU with your college bound students.

This hotel is to be congratulated on its decor, staff, comfort, cleanliness and location. What a gem!It's on W13th and easy walking to a host of attractions. It is small - a real boutique feel - but beautifully put together and opposite the original Macy's building. I highly recommend it, particularly if you prefer small and elegant rather than big and brash!

I was 7 days in the New Jade Hotel in greenwich Village. What can I say. Clean Hotel, Amazing people works there, beautiful place, near to 6th av where you can take easily subway or bus, in the heart of the great city!!!I normally stays in medium price hotels in NYC, rates like Jade, and comparing is hard to find that kind of clean and nice rooms in the City. the restaurant - bar is good too, I like everything in this hotel. They should speed up the elevators, sometimes are too slow, but that can be easily change.

My son and I stayed in the Jade for five nights while he was visiting New York colleges. The Jade is a delightful hotel with a splendid location in the village. Located in easy walking distance of both Union Square and Washington Square Park, it was the perfect base to explore lower Manhattan. Both NYU and the New School are close by. Abundant subway stations are with a block or two. The rooms are very small but quite nice and the hallways can get very crowded when the cleaning staff is at work. But the staff is friendly, professional and very helpful. My only serious complaint is about the elevators. This is a very new hotel and I suspect the elevator program needs some tweaking, the waits in the lobby were interminable while two elevators would be stopped on the same floor. Our room, a double on the 10th floor, was quiet and very clean.The bathroom was tiny but very well appointed. I think it would be the perfect hotel for a romantic getaway weekend but I don't think I would recommend it for family trips--the rooms are simply too small for children.

I was recently suprised by my boyfriend with a two night stay at the lovely new Jade Hotel.On arrival (after the most horrific 24 hour journey) at 8.30am we were greeted by very friendly and welcoming reception staff and although we were prepaired to venture back out into the cold to while away a couple of hours until check in, our room was already ready and waiting, which couldnt have been more welcome.I vaguely remember saying that the bed was like falling asleep on clouds before passing out for three hours!The bed is large and super comfortable, the room is decorated in an art deco style and is very kool, if not a little on the small side, the bathroom is stylish and clean with a lovely strong shower and expensive toilettries and there is free mineral water which was a nice touch (although no mini bar). The only negatives about the room would be that it was indeed quite small, which for us was not a problem, but should you stay longer than two nights and wished to unpack might cause problems. The walls are paper thin... we could hear another couple talking quite clearly through the wall, which we thought was rather entertaining but others might find irritating. Lastly, some of the fixtures were a little tempramental... the toilet flush fell off the wall and one of the bedside light bulbs didn't work. However having said this when we alerted the staff of the problem they came to sort it straight away for us.We did not eat in the restaurant but the food looked great... We did have a drink in the bar which was very cosy with low lighting and a very personal feel to it, the bar tender on duty was very attentive and generous which was greatly appreciated.The location was impeccible, on a nice quiet street only a couple of minutes walk from three subway stops and the famous union square and Washing Square, lots of restaurants, shops a cinema - everything you could need really.All in all we had a really lovely stay at The Jade and I would definitely go back again should I return to New York, and have already recommended it to a friend as a stop to include on her Honeymoon.

The hotel has a great staff at the Front desk! they try to help you with everything you need and are very nice! The other staff, for example House keeping is not very helpful and a little messi. The day you are leaving they keep asking you at the morning when you are going to leave the room constantly.Yesterday at 9.30 pm the hotel was using the Elevator for the trash. There are only two Elevators and i think 20 floors...this should not happen in a good hotel and not at 9 pm, when everyone is trying to go up and down....maybe they still have to work some things out...is still very new. The rooms are Rey small and in some of them the shower doesnt have a step, so water is everywhere, when you take a shower...In the breakfastroom runs a cold Wind that they are not able to control. This makes te breakfastroom uncomfortable....

What a treat to stay in a new (clean!) hotel in the heart of the city! The staff at the hotel are outstanding, easily accommodating all requests and helping us secure some excellent dining reservations. We stayed in a double/double room. The beds are small but very comfortable, however the room was very cramped for two people...by any international standards. Still, it was clean and quiet and our 15the floor window offered a great view of the south end of Manhattan. I used a car service to the airport ordered by the hotel which ended up costing 25% more than the "guaranteed" price quoted by the hotel. Do not use this service, yellow cabs are plentiful and offer better value.

Just spent a night at the hotel and I am in love. My room was on the 17th floor and the view was gorgeous! Loved the 1930's feel of the hotel with the techno touches of today! It is a new hotel and you can tell that they have just opened but I think this hotel will be a NY classic!

Beautiful lobby, outstanding room, great location. Loved the service and all the nice little touches everywhere. The classy decor includes many details. Only complaint: thin room doors so I could hear people in the hallway. But I did enjoy my stay. Price point won't stay for long so get in while you can! Will return!

I stayed at the hotel on a business trip, and really enjoyed my stay. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, cozy, and has a nice restaurant and lounge area. I would definitely stay here again!

I made an account just so I could review this hotel so it’s my first review, it was also my first time in New York City so first times all around! I’m so happy I chose this hotel for our trip. It was the perfect location, the building, our room, and the view were beautiful, and we had such a quiet, relaxing stay. The staff were not only pleasant but took nice to a whole new level. Every staff member we came across greeted us warmly and asked if we needed anything.I’ve read some of the other less than glowing reviews from individuals who stayed at the hotel around the same time and can’t for the life of me figure out how our experiences differ so much. I read one review that said the hotel was cold and yes, when we first arrived the room was freezing but a quick adjustment to the thermostat solved that problem. (I accidentally set it too high the first night and woke up sweltering but that was my fault) I saw no fingerprints on any of the fixtures and our room was always impeccably clean. The room we stayed in was by no means small but it was a corner room so perhaps that’s the difference. I could see on the fire escape map near the elevator that we had the largest room on the floor.

I stayed for 5 nights in room 1205. I got a corporate rate from my company's travel agency. The problem is, since I paid $179 + tax per night, I probably got the tiniest room and the desk & chair were a serious problem, especially if you have to work at night after a day of meetings. My chair was touching the side of the bed when I pushed it backwards to get up and I could barely get my legs out from under the desk. As you can see from the pics I posted, the front of the desk is built in a certain way to allow your thighs to go right inside the front of a wooden board with a round top and considering that I am skinny and of average height, I spent a considerable amount of trying to get out of the desk. I ended up sitting on my bed and doing all my computer work. Good thing the bed had lots of brand new comfy pillows.Another annoying thing was I kept bumping my lower leg against the side legs of the beds. I even got purple bruises so after night #3, I found a solution by taking both cylinder pillows from the bed and putting them on the floor in front of the bed to avoid this from happening again. Problem solved.There's no space to leave your luggage open, you must close it and use all the closets and drawer space offered. I even used the area in front of the window to put books since the desk is tiny. During my night #2 to 5, I called downstairs to ask if it was possible to change to another room since I was staying for another 3 nights. Jenny from downstairs said she would call me back to let me know. Well, she never did and that's bad Customer service. I also became creative and moved the white bench that was right under the TV and in front of the bed, to the left side of my bed or it would have been impossible to walk at all. The bench is super light, actually quite cheap. I had a big cold and ordered hot water, lemon and honey almost every night. Hotel didn't charge me and I made sure to tip the waiter. However, the cup was missing from the order so I called downstairs and jenny answered the phone. She said she would send one up but nobody ever came up with the mug. I finally used the glass from the bathroom. These are tiny details that waste my time. Also, the hotel's website says that there's a business center but when I called downstairs, I was told that it wasn't ready.I checked out at 5 AM on Sun morning. At the front desk, I was given the total and so asked for a printout to read it first before having my card charged. Well, the girl there seemed reluctant and just showed me the computer screen by pointing the total. I asked her politely again that I would just like to read a hardcopy first if that's ok. Wow, she didn't smile one bit and showed her colleague (a much nicer gentleman who was new) how to print. If I were her boss, I would teach her some manner. She was probably the rudest person I encountered at the hotel.I also heard the neighbors watching TV and talking next door, but they went to bed early luckily.Only 2 elevators at this hotel and they can slow so be prepared to wait. The Plus side:Great location, near 14th St. subway and 1,2 & 3 line. lots of restaurants and Whole Foods nearbyVery friendly staff that greets you when you return everyday, always someone to open the doors for youGreat bathroom & productsFree bottled waterLots of fluffy new towelsBathrobe & slippers providedGreat productsHigh end Egyptian cotton bedsheetsSuper comfy bedVery clean (except the carpet wasn't well vacuumed)Plush pillowsTurn down service Wake-up callNo noise outside, facing another building which didn't bother meI tipped the maid every day.If you're thinking of staying here for business, get a much bigger room or you'll be 'stuck' behind the desk. I didn't eat at the restaurant although it seemed popular at night.This is a good value hotel but not sure I'll return. If you are on vacation, and don't mind the small size like in Europe, then go for it!

i made an account just to review this hotel. as much as my hype for this new hotel was, the disappointmet was even bigger.lovely decor of the entrance. the terrace door looking enteance door looks amazing. however, not so long after arriving at the hotel i was greeted by a young lady with an ipad that answered close to none of my questions, which of one being the swuare footage of the room, not even an estimated figure.after waiting for about 40 minutes, i was given my room key. loved the fixtures again until i saw finger prints here and there. would have been understadable as they have glass counter glass shelf glass shower door... a lot of glass fixture but i was able to feel the cleaning maid's presence through her fingerprints on these glass items.the hotel seems to be recovering from construction as the hallway air felt to be very dusty. dusts were well visible under hallway lights.the hotel is VERY new and hip, but the expectation of the new hotel didnt live up to it. props to the amazing building though.

This is the worst and most uncomfortable hotel I have ever been. In order to have breakfast I had to put my jacket on!!! There is a cold wind running through the hotel. We complain twice but they choose to ignore us. I asked for the manager but he is still not here.... The waitress spills the coffee over us everytime she serves us coffee...and never apologies.

We sent our parents there as a gift. They have stayed at some of the best hotels in NYC and many European cities -- they thought The Jade was outstanding. Frete bathrobes, sparkling room, friendly and courteous service, a wonderful breakfast and, of course, a world class location. They'll be back, and we want to thank the staff for giving them a great weekend.

We couldn't be happier with our 4-night stay. This place is a winner, here are the highlights:-The room was comfortable, clean, quiet, and had "prohibition-era" thematic touches like an old-school radio and rotary phone. Fun!-The staff were the nicest I've ever met. We were always greeted warmly at the door. Any request from room service, ice, or printing our tickets and boarding passes was done quickly. -Some staff really helped us with recommendation for NY stuff. Thanks for the restaurants list, Kyle!-The location was convenient- we could hang out in the Village or easily get around via subway or taxi. Close to Union Station, as well as other subway stations. Good eats abound on this block. French Roast, Murray's Bagels, and Slice & Co. are all close and good.

This is such a restful place to come back to after a big trip in the city, and amazing that it is so close to Union Square and the West Vilage. The room was quiet and had a lovely view, as well as a marvelous bed after a lot day of walking. We also loved the food at the restaurant and felt like the staff really made an effort to make us feel at home and welcome. Definitley looking forward to the next time.

The hotel is quite nice and has a nice vibe. Rooms are tastefully decorated but small, so you have to maneuver a bit around the furniture. My stay was during their soft opening so the restaurant was not available. I was visiting with other family members for a birthday celebration. Firstly it took them a while to find my sister's luggage that was left at the hotel earlier. The system or lack of one was off, so they brought up another guests luggage first. Secondly, the acoustics are terrible so you can hear everything, including the staff running through their day at 8 AM on a Sunday. Thirdly, when I checked out I asked for an email receipt, which I haven't received to date. Lastly, the bell hop was nice enough to arrange a car to the airport for my sister. He told her the fee was a flat rate of $70 including the tip. Wrong - it did not include the tip and there was a surcharge for using a credit card! I did drop a line to the hotel and to date have not heard back from them. This is a new property, so a few bumps are expected. Sadly, customer service shouldn't be one of them.

My partner and I decided to fly to New York City (first timers) from London, for our 16th year anniversary and decided to book this hotel on the last minute! WORTH IT!! From the moment you step out of the Yellow Cab, there is a sense that you’ve just ‘step back in time’! Step inside and you see gold gilded walls, smoky mirrors, carved wooden ceilings, a fire place, smell of leather, plush, velvety furniture, above all huge smiles from staff and customers! Note: unbeknownst to us, it was they’re Opening Night after all! Just about everything about this hotel oozes style and elegance, WITHOUT overstatement. Definitely, first great impression!! No problems checking in (Ipads and all, also free WIFI) and staff made us feel really welcome. Gone into a small room, yet got upgraded to a much bigger room with a view of the Freedom Tower!! Gee, the design was amazing!! The Art Deco ambiance, created by the vintage (look alike/ design) furniture pieces and impressive wall paper, are beautifully set-off by the tasteful and calming décor; Tivoli Radio was a great touch!!! BED was brilliant, with two choice of pillows…surprisingly quiet area and with a comfortable bed = many a great nights rest! The design extends right through the towel presentation in a monochromatic bathroom, finished off with classic lush American Toiletries (C.O. Bigelow)!! Located at Greenwich Village Manhattan, the hotel is close to everything. 14th W Street Metro is close by and has a lot of Café’s nearby. We particularly loved hanging around O’Café (cnr of 12th St and 6th Ave) for good coffee and brekky. We ventured out for dinner, mainly Chelsea area (Pad Thai, Room Service and Koffeecake Corner) and you definitely need to try Las Ramblas (near the corner of 4th St and 6th Avenue) for tapas. We literally walked all over the place and even set off from the Hotel to discover Lower East Side area, passing through Tribeca, Soho, etc…As with any mini trips (we stayed for 5 nights here), your 'home away from home' matters a lot! The Jade Hotel Greenwich Village NYC was just the spot and more. Massive thanks and KUDOS to the management and the team (especially Brian, Carmello, Oscar, gee I can’t remember all the names, oh, you know who you are) at The Jade Hotel Greenwich Village NYC! All the best with the venture! You made our stay truly memorable.....

The hotel website is not clear enough to make a proper room selection. So I have contacted the hotel 3 times to make a reservation and they simply do not reply. For me this means the hotel lacks either staff or is just not interested, in any case personal attention is missing.

I was lucky to be one of the first paying guests of this newly opened boutique hotel; the front desk couldn't have been more friendly with information and general attitude. The room, although tiny, was functional and comfortable as well as well decorated. The bathroom could have done with a bit of shelf space but the products are first class, the water pressure very good and the towels fluffy and plentiful. Unfortunately, the kitchen wasn't yet open, so I couldn''t rate the food experience. I will undoubtedly be coming back to stay.

Loved the beautifully appointed Art Deco room overlooking Freedom Tower. Excellent accommodating, friendly, professional staff. Shower was especially delightful! Perfect location! Close to many delicious restaurants and Washington Square. Elegant downstairs entrance with an inviting fireplace and sitting area.

This new boutique hotel hit all the right notes from the inviting and hip staff to the awesome lobby complete with back-lit onyx counters and very well appointed rooms. The rooms are quite comparable in size to others I have stayed at in NYC but have way better high end fixtures which quite frankly belong in a much more expensive hotel. The location was awesome for a boys weekend in the City (close to some great bars and restaurants in the Village) but I expect this place will be a go-to spot for couples looking for a weekend getaway. Overall, I was very impressed with the service, cool vibe, location and value-for-money. I will definitely be going back to the Jade on future visits.

Stayed here for one night during their soft launch. The hotel is relatively disguised on the block and. Felt like I was entering a private club. Mood lighting. Dark colors. Red velvet. Great setting.Everything in the place was new -- I was the first person to ever use the iron. And the room was well appointed, well designed, and cute. The problem though was it was extremely tight. As in I kept bumping into things. The bed. The desk. The luggage bench. At first I thought it might be because I was tall but remembered I'd stayed at many small rooms in NYC but none this compact. I also noticed the furniture seemed slightly smaller in size than normal -- which explained how they got all the pieces in the room. But it was still tight. Maybe if you're under 6' you won't notice but for us tall folks this will be a problem.If you can handle the tightness, it's a great place nif not, you might want to consider someplace with larger rooms.

Stayed at the Jade hotel recently for a romantic getaway with my husband. The hotel is well located in the Village. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I loved the inviting lobby with fireplace. The room gave a big feel and was well appointed. Loved the art deco touches complete with a rotary phone! Would definitely go back again.

This newly opened hotel is in a great Manhattan location. Rooms are not large, but they are very elegantly appointed. Lobby is very inviting and staff is courteous and very accommodating to all needs. Can't wait for restaurant to open too.
